what you will two gentlemen verona two nobl kinsmen winter s tale lover s complaint passion pilgrim phoenix turtl rape lucrec venu adoni sonnet 1 fairest creatur we desir increas that therebi beauti s rose might never die but as riper should time deceas hi tender heir might bear hi memori but thou contract thine own bright eye feed st thi light s flame self substanti fuel make famin where abund lie thi self thi foe thi sweet self too cruel thou that art now world s fresh ornament onli herald gaudi spring thine own bud buriest thi content tender churl mak st wast niggard piti world or els thi glutton be eat world s due grave thee 2 when forti winter shall besieg thi brow dig deep trench thi beauti s field thi youth s proud liveri so gaze now will be tatter weed small worth held then be ask where all thi beauti lie where all treasur thi lusti day say thine own deep sunken eye were all eat shame thriftless prais how much more prais deserv d thi beauti s use if thou couldst answer thi fair child mine shall sum my count make my old excus prove hi beauti success thine thi were be new made when thou art old see thi blood warm when thou feel st it cold 3 look thi glass tell face thou viewest now is time that face should form anoth whose fresh repair if now thou not renewest thou dost beguil world unbless some mother where is she so fair whose unear womb disdain tillag thi husbandri or who is he so fond will be tomb hi self love stop poster thou art thi mother s glass she thee call back love april her prime so thou window thine age shalt see despit wrinkl thi thi golden time but if thou live rememb not be die singl thine imag die thee 4 unthrifti loveli whi dost thou spend thi self thi beauti s legaci natur s bequest give noth but doth lend be frank she lend those are free then beauteou niggard whi dost thou abus bounteou largess given thee give profitless usur whi dost thou use so great sum sum yet canst not live have traffic thi self alon thou thi self thi sweet self dost deceiv then how when natur call thee be gone what accept audit canst thou leav thi unus beauti must be tomb thee which use live th executor be 5 those hour that gentl work did frame love gaze where everi eye doth dwell will play tyrant veri same that unfair which fairli doth excel never rest time lead summer hideou winter confound him there sap check frost lusti leav quit gone beauti o er snow bare everi where then were not summer s distil left liquid prison pent wall glass beauti s effect beauti were bereft nor it nor no remembr what it wa but flower distil though they winter meet lees but their show their substanc still live sweet 6 then let not winter s rag hand defac thee thi summer ere thou be distil make sweet some vial treasur thou some place beauti s treasur ere it be self kill that use is not forbidden usuri which happi those that pay will loan that s thi self breed anoth thee or ten time happier be it ten one ten time thi self were happier than thou art if ten thine ten time refigur thee then what could death do if thou shouldst depart leav thee live poster be not self will thou art much too fair be death s conquest make worm thine heir 7 lo orient when graciou light lift hi burn head each eye doth homag hi new appear sight serv look hi sacr majesti have climb steep heavenli hill resembl strong youth hi middl age yet mortal look ador hi beauti still attend hi golden pilgrimag but when highmost pitch weari car like feebl age he reeleth day eye fore duteou now convert are hi low tract look anoth way so thou thi self go thi noon unlook diest unless thou get son 8 music hear whi hear st thou music sadli sweet sweet war not joy delight joy whi lov st thou that which thou receiv st not gladli or els receiv st pleasur thine annoy if true concord well tune sound union marri do offend thine ear they do but sweetli chide thee who confound singl part that thou shouldst bear mark how one string sweet husband anoth strike each each mutual order resembl sire child happi mother who all one one pleas note do sing whose speechless song be mani seem one sing thi thee thou singl wilt prove none 9 is it fear wet widow s eye that thou consum st thi self singl life ah if thou issueless shalt hap die world will wail thee like makeless wife world will be thi widow still weep that thou no form thee hast left behind when everi privat widow well may keep children s eye her husband s shape mind look what unthrift world doth spend shift but hi place still world enjoy it but beauti s wast hath world end kept unus user so destroy it no love other that bosom sit that himself such murd rou shame commit 10 shame deni that thou bear st love ani who thi self art so unprovid grant if thou wilt thou art belov mani but that thou none lov st is most evid thou art so possess murd rou hate that gainst thi self thou stick st not conspir seek that beauteou roof ruinat which repair should be thi chief desir o chang thi thought that i may chang my mind shall hate be fairer lodg than gentl love be as thi presenc is graciou kind or thi self least kind heart prove make thee anoth self love me that beauti still may live thine or thee 11 as fast as thou shalt wane so fast thou grow st one thine that which thou departest that fresh blood which youngli thou bestow st thou mayst call thine when thou youth convertest herein live wisdom beauti increas thi folli age cold decay if all were mind so time should ceas threescor year would make world away let those whom natur hath not made store harsh featureless rude barrenli perish look whom she best endow she gave thee more which bounteou gift thou shouldst bounti cherish she carv thee her seal meant therebi thou shouldst print more not let that copi die 12 when i do count clock that tell time see brave day sunk hideou night when i behold violet past prime sabl curl all silver o er white when lofti tree i see barren leav which erst heat did canopi herd summer s green all gird sheav born bier white bristli beard then thi beauti do i question make that thou wast time must go sweet beauti do themselv forsak die as fast as they see other grow noth gainst time s scyth can make defenc save breed brave him when he take thee henc 13 o that you were your self but love you are no longer your than you your self here live against thi come end you should prepar your sweet semblanc some other give so should that beauti which you hold leas find no determin then you were your self again your self s deceas when your sweet issu your sweet form should bear who let so fair hous fall decay which husbandri honour might uphold against stormi gust winter s day barren rage death s etern cold o none but unthrift dear my love you know you had father let your son say so 14 not star do i my judgement pluck yet methink i have astronomi but not tell good or evil luck plagu dearth or season qualiti nor can i fortun brief minut tell point each hi thunder rain wind or say princ if it shall go well oft predict that i heaven find but thine eye my knowledg i deriv constant star them i read such art as truth beauti shall togeth thrive if thi self store thou wouldst convert or els thee thi i prognost thi end is truth s beauti s doom date 15 when i consid everi thing that grow hold perfect but littl moment that thi huge stage presenteth nought but show whereon star secret influenc comment when i perceiv that men as plant increas cheer check even self same sky vaunt their youth sap height decreas wear their brave state memori then conceit thi inconst stay set you most rich youth my sight where wast time debateth decay chang your day youth sulli night all war time love you as he take you i engraft you new 16 but wherefor do not you mightier way make war thi bloodi tyrant time fortifi your self your decay mean more bless than my barren rhyme now stand you top happi hour mani maiden garden yet unset virtuou wish would bear you live flower much liker than your paint counterfeit so should line life that life repair which thi time s pencil or my pupil pen neither inward worth nor outward fair can make you live your self eye men give away your self keep your self still you must live drawn your own sweet skill 17 who will believ my vers time come if it were fill your most high desert though yet heaven know it is but as tomb which hide your life show not half your part if i could write beauti your eye fresh number number all your grace age come would say thi poet lie such heavenli touch ne er touch earthli face so should my paper yellow their age be scorn like old men less truth than tongu your true right be term poet s rage stretch metr antiqu song but were some child your aliv that time you should live twice it my rhyme 18 shall i compar thee summer s day thou art more love more temper rough wind do shake darl bud may summer s leas hath all too short date sometim too hot eye heaven shine often is hi gold complexion dim everi fair fair sometim declin chanc or natur s chang cours untrim but thi etern summer shall not fade nor lose possess that fair thou ow st nor shall death brag thou wand rest hi shade when etern line time thou grow st so long as men can breath or eye can see so long live thi thi give life thee 19 devour time blunt thou lion s paw make earth devour her own sweet brood pluck keen teeth fierc tiger s jaw burn long live phoenix her blood make glad sorri season as thou fleet st do whate er thou wilt swift foot time wide world all her fade sweet but i forbid thee one most heinou crime o carv not thi hour my love s fair brow nor draw no line there thine antiqu pen him thi cours untaint do allow beauti s pattern succeed men yet do thi worst old time despit thi wrong my love shall my vers ever live young 20 woman s face natur s own hand paint hast thou master mistress my passion woman s gentl heart but not acquaint shift chang as is fals women s fashion eye more bright than their less fals roll gild object whereupon it gazeth man hue all hue hi control which steal men s eye women s soul amazeth woman wert thou first creat till natur as she wrought thee fell dote addit me thee defeat ad one thing my purpos noth but she prick thee women s pleasur mine be thi love thi love s use their treasur 21 so is it not me as that muse stir paint beauti hi vers who heaven it self ornament doth use everi fair hi fair doth rehears make couplement proud compar sun moon earth sea s rich gem april s first born flower all thing rare that heaven s air thi huge rondur hem o let me true love but truli write then believ me my love is as fair as ani mother s child though not so bright as those gold candl fix heaven s air let them say more that like hearsay well i will not prais that purpos not sell 22 my glass shall not persuad me i am old so long as youth thou are one date but when thee time s furrow i behold then look i death my day should expiat all that beauti that doth cover thee is but seemli raiment my heart which thi breast doth live as thine me how can i then be elder than thou art o therefor love be thyself so wari as i not my self but thee will bear thi heart which i will keep so chari as tender nurs her babe fare ill presum not thi heart when mine is slain thou gav st me thine not give back again 23 as unperfect actor stage who hi fear is put besid hi part or some fierc thing replet too much rage whose strength s abund weaken hi own heart so i fear trust forget say perfect ceremoni love s rite mine own love s strength seem decay o ercharg burthen mine own love s might o let my look be then eloqu dumb presag my speak breast who plead love look recompens more than that tongu that more hath more express o learn read what silent love hath writ hear eye belong love s fine wit 24 mine eye hath play painter hath stell thi beauti s form tabl my heart my bodi is frame wherein ti held perspect it is best painter s art painter must you see hi skill find where your true imag pictur lie which my bosom s shop is hang still that hath hi window glaze thine eye now see what good turn eye eye have done mine eye have drawn thi shape thine me are window my breast where sun delight peep gaze therein thee yet eye thi cun want grace their art they draw but what they see know not heart 25 let those who are favour their star public honour proud titl boast whilst i whom fortun such triumph bar unlook joy that i honour most great princ favourit their fair leav spread but as marigold sun s eye themselv their pride lie buri frown they their glori die pain warrior famous fight thousand victori onc foil is book honour raze quit all rest forgot which he toil then happi i that love am belov where i may not remov nor be remov 26 lord my love whom vassalag thi merit hath my duti strongli knit thee i send thi written embassag wit duti not show my wit duti so great which wit so poor as mine may make seem bare want word show it but that i hope some good conceit thine thi soul s thought all nake will bestow it till whatsoev star that guid my move point me gracious fair aspect put apparel my tatter love show me worthi thi sweet respect then may i dare boast how i do love thee till then not show my head where thou mayst prove me 27 weari toil i hast me my bed dear respos limb travel tire but then begin journey my head work my mind when bodi s work s expir then my thought far where i abid intend zealou pilgrimag thee keep my droop eyelid open wide look dark which blind do see save that my soul s imaginari sight present thi shadow my sightless view which like jewel hung ghastli night make black night beauteou her old face new lo thu day my limb night my mind thee my self no quiet find 28 how can i then return happi plight that am debar benefit rest when day s oppress is not eas night but day night night day oppress each though enemi either s reign do consent shake hand tortur me one toil other complain how far i toil still farther off thee i tell day pleas him thou art bright dost him grace when cloud do blot heaven so flatter i swart complexion night when sparkl star twire not thou gild st even but day doth daili draw my sorrow longer night doth nightli make grief s length seem stronger 29 when disgrac fortun men s eye i all alon beweep my outcast state troubl deaf heaven my bootless cri look my self curs my fate wish me like one more rich hope featur like him like him friend possess desir thi man s art that man s scope what i most enjoy content least yet these thought my self almost despis hapli i think thee then my state like lark break day aris sullen earth sing hymn heaven s gate thi sweet love rememb such wealth bring that then i scorn chang my state king 30 when session sweet silent thought i summon remembr thing past i sigh lack mani thing i sought old woe new wail my dear time s wast then can i drown eye unus flow preciou friend hid death s dateless night weep afresh love s long cancel woe moan th expens mani vanish sight then can i griev grievanc foregon heavili woe woe tell o er sad account fore bemoan moan which i new pay as if not paid but if while i think thee dear friend all loss are restor sorrow end 31 thi bosom is endear all heart which i lack have suppos dead there reign love all love s love part all those friend which i thought buri how mani holi obsequi tear hath dear religi love stol n mine eye as interest dead which now appear but thing remov that hidden thee lie thou art grave where buri love doth live hung trophi my lover gone who all their part me thee did give that due mani now is thine alon their imag i love i view thee thou all they hast all all me 32 if thou surviv my well content day when that churl death my bone dust shall cover shalt fortun onc more re survey these poor rude line thi deceas lover compar them bett ring time though they be outstrip everi pen reserv them my love not their rhyme exceed height happier men o then vouchsaf me but thi love thought had my friend s muse grown thi grow age dearer birth than thi hi love had brought march rank better equipag but he die poet better prove their their style i ll read hi hi love 33 full mani gloriou morn have i seen flatter mountain top sovereign eye kiss golden face meadow green gild pale stream heavenli alchemi anon permit basest cloud ride ugli rack hi celesti face forlorn world hi visag hide steal unseen west thi disgrac even so my sun one earli morn did shine all triumphant splendour my brow but alack he wa but one hour mine region cloud hath mask him me now yet him thi my love no whit disdaineth sun world may stain when heaven s sun staineth 34 whi didst thou promis such beauteou day make me travel forth my cloak let base cloud o ertak me my way hide thi brav ry their rotten smoke ti not enough that cloud thou break dri rain my storm beaten face no man well such salv can speak that heal wound cure not disgrac nor can thi shame give physic my grief though thou repent yet i have still loss th offend s sorrow lend but weak relief him that bear strong offenc s cross ah but those tear are pearl which thi love shed they are rich ransom all ill deed 35 no more be griev that which thou hast done rose have thorn silver fountain mud cloud eclips stain both moon sun loathsom canker live sweetest bud all men make fault even i thi author thi trespass compar my self corrupt salv thi amiss excus thi sin more than thi sin are thi sensual fault i bring sens thi advers parti is thi advoc gainst my self law plea commenc such civil war is my love hate that i accessari need must be that sweet thief which sourli rob me 36 let me confess that we two must be twain although our undivid love are one so shall those blot that do me remain thi help me be born alon our two love there is but one respect though our live separ spite which though it alter not love s sole effect yet doth it steal sweet hour love s delight i may not evermor acknowledg thee lest my bewail guilt should do thee shame nor thou public kind honour me unless thou take that honour thi name but do not so i love thee such sort as thou be mine mine is thi good report 37 as decrepit father take delight see hi activ child do deed youth so i made lame fortun s dearest spite take all my comfort thi worth truth beauti birth or wealth or wit or ani these all or all or more entitl thi part do crown sit i make my love engraft thi store so then i am not lame poor nor despis whilst that thi shadow doth such substanc give that i thi abund am suffic part all thi glori live look what is best that best i wish thee thi wish i have then ten time happi me 38 how can my muse want subject invent while thou dost breath that pour st my vers thine own sweet argument too excel everi vulgar paper rehears o give thi self thank if aught me worthi perus stand against thi sight who s so dumb that cannot write thee when thou thi self dost give invent light be thou tenth muse ten time more worth than those old nine which rhymer invoc he that call thee let him bring forth etern number outliv long date if my slight muse do pleas these curiou day pain be mine but thine shall be prais 39 o how thi worth manner may i sing when thou art all better part me what can mine own prais mine own self bring what is t but mine own when i prais thee even thi let us divid live our dear love lose name singl one that thi separ i may give that due thee which thou deserv st alon o absenc what torment wouldst thou prove were it not thi sour leisur gave sweet leav entertain time thought love which time thought so sweetli doth deceiv that thou teachest how make one twain prais him here who doth henc remain 40 take all my love my love yea take them all what hast thou then more than thou hadst no love my love that thou mayst true love call all mine wa thine thou hadst thi more then if my love thou my love receivest i cannot blame thee my love thou usest but yet be blame if thou thi self deceivest wil tast what thi self refusest i do forgiv thi robberi gentl thief although thou steal thee all my poverti yet love know it is greater grief bear greater wrong than hate s known injuri lascivi grace whom all ill well show kill me spite yet we must not be foe 41 those pretti wrong that liberti commit when i am sometim absent thi heart thi beauti thi year full well befit still temptat follow where thou art gentl thou art therefor be won beauteou thou art therefor be assail when woman woo what woman s son will sourli leav her till he have prevail ay me but yet thou mightst my seat forbear chide thi beauti thi stray youth who lead thee their riot even there where thou art forc break twofold truth her thi beauti tempt her thee thine thi beauti be fals me 42 that thou hast her it is not all my grief yet it may be said i love her dearli that she hath thee is my wail chief loss love that touch me more nearli love offend thu i will excus ye thou dost love her becaus thou know st i love her my sake even so doth she abus me suff ring my friend my sake approv her if i lose thee my loss is my love s gain lose her my friend hath found that loss both find each other i lose both twain both my sake lay me thi cross but here s joy my friend i are one sweet flatteri then she love but me alon 43 when most i wink then do mine eye best see all day they view thing unrespect but when i sleep dream they look thee darkli bright are bright dark direct then thou whose shadow shadow doth make bright how would thi shadow s form form happi show clear day thi much clearer light when unse eye thi shade shine so how would i say mine eye be bless made look thee live day when dead night thi fair imperfect shade heavi sleep sightless eye doth stay all day are night see till i see thee night bright day when dream do show thee me 44 if dull substanc my flesh were thought injuri distanc should not stop my way then despit space i would be brought limit far remot where thou dost stay no matter then although my foot did stand farthest earth remov thee nimbl thought can jump both sea land as soon as think place where he would be but ah thought kill me that i am not thought leap larg length mile when thou art gone but that so much earth water wrought i must attend time s leisur my moan receiv nought element so slow but heavi tear badg either s woe 45 other two slight air purg fire are both thee wherev i abid first my thought other my desir these present absent swift motion slide when these quicker element are gone tender embassi love thee my life be made four two alon sink down death oppress melancholi life s composit be recur those swift messeng return thee who even but now come back again assur thi fair health recount it me thi told i joy but then no longer glad i send them back again straight grow sad 46 mine eye heart are mortal war how divid conquest thi sight mine eye my heart thi pictur s sight would bar my heart mine eye freedom that right my heart doth plead that thou him dost lie closet never pierc crystal eye but defend doth that plea deni say him thi fair appear lie side thi titl is impanel quest thought all tenant heart their verdict is determin clear eye s moieti dear heart s part as thu mine eye s due is thi outward part my heart s right thi inward love heart 47 betwixt mine eye heart leagu is took each doth good turn now unto other when that mine eye is famish look or heart love sigh himself doth smother my love s pictur then my eye doth feast paint banquet bid my heart anoth time mine eye is my heart s guest hi thought love doth share part so either thi pictur or my love thi self away art present still me thou not farther than my thought canst move i am still them they thee or if they sleep thi pictur my sight awak my heart heart s eye s delight 48 how care wa i when i took my way each trifl truest bar thrust that my use it might unus stay hand falsehood sure ward trust but thou whom my jewel trifl are most worthi comfort now my greatest grief thou best dearest mine onli care art left prey everi vulgar thief thee have i not lock ani chest save where thou art not though i feel thou art gentl closur my breast whenc pleasur thou mayst come part even thenc thou wilt be stol n i fear truth prove thievish prize so dear 49 against that time if ever that time come when i shall see thee frown my defect when as thi love hath cast hi utmost sum call that audit advis respect against that time when thou shalt strang pass scarc greet me that sun thine eye when love convert thing it wa shall reason find settl graviti against that time do i ensconc me here knowledg mine own desert thi my hand against my self uprear guard law reason thi part leav poor me thou hast strength law whi love i can alleg no caus 50 how heavi do i journey way when what i seek my weari travel s end doth teach that case that repos say thu far mile are measur thi friend beast that bear me tire my woe plod dulli bear that weight me as if some instinct wretch did know hi rider love not speed be made thee bloodi spur cannot provok him that sometim anger thrust hi hide which heavili he answer groan more sharp me than spur hi side that same groan doth put thi my mind my grief lie onward my joy behind 51 thu can my love excus slow offenc my dull bearer when thee i speed where thou art whi should i hast me thenc till i return post is no need o what excus will my poor beast then find when swift extrem can seem but slow then should i spur though mount wind wing speed no motion shall i know then can no hors my desir keep pace therefor desir perfect st love be made shall neigh no dull flesh hi fieri race but love love thu shall excus my jade thee go he went wil slow thee i ll run give him leav go 52 so am i as rich whose bless key can bring him hi sweet lock treasur which he will not everi hour survey blunt fine point seldom pleasur therefor are feast so solemn so rare seldom come that long year set like stone worth they thinli place are or captain jewel carcanet so is time that keep you as my chest or as wardrob which robe doth hide make some special instant special blest new unfold hi imprison pride bless are you whose worthi give scope be had triumph be lack hope 53 what is your substanc whereof are you made that million strang shadow you tend everi one hath everi one one shade you but one can everi shadow lend describ adoni counterfeit is poorli imit you helen s cheek all art beauti set you grecian tire are paint new speak spring foison year one doth shadow your beauti show other as your bounti doth appear you everi bless shape we know all extern grace you have some part but you like none none you constant heart 54 o how much more doth beauti beauteou seem that sweet ornament which truth doth give rose look fair but fairer we it deem that sweet odour which doth it live canker bloom have full as deep dye as perfum tinctur rose hang such thorn play as wantonli when summer s breath their mask bud disclos but their virtu onli is their show they live unwoo unrespect fade die themselv sweet rose do not so their sweet death are sweetest odour made so you beauteou love youth when that shall fade my vers distil your truth 55 not marbl nor gild monument princ shall outliv thi power rhyme but you shall shine more bright these content than unswept stone besmear sluttish time when wast war shall statu overturn broil root work masonri nor mar hi sword nor war s quick fire shall burn live record your memori gainst death all oblivi enmiti shall you pace forth your prais shall still find room even eye all poster that wear thi world end doom so till judgment that your self aris you live thi dwell lover eye 56 sweet love renew thi forc be it not said thi edg should blunter be than appetit which but day feed is allay morrow sharpen hi former might so love be thou although day thou fill thi hungri eye even till they wink ful morrow see again do not kill spirit love perpetu dul let thi sad interim like ocean be which part shore where two contract new come daili bank that when they see return love more blest may be view or call it winter which be full care make summer s welcom thrice more wish more rare 57 be your slave what should i do but tend hour time your desir i have no preciou time all spend nor servic do till you requir nor dare i chide world end hour whilst i my sovereign watch clock you nor think bitter absenc sour when you have bid your servant onc adieu nor dare i question my jealou thought where you may be or your affair suppos but like sad slave stay think nought save where you are how happi you make those so true fool is love that your will though you do ani thing he think no ill 58 that god forbid that made me first your slave i should thought control your time pleasur or your hand th account hour crave be your vassal bound stay your leisur o let me suffer be your beck th imprison absenc your liberti patienc tame suffer bide each check accus you injuri be where you list your charter is so strong that you your self may privilag your time what you will you it doth belong your self pardon self do crime i am wait though wait so be hell not blame your pleasur be it ill or well 59 if there be noth new but that which is hath been how are our brain beguil which labour invent bear ami second burthen former child o that record could backward look even five hundr cours sun show me your imag some antiqu book mind first charact wa done that i might see what old world could say thi compos wonder your frame we are mend or better they or revolut be same o sure i am wit former day subject wors have given admir prais 60 like as wave make pebbl shore so do our minut hasten their end each chang place that which goe sequent toil all forward do contend nativ onc main light crawl matur wherewith be crown crook eclips gainst hi glori fight time that gave doth now hi gift confound time doth transfix flourish set youth delv parallel beauti s brow feed rariti natur s truth noth stand but hi scyth mow yet time hope my vers shall stand prais thi worth despit hi cruel hand 61 is it thi will thi imag should keep open my heavi eyelid weari night dost thou desir my slumber should be broken while shadow like thee do mock my sight is it thi spirit that thou send st thee so far home my deed pri find shame idl hour me scope tenur thi jealousi o no thi love though much is not so great it is my love that keep mine eye awak mine own true love that doth my rest defeat play watchman ever thi sake thee watch i whilst thou dost wake elsewher me far off other all too near 62 sin self love possesseth all mine eye all my soul all my everi part thi sin there is no remedi it is so ground inward my heart methink no face so graciou is as mine no shape so true no truth such account my self mine own worth do defin as i all other all worth surmount but when my glass show me my self inde beat chopt tan antiqu mine own self love quit contrari i read self so self love were iniqu ti thee my self that my self i prais paint my age beauti thi day 63 against my love shall be as i am now time s injuri hand crush o erworn when hour have drain hi blood fill hi brow line wrinkl when hi youth morn hath travel age s steepi night all those beauti whereof now he s king are vanish or vanish sight steal away treasur hi spring such time do i now fortifi against confound age s cruel knife that he shall never cut memori my sweet love s beauti though my lover s life hi beauti shall these black line be seen they shall live he them still green 64 when i have seen time s fell hand defac rich proud cost outworn buri age when sometim lofti tower i see down rase brass etern slave mortal rage when i have seen hungri ocean gain advantag kingdom shore firm soil win wateri main increas store loss loss store when i have seen such interchang state or state it self confound decay ruin hath taught me thu rumin that time will come take my love away thi thought is as death which cannot choos but weep have that which it fear lose 65 brass nor stone nor earth nor boundless sea but sad mortal o ersway their power how thi rage shall beauti hold plea whose action is no stronger than flower o how shall i be pent thee perforc am thine all that is me 134 so now i have confess that he is thine i my self am mortgag thi will my self i ll forfeit so that other mine thou wilt restor be my comfort still but idl doth hatch how now enobarbu enter enobarbu enobarbu what s your pleasur sir antoni i must hast henc enobarbu whi then we kill all our women we see how mortal unkind is them if they suffer our departur death s word antoni i must be gone enobarbu compel occas let women die it were piti cast them away noth though them great caus they should be esteem noth cleopatra catch but least nois thi die instantli i have seen her die twenti time far poorer moment i do think there is mettl death which commit some love act her she hath such celer die antoni she is cun past man s thought enobarbu alack sir no her passion are made noth but finest part pure love we cannot call her wind water sigh tear they are greater storm tempest than almanac can report thi cannot be cun her if it be she make shower rain as well as jove antoni would i had never seen her enobarbu o sir you had then left unseen wonder piec work which not have been blest withal would have discredit your travel antoni fulvia hair do mutini white reprov brown rash they them fear dote friend be gone you shall have letter me some friend that will sweep your way you pray you look not sad nor make repli loath take hint which my despair proclaim let that be left which leav itself sea side straightway i will possess you that ship treasur leav me i pray littl pray you now nay do so inde i have lost command therefor i pray argument but that peopl prais her her virtu piti her her good father s sake my life hi malic gainst ladi will suddenli break forth sir fare you well hereaft better world than thi i shall desir more love knowledg you orlando i rest much bounden you fare you well exit le beau thu must i smoke smother tyrant duke unto tyrant brother but heavenli rosalind exit scene iii duke s palac enter celia civet touchston most shallow man thou worm s meat respect good piec flesh inde learn wise perpend civet is baser birth than tar veri uncleanli flux cat mend instanc shepherd corin you have too courtli wit me i ll rest touchston wilt thou rest damn d god help thee shallow man god make incis thee thou art raw corin sir i am true labour i earn that i eat get that i wear owe no man hate envi no man s that s no matter i say she never did invent thi letter thi is man s invent hi hand silviu sure it is her rosalind whi ti boister cruel style style challeng whi she defi me like turk christian women s cam st ephesu egeon heavier task could not have been impo d than i speak my grief unspeak yet that world may wit that my end wa wrought natur not vile offenc i ll utter what my sorrow give me leav syracusa wa i born wed unto woman happi but me me had not our hap been bad her i liv d joy our wealth increa d prosper voyag i often made epidamnum till my factor s death great care good random left drew me kind embrac my spous whom my absenc wa not six month old herself almost faint pleas punish that women bear had made provis her follow me soon safe arriv where i wa there had she not been long but she becam joy mother two goodli son which wa strang one so like other as could not be distinguish d but name that veri hour self same inn mean woman wa deliv such burden male twin both alik those their parent were exceed poor i bought brought attend my son my wife not meanli proud two such boy made daili motion our home return unwil i agre ala too soon we came aboard leagu epidamnum had we sail d alway wind obey deep gave ani tragic instanc our harm but longer did we not retain much hope what obscur light heaven did grant did but convey unto our fear mind doubt warrant immedi death which though myself would gladli have embrac d yet incess weep my wife weep what she saw must come piteou plain pretti babe that mourn d fashion ignor what fear forc d me seek delay them me thi it wa other mean wa none sailor sought safeti our boat left ship then sink ripe us my wife more care latter born had fast ned him unto small spare mast such as sea fare men provid storm him one other twin wa bound whilst i had been like heed other children thu dispo d my wife i fix our eye whom our care wa fix d fast ned ourselv either end mast float straight obedi stream wa carri corinth as we thought length sun gaze earth disper d those vapour that offend us benefit hi wish light sea wax d calm we discov two ship far make amain us corinth that epidauru thi but ere they came o let me say no more gather sequel that went duke nay forward old man do not break off so we may piti though not pardon thee egeon o had god done so i had not now worthili term d them merciless us ere ship could meet twice five leagu we were encount mighti rock which be violent born our help ship wa split midst so that thi unjust divorc us fortun had left both us alik what delight what sorrow her part poor soul seem as burden lesser weight but not lesser woe wa carri more speed wind our sight they three were taken fishermen corinth as we thought length anoth ship had seiz d us know whom it wa their hap save gave health welcom their ship wrack d guest would have reft fisher their prey had not their bark been veri slow sail therefor homeward did they bend their cours thu have you heard me sever d my bliss that misfortun wa my life prolong d tell sad stori my own mishap duke sake them thou sorrowest do me favour dilat full what have befal n them thee till now egeon my youngest boy yet my eldest care eighteen year becam inquisit hi brother importun d me that hi attend so hi case wa like reft hi brother but retain d hi name might bear him compani quest him whom whilst i labour love see i hazard loss whom i lov d five summer have i spent farthest greec roam clean bound asia coast homeward came ephesu hopeless find yet loath leav unsought or that or ani place that harbour men but here must end stori my life happi were i my time death could all my travel warrant me they live duke hapless egeon whom fate have mark d bear extrem dire mishap now trust me were it not against our law against my crown my oath my digniti which princ would they may not disannul my soul should sue as advoc thee but though thou art adjudg death pass sentenc may not be recal d but our honour s great disparag yet will i favour thee what i can therefor merchant i ll limit thee thi day seek thi health benefici help tri all friend thou hast ephesu beg thou or borrow make sum live if no then thou art doom d die true date what now how chanc thou art return d so soon dromio ephesu return d so soon rather approach d too late capon burn pig fall spit clock hath strucken twelv bell my mistress made it one my are penit your default today antipholu syracus stop your wind sir tell me thi i pray where have you left money that i gave you dromio ephesu o sixpenc that i had o wednesday last pay saddler my mistress crupper saddler had it sir i kept it not antipholu syracus i am not sportiv humour now tell me dalli not where is money we be stranger here how dar st thou trust so great charg thine own me antipholu syracus come sir knave have done your foolish tell me how thou hast dispo d thi charg dromio ephesu my charg wa but fetch you mart home your hous phoenix sir dinner my mistress her sister patient antipholu syracus thi mistress mark what mistress slave hast thou dromio ephesu your worship s wife my mistress phoenix she that doth fast till you come home dinner pray that you will hie you home dinner antipholu syracus what wilt thou flout me thu unto my face be forbid there take you that sir knave dromio ephesu what mean you sir god s sake hold your hand nay you will not sir i ll take my heel _exit dromio _ antipholu syracus my life some devic or other villain is o er raught all my money they say thi town is full cozenag as nimbl juggler that deceiv eye dark work sorcer that chang mind soul kill witch that deform bodi disguis cheater prate mountebank mani such like liberti sin if it prove so i will be gone sooner i ll centaur go seek thi slave i greatli fear my money is not safe _exit _ act ii scene i public place enter adriana wife antipholu ephesu luciana her sister adriana neither my husband nor slave return d that such hast i sent seek hi master sure luciana it is two o clock luciana perhap some merchant hath invit him mart he s somewher gone dinner good sister let us dine never fret man is master hi liberti time is their master when they see time they ll go or come if so be patient sister adriana whi should their liberti than our be more luciana becaus their busi still lie o door adriana look when i serv him so he take it ill luciana o know he is bridl your will adriana there s none but ass will be bridl so luciana whi headstrong liberti is lash d woe there s noth situat heaven s eye but hath hi bound earth sea sky beast fish wing fowl are their male subject their control man more divin master all these lord wide world wild wat ry sea indu intellectu sens soul more pre emin than fish fowl are master their femal their lord then let your will attend their accord adriana thi servitud make you keep unw luciana not thi but troubl marriag bed adriana but were you wed you would bear some sway luciana ere i learn love i ll practis obey adriana how if your husband start some other where luciana till he come home again i would forbear adriana patienc unmov d no marvel though she paus they can be meek that have no other caus wretch soul brui d advers we bid be quiet when we hear it cri but were we burd ned like weight pain as much or more we should ourselv complain so thou that hast no unkind mate griev thee urg helpless patienc would reliev me but if thou live see like right bereft thi fool begg d patienc thee will be left luciana well i will marri one day but tri here come your man now is your husband nigh enter dromio ephesu adriana say is your tardi master now hand dromio ephesu nay he s two hand me that my two ear can wit adriana say didst thou speak him know st thou hi mind dromio ephesu ay ay he told hi mind mine ear beshrew hi hand i scarc could understand it luciana spake he so doubt thou couldst not feel hi mean dromio ephesu nay he struck so plainli i could too well feel hi blow withal so doubt that i could scarc understand them adriana but say i prithe is he come home it seem he hath great care pleas hi wife dromio ephesu whi mistress sure my master is horn mad adriana horn mad thou villain dromio ephesu i mean not cuckold mad but sure he s stark mad when i desir d him come home dinner he ask d me thousand mark gold ti dinner time quoth i my gold quoth he your meat doth burn quoth i my gold quoth he will you come home quoth i my gold quoth he where is thousand mark i gave thee villain pig quoth i is burn d my gold quoth he my mistress sir quoth i hang thi mistress i know not thi mistress thi mistress luciana quoth who dromio ephesu quoth my master i know quoth he no hous no wife no mistress so that my errand due unto my tongu i thank him i bare home my shoulder conclus he did beat me there adriana go back again thou slave fetch him home dromio ephesu go back again be new beaten home god s sake send some other messeng adriana back slave or i will break thi pate across dromio ephesu he will bless that cross other beat you i shall have holi head adriana henc prate peasant fetch thi master home dromio ephesu am i so round you as you me that like footbal you do spurn me thu you spurn me henc he will spurn me hither if i last thi servic you must case me leather _exit _ luciana fie how impati loureth your face adriana hi compani must do hi minion grace whilst i home starv merri look hath home age th allur beauti took my poor cheek then he hath wast it are my discours dull barren my wit if volubl sharp discours be marr d unkind blunt it more than marbl hard do their gay vestment hi affect bait that s not my fault he s master my state what ruin are me that can be found him not ruin d then is he ground my defeatur my decay fair sunni look hi would soon repair but too unruli deer he break pale feed home poor i am but hi stale luciana self harm jealousi fie beat it henc adriana unfeel fool can such wrong dispens i know hi eye doth homag otherwher or els what let it but he would be here sister you know he promi d me chain would that alon love he would detain so he would keep fair quarter hi bed i see jewel best enamel will lose hi beauti yet gold bide still that other touch yet often touch will wear gold no man that hath name falsehood corrupt doth it shame that my beauti cannot pleas hi eye i ll weep what s left away weep die luciana how mani fond fool serv mad jealousi _exeunt _ scene ii same enter antipholu syracus antipholu syracus gold i gave dromio is laid safe centaur heed slave is wander d forth care seek me comput mine host s report i could not never object pleas thine eye that never touch well welcom thi hand that never meat sweet savour d thi tast unless i spake or look d or touch d or carv d thee how come it now my husband o how come it motion turn you may move us then gentl brother get you again comfort my sister cheer her call her wife ti holi sport be littl vain when sweet breath flatteri conquer strife antipholu syracus sweet mistress what your name is els i know not nor what wonder you do hit mine less your knowledg your grace you show not than our earth s wonder more than earth divin teach me dear creatur how think speak lay open my earthi gross conceit smother d error feebl shallow weak fold mean your word deceit against my soul s pure truth whi labour you make it wander unknown field are you god would you creat me new transform me then your power i ll yield but if that i am i then well i know your weep sister is no wife mine nor her bed no homag do i owe far more far more you do i declin o train me not sweet eye antipholu syracus gaze your beam fair sun be luciana gaze where you should that will clear your sight antipholu syracus as good wink sweet love as look night luciana whi call you me love call my sister so antipholu syracus thi sister s sister luciana that s my sister antipholu syracus no it is thyself mine own self s better part mine eye s clear eye my dear heart s dearer heart my food my fortun my sweet hope s aim my sole earth s heaven my heaven s claim luciana all thi my sister is or els should be antipholu syracus call thyself sister sweet i aim thee thee will i love thee lead my life thou hast no husband yet nor i no wife give me thi hand luciana o soft sir hold you still i ll fetch my sister get her goodwil _exit luciana _ enter dromio syracus antipholu syracus whi how now creatur lay claim me antipholu syracus what is she dromio syracus veri rever bodi ay such one as man may not speak he say sir rever i have but lean luck match yet is she wondrou fat marriag antipholu burn poland winter if she live till doomsday she ll burn week longer than whole world antipholu syracus what complexion is she dromio syracus swart like my shoe but her face noth like so clean kept i think trudg pack be gone dromio syracus as bear man would run life so fli i her that would be my wife _exit _ antipholu syracus there s none but witch do inhabit here therefor ti high time that i were henc she that doth call me husband even my soul doth wife abhor but her fair sister possess d such gentl sovereign grace such enchant presenc discours hath almost made me traitor myself but lest is so vain that would refus so fair offer d chain i see man here need not live shift when street he meet such golden gift i ll mart there dromio stay if ani ship put then straight away _exit _ act iv scene i same enter merchant angelo offic merchant you know pentecost sum is due i have not much importun d you nor now i had not but that i am bound persia want guilder my voyag therefor make present satisfact or i ll attach you thi offic angelo even just sum that i do owe you is grow me antipholu instant that i met you he had me chain five o clock i shall receiv money same pleaseth you walk me down hi hous i will discharg my bond thank you too enter antipholu ephesu dromio ephesu courtesan s offic that labour may you save see where he come antipholu ephesu while i go goldsmith s hous go thou buy rope s end that will i bestow my wife her confeder lock me my door day but soft i see goldsmith get thee gone buy thou rope bring it home me dromio ephesu i buy thousand pound year i buy rope _exit dromio _ antipholu ephesu man is well holp that trust you i promis your presenc chain but neither chain nor goldsmith came me belik you thought our love would last too long if it were chain d togeth therefor came not angelo save your merri humour here s note how much your chain weigh utmost carat fine gold charg fashion which doth amount three odd ducat more than i stand debt thi gentleman i pray you see him present discharg d he is bound sea stay but it antipholu ephesu i am not furnish present money besid i have some busi town good signior take stranger my hous you take chain bid my wife disburs sum receipt thereof perchanc i will be there as soon as you angelo then you will bring chain her yourself antipholu ephesu no bear it you lest i come not time enough angelo well sir i will have you chain you antipholu ephesu if i have not sir i hope you have or els you may return your money angelo nay come i pray you sir give me chain both wind tide stay thi gentleman i blame have held him here too long antipholu ephesu good lord you use thi dallianc excus your breach promis porpentin i should have chid you not bring it but like shrew you first begin brawl merchant hour steal i pray you sir dispatch angelo you hear how he importun me chain antipholu ephesu whi give it my wife fetch your money angelo come come you know i gave it you even now either send chain or send me some token antipholu ephesu fie now you run thi humour breath come where s chain i pray you let me see it merchant my busi cannot brook thi dallianc good sir say whe er you ll answer me or no if not i ll leav him offic antipholu ephesu i answer you what should i answer you angelo money that you owe me chain antipholu ephesu i owe you none till i receiv chain angelo you know i gave it you half hour antipholu ephesu you gave me none you wrong me much say so angelo you wrong me more sir deni it consid how it stand my credit merchant well offic arrest him my suit offic i do charg you duke s name obey me angelo thi touch me reput either consent pay thi sum me or i attach you thi offic antipholu ephesu consent pay thee that i never had arrest me foolish fellow if thou dar st angelo here is thi fee arrest him offic i would not spare my brother thi case if he should scorn me so appar offic i do arrest you sir you hear suit antipholu ephesu i do obey thee till i give thee bail but sirrah you shall buy thi sport as dear as all metal your shop will answer angelo sir sir i shall have law ephesu your notori shame i doubt it not enter dromio syracus bay dromio syracus master there s bark epidamnum that stay but till her owner come aboard then sir bear away our fraughtag sir i have convey d aboard i have bought oil balsamum aqua vita ship is her trim merri wind blow fair land they stay nought all but their owner master yourself antipholu ephesu how now madman whi thou peevish sheep what ship epidamnum stay me dromio syracus ship you sent me hire waftag antipholu ephesu thou drunken slave i sent thee rope told thee what purpos what end dromio syracus you sent me rope s end as soon you sent me bay sir bark antipholu ephesu i will debat thi matter more leisur teach your ear list me more heed adriana villain hie thee straight give her thi key tell her desk that s cover d o er turkish tapestri there is purs ducat let her send it tell her i am arrest street that shall bail me hie thee slave be gone offic prison till it come _exeunt merchant angelo offic antipholu ephesu _ dromio syracus adriana that is where we din d where dowsabel did claim me her husband she is too big i hope me compass thither i must although against my will servant must their master mind fulfil _exit _ scene ii same enter adriana luciana adriana ah luciana did he tempt thee so might st thou perceiv auster hi eye that he did plead earnest yea or no look d he or red or pale or sad or merrili what observ mad st thou thi case hi heart s meteor tilt hi face luciana first he deni you had him no right adriana he meant he did me none more my spite luciana then swore he that he wa stranger here adriana true he swore though yet forsworn he were luciana then plead i you adriana what said he luciana that love i begg d you he begg d me adriana what persuas did he tempt thi love luciana word that honest suit might move first he did prais my beauti then my speech adriana did st speak him fair luciana have patienc i beseech adriana i cannot nor i will not hold me still my tongu though not my heart shall have hi will he is deform crook old sere ill fac d wors bodi shapeless everywher viciou coriolanu hear st thou mar aufidiu name not god thou boy tear coriolanu ha aufidiu no more coriolanu measureless liar thou hast made my heart too great what contain it boy o slave pardon me lord ti first time that ever i wa forc d scold your judgment my grave lord must give thi cur lie hi own notion who wear my stripe impress d him that must bear my beat hi grave shall join thrust lie unto him first lord peac both hear me speak coriolanu cut me piec volsc men lad stain all your edg me boy fals hound if you have writ your annal true ti there that like eagl dove cote i flutter d your volscian corioli alon i did it boy aufidiu whi nobl lord will you be put mind hi blind fortun which wa your shame thi unholi braggart fore your own eye ear conspir let him die t all peopl tear him piec do it present he kill d my son my daughter he kill d my cousin marcu he kill d my father second lord peac ho no outrag peac man is nobl hi fame fold thi orb o th earth hi last offenc us shall have judici hear stand aufidiu troubl not peac coriolanu o that i had him six aufidius or more hi tribe use my law sword aufidiu insol villain conspir kill kill kill kill kill him conspir draw kill coriolanu who fall aufidiu stand him lord hold hold hold hold aufidiu my nobl master hear me speak first lord o tullu second lord thou hast done deed whereat valour will weep third lord tread not him master all be quiet put your sword aufidiu my lord when you shall know as thi rage provok d him you cannot great danger which thi man s life did owe you you ll rejoic that he is thu cut off pleas it your honour call me your senat i ll deliv myself your loyal servant or endur your heaviest censur first lord bear henc hi bodi mourn you him let him be regard as most nobl cors that ever herald did follow hi um second lord hi own impati take aufidiu great part blame let s make best it aufidiu my rage is gone i am struck sorrow take him help three o th chiefest soldier i ll be one beat thou drum that it speak mourn trail your steel pike though thi citi he hath widow unchild mani one which thi hour bewail injuri yet he shall have nobl memori assist exeunt bear bodi coriolanu dead march sound cymbelin enter two gentlemen first gentleman you do not meet man but frown our blood no more obey heaven than our courtier still seem as doe king s second gentleman but what s matter first gentleman hi daughter heir s kingdom whom he purpo d hi wife s sole son widow that late he marri hath referr d herself unto poor but worthi gentleman she s wed her husband banish d she imprison d all is outward sorrow though i think king be touch d veri heart second gentleman none but king first gentleman he that hath lost her too so is queen that most desir d match but not courtier although they wear their face bent king s look hath heart that is not glad thing they scowl second gentleman whi so first gentleman he that hath miss d princess is thing too bad bad report he that hath her i mean that marri her alack good man therefor banish d is creatur such as seek region earth one hi like there would be someth fail him that should compar i do not think so fair outward such stuff endow man but he second gentleman you speak him far first gentleman i do extend him sir himself crush him togeth rather than unfold hi measur duli second gentleman what s hi name birth first gentleman i cannot delv him root hi father wa call d siciliu who did join hi honour against roman cassibelan but had hi titl tenantiu whom he serv d glori admir d success so gain d sur addit leonatu had besid thi gentleman question two other son who war o th time die their sword hand which their father then old fond issu took such sorrow that he quit be hi gentl ladi big thi gentleman our theme decea d as he wa born king he take babe hi protect call him posthumu leonatu breed him make him hi bed chamber put him all learn that hi time could make him receiv which he took as we do air fast as twa minist red s spring becam harvest liv d court which rare it is do most prai d most lov d sampl youngest th more matur glass that feat them graver child that guid dotard hi mistress whom he now is banish d her own price proclaim how she esteem d him hi virtu her elect may be truli read what kind man he is second gentleman i honour him even your report but pray you tell me is she sole child th king first gentleman hi onli child he had two son if thi be worth your hear mark it eldest them three year old i th swath cloth other their nurseri were stol n thi hour no guess knowledg which way they went second gentleman how long is thi ago first gentleman some twenti year second gentleman that king s children should be so convey d so slackli guard search so slow that could not trace them first gentleman howso er ti strang or that neglig may well be laugh d yet is it true sir second gentleman i do well believ you first gentleman we must forbear here come gentleman queen princess _exeunt _ scene ii same enter queen posthumu imogen queen no be assur d you shall not find me daughter slander most stepmoth evil ey d unto you you re my prison but your gaoler shall deliv you key that lock your restraint you high i will henc today queen you know peril i ll fetch turn garden piti pang barr d affect though king hath charg d you should not speak togeth _exit _ imogen o dissembl courtesi how fine thi tyrant can tickl where she wound my dearest husband i someth fear my father s wrath but noth alway reserv d my holi duti what hi rage can do me you must be gone i shall here abid hourli shot angri eye not comfort live but that there is thi jewel world that i may see again posthumu my queen my mistress o ladi weep no more lest i give caus be suspect more tender than doth becom man i will remain loyal st husband that did e er plight troth my resid rome one philario s who my father wa friend me known but letter thither write my queen mine eye i ll drink word you send though ink be made gall enter queen queen be brief i pray you if king come i shall incur i know not how much hi displeasur _asid _ yet i ll move him walk thi way i never do him wrong but he doe buy my injuri be friend pay dear my offenc love thi diamond wa my mother s take it heart but keep it till you woo anoth wife when imogen is dead posthumu how how anoth you gentl god give me but thi i have sear my embrac next bond death remain it thi fairest prison _put bracelet her arm _ imogen o god when shall we see again enter cymbelin lord posthumu alack king cymbelin thou basest thing avoid henc my sight if thi command thou fraught court thi unworthi thou diest away thou rt poison my blood posthumu god protect you bless good remaind court i am gone _exit _ imogen there cannot be pinch death more sharp than thi is cymbelin o disloy thing that shouldst repair my youth thou heap st year s age me imogen i beseech you sir harm not yourself your vexat i am senseless your wrath touch more rare subdu all pang all fear cymbelin past grace obedi imogen past hope despair that way past grace cymbelin that mightst have had sole son my queen imogen o bless that i might not i chose eagl did avoid puttock cymbelin thou took st beggar wouldst have made my throne seat base imogen no i rather ad lustr it cymbelin o thou vile one imogen sir it is your fault that i have lov d posthumu you bred him as my playfellow he is man that i did amplifi my judgement other conclus i will tri forc these thi compound such creatur as we count not worth hang but none human tri vigour them appli allay their act them gather their sever me my law pleasur she restrain d pray d me oft forbear did it pudenc so rosi sweet view t might well have warm d old saturn that i thought her as chast as unsunn d snow o all devil thi yellow iachimo hour wa t not or less first perchanc he spoke not but like full acorn d boar german one cri o mount found no opposit but what he look d should oppos she should encount guard could i find woman s part me there s no motion that tend vice man but i affirm it is woman s part be it lie note it woman s flatter her deceiv her lust rank thought her her reveng her ambit covet chang pride disdain nice long slander mutabl all fault that man may name nay that hell know whi her part or all but rather all even vice they are not constant but are chang still one vice but minut old one not half so old as that gain cap him that make him fine yet keep hi book uncross d no life our guideriu your proof you speak we poor unfledg d have never wing d view o th nest nor know not what air s home hapli thi life is sland rou epitaph as record fair act nay mani time doth ill deserv do well what s wors must curtsi censur o boy thi stori world may read me my bodi s mark d roman sword my report wa onc first best note cymbelin lov d me when soldier wa theme my name wa not far off then wa i as tree whose bough did bend fruit but one night storm or robberi call it what you will shook down my mellow hang nay my leav left me bare weather guideriu uncertain favour belariu my fault be noth as i have told you oft but that two villain whose fals oath prevail d my perfect honour swore cymbelin i wa confeder roman so follow d my banish thi twenti year thi rock these demesn have been my world where i have liv d honest freedom paid more piou debt heaven than all fore end my time but th mountain thi is not hunter languag he that strike venison first shall be lord o th feast him other two shall minist we will fear no poison which attend place greater state i ll meet you valley _exeunt guideriu arviragu _ how hard it is hide spark natur these boy know littl they are son th king nor cymbelin dream that they are aliv they think they are mine though train d thu meanli i th cave wherein they bow their thought do hit roof palac natur prompt them simpl low thing princ it much trick other thi polydor heir cymbelin britain who king hi father call d guideriu jove when my three foot stool i sit tell warlik feat i have done hi spirit fli my stori say thu mine enemi fell thu i set my foot s neck even then princ blood flow hi cheek he sweat strain hi young nerv put himself postur that act my word younger brother cadwal onc arviragu as like figur strike life my speech show much more hi own conceiv hark game is rou d o cymbelin heaven my conscienc know thou didst unjustli banish me whereon three two year old i stole these babe think bar thee success as thou reft me my land euriphil thou wast their nurs they took thee their mother everi day do honour her grave myself belariu that am morgan call d they take natur father game is _exit _ scene iv wale near milford haven enter pisanio imogen imogen thou told st me when we came hors place wa near hand ne er long d my mother so see me first as i wretch man thing most disdain d fortun imogen _read _ _thi mistress pisanio hath play d strumpet my bed testimoni whereof lie bleed me i speak not weak surmis but proof as strong as my grief as certain as i expect my reveng that part thou pisanio must act me if thi faith be not taint breach her let thine own hand take away her life i shall give thee opportun milford haven she hath my letter purpos where if thou fear strike make me certain it is done thou art pandar her dishonour equal me disloy _ pisanio what shall i need draw my sword paper hath cut her throat alreadi no ti slander whose edg is sharper than sword whose tongu outvenom all worm nile whose breath ride post wind doth beli all corner world king queen state maid matron nay secret grave thi viper slander enter what cheer madam imogen fals hi bed what is it be fals lie watch there think him weep twixt clock clock if sleep charg natur break it fear dream him cri myself awak that s fals s bed is it pisanio ala good him poor i am stale garment fashion i am richer than hang th wall i must be ripp d piec me o men s vow are women s traitor all good seem thi revolt o husband shall be thought put villaini not born where t grow but worn bait ladi pisanio good madam hear me imogen true honest men be heard like fals nea were hi time thought fals sinon s weep did scandal mani holi tear took piti most true wretched so thou posthumu wilt lay leaven all proper men goodli gallant shall be fals perjur d thi great fail come fellow be thou honest do thou thi master s bid when thou seest him littl wit my obedi look i
