now thou seem st coward pisanio henc vile instrument thou shalt not damn my hand imogen whi i must die if i do not thi hand thou art no servant thi master s against self slaughter there is prohibit so divin that craven my weak hand come here s my heart someth s afor t soft soft we ll no defenc obedi as scabbard what is here scriptur loyal leonatu all turn d heresi away away corrupt my faith you shall no more be stomach my heart thu may poor fool believ fals teacher though those that are betray d do feel treason sharpli yet traitor stand wors case woe thou posthumu that didst set my disobedi gainst king my father make me put contempt suit princ fellow shalt hereaft find it is no act common passag but strain rare i griev myself think when thou shalt be disedg d her that now thou tirest how thi memori will then be pang d me prithe dispatch lamp entreat butcher where s thi knife thou art too slow do thi master s bid when i desir it too pisanio o graciou ladi i receiv d command do thi busin i have not slept one wink imogen do t bed then pisanio i ll wake mine eyebal first imogen wherefor then didst undertak it whi hast thou abu d so mani mile pretenc thi place mine action thine own our hors labour time invit thee perturb d court my be absent whereunto i never purpos return whi hast thou gone so far be unbent when thou hast ta en thi stand th elect deer thee pisanio but win time lose so bad employ which i have consid d cours good ladi hear me patienc imogen talk thi tongu weari speak i have heard i am strumpet mine ear therein fals struck can take no greater wound nor tent bottom that but speak pisanio then madam i thought you would not back again imogen most like bring me here kill me pisanio not so neither but if i were as wise as honest then my purpos would prove well it cannot be but that my master is abu d some villain ay singular hi art hath done you both thi curs injuri imogen some roman courtezan pisanio no my life i ll give but notic you are dead send him some bloodi sign it ti command i should do so you shall be miss d court that will well confirm it imogen whi good fellow what shall i do while where bide how live or my life what comfort when i am dead my husband pisanio if you ll back th court imogen no court no father nor no more ado that harsh nobl simpl noth that cloten whose love suit hath been me as fear as sieg pisanio if not court then not britain must you bide imogen where then hath britain all sun that shine day night are they not but britain i th world s volum our britain seem as it but not t great pool swan s nest prithe think there s liver britain pisanio i am most glad you think other place th ambassador luciu roman come milford haven tomorrow now if you could wear mind dark as your fortun is but disguis that which t appear itself must not yet be but self danger you should tread cours pretti full view yea happili near resid posthumu so nigh least that though hi action were not visibl yet report should render him hourli your ear as truli as he move imogen o such mean though peril my modesti not death t i would adventur pisanio well then here s point you must forget be woman chang command obedi fear nice handmaid all women or more truli woman it pretti self waggish courag readi gibe quick answer d sauci as quarrel as weasel nay you must forget that rarest treasur your cheek expos it but o harder heart alack no remedi greedi touch common kiss titan forget your laboursom dainti trim wherein you made great juno angri imogen nay be brief i see thi end am almost man alreadi pisanio first make yourself but like one fore think thi i have alreadi fit ti my cloak bag doublet hat hose all that answer them would you their serv what imit you can borrow youth such season fore nobl luciu present yourself desir hi servic tell him wherein you re happi which will make him know if that hi head have ear music doubtless joy he will embrac you he s honour doubl that most holi your mean abroad you have me rich i will never fail begin nor supplyment imogen thou art all comfort god will diet me prithe away there s more be consid d but we ll even all that good time will give us thi attempt i am soldier will abid it princ s courag away i prithe pisanio well madam we must take short farewel lest be miss d i be suspect your carriag court my nobl mistress here is box i had it queen what s t is preciou if you are sick sea or stomach qualm d land dram thi will drive away distemp some shade fit you your manhood may god direct you best imogen amen i thank thee _exeunt sever _ scene v britain cymbelin s palac enter cymbelin queen cloten luciu lord cymbelin thu far so farewel luciu thank royal sir my emperor hath wrote i must henc am right sorri that i must report ye my master s enemi cymbelin our subject sir will not endur hi yoke ourself show less sovereignti than they must need appear unkinglik luciu so sir i desir you conduct overland milford haven madam all joy befal your grace you cymbelin my lord you are appoint that offic due honour no point omit so farewel nobl luciu luciu your hand my lord cloten receiv it friendli but thi time forth i wear it as your enemi luciu sir event is yet name winner fare you well cymbelin leav not worthi luciu good my lord till he have cross d severn happi _exeunt luciu lord _ queen he goe henc frown but it honour us that we have given him caus cloten ti all better your valiant briton have their wish it cymbelin luciu hath wrote alreadi emperor how it goe here it fit us therefor ripe our chariot our horsemen be readi pow rs that he alreadi hath gallia will soon be drawn head whenc he move hi war britain queen ti not sleepi busi but must be look d speedili strongli cymbelin our expect that it would be thu hath made us forward but my gentl queen where is our daughter she hath not appear d roman nor us hath tender d duti day she look us like thing more made malic than duti we have note it call her us we have been too slight suffer _exit attend _ queen royal sir exil posthumu most retir d hath her life been cure whereof my lord ti time must do beseech your majesti forbear sharp speech her she s ladi so tender rebuk that word are stroke stroke death her enter attend cymbelin where is she sir how can her contempt be answer d attend pleas you sir her chamber are all lock d there s no answer that will be given th loud nois we make queen my lord when last i went visit her she pray d me excus her keep close whereto constrain d her infirm she should that duti leav unpaid you which daili she wa bound proffer thi she wish d me make known but our great court made me blame memori cymbelin her door lock d not seen late grant heaven that which i fear prove fals _exit _ queen son i say follow king cloten that man her pisanio her old servant i have not seen these two day queen go look _exit cloten _ pisanio thou that stand st so posthumu he hath drug mine i pray hi absenc proceed swallow that he believ it is thing most preciou but her where is she gone hapli despair hath seiz d her or wing d fervour her love she s flown her desir d posthumu gone she is death or dishonour my end can make good use either she be down i have place british crown enter cloten how now my son cloten ti certain she is fled go cheer king he rage none dare come him queen all better may thi night forestal him come day _exit _ cloten i love hate her she s fair royal that she hath all courtli part more exquisit than ladi ladi woman everi one best she hath she all compound outsel them all i love her therefor but disdain me throw favour low posthumu slander so her judgement that what s els rare is chok d that point i will conclud hate her nay inde be reveng d her when fool shall enter pisanio who is here what are you pack sirrah come hither ah you preciou pandar villain where is thi ladi word or els thou art straightway fiend pisanio o good my lord cloten where is thi ladi or jupit i will not ask again close villain i ll have thi secret thi heart or rip thi heart find it is she posthumu whose so mani weight base cannot dram worth be drawn pisanio ala my lord how can she be him when wa she miss d he is rome cloten where is she sir come nearer no farther halt satisfi me home what is becom her pisanio o my all worthi lord cloten all worthi villain discov where thi mistress is onc next word no more worthi lord speak or thi silenc instant is thi condemn thi death pisanio then sir thi paper is histori my knowledg touch her flight _present letter _ cloten let s see t i will pursu her even augustu throne pisanio _asid _ or thi or perish she s far enough what he learn thi may prove hi travel not her danger cloten humh pisanio _asid _ i ll write my lord she s dead o imogen safe mayst thou wander safe return again cloten sirrah is thi letter true pisanio sir as i think cloten it is posthumu hand i know t sirrah if thou wouldst not be villain but do me true servic undergo those employ wherein i should have caus use thee seriou industri that is what villaini soe er i bid thee do perform it directli truli i would think thee honest man thou shouldst neither want my mean thi relief nor my voic thi prefer pisanio well my good lord cloten wilt thou serv me patient constantli thou hast stuck bare fortun that beggar posthumu thou canst not cours gratitud but be dilig follow mine wilt thou serv me pisanio sir i will cloten give me thi hand here s my purs hast ani thi late master s garment thi possess pisanio i have my lord my lodg same suit he wore when he took leav my ladi mistress cloten first servic thou dost me fetch that suit hither let it be thi first servic go pisanio i shall my lord _exit _ cloten meet thee milford haven i forgot ask him one thing i ll rememb t anon even there thou villain posthumu will i kill thee i would these garment were come she said time bitter it i now belch my heart that she held veri garment posthumu more respect than my nobl natur person togeth adorn my qualiti that suit my back will i ravish her first kill him her eye there shall she see my valour which will then be torment her contempt he ground my speech insult end hi dead bodi when my lust hath dine which as i say vex her i will execut cloth that she so prai d court i ll knock her back foot her home again she hath despi d me rejoicingli i ll be merri my reveng enter pisanio cloth be those garment pisanio ay my nobl lord cloten how long is t she went milford haven pisanio she can scarc be there yet cloten bring thi apparel my chamber that is second thing that i have command thee third is that thou wilt be voluntari mute my design be but duteou true prefer shall tender itself thee my reveng is now milford would i had wing follow it come be true _exit _ pisanio thou bid st me my loss true thee were prove fals which i will never be him that is most true milford go find not her whom thou pursuest flow flow you heavenli bless her thi fool s speed be cross d slow labour be hi meed _exit _ scene vi wale cave belariu enter imogen alon boy s cloth imogen i see man s life is tediou one i have tir d myself two night togeth have made ground my bed i should be sick but that my resolut help me milford when mountain top pisanio show d thee thou wast ken o jove i think foundat fli wretch such i mean where they should be reliev d two beggar told me i could not miss my way will poor folk lie that have afflict them know ti punish or trial ye no wonder when rich one scarc tell true laps ful is sorer than lie need falsehood is wors king than beggar my dear lord thou art one o th fals one now i think thee my hunger s gone but even i wa point sink food but what is thi here is path t ti some savag hold i were best not call i dare not call yet famin ere clean it o erthrow natur make it valiant plenti peac breed coward hard ever hardi is mother ho who s here if anyth that s civil speak if savag take or lend ho no answer then i ll enter best draw my sword if mine enemi but fear sword like me he ll scarc look t such foe good heaven _exit cave _ scene vii same enter belariu guideriu arviragu belariu you polydor have prov d best woodman are master feast cadwal i will play cook servant ti our match sweat industri would dri die but end it work come our stomach will make what s home savouri weari can snore flint when resti sloth find down pillow hard now peac be here poor hous that keep st thyself guideriu i am thoroughli weari arviragu i am weak toil yet strong appetit guideriu there is cold meat i th cave we ll brows that whilst what we have kill d be cook d belariu _look cave _ stay come not but that it eat our victual i should think here were fairi guideriu what s matter sir belariu jupit angel or if not earthli paragon behold divin no elder than boy enter imogen imogen good master harm me not i enter d here i call d thought have begg d or bought what i have took good troth i have stol n nought nor would not though i had found gold strew d i th floor here s money my meat i would have left it board so soon as i had made my meal part pray rs provid guideriu money youth arviragu all gold silver rather turn dirt as ti no better reckon d but those who worship dirti god imogen i see you re angri know if you kill me my fault i should have die had i not made it belariu whither bound imogen milford haven belariu what s your name imogen fidel sir i have kinsman who is bound itali he embark d milford whom be go almost spent hunger i am fall n thi offenc belariu prithe fair youth think us no churl nor measur our good mind thi rude place we live well encount d ti almost night you shall have better cheer ere you depart thank stay eat it boy bid him welcom guideriu were you woman youth i should woo hard but be your groom honesti i bid you as i d buy arviragu i ll make t my comfort he is man i ll love him as my brother such welcom as i d give him long absenc such is your most welcom be sprightli you fall mongst friend imogen mongst friend if brother _asid _ would it had been so that they had been my father s son then had my prize been less so more equal ballast thee posthumu belariu he wring some distress guideriu would i could free t arviragu or i whate er it be what pain it cost what danger god belariu _whisper _ hark boy imogen _asid _ great men that had court no bigger than thi cave that did attend themselv had virtu which their own conscienc seal d them lay that noth gift differ multitud could not peer these twain pardon me god i d chang my sex be companion them leonatu fals belariu it shall be so boy we ll go dress our hunt fair youth come discours is heavi fast when we have supp d we ll mannerli demand thee thi stori so far as thou wilt speak it guideriu pray draw near arviragu night th owl morn th lark less welcom imogen thank sir arviragu i pray draw near _exeunt _ scene viii rome public place enter two roman senat tribun first senat thi is tenour emperor s writ that common men are now action gainst pannonian dalmatian that legion now gallia are full weak undertak our war against fall n off briton that we do incit gentri thi busi he creat luciu proconsul you tribun thi immedi levi he command hi absolut commiss long live csar tribun is luciu gener forc second senat ay tribun remain now gallia first senat those legion which i have spoke whereunto your levi must be supplyant word your commiss will tie you number time their dispatch tribun we will discharg our duti _exeunt _ act iv scene i wale near cave belariu enter cloten alon cloten i am near th place where they should meet if pisanio have mapp d it truli how fit hi garment serv me whi should hi mistress who wa made him that made tailor not be fit too rather save rever word ti said woman s fit come fit therein i must play workman i dare speak it myself it is not vain glori man hi glass confer hi own chamber i mean line my bodi are as well drawn as hi no less young more strong not beneath him fortun him advantag time him birth alik convers gener servic more remark singl opposit yet thi imperceiver thing love him my despit what mortal is posthumu thi head which now is grow thi shoulder shall thi hour be off thi mistress enforc thi garment cut piec her face all thi done spurn her home her father who may hapli be littl angri my so rough usag but my mother have power hi testi shall turn all my commend my hors is tie safe sword sore purpos fortun put them my hand thi is veri descript their meet place fellow dare not deceiv me _exit _ scene ii wale cave belariu enter cave belariu guideriu arviragu imogen belariu _to imogen _ you are not well remain here cave we ll come you hunt arviragu _to imogen _ brother stay here are we not brother imogen so man man should be but clay clay differ digniti whose dust is both alik i am veri sick guideriu go you hunt i ll abid him imogen so sick i am not yet i am not well but not so citizen wanton as seem die ere sick so pleas you leav me stick your journal cours breach custom is breach all i am ill but your be me cannot amend me societi is no comfort one not sociabl i am not veri sick i can reason it pray you trust me here i ll rob none but myself let me die steal so poorli guideriu i love thee i have spoke it how much quantiti weight as much as i do love my father belariu what how how arviragu if it be sin say so sir i yoke me my good brother s fault i know not whi i love thi youth i have heard you say love s reason s reason bier door demand who is t shall die i d say my father not thi youth belariu _asid _ o nobl strain o worthi natur breed great st report th imperi sea breed monster dish poor tributari river as sweet fish i am sick still heart sick pisanio i ll now tast thi drug _swallow some _ guideriu i could not stir him he said he wa arviragu how angel like he sing guideriu but hi neat cookeri he cut our root charact sauc d our broth as juno had been sick he her dieter arviragu nobli he yoke smile sigh as if sigh wa that it wa not be such smile smile mock sigh that it would fli so divin templ commix wind that sailor rail guideriu i do note that grief patienc root him both mingl their spur togeth arviragu grow patienc let stink compani are near pray you away let me alon him _exeunt belariu arviragu _ cloten soft what are you that fli me thu some villain mountain i have heard such what slave art thou guideriu thing more bigger i wear not my dagger my mouth say what thou art whi i should yield thee cloten thou villain base know st me not my cloth guideriu no nor thi tailor rascal who is thi grandfath he made those cloth which as it seem make thee cloten thou preciou varlet my tailor made them not guideriu henc then thank man that gave them thee thou art some fool i am loath beat thee cloten thou injuri thief hear but my name trembl guideriu what s thi name cloten cloten thou villain guideriu cloten thou doubl villain be thi name i cannot trembl it were it toad or adder spider twould move me sooner cloten thi further fear nay thi mere confus thou shalt know i am son th queen guideriu i m sorri t not seem so worthi as thi birth cloten art not afeard guideriu those that i rever those i fear wise fool i laugh not fear them cloten die death when i have slain thee my proper hand i ll follow those that even now fled henc gate lud s town set your head yield rustic mountain _exeunt fight _ enter belariu arviragu belariu no compani s abroad arviragu none world you did mistak him sure belariu i cannot tell long is it i saw him but time hath noth blurr d those line favour which then he wore snatch hi voic burst speak were as hi i am absolut twa veri cloten arviragu thi place we left them i wish my brother make good time him you say he is so fell belariu be scarc made i mean man he had not apprehens or roar terror defect judgement is oft ceas fear enter guideriu cloten s head but see thi brother guideriu thi cloten wa fool empti purs there wa no money t not hercul could have knock d hi brain he had none yet i not do thi fool had born my head as i do hi belariu what hast thou done guideriu i am perfect what cut off one cloten s head son queen hi own report who call d me traitor mountain swore hi own singl hand he d take us displac our head where thank god they grow set them lud s town belariu we are all undon guideriu whi worthi father what have we lose but that he swore take our live law protect not us then whi should we be tender let arrog piec flesh threat us play judg execution all himself we do fear law what compani discov you abroad belariu no singl soul can we set eye but all safe reason he must have some attend though hi humour wa noth but mutat ay that one bad thing wors not frenzi not absolut mad could so far have rav d bring him here alon although perhap it may be heard court that such as we cave here hunt here are outlaw time may make some stronger head which he hear as it is like him might break swear he d fetch us yet is t not probabl come alon either he so undertak or they so suffer then good ground we fear if we do fear thi bodi hath tail more peril than head arviragu let ordin come as god foresay it howso er my brother hath done well belariu i had no mind hunt thi day boy fidel s sick did make my way long forth guideriu hi own sword which he did wave against my throat i have ta en hi head him i ll throw t creek behind our rock let it sea tell fish he s queen s son cloten that s all i reck _exit _ belariu i fear twill be reveng d would polydor thou hadst not done t though valour becom thee well enough arviragu would i had done t so reveng alon pursu d me polydor i love thee brotherli but envi much thou hast robb d me thi deed i would reveng that possibl strength might meet would seek us put us our answer belariu well ti done we ll hunt no more today nor seek danger where there s no profit i prithe our rock you fidel play cook i ll stay till hasti polydor return bring him dinner present arviragu poor sick fidel i ll willingli him gain hi colour i d let parish such cloten s blood prais myself chariti _exit _ belariu o thou goddess thou divin natur thou thyself thou blazon st these two princ boy they are as gentl as zephyr blow violet not wag hi sweet head yet as rough their royal blood enchaf d as rud st wind that top doth take mountain pine make him stoop th vale ti wonder that invis instinct should frame them royalti unlearn d honour untaught civil not seen other valour that wildli grow them but yield crop as if it had been sow d yet still it s strang what cloten s be here us portend or what hi death will bring us enter guideriu guideriu where s my brother i have sent cloten s clotpol down stream embassi hi mother hi bodi s hostag hi return _solemn music _ belariu my ingeni instrument hark polydor it sound but what occas hath cadwal now give it motion hark guideriu is he home belariu he went henc even now guideriu what doe he mean death my dear st mother it did not speak all solemn thing should answer solemn accid matter triumph noth lament toy is jolliti ape grief boy is cadwal mad enter arviragu imogen as dead bear her hi arm belariu look here he come bring dire occas hi arm what we blame him arviragu bird is dead that we have made so much i had rather have skipp d sixteen year age sixti have turn d my leap time crutch than have seen thi guideriu o sweetest fairest lili my brother wear thee not one half so well as when thou grew st thyself belariu o melancholi who ever yet could sound thi bottom find ooz show what coast thi sluggish crare might st easiliest harbour thou bless thing flower that s like thi face pale primros nor azur d hare bell like thi vein no nor leaf eglantin whom not slander sweet ned not thi breath ruddock would charit bill o bill sore shame those rich left heir that let their father lie monument bring thee all thi yea furr d moss besid when flow rs are none winter ground thi cors guideriu prithe have done do not play wench like word that which is so seriou let us buri him not protract admir what is now due debt th grave arviragu say where shall s lay him guideriu good euriphil our mother arviragu be t so let us polydor though now our voic have got mannish crack sing him th ground as onc our mother use like note word save that euriphil must be fidel guideriu cadwal i cannot sing i ll weep word it thee note sorrow tune are wors than priest fane that lie arviragu we ll speak it then belariu great grief i see med cine less cloten is quit forgot he wa queen s son boy though he came our enemi rememb he wa paid that though mean mighti rot togeth have one dust yet rever that angel world doth make distinct place tween high low our foe wa princ though you took hi life as be our foe yet buri him as princ guideriu pray you fetch him hither thersit bodi is as good as ajax when neither are aliv arviragu if you ll go fetch him we ll say our song whilst brother begin _exit belariu _ guideriu nay cadwal we must lay hi head th east my father hath reason t arviragu ti true guideriu come then remov him arviragu so begin song guideriu _ fear no more heat o th sun nor furiou winter s rage thou thi worldli task hast done home art gone ta en that have them cold dew o th night are strew fit st grave their face you were as flow rs now wither d even so these herblet shall which we you strew come away apart our knee ground that gave them first ha them again their pleasur here are past so is their pain _exeunt all but imogen _ imogen _awak _ ye sir milford haven which is way i thank you yond bush pray how far thither od pittikin can it be six mile yet i have gone all night faith i ll lie down sleep but soft no bedfellow o god goddess _see bodi _ these flow rs are like pleasur world thi bloodi man care t i hope i dream so i thought i wa cave keeper cook honest creatur but ti not so twa but bolt noth shot noth which brain make fume our veri eye are sometim like our judgement blind good faith i trembl still fear but if there be yet left heaven as small drop piti as wren s eye fear d god part it dream s here still even when i wake it is me as me not imagin d felt headless man garment posthumu i know shape s leg thi is hi hand hi cut off my lord write read be henceforth treacher damn d pisanio hath hi forg letter damn d pisanio thi most bravest vessel world struck main top o posthumu ala where is thi head where s that ay me preciou cordial me have i not found it murd rou th sens that confirm it home thi is pisanio s deed cloten o give colour my pale cheek thi blood that we horrid may seem those which chanc find us o my lord my lord _fall faint bodi _ enter luciu captain soothsay captain them legion garrison d gallia your will have cross d sea attend you here milford haven your ship they are readi luciu but what rome captain senat hath stirr d confin gentlemen itali most will spirit that promis nobl servic they come conduct bold iachimo sienna s brother luciu when expect you them captain next benefit o th wind pray d their intellig thu i saw jove s bird roman eagl wing d spongi south thi part west there vanish d sunbeam which portend unless my sin abus my divin success th roman host luciu dream often so never fals soft ho what trunk is here hi top ruin speak that sometim it wa worthi build how page or dead or sleep him but dead rather natur doth abhor make hi bed defunct or sleep dead let s see boy s face captain he s aliv my lord luciu he ll then instruct us thi bodi young one inform us thi fortun it seem they crave be demand who is thi thou mak st thi bloodi pillow or who wa he that otherwis than nobl natur did hath alter d that good pictur what s thi interest thi sad wreck how came t who is t what art thou imogen i am noth or if not noth be were better thi wa my master veri valiant briton good that here mountain lie slain ala there is no more such master i may wander east occid cri servic tri mani all good serv truli never find such anoth master luciu lack good youth thou mov st no less thi complain than thi master bleed say hi name good friend imogen richard du champ _asid _ if i do lie do no harm it though god hear i hope they ll pardon it say you sir luciu thi name imogen fidel sir luciu thou dost approv thyself veri same thi name well fit thi faith thi faith thi name wilt take thi chanc me i will not say thou shalt be so well master d but be sure no less belov d roman emperor s letter sent consul me should not sooner than thine own worth prefer thee go me imogen i ll follow sir but first t pleas god i ll hide my master fli as deep as these poor pickax can dig when wild wood leav weed i ha strew d hi grave it said centuri prayer such as i can twice o er i ll weep sigh leav so hi servic follow you so pleas you entertain me luciu ay good youth rather father thee than master thee my friend boy hath taught us manli duti let us find prettiest daisi plot we can make him our pike partisan grave come arm him boy he is preferr d thee us he shall be interr d as soldier can be cheer wipe thine eye some fall are mean happier aris _exeunt _ scene iii britain cymbelin s palac enter cymbelin lord pisanio attend cymbelin again bring me word how ti her _exit attend _ fever absenc her son mad which her life s danger heaven how deepli you onc do touch me imogen great part my comfort gone my queen desper bed time when fear war point me her son gone so need thi present it strike me past hope comfort but thee fellow who need must know her departur dost seem so ignor we ll enforc it thee sharp tortur pisanio sir my life is your i humbl set it your will but my perform all part hi subject loyal cloten there want no dilig seek him will no doubt be found cymbelin time is troublesom _to pisanio _ we ll slip you season but our jealousi doe yet depend lord so less than what you hear come more more you re readi want is but put those pow rs motion that long move cymbelin i thank you let s withdraw meet time as it seek us we fear not what can itali annoy us but we griev chanc here away _exeunt all but pisanio _ pisanio i heard no letter my master i wrote him imogen wa slain ti strang nor hear i my mistress who did promis yield me often tide neither know i what is betid cloten but remain perplex d all heaven still must work wherein i am fals i am honest not true be true these present war shall find i love my countri even note o th king or i ll fall them all other doubt time let them be clear d fortun bring some boat that are not steer d _exit _ scene iv wale cave belariu enter belariu guideriu arviragu guideriu nois is round us belariu let us it son we ll higher mountain there secur us king s parti there s no go new cloten s death we be not known not muster d band may drive us render where we have liv d so extort s that which we have done whose answer would be death drawn tortur guideriu thi is sir doubt such time noth becom you nor satisfi us arviragu it is not like that when they hear roman hors neigh behold their quarter d fire have both their eye ear so cloy d importantli as now that they will wast their time our note know whenc we are belariu o i am known mani armi mani year though cloten then but young you see not wore him my slave winter guideriu than be so better ceas be pray sir th armi i my brother are not known yourself so thought thereto so o ergrown cannot be question arviragu thi sun that shine i ll thither what thing is t that i never did see man die scarc ever look d blood but that coward hare hot goat venison never bestrid hors save one that had rider like myself who ne er wore rowel nor iron hi heel i am asham d look holi sun have benefit hi blest beam remain so long poor unknown guideriu heaven i ll go if you will bless me sir give me leav i ll take better care but if you will not hazard therefor due fall me hand roman arviragu so say i amen belariu no reason i your live you set so slight valuat should reserv my crack d one more care have you boy if your countri war you chanc die that is my bed pisanio everi good servant doe not all command no bond but do just one god if you should have ta en vengeanc my fault i never had liv d put thi so had you save nobl imogen repent struck me wretch more worth your vengeanc but alack you snatch some henc littl fault that s love have them fall no more you some permit second ill ill each elder wors make them dread it doer thrift but imogen is your own heaven hear patient my purpos i ll disrob me these italian weed suit myself as doe britain peasant so i ll fight against part i come so i ll die thee o imogen even whom my life is everi breath death thu unknown piti nor hate face peril myself i ll dedic let me make men know more valour me than my habit show god put strength o th leonati me shame guis o th world i will begin fashion less more _exit _ scene ii britain field battl british roman camp enter luciu iachimo roman armi one door british armi anoth leonatu posthumu follow like poor soldier they march go alarum then enter again skirmish iachimo posthumu he vanquisheth disarmeth iachimo then leav him iachimo heavi guilt my bosom take off my manhood i have beli ladi princess thi countri air t revengingli enfeebl me or could thi carl veri drudg natur s have subdu d me my profess knighthood honour born as i wear mine are titl but scorn if that thi gentri britain go thi lout as he exce our lord odd is that we scarc are men you are god _exit _ battl continu briton fli cymbelin is taken then enter hi rescu belariu guideriu arviragu belariu stand stand we have th advantag ground lane is guard noth rout us but villaini our cri those that fled our britain s hart die fli not our men dark fleet soul that fli backward stand or we are roman will give you that like beast which you shun beastli may save but look back frown stand stand these three three thousand confid act as mani three perform are file when all rest do noth thi word stand stand accommod place more charm their own nobl which could have turn d distaff mere offenc my punish itself all my treason that i suffer d wa all harm i did these gentl princ such so they are these twenti year have i train d those art they have as i could put them my breed wa sir as your high know their nurs euriphil whom theft i wed stole these children my banish i mov d her t have receiv d punish that which i did then beaten loyalti excit me treason their dear loss more you twa felt more it shap d unto my end steal them but graciou sir here are your son again i must lose two sweet st companion world benedict these cover heaven fall their head like dew they are worthi inlay heaven star cymbelin thou weep st speak st servic that you three have done is more unlik than thi thou tell st i lost my children if these be they i know not how wish pair worthier son belariu be plea d awhil thi gentleman whom i call polydor most worthi princ as your is true guideriu thi gentleman my cadwal arviragu your younger princ son he sir wa lapp d most curiou mantl wrought th hand hi queen mother which more probat i can eas produc cymbelin guideriu had hi neck mole sanguin star it wa mark wonder belariu thi is he who hath him still that natur stamp it wa wise natur s end donat be hi evid now cymbelin o what am i mother birth three ne er mother rejoic d deliver more blest pray you be that thi strang start your orb you may reign them now o imogen thou hast lost thi kingdom imogen no my lord i have got two world t o my gentl brother have we thu met o never say hereaft but i am truest speaker you call d me brother when i wa but your sister i you brother when we were so inde cymbelin did you e er meet arviragu ay my good lord guideriu first meet lov d continu d so we thought he die corneliu queen s dram she swallow d cymbelin o rare instinct when shall i hear all thi fierc abridg hath it circumstanti branch which distinct should be rich where how liv d you when came you serv our roman captiv how part your brother how first met them whi fled you court whither these your three motiv battl i know not how much more should be demand all other depend chanc chanc but nor time nor place will serv our long interrogatori see posthumu anchor imogen she like harmless lightn throw her eye him her brother me her master hit each object joy counterchang is sever all let s quit thi ground smoke templ our sacrific _to belariu _ thou art my brother so we ll hold thee ever imogen you are my father too did reliev me see thi graciou season cymbelin all o erjoy d save these bond let them be joy too they shall tast our comfort imogen my good master i will yet do you servic luciu happi be you cymbelin forlorn soldier that so nobli fought he would have well becom d thi place grac d thank king posthumu i am sir soldier that did compani these three poor beseem twa fitment purpos i then follow d that i wa he speak iachimo i had you down might have made you finish iachimo _kneel _ i am down again but now my heavi conscienc sink my knee as then your forc did take that life beseech you which i so often owe but your ring first here bracelet truest princess that ever swore her faith posthumu kneel not me pow r that i have you is spare you malic you forgiv you ll go no further ghost mark me hamlet i will ghost my hour is almost come when i sulph rou torment flame must render myself hamlet ala poor ghost ghost piti me not but lend thi seriou hear what i shall unfold hamlet speak i am bound hear ghost so art thou reveng when thou shalt hear hamlet what ghost i am thi father s spirit doom d certain term walk night day confin d fast fire till foul crime done my day natur are burnt purg d away but that i am forbid tell secret my prison hous i could tale unfold whose lightest word would harrow thi soul freez thi young blood make thi two eye like star start their sphere thi knot combin lock part each particular hair stand end like quill fret porcupin but thi etern blazon must not be ear flesh blood list list o list if thou didst ever thi dear father love hamlet o god ghost reveng hi foul most unnatur murder hamlet murder ghost murder most foul as best it is but thi most foul strang unnatur hamlet hast me know t that i wing as swift as medit or thought love may sweep my reveng ghost i find thee apt duller shouldst thou be than fat weed that rot itself eas leth wharf wouldst thou not stir thi now hamlet hear ti given that sleep my orchard serpent stung me so whole ear denmark is forg process my death rankli abu d but know thou nobl youth serpent that did sting thi father s life now wear hi crown hamlet o my prophet soul mine uncl ghost ay that incestu that adulter beast witchcraft hi wit traitor gift o wick wit gift that have power so seduc won hi shame lust will my most seem virtuou queen o hamlet what fall off wa there me whose love wa that digniti that it went hand hand even vow i made her marriag declin wretch whose natur gift were poor those mine but virtu as it never will be mov d though lewd court it shape heaven so lust though radiant angel link d will sate itself celesti bed prey garbag but soft methink i scent morn air brief let me be sleep my orchard my custom alway afternoon my secur hour thi uncl eager drop milk thin wholesom blood so did it mine most instant tetter bark d most lazar like vile loathsom crust all my smooth bodi thu wa i sleep brother s hand life crown queen onc dispatch d cut is allow her virgin rite her maiden strewment bring home bell burial laert must there no more be done priest no more be done we should profan servic dead sing sage requiem such rest her as peac part soul laert lay her i th earth her fair unpollut flesh may violet spring i tell thee churlish priest minist ring angel shall my sister be when thou liest howl hamlet what fair ophelia queen _scatter flower _ sweet sweet farewel i hop d thou shouldst have been my hamlet s wife i thought thi bride bed have deck d sweet maid not have strew d thi grave laert o trebl woe fall ten time trebl that curs head whose wick deed thi most ingeni sens depriv d thee hold off earth while till i have caught her onc more mine arm _leap grave _ now pile your dust quick dead till thi flat mountain you have made o fear away thi hand king pluck them asund queen hamlet hamlet all gentlemen horatio good my lord be quiet _the attend part them they come grave _ hamlet whi i will fight him thi theme my eyelid will no mere mad thu awhil fit will work him anon as patient as femal dove when that her golden couplet are disclo d hi silenc will sit droop hamlet hear you sir what is reason that you use me thu i lov d you th irregular wild glendow wa rude hand that welshman taken thousand hi peopl butcher whose dead corps there wa such misus such beastli shameless transform those welshwomen done as may not be much visard we will chang we leav them sirrah i have case buckram nonc immask our note outward garment princ but i doubt they will be too hard us poin well two them i know them be as true bred coward as fought what ward what blow what extrem he endur reproof thi lie jest princ well i ll go thee provid us all thing necessari meet me night eastcheap there i ll sup farewel poin farewel my lord exit princ i know you all will awhil uphold unyok d humour your idl yet herein will i imit sun who doth permit base contagi cloud smother hi beauti world that when he pleas again be himself be want he may be more wonder d break foul ugli mist vapour that did seem strangl him if all year were play holiday sport would be as tediou as work but when they seldom come they wish d come noth pleaseth but rare accid so when thi loos behaviour i throw off pay debt i never promis how much better than my word i am so much shall i falsifi men s hope like bright metal sullen ground my reform glitter o er my fault shall show more goodli attract more eye than that which hath no foil set it off i ll so offend make offenc skill redeem time when men think least i will exit scene iii same room palac enter king henri northumberland worcest hotspur sir walter blunt other king my blood hath been too cold temper unapt stir these indign you have found me accordingli you tread my patienc but be sure i will henceforth rather be myself mighti be fear d than my condit which hath been smooth as oil soft as young down therefor lost that titl respect which proud soul ne er pay but proud worcest our hous my sovereign lieg littl deserv scourg great be use it that same great too which our own hand have holp make so portli northumberland my good lord king worcest get thee gone i do see danger disobedi thine eye o sir your presenc is too bold peremptori majesti might never yet endur moodi frontier servant brow you have good leav leav us when we need your use counsel we shall send you exit worcest northumberland you were speak northumberland yea my good lord those prison your high name demand which harri perci here holmedon took were as he say not such strength deni as is deliv d your majesti either envi therefor or mispris is guilti thi fault not my son hotspur my lieg i did deni no prison but i rememb when fight wa done when i wa dri rage extrem toil breathless faint lean my sword came there certain lord neat trimli dress d fresh as bridegroom hi chin new reap d show d like stubbl land harvest home he wa perfum like millin twixt hi finger hi thumb he held pouncet box which ever anon he gave hi nose took t away again who therewith angri when it next came there took it snuff still he smile talk d as soldier bore dead bodi he call d them untaught knave unmannerli bring slovenli unhandsom cors betwixt wind hi nobil mani holiday ladi term he question d me rest demand my prison your majesti s behalf i then all smart my wound be cold my grief my impati be so pester d popinjay answer d neglectingli i know not what he should or he should not t made me mad see him shine so brisk smell so sweet talk so like wait gentlewoman gun drum wound god save mark tell me sovereign st thing earth wa parmaceti inward bruis that it wa great piti so it wa thi villain salt petr should be digg d bowel harmless earth which mani good tall fellow had destroy d so cowardli but these vile gun he would himself have been soldier thi bald unjoint chat hi my lord i answer indirectli as i said i beseech you let not hi report come current accus betwixt my love your high majesti blunt well enter messeng letter what letter hast thou there i can but thank you messeng these letter come your father hotspur letter him whi come he not himself messeng he cannot come my lord he s grievou sick hotspur zwound how ha he leisur be sick such justl time who lead hi power whose govern come they messeng hi letter bear hi mind not i my lord worcest i pr ythee tell me doth he keep hi bed messeng he did my lord four day ere i set forth time my departur thenc he wa much fear d hi physician worcest i would state time had first been whole ere he sick had been visit hi health wa never better worth than now hotspur sick now droop now thi sick doth infect veri life blood our enterpris ti catch hither even our camp he write me here that inward sick that hi friend deput could not so soon be drawn no did he think it meet lay so danger dear trust ani soul remov but hi own yet doth he give us bold advertis that our small conjunct we should see how fortun is dispos us as he write there is no quail now becaus king is certainli possess d all our purpos what say you it worcest your father s sick is maim us hotspur peril gash veri limb lopp d off yet faith ti not hi present want seem more than we shall find it were it good set exact wealth all our state all one cast set so rich main nice hazard one doubt hour it were not good therein should we read veri bottom soul hope veri list veri utmost bound all our fortun dougla faith so we should where now remain sweet revers we may boldli spend hope what is come comfort retir live thi hotspur rendezv home fli unto if that devil mischanc look big maidenhead our affair worcest but yet i would your father had been here qualiti hair our attempt brook no divis it will be thought some that know not whi he is away that wisdom loyalti mere dislik our proceed kept earl henc think how such apprehens may turn tide fear faction breed kind question our caus well you know we offer side must keep aloof strict arbitr stop all sight hole everi loop whenc eye reason may pri us thi absenc your father s draw curtain that show ignor kind fear not dreamt hotspur nay you strain too far i rather hi absenc make thi use it lend lustr more great opinion larger dare our great enterpris than if earl were here men must think if we hi help can make head push against kingdom hi help we shall o erturn it topsi turvi down yet all goe well yet enter rumour paint full tongu rumour open your ear which you will stop vent hear when loud rumour speak i orient droop west make wind my post hors still unfold act commenc thi ball earth my tongu continu slander ride which everi languag i pronounc stuf ear men fals report i speak peac while covert emniti smile safeti wound world who but rumour who but onli i make fear muster prepar d defenc while big year swoln some other grief is thought child stern tyrant war no such matter rumour is pipe blown surmis jealousi conjectur so easi so plain stop that blunt monster uncount head still discord wav ring multitud can play it but what need i thu my well known bodi anatom my household whi is rumour here i run king harri s victori who bloodi field shrewsburi hath beaten down young hotspur hi troop quench flame bold rebellion even rebel blood but what mean i speak so true first my offic is nois abroad that harri monmouth fell wrath nobl hotspur s sword that king dougla rage stoop d hi anoint head as low as death thi have i rumour d peasant town that royal field shrewsburi thi worm eaten hold rag stone where hotspur s father old northumberland lie crafti sick post come tire not man them bring other news than they have learnt me rumour s tongu they bring smooth comfort fals wors than true wrong exit act i scene i warkworth northumberland s castl enter lord bardolph lord bardolph who keep gate here ho porter open gate where is earl porter what shall i say you are lord bardolph tell thou earl that lord bardolph doth attend him here porter hi lordship is walk d forth orchard pleas it your honour knock but gate he himself will answer enter northumberland lord bardolph here come earl exit porter northumberland what news lord bardolph everi minut now should be father some stratagem time are wild content like hors full high feed madli hath broke loos bear down all him lord bardolph nobl earl i bring you certain news shrewsburi northumberland good god will lord bardolph as good as heart can wish king is almost wound death fortun my lord your son princ harri slain outright both blunt kill d hand dougla young princ john westmoreland stafford fled field you shrewsburi lord bardolph i spake one my lord that came thenc gentleman well bred good name that freeli rend red me these news true enter traver northumberland here come my servant traver whom i sent tuesday last listen news lord bardolph my lord i rode him way he is furnish d no certainti more than he hapli may retail me northumberland now traver what good tide come you traver my lord sir john umfrevil turn d me back joy tide be better hor d rode me him came spur hard gentleman almost forspent speed that stopp d me breath hi bloodi hors he ask d way chester him i did demand what news shrewsburi he told me that rebellion had bad luck that young harri perci s spur wa cold that he gave hi abl hors head bend forward struck hi arm heel against pant side hi poor jade rowel head start so he seem d run devour way stay no longer question northumberland ha again said he young harri perci s spur wa cold hotspur coldspur that rebellion had met ill luck lord bardolph my lord i ll tell you what if my young lord your son have not day mine honour silken point i ll give my baroni never talk it northumberland whi should that gentleman that rode traver give then such instanc loss lord bardolph who he he wa some hild fellow that had stol n hors he rode my life spoke ventur look here come more news enter morton northumberland yea thi man s brow like titl leaf foretel natur tragic volum so look strand whereon imperi flood hath left wit d usurp say morton didst thou come shrewsburi morton i ran shrewsburi my nobl lord where hate death put hi ugliest mask fright our parti northumberland how doth my son brother thou tremblest white thi cheek is apter than thi tongu tell thi errand even such man so faint so spiritless so dull so dread look so woe begon drew priam s curtain dead night would have told him half hi troy wa burnt but priam found fire ere he hi tongu i my perci s death ere thou report st it thi thou wouldst say your son did thu thu your brother thu so fought nobl dougla stop my greedi ear their bold deed but end stop my ear inde thou hast sigh blow away thi prais end brother son all are dead morton dougla is live your brother yet but my lord your son northumberland whi he is dead see what readi tongu suspicion hath he that but fear thing he would not know hath instinct knowledg other eye that what he fear d is chanc yet speak morton tell thou earl hi divin lie i will take it as sweet disgrac make thee rich do me such wrong morton you are too great be me gainsaid your spirit is too true your fear too certain northumberland yet all thi say not that perci s dead i see strang confess thine eye thou shak st thi head hold st it fear or sin speak truth if he be slain say so tongu offend not that report hi death he doth sin that doth beli dead not he which say dead is not aliv yet first bringer unwelcom news hath but lose offic hi tongu sound ever as sullen bell rememb red toll depart friend lord bardolph i cannot think my lord your son is dead morton i am sorri i should forc you believ that which i would god i had not seen but these mine eye saw him bloodi state rend ring faint quittanc weari breath d harri monmouth whose swift wrath beat down never daunt perci earth whenc life he never more sprung few hi death whose spirit lent fire even dullest peasant hi camp be bruit onc took fire heat away best temper d courag hi troop hi metal wa hi parti steel which onc him abat rest turn d themselv like dull heavi lead as thing that s heavi itself enforc fli greatest speed so did our men heavi hotspur s loss lend thi weight such light their fear that arrow fled not swifter their aim than did our soldier aim their safeti fli field then wa that nobl worcest too soon ta en prison that furiou scot bloodi dougla whose well labour sword had three time slain th appear king gan vail hi stomach did grace shame those that turn d their back hi flight stumbl fear wa took sum all is that king hath won hath sent speedi power encount you my lord conduct young lancast westmoreland thi is news full northumberland thi i shall have time enough mourn poison there is physic these news have been well that would have made me sick be sick have some measur made me well as wretch whose fever weak ned joint like strengthless hing buckl life impati hi fit break like fire hi keeper s arm even so my limb weak ned grief be now enrag d grief are thrice themselv henc therefor thou nice crutch scali gauntlet now joint steel must glove thi hand henc thou sickli coif thou art guard too wanton head which princ flesh d conquest aim hit now bind my brow iron approach rag st hour that time spite dare bring frown th enrag d northumberland let heaven kiss earth now let not natur s hand keep wild flood confin d let order die let thi world no longer be stage feed content ling ring act but let one spirit first born cain reign all bosom that each heart be set bloodi cours rude scene may end dark be burier dead lord bardolph thi strain passion doth you wrong my lord morton sweet earl divorc not wisdom your honour live all your love complic lean your health which if you give o er stormi passion must perforc decay you cast th event hi flesh wa capabl wound scar that hi forward spirit would lift him where most trade danger rang d yet did you say go forth none thi though strongli apprehend could restrain stiff born action what hath then befal n or what hath thi bold enterpris brought forth more than that be which wa like be lord bardolph we all that are engag thi loss knew that we ventur such danger sea that if we wrought dare speak truth gentl archbishop york is well appoint pow rs he is man who doubl sureti bind hi follow my lord your son had onli but corps but shadow show men fight that same word rebellion did divid good thing princ it shall serv wit no higher breed than thine poin go i stand push your one thing that you will tell princ marri i tell thee it is not meet that i should be sad now my father is sick thou wilt be wilder again peopl wolv thi old inhabit princ o pardon me my lieg but my tear moist impedi unto my speech i had forestal d thi dear deep rebuk ere you grief had spoke i had heard cours it so far there is your crown he that wear crown immort long guard it your kneel if i affect it more than as your honour as your renown let me no more thi obedi rise which my most inward true duteou spirit teacheth thi prostrat exterior bend god wit me when i here came found no cours breath your majesti how cold it struck my heart if i do feign o let me my present wild die never live show th incredul world nobl chang that i have purpos come look you think you dead dead almost my lieg think you were i spake unto thi crown as have sens thu upbraid it care thee depend hath fed bodi my father therefor thou best gold art worst gold other less fine carat is more preciou preserv life med cine potabl but thou most fine most honour d most renown d hast eat thi bearer thu my most royal lieg accus it i put it my head tri it as enemi that had my face murd red my father quarrel true inheritor but if it did infect my blood joy or swell my thought ani strain pride if ani rebel or vain spirit mine did least affect welcom give entertain might it let god ever keep it my head make me as poorest vassal is that doth awe terror kneel it king o my son god put it thi mind take it henc that thou against your high claim franc but thi which they produc pharamond _in terram salicam mulier ne succedant_ no woman shall succeed salic land which salic land french unjustli gloze be realm franc pharamond founder thi law femal bar yet their own author faith affirm that land salic is germani flood sala elb where charl great have subdu d saxon there left behind settl certain french who hold disdain german women some dishonest manner their life establish d then thi law wit no femal should be inheritrix salic land which salic as i said twixt elb sala is thi day germani call d meissen then doth it well appear salic law wa not devis realm franc nor did french possess salic land four hundr one twenti year defunct king pharamond idli suppo d founder thi law who die year our redempt four hundr twenti six charl great subdu d saxon did seat french river sala year eight hundr five besid their writer say king pepin which depos childer did as heir gener be descend blithild which wa daughter king clothair make claim titl crown franc hugh capet also who usurp d crown charl duke lorrain sole heir male true line stock charl great find hi titl some show truth though pure truth it wa corrupt naught convey d himself as heir ladi lingar daughter charlemain who wa son lewi emperor lewi son charl great also king lewi tenth who wa sole heir usurp capet could not keep quiet hi conscienc wear crown franc till satisfi that fair queen isabel hi grandmoth wa lineal ladi ermengar daughter charl foresaid duke lorrain which marriag line charl great wa re unit crown franc so that as clear as is summer s sun king pepin s titl hugh capet s claim king lewi hi satisfact all appear hold right titl femal so do king franc unto thi day howbeit they would hold thi salic law bar your high claim femal rather choos hide them net than ampli imbar their crook titl usurp d you your progenitor king henri may i right conscienc make thi claim canterburi sin my head dread sovereign book number is it writ when man die let inherit descend unto daughter graciou lord stand your own unwind your bloodi flag look back your mighti ancestor go my dread lord your great grandsir s tomb whom you claim invok hi warlik spirit your great uncl s edward black princ who french ground play d tragedi make defeat full power franc while hi most mighti father hill stood smile behold hi lion s whelp forag blood french nobil o nobl english that could entertain half their forc full pride franc let anoth half stand laugh all work cold action eli awak remembr these valiant dead your puissant arm renew their feat you are their heir you sit their throne blood courag that renown them run your vein my thrice puissant lieg is veri may morn hi youth ripe exploit mighti enterpris exet your brother king monarch earth do all expect that you should rous yourself as did former lion your blood westmorland they know your grace hath caus mean might so hath your high never king england had nobl richer more loyal subject whose heart have left their bodi here england lie pavilion d field franc canterburi o let their bodi follow my dear lieg blood sword fire win your right aid whereof we spiritualti will rais your high such mighti sum as never did clergi one time bring ani your ancestor king henri we must not onli arm invad french but lay down our proport defend against scot who will make road us all advantag canterburi they those march graciou sovereign shall be wall suffici defend our inland pilfer border king henri we do not mean cours snatcher onli but fear main intend scot who hath been still giddi neighbour us you shall read that my great grandfath never went hi forc franc but that scot hi unfurnish d kingdom came pour like tide breach ampl brim full hi forc gall glean land hot assay girdl grievou sieg castl town that england be empti defenc hath shook trembl ill neighbourhood canterburi she hath been then more fear d than harm d my lieg hear her but exampl d herself when all her chivalri hath been franc she mourn widow her nobl she hath herself not onli well defend but taken impound as stray king scot whom she did send franc fill king edward s fame prison king make her chronicl as rich prais as is ooz bottom sea sunken wreck sumless treasuri westmorland but there s say veri old true if that you will franc win then scotland first begin onc eagl england be prey her unguard nest weasel scot come sneak so suck her princ egg play mous absenc cat tear havoc more than she can eat exet it follow then cat must stay home yet that is but crush d necess we have lock safeguard necessari pretti trap catch petti thiev while that arm hand doth fight abroad advis head defend itself home govern though high low lower put part doth keep one consent congre full natur close like music canterburi therefor doth heaven divid state man diver function set endeavour continu motion which is fix as aim or butt obedi so work honey bee creatur that rule natur teach act order peopl kingdom they have king offic sort where some like magistr correct home other like merchant ventur trade abroad other like soldier arm their sting make boot summer s velvet bud which pillag they merri march bring home tent royal their emperor who busi hi majesti survey sing mason build roof gold civil citizen knead honey poor mechan porter crowd their heavi burden hi narrow gate sad eye justic hi surli hum deliv o er executor pale lazi yawn drone i thi infer that mani thing have full refer one consent may work contrari as mani arrow loos sever way come one mark as mani way meet one town as mani fresh stream meet one salt sea as mani line close dial s centr so mani thousand action onc afoot end one purpos be all well born defeat therefor franc my lieg divid your happi england four whereof take you one quarter franc you withal shall make all gallia shake if we thrice such power left home cannot defend our own door dog let us be worri our nation lose name hardi polici king henri call messeng sent dauphin _exeunt some attend _ now are we well resolv d god s help your nobl sinew our power franc be our we ll bend it our awe or break it all piec or there we ll sit rule larg ampl emperi o er franc all her almost kingli dukedom or lay these bone unworthi urn tombless no remembr them either our histori shall full mouth speak freeli our act or els our grave like turkish mute shall have tongueless mouth not worshipp d waxen epitaph enter ambassador franc now are we well prepar d know pleasur our fair cousin dauphin we hear your greet is him not king first ambassador may t pleas your majesti give us leav freeli render what we have charg or shall we sparingli show you far off dauphin s mean our embassi king henri we are no tyrant but christian king unto whose grace our passion is as subject as is our wretch fett red our prison therefor frank uncurb plain tell us dauphin s mind ambassador thu then few your high late send franc did claim some certain dukedom right your great predecessor king edward third answer which claim princ our master say that you savour too much your youth bid you be advi d there s nought franc that can be nimbl galliard won you cannot revel dukedom there he therefor send you meeter your spirit thi tun treasur lieu thi desir you let dukedom that you claim hear no more you thi dauphin speak king henri what treasur uncl exet tenni ball my lieg king henri we are glad dauphin is so pleasant us hi present your pain we thank you when we have match d our racket these ball we will franc god s grace play set shall strike hi father s crown hazard tell him he hath made match such wrangler that all court franc will be disturb d chace we understand him well how he come o er us our wilder day not measur what use we made them we never valu d thi poor seat england therefor live henc did give ourself barbar licenc as ti ever common that men are merriest when they are home but tell dauphin i will keep my state be like king show my sail great when i do rous me my throne franc that i have laid my majesti plod like man work day but i will rise there so full glori that i will dazzl all eye franc yea strike dauphin blind look us left poor behind them some debt they owe some their children rawli left i am afeard there are few die well that die battl how can they charit dispos anyth when blood is their argument now if these men your rule should be impos hi father that sent him or if servant hi master s command transport sum money be assail robber die mani irreconcil d iniqu you may call busi master author servant s damnat but thi is not so king is not bound answer particular end hi soldier father hi son nor master hi servant they purpos not their death when they purpos their servic besid there is no king be hi caus never so spotless if it come arbitr sword can tri it all unspot soldier some peradventur have them guilt premedit contriv murder some beguil virgin broken seal perjuri some make war their bulwark that have gore gentl bosom peac pillag robberi now if these men have defeat law outrun nativ punish though they can outstrip men they have no wing fli god war is hi beadl war is hi vengeanc so that here men are punish d breach king s law now king s quarrel where they fear death they have born life away where they would be safe they perish then if they die unprovid no more is king guilti their damnat than he wa guilti those impieti which they are now visit everi subject s duti is king s but everi subject s soul is hi own therefor should everi soldier war do as everi sick man hi bed wash everi mote what kind god art thou that suffer st more mortal grief than do thi worshipp what are thi rent what are thi come o ceremoni show me but thi worth what is thi soul ador art thou aught els but place degre form creat awe fear other men wherein thou art less happi be fear d than they fear what drink st thou oft instead homag sweet but poison d flatteri o be sick great great bid thi ceremoni give thee cure think st thou fieri fever will go titl blown adul will it give place flexur low bend canst thou when thou command st beggar s knee command health it no thou proud dream that play st so their prayer they stay death dauphin shall we go send them dinner fresh suit give their fast hors provend fight them constabl i stay but my guard field i will banner trumpet take use it my hast come loss if live fewer men greater share honour god s will i pray thee wish not one man more jove i am not covet gold nor care i who doth feed my cost it yearn me not if men my garment wear such outward assembl is contriv d we do salut you duke burgundi princ french peer health you all french king right joyou are we behold your face most worthi brother england fairli met so are you princ english fatal ball murder basilisk venom such look we fairli hope have lost their qualiti that thi day shall chang all grief quarrel love king henri cri amen that thu we appear queen isabel you english princ all i do salut you burgundi my duti you both equal love great king franc england that i have labour d all my wit my pain strong endeavour bring your most imperi majesti unto thi bar royal interview your mighti both part best can wit then my offic hath so far prevail d that face face royal eye eye you have congreet let it not disgrac me if i demand thi royal view what rub or what impedi there is whi that nake poor mangl peac dear nurs art plenti joy birth should not thi best garden world our fertil franc put her love visag ala she hath franc too long been cha d all her husbandri doth lie heap corrupt it own fertil her vine merri cheerer heart unprun die her hedg even pleach d like prison wildli overgrown hair put forth disord d twig her fallow lea darnel hemlock rank fumitori doth root while that coulter rust that should deracin such savageri even mead that erst brought sweetli forth freckl cowslip burnet green clover want scyth all uncorrect rank conceiv idl noth teem but hate dock rough thistl kecksi bur lose both beauti util as our vineyard fallow mead hedg defect their natur grow wild even so our hous ourselv children have lost or do not learn want time scienc that should becom our countri but grow like savag as soldier will that noth do but medit blood swear stern look diffu d attir everyth that seem unnatur which reduc our former favour you are assembl my speech entreat that i may know let whi gentl peac should not expel these inconveni bless us her former qualiti king henri if duke burgundi you would peac whose want give growth imperfect which you have cite you must buy that peac full accord all our just demand whose tenour particular effect you have enschedul d briefli your hand burgundi king hath heard them which as yet there is no answer made king first serv man it is nobl duke gloucest second warder whoe er he be you may not be let first serv man villain answer you so lord protector first warder lord protect him so we answer him we do no not protector king or realm gloucest stand back thou manifest conspir thou that contriv st murder our dead lord thou that giv st whore indulg sin i ll canvass thee thi broad cardin s hat if thou proceed thi thi insol winchest nay stand thou back i will not budg foot thi be damascu be thou curs cain slay thi brother abel if thou wilt gloucest i will not slay thee but i ll drive thee back thi scarlet robe as child s bear cloth i ll use carri thee thi place winchest do what thou dar st i beard thee thi face gloucest what am i dar d beard my face draw men all thi privileg place blue coat tawni coat priest bewar your beard i mean tug it cuff you soundli my feet i stamp thi cardin s hat spite pope or digniti church here cheek i ll drag thee down winchest gloucest thou wilt answer thi pope gloucest winchest goos i cri rope rope now beat them henc whi do you let them stay thee i ll chase henc thou wolf sheep s array tawni coat scarlet hypocrit here gloucest s men beat cardin s men enter hurli burli mayor london hi offic mayor fie lord that you be suprem magistr thu contumeli should break peac gloucest peac mayor thou know st littl my wrong here s beaufort that regard nor god nor king hath here distrain d tower hi use winchest here s gloucest foe citizen one that still motion war never peac o ercharg your free purs larg fine that seek overthrow religion becaus he is protector realm would have armour here tower crown himself king suppress princ gloucest i will not answer thee word but blow here they skirmish again mayor nought rest me thi tumultu strife but make open proclam come offic as loud as e er thou canst cri offic cri all manner men assembl here arm thi day against god s peac king s we charg command you hi high name repair your sever dwell place not wear handl or use ani sword weapon or dagger henceforward pain death gloucest cardin i ll be no breaker law but we shall meet break our mind larg winchest gloucest we ll meet thi cost be sure thi heart blood i will have thi day s work mayor i ll call club if you will not away thi cardin s more haughti than devil gloucest mayor farewel thou dost but what thou mayst winchest abomin gloucest guard thi head i intend have it ere long exeunt sever gloucest winchest their servant mayor see coast clear d then we will depart good god these nobl should such stomach bear i myself fight not onc forti year exeunt scene 4 franc orlean enter wall master gunner orlean hi boy master gunner sirrah thou know st how orlean is besieg d how english have suburb won boy father i know oft have shot them howe er unfortun i miss d my aim master gunner but now thou shalt not be thou rul d me chief master gunner am i thi town someth i must do procur me grace princ s espial have inform me how english suburb close intrench d wont secret grate iron bar yonder tower overp citi thenc discov how most advantag they may vex us shot or assault intercept thi inconveni piec ordnanc gainst it i have plac d even these three day have i watch d if i could see them now do thou watch i can stay no longer if thou spi st ani run bring me word thou shalt find me governor s exit boy father i warrant you take you no care i ll never troubl you if i may spi them exit enter salisburi talbot turret sir william glansdal sir thoma gargrav other salisburi talbot my life my joy again return d how wert thou handl be contempt they would have barter d me which i disdain scorn d crave death rather than i would be so vile esteem d fine redeem d i wa as i desir d but o treacher fastolf wound my heart whom my bare fist i would execut if i now had him brought my power salisburi yet tell st thou not how thou wert entertain d talbot scoff scorn contumeli taunt open market place produc d they me be public spectacl all here said they is terror french scarecrow that affright our children so then broke i offic that led me my nail digg d stone ground hurl behold my shame my grisli counten made other fli none durst come near fear sudden death iron wall they deem d me not secur so great fear my name mongst them wa spread that they suppo d i could rend bar steel spurn piec post adam wherefor guard chosen shot i had that walk d me everi minut while if i did but stir my bed readi they were shoot me heart enter boy linstock salisburi i griev hear what torment you endur d but we will be reveng d suffici now it is shoot salisburi gargrav fall down salisburi o lord have merci us wretch sinner gargrav o lord have merci me woeful man talbot what chanc is thi that suddenli hath cross d us speak salisburi least if thou canst speak how far st thou mirror all martial men one thi eye thi cheek s side struck off accurs tower accurs fatal hand that hath contriv d thi woeful tragedi thirteen battl salisburi o ercam grace sun one eye vieweth all world heaven be thou graciou none aliv if salisburi want merci thi hand bear henc hi bodi i will help buri it sir thoma gargrav hast thou ani life speak unto talbot nay tri what these dastard frenchmen dare alarum exeunt scene 5 orlean here alarum again talbot pursueth dauphin driveth him then enter joan la pucel drive englishmen her then enter talbot talbot where is driven away they call d us our fierc english dog now like whelp we cri run away short alarum hark countrymen either renew fight or tear lion england s coat renounc your soil give sheep lion stead sheep run not half so treacher wolf or hors or oxen leopard as you fli your oft subdu slave alarum here anoth skirmish it will not be retir your trench you all consent unto salisburi s death none would strike stroke hi reveng pucel is ent red orlean spite us or aught that we could do o would i were die salisburi shame hereof will make me hide my head exit talbot alarum retreat scene 6 orlean la pucel bastard tut holi joan wa hi defens guard charl is thi thi cun thou deceit dame didst thou first flatter us withal make us partak littl gain that now our loss might be ten time so much pucel but thi gather our soldier scatter d disper d lay new platform endamag them alarum enter english soldier cri talbot talbot they fli leav their cloth behind soldier i ll be so bold take what they have say withal i think he held right vernon stay lord gentlemen pluck no more till you conclud that he whose side fewest rose are cropp d tree shall yield other right opinion somerset good master vernon you pluck it off lest bleed you do paint white rose red fall my side so against your will vernon if i my lord my opinion bleed opinion shall be surgeon my hurt keep me side where still i am somerset well well come who els lawyer somerset unless my studi my book be fals argument you held wa wrong you sign whereof i pluck white rose too plantagenet now somerset where is your argument somerset here my scabbard medit that shall dye your white rose bloodi red plantagenet meantim your cheek do counterfeit our rose pale they look fear as wit truth our side somerset no plantagenet ti not fear but verbatim rehears method my pen no prelat such is thi audaci wicked thi lewd pestifer dissenti prank as veri infant prattl thi pride thou art most pernici usur froward natur enemi peac lascivi wanton sovereign is not quit exempt enviou malic thi swell heart winchest gloucest i do defi thee lord vouchsaf give me hear what i shall repli if i were covet ambiti or pervers as he will have me how am i so poor or how hap it i seek not advanc or rais myself but keep my wont call dissens who preferreth peac more than i do i be provok d no my good lord it is not that offend it is not that that incen d hath incen d duke it is becaus no one should sway but he no one but he should be king that engend thunder hi breast make him roar these accus forth but he shall know i am as good gloucest as good thou bastard my grandfath winchest ay lordli sir what are you i pray but one imperi anoth s throne gloucest am i not protector sauci priest winchest am not i prelat church gloucest ye as outlaw castl keep were your duti forbear warwick ay see bishop be not overborn somerset methink my lord should be religi know offic that belong such warwick methink hi lordship should be humbler it fitteth not prelat might prevail join your heart love amiti o what scandal is it our crown that two such nobl peer as ye should jar believ me lord my tender year can tell civil dissens is viper worm that gnaw bowel
