repair miseri thou dost bear someth rich me that place i shall no lead need edgar give me thi arm poor tom shall lead thee _exeunt _ scene ii duke albani s palac enter goneril edmund oswald meet them goneril welcom my lord i marvel our mild husband not met us way now where s your master oswald madam but never man so chang d i told him armi that wa land he smil d it i told him you were come hi answer wa wors gloucest s treacheri loyal servic hi son when i inform d him then he call d me sot told me i had turn d wrong side what most he should dislik seem pleasant him what like offens goneril _to edmund _ then shall you go no further it is cowish terror hi spirit that dare not undertak he ll not feel wrong which tie him answer our wish way may prove effect back edmund my brother hasten hi muster conduct hi power i must chang name home give distaff my husband s hand thi trusti servant shall pass us ere long you are like hear if you dare ventur your own behalf mistress s command _give favour _ wear thi spare speech declin your head thi kiss if it durst speak would stretch thi spirit air conceiv fare thee well edmund your rank death _exit edmund _ goneril my most dear gloucest o differ man man thee woman s servic are due my fool usurp my bodi oswald madam here come my lord _exit _ enter albani goneril i have been worth whistl albani o goneril you are not worth dust which rude wind blow your face i fear your disposit that natur which contemn it origin cannot be border certain itself she that herself will sliver disbranch her materi sap perforc must wither come deadli use goneril no more text is foolish albani wisdom good vile seem vile filth savour but themselv what have you done tiger not daughter what have you perform d father graciou age man whose rever even head lugg d bear would lick most barbar most degener have you mad could my good brother suffer you do it man princ him so benefit if that heaven do not their visibl spirit send quickli down tame these vile offenc it will come human must perforc prey itself like monster deep goneril milk liver d man that bear st cheek blow head wrong who hast not thi brow eye discern thine honour thi suffer that not know st fool do those villain piti who are punish d ere they have done their mischief where s thi drum franc spread hi banner our noiseless land plume helm thi state begin threat whilst thou moral fool sitt st still criest alack whi doe he so albani see thyself devil proper deform seem not fiend so horrid as woman goneril o vain fool albani thou chang self cover d thing shame be monster not thi featur were t my fit let these hand obey my blood they are apt enough disloc tear thi flesh bone howe er thou art fiend woman s shape doth shield thee goneril marri your manhood mew enter messeng albani what news messeng o my good lord duke cornwal s dead slain hi servant go put other eye gloucest albani gloucest s eye messeng servant that he bred thrill d remors oppo d against act bend hi sword hi great master who thereat enrag d flew him them fell d him dead but not that harm stroke which hath pluck d him albani thi show you are you justic that these our nether crime so speedili can veng but o poor gloucest lost he hi other eye messeng both both my lord thi letter madam crave speedi answer ti your sister goneril _asid _ one way i like thi well but be widow my gloucest her may all build my fanci pluck my hate life anoth way news is not so tart i ll read answer _exit _ albani where wa hi son when they did take hi eye messeng come my ladi hither albani he is not here messeng no my good lord i met him back again albani know he wicked messeng ay my good lord twa he inform d against him quit hous purpos that their punish might have freer cours albani gloucest i live thank thee love thou show dst king reveng thine eye come hither friend tell me what more thou know st _exeunt _ scene iii french camp near dover enter kent gentleman kent whi king franc is so suddenli gone back know you no reason gentleman someth he left imperfect state which hi come forth is thought which import kingdom so much fear danger that hi person return wa most requir necessari kent who hath he left behind him gener gentleman maresch franc monsieur la far kent did your letter pierc queen ani demonstr grief gentleman ay sir she took them read them my presenc now then ampl tear trill d down her delic cheek it seem d she wa queen her passion who most rebel like sought be king o er her kent o then it mov d her gentleman not rage patienc sorrow strove who should express her goodliest you have seen sunshin rain onc her smile tear were like better day those happi smilet that play d her ripe lip seem d not know what guest were her eye which part thenc as pearl diamond dropp d brief sorrow would be rariti most belov d if all could so becom it kent made she no verbal question gentleman faith onc or twice she heav d name father pantingli forth as if it press d her heart cri sister sister shame ladi sister kent father sister what i storm i night let piti not be believ d there she shook holi water her heavenli eye clamour master d her then away she start deal grief alon kent it is star star us govern our condit els one self mate make could not beget such differ issu you spoke not her gentleman no kent wa thi king return d gentleman no kent well sir poor distress lear s i town who sometim hi better tune rememb what we are come no mean will yield see hi daughter gentleman whi good sir kent sovereign shame so elbow him hi own unkind that stripp d her hi benedict turn d her foreign casualti gave her dear right hi dog heart daughter these thing sting hi mind so venom that burn shame detain him cordelia gentleman alack poor gentleman kent albani s cornwal s power you heard not gentleman ti so they are afoot kent well sir i ll bring you our master lear leav you attend him some dear caus will conceal wrap me awhil when i am known aright you shall not griev lend me thi acquaint i pray you go me _exeunt _ scene iv french camp tent enter drum colour cordelia physician soldier cordelia alack ti he whi he wa met even now as mad as vex d sea sing aloud crown d rank fumit close eye anguish cordelia all bless d secret all you unpublish d virtu earth spring my tear be aidant remedi good man s distress seek seek him lest hi ungovern d rage dissolv life that want mean lead charg d my duti thi busi regan whi should she write edmund might not you transport her purpos word belik someth i know not what i ll love thee much let me unseal letter oswald madam i had rather regan know t therefor i do advis you take thi note my lord is dead edmund i have talk d more conveni is he my hand than your ladi s you may gather more if you do find him pray you give him thi when your mistress hear thu much you i pray desir her call her wisdom her so fare you well if you do chanc hear that blind traitor prefer fall him that cut him off oswald would i could meet him madam i should show what parti i do follow regan fare thee well _exeunt _ scene vi countri near dover enter gloucest edgar dress like peasant gloucest when shall i come top that same hill edgar you do climb it now look how we labour gloucest methink ground is even edgar horribl steep hark do you hear sea gloucest no truli edgar whi then your other sens grow imperfect your eye anguish gloucest so may it be inde methink thi voic is alter d thou speak st better phrase matter than thou didst edgar y are much deceiv d noth am i chang d but my garment gloucest methink you re better spoken edgar come sir here s place stand still how fear dizzi ti cast one s eye so low crow chough that wing midway air show scarc so gross as beetl half way down hang one that gather samphir dread trade methink he seem no bigger than hi head fishermen that walk beach appear like mice yond tall anchor bark diminish d her cock her cock buoy almost too small sight murmur surg that th unnumb d idl pebbl chafe cannot be heard so high i ll look no more lest my brain turn defici sight toppl down headlong gloucest set me where you stand edgar give me your hand you are now foot th extrem verg all beneath moon would i not leap good sir _seem go _ gloucest all my heart edgar _asid _ whi i do trifl thu hi despair is done cure it gloucest o you mighti god thi world i do renounc your sight shake patient my great afflict off if i could bear it longer not fall quarrel your great opposeless will my snuff loath part natur should burn itself if edgar live o bless him now fellow fare thee well edgar gone sir farewel _gloucest leap fall along_ yet i know not how conceit may rob treasuri life when life itself yield theft had he been where he thought thi had thought been past aliv or dead ho you sir friend hear you sir speak comfort when miseri could beguil tyrant s rage frustrat hi proud will edgar give me your arm so how is t feel you your leg you stand gloucest too well too well edgar thi is all strang crown o cliff no wren goe t small gild fli doe lecher my sight let copul thrive gloucest s bastard son wa kinder hi father than my daughter got tween law sheet t luxuri pell mell i lack soldier behold yond simp _exeunt lear cordelia guard _ edmund come hither captain hark take thou thi note _give paper_ go follow them prison one step i have advanc d thee if thou dost as thi instruct thee thou dost make thi way nobl fortun know thou thi that men are as time is be tender mind doe not becom sword thi great employ will not bear question either say thou lt do t or thrive other mean captain i ll do t my lord edmund it write happi when thou hast done mark i say instantli carri it so as i have set it down captain i cannot draw cart nor eat dri oat if it be man s work i ll do t _exit _ flourish enter albani goneril regan offic attend albani sir you have show d today your valiant strain fortun led you well you have captiv who were opposit thi day s strife i do requir them you so use them as we shall find their merit our safeti may equal determin edmund sir i thought it fit send old miser king some retent appoint guard whose age ha charm it whose titl more pluck common bosom hi side turn our impress d lanc our eye which do command them him i sent queen my reason all same they are readi tomorrow or further space appear where you shall hold your session thi time we sweat bleed friend hath lost hi friend best quarrel heat are cur d those that feel their sharp question cordelia her father requir fitter place albani sir your patienc i hold you but subject thi war not as brother regan that s as we list grace him methink our pleasur might have been demand ere you had spoke so far he led our power bore commiss my place person which immediaci may well stand call itself your brother goneril not so hot hi own grace he doth exalt himself more than your addit regan my right me invest he compeer best albani that were most if he should husband you regan jester do oft prove prophet goneril holla holla that eye that told you so look d but asquint regan ladi i am not well els i should answer full flow stomach gener take thou my soldier prison patrimoni dispos them me wall are thine wit world that i creat thee here my lord master goneril mean you enjoy him albani let alon lie not your good will edmund nor thine lord albani half blood fellow ye regan _to edmund _ let drum strike prove my titl thine albani stay yet hear reason edmund i arrest thee capit treason thine arrest thi gild serpent _point goneril _ your claim fair sister i bar it interest my wife ti she is sub contract thi lord i her husband contradict your ban if you will marri make your love me my ladi is bespok goneril interlud albani thou art arm d gloucest let trumpet sound if none appear prove thi person thi heinou manifest mani treason there is my pledg _throw down glove _ i ll make it thi heart ere i tast bread thou art noth less than i have here proclaim d thee regan sick o sick goneril _asid _ if not i ll ne er trust medicin edmund there s my exchang _throw down glove _ what world he is that name me traitor villain like he lie call thi trumpet he that dare approach him you who not i will maintain my truth honour firmli albani herald ho enter herald trust thi singl virtu thi soldier all levi my name have my name took their discharg regan my sick grow me albani she is not well convey her my tent _exit regan led _ come hither herald let trumpet sound read thi offic sound trumpet _a trumpet sound _ herald _read _ if ani man qualiti or degre list armi will maintain edmund suppos earl gloucest that he is manifold traitor let him appear third sound trumpet he is bold hi defenc edmund sound _first trumpet _ herald again _second trumpet _ herald again third trumpet trumpet answer enter edgar arm preced trumpet albani ask him hi purpos whi he appear thi call o trumpet herald what are you your name your qualiti whi you answer thi present summon edgar know my name is lost treason s tooth bare gnawn canker bit yet am i nobl as adversari i come cope albani which is that adversari edgar what s he that speak edmund earl gloucest edmund himself what say st thou him edgar draw thi sword that if my speech offend nobl heart thi arm may do thee justic here is mine behold it is privileg mine honour my oath my profess i protest maugr thi strength youth place emin despit thi victor sword fire new fortun thi valour thi heart thou art traitor fals thi god thi brother thi father conspir gainst thi high illustri princ extremest upward thi head descent dust beneath thi foot most toad spot breed breath what safe nice i might well delay rule knighthood i disdain spurn back do i toss those treason thi head hell hate lie o erwhelm thi heart which they yet glanc scarc bruis thi sword mine your grace s will i come know your pleasur duke angelo there is kind charact thi life that th observ doth thi histori fulli unfold thyself thi belong are not thine own so proper as wast thyself thi virtu they thee heaven doth us as we torch do not light them themselv if our virtu did not go forth us twere all alik as if we had them not spirit are not fine touch d but fine issu nor natur never lend smallest scrupl her excel but like thrifti goddess she determin herself glori creditor both thank use but i do bend my speech one that can my part him advertis hold therefor angelo our remov be public ear profess d contrari enter messeng thi is hi lordship s man duke here come claudio s pardon messeng my lord hath sent you thi note me thi further charg that you swerv not smallest articl it neither time matter or other circumst good morrow as i take it it is almost day provost i shall obey him exit messeng duke asid thi is hi pardon purcha d such sin which pardon himself is henc hath offenc hi quick celer when it is born high author when vice make merci merci s so extend that fault s love is th offend friend now sir what news provost i told you lord angelo belik think me remiss mine offic awaken me thi unwont put methink strang he hath not us d it duke pray you let s hear provost read whatsoev you may hear contrari let claudio be execut four clock afternoon barnardin my provost most manifest not deni himself duke hath he born himself penit prison how seem he be touch d provost man that apprehend death no more dread but as drunken sleep careless reckless fearless what s past present or come insens mortal desper mortal duke he want advic provost he will hear none he hath evermor had liberti prison give him leav escap henc he would not drunk mani time day if not mani day entir drunk we have veri oft awak d him as if carri him execut show d him seem warrant it it hath not move him all duke more him anon there is written your brow provost honesti constanc if i read it not truli my ancient skill beguil me but bold my cun i will lay myself hazard claudio whom here you have warrant execut is no greater forfeit law than angelo who hath sentenc d him make you understand thi manifest effect i crave but four day respit which you are do me both present danger courtesi provost pray sir what duke delay death provost alack how may i do it have hour limit express command penalti deliv hi head view angelo i may make my case as claudio s cross thi smallest duke vow mine order i warrant you if my instruct may be your guid let thi barnardin be thi morn execut hi head born angelo provost angelo hath seen them both will discov favour duke o death s great disguis you may add it shave head tie beard say it wa desir penit be so bar d hi death you know cours is common if anyth fall you thi more than thank good fortun saint whom i profess i will plead against it my life provost pardon me good father it is against my oath duke were you sworn duke or deputi provost him hi substitut duke you will think you have made no offenc if duke avouch justic your deal provost but what likelihood is that duke not resembl but certainti yet i see you fear that neither my coat integr nor persuas can eas attempt you i will go further than i meant pluck all fear you look you sir here is hand seal duke you know charact i doubt not signet is not strang you provost i know them both duke content thi is return duke you shall anon read it your pleasur where you shall find these two day he will be here thi is thing that angelo know not he thi veri day receiv letter strang tenour perchanc duke s death perchanc enter some monasteri but chanc noth what is writ look th unfold star call shepherd put not yourself amaz how these thing should be all difficulti are but easi when they are known call your execution off barnardin s head i will give him present shrift advis him better place yet you are amaz d but thi shall absolut resolv you come away it is almost clear where your argosi portli sail like signior rich burgher flood or as it were pageant sea do overp petti traffick that curtsi them do them rever as they fli them their woven wing solanio believ me sir had i such ventur forth better part my affect would be my hope abroad i should be still pluck grass know where sit wind peer map port pier road everi object that might make me fear misfortun my ventur doubt would make me sad salarino my wind cool my broth would blow me agu when i thought what harm wind too great might do sea i should not see sandi hour glass run but i should think shallow flat see my wealthi andrew dock d sand vail her high top lower than her rib kiss her burial should i go church see holi edific stone not bethink me straight danger rock which touch but my gentl vessel s side would scatter all her spice stream enrob roar water my silk word but even now worth thi now worth noth shall i have thought think thi shall i lack thought that such thing bechanc d would make me sad but tell not me i know antonio is sad think hi merchandis antonio believ me no i thank my fortun it my ventur are not one bottom trust nor one place nor is my whole estat fortun thi present year therefor my merchandis make me not sad salarino whi then you are love antonio fie fie salarino not love neither then let us say you are sad becaus you are not merri twere as easi you laugh leap say you are merri becaus you are not sad now two head janu natur hath fram d strang fellow her time some that will evermor peep their eye laugh like parrot bagpip other such vinegar aspect that they ll it is most impenetr cur that ever kept men antonio let him alon i ll follow him no more bootless prayer he seek my life hi reason well i know i oft deliv d hi forfeitur mani that have time made moan me therefor he hate me salarino i am sure duke will never grant thi forfeitur hold antonio duke cannot deni cours law commod that stranger have us venic if it be deni twill much impeach justic state that trade profit citi consisteth all nation therefor go these grief loss have so bate me that i shall hardli spare pound flesh tomorrow my bloodi creditor well gaoler pray god bassanio come see me pay hi debt then i care not _exeunt _ scene iv belmont room portia s hous enter portia nerissa lorenzo jessica balthazar lorenzo madam although i speak it your presenc you have nobl true conceit godlik amiti which appear most strongli bear thu absenc your lord but if you knew whom you show thi honour how true gentleman you send relief how dear lover my lord your husband i know you would be prouder work than customari bounti can enforc you portia i never did repent do good nor shall not now companion that do convers wast time togeth whose soul do bear equal yoke love there must be need like proport lineament manner spirit which make me think that thi antonio be bosom lover my lord must need be like my lord if it be so how littl is cost i have bestow purchas semblanc my soul state hellish cruelti thi come too near prais myself therefor no more it hear other thing lorenzo i commit your hand husbandri manag my hous my lord s return mine own part i have heaven breath d secret vow now balthazar as i have ever found thee honest true so let me find thee still take thi same letter use thou all th endeavour man speed padua see thou render thi my cousin s hand doctor bellario look what note garment he doth give thee bring them i pray thee imagin d speed unto traject common ferri which trade venic wast no time word but get thee gone i shall be there thee balthazar madam i go all conveni speed _exit _ portia come nerissa i have work hand that you yet know not we ll see our husband they think us nerissa shall they see us portia they shall nerissa but such habit that they shall think we are accomplish that we lack i ll hold thee ani wager when we are both accout like young men i ll prove prettier fellow two wear my dagger braver grace speak chang man boy reed voic turn two minc step manli stride speak fray like fine brag youth tell quaint lie how honour ladi sought my love which i deni they fell sick die i could not do withal then i ll repent wish all that that i had not kill d them twenti these puni lie i ll tell that men shall swear i have discontinu school twelvemonth i have my mind thousand raw trick these brag jack which i will practis nerissa whi shall we turn men portia fie what question s that if thou wert near lewd interpret but come i ll tell thee all my whole devic when i am my coach which stay us park gate therefor hast away we must measur twenti mile today _exeunt _ scene v same garden enter launcelet jessica launcelet ye truli look you sin father are be laid children therefor i promis you i fear you i wa alway plain you so now i speak my agit matter therefor be good cheer truli i think you are damn d there is but one hope it that can do you ani good that is but kind bastard hope neither jessica what hope is that i pray thee launcelet marri you may partli hope that your father got you not that you are not jew s daughter jessica that were kind bastard hope inde so sin my mother should be visit me launcelet truli then i fear you are damn d both father mother thu when i shun scylla your father i fall charybdi your mother well you are gone both way jessica i shall be save my husband he hath made me christian launcelet truli more lorenzo how everi fool can play word i think best grace wit will shortli turn silenc discours grow commend none onli but parrot go sirrah bid them prepar dinner launcelet that is done sir they have all stomach lorenzo goodli lord what wit snapper are you then bid them prepar dinner launcelet that is done too sir onli cover is word lorenzo will you cover then sir launcelet not so sir neither i bassanio s wife jessica past all express it is veri meet lord bassanio live upright life have such bless hi ladi he find joy heaven here earth if earth he do not merit it reason he should never come go one call jew court salarino he is readi door he come my lord enter shylock duke make room let him stand our face shylock world think i think so too that thou but leadest thi fashion thi malic last hour act then ti thought thou lt show thi merci remors more strang than is thi strang appar cruelti where thou now exact penalti which is pound thi poor merchant s flesh thou wilt not onli loos flint stubborn turk tartar never train d offic tender courtesi we all expect gentl answer jew shylock i have possess d your grace what i purpos our holi sabbath have i sworn have due forfeit my bond if you deni it let danger light your charter your citi s freedom you ll ask me whi i rather choos have weight carrion flesh than receiv three thousand ducat i ll not answer that but say it is my humour is it answer d what if my hous be troubl rat i be plea d give ten thousand ducat have it ban d what are you answer d yet some men there are love not gape pig some that are mad if they behold cat other when bagpip sing i nose cannot contain their urin affect mistress passion sway it mood what it like or loath now your answer as there is no firm reason be render d whi he cannot abid gape pig whi he harmless necessari cat whi he woollen bagpip but forc must yield such inevit shame as offend himself be offend so can i give no reason nor i will not more than lodg d hate certain loath i bear antonio that i follow thu lose suit against him are you answer bassanio thi is no answer thou unfeel man excus current thi cruelti shylock i am not bound pleas thee my answer bassanio do all men kill thing they do not love shylock hate ani man thing he would not kill bassanio everi offenc is not hate first shylock what wouldst thou have serpent sting thee twice antonio i pray you think you question jew you may as well go stand beach bid main flood bate hi usual height you may as well use question wolf whi he hath made ewe bleat lamb you may as well forbid mountain pine wag their high top make no nois when they are fretten gust heaven you may as well do anyth most hard as seek soften that than which what s harder hi jewish heart therefor i do beseech you make no moe offer use no farther mean but all brief plain conveni let me have judgment jew hi will bassanio thi three thousand ducat here is six shylock if everi ducat six thousand ducat were six part everi part ducat i would not draw them i would have my bond duke how shalt thou hope merci rend ring none shylock what judgment shall i dread do no wrong you have you mani purcha d slave which like your ass your dog mule you use abject slavish part becaus you bought them shall i say you let them be free marri them your heir whi sweat they burden let their bed be made as soft as your let their palat be season d such viand you will answer slave are our so do i answer you pound flesh which i demand him is dearli bought ti mine i will have it if you deni me fie your law there is no forc decre venic i stand judgment answer shall i have it duke my power i may dismiss thi court unless bellario learn doctor whom i have sent determin thi come here today salarino my lord here stay messeng letter doctor new come padua duke hippolyta scene athen wood not far it act i scene i athen room palac theseu enter theseu hippolyta philostr attend theseu now fair hippolyta our nuptial hour draw apac four happi day bring anoth moon away time then moon like silver bow new bent heaven shall behold night our solemn theseu go philostr stir athenian youth merriment awak pert nimbl spirit mirth turn melancholi forth funer pale companion is not our pomp _exit philostr _ hippolyta i woo d thee my sword won thi love do thee injuri but i will wed thee anoth key pomp triumph revel enter egeu hermia lysand demetriu egeu happi be theseu our renownd duke theseu thank good egeu what s news thee egeu full vexat come i complaint against my child my daughter hermia stand forth demetriu my nobl lord thi man hath my consent marri her stand forth lysand my graciou duke thi man hath bewitch d bosom my child thou thou lysand thou hast given her rhyme interchang d love token my child thou hast moonlight her window sung feign voic vers feign love stol n impress her fantasi bracelet thi hair ring gaud conceit knack trifl nosegay sweetmeat messeng strong prevail unharden d youth cun hast thou filch d my daughter s heart turn d her obedi which is due me stubborn harsh my graciou duke be it so she will not here your grace consent marri demetriu i beg ancient privileg athen as she is mine i may dispos her which shall be either thi gentleman or her death accord our law immedi provid that case theseu what say you hermia be advi d fair maid you your father should be as god one that compo d your beauti yea one whom you are but as form wax him imprint hi power leav figur or disfigur it demetriu is worthi gentleman hermia so is lysand theseu himself he is but thi kind want your father s voic other must be held worthier hermia i would my father look d but my eye theseu rather your eye must hi judgment look hermia i do entreat your grace pardon me i know not what power i am made bold nor how it may concern my modesti such presenc here plead my thought but i beseech your grace that i may know worst that may befal me thi case if i refus wed demetriu theseu either die death or abjur ever societi men therefor fair hermia question your desir know your youth examin well your blood if you yield not your father s choic you can endur liveri nun aye be shadi cloister mew d live barren sister all your life chant faint hymn cold fruitless moon thrice blessd they that master so their blood undergo such maiden pilgrimag but earthlier happi is rose distil d than that which wither virgin thorn grow live die singl blessed betwixt my love me everlast bond fellowship that day either prepar die disobedi your father s will or els wed demetriu as he would or diana s altar protest aye auster singl life demetriu relent sweet as demetriu which is more than all these boast can be i am belov d beauteou hermia whi should not i then prosecut my right demetriu i ll avouch it hi head made love nedar s daughter helena won her soul she sweet ladi dote devoutli dote dote idolatri thi spot inconst man theseu i must confess that i have heard so much demetriu thought have spoke thereof but be full self affair my mind did lose it but demetriu come come egeu you shall go me i have some privat school you both you fair hermia look you arm yourself fit your fanci your father s will or els law athen yield you which no mean we we follow you _exeunt all but lysand hermia _ lysand how now my love whi is your cheek so pale how chanc rose there do fade so fast hermia belik want rain which i could well beteem them tempest my eye misgraffd respect year hermia o spite too old be engag d young lysand or els it stood choic friend hermia o hell choos love anoth s eye lysand or if there were sympathi choic war death or sick did lay sieg it make it momentani as sound swift as shadow short as ani dream brief as lightn colli night that spleen unfold both heaven earth ere man hath power say behold jaw dark do devour it so quick helena how happi some o er other some can be athen i am thought as fair as she but what that demetriu think not so he will not know what all but he do know as he err dote hermia s eye so i admir hi qualiti thing base vile hold no quantiti love can transpos form digniti love look not eye but mind therefor is wing d cupid paint blind nor hath love s mind ani judgment tast wing no eye figur unheedi he wa onli mine when thi hail some heat hermia felt so he dissolv d shower oath did melt i will go tell him fair hermia s flight then wood will he tomorrow night pursu her thi intellig if i have thank it is dear expens but herein mean i enrich my pain have hi sight thither back again _exit helena _ scene ii same room cottag enter quinc snug bottom flute snout starvel quinc is all our compani here quinc say what play treat then read name actor so grow point quinc marri our play is _the most lament comedi most cruel death pyramu thisbe_ bottom veri good piec work i assur you merri now good peter quinc call forth your actor scroll master spread yourselv quinc answer as i call you nick bottom weaver bottom readi name what part i am proceed quinc you nick bottom are set down pyramu bottom what is pyramu lover or tyrant quinc lover that kill himself most gallantli love bottom that will ask some tear true perform it if i do it let audienc look their eye i will move storm i will condol some measur rest yet my chief humour is tyrant i could play ercl rare or part tear cat make all split rage rock shiver shock shall break lock prison gate phibbu car shall shine far make mar foolish fate thi wa lofti now name rest player thi is ercl vein tyrant s vein lover is more condol quinc franci flute bellow mender flute here peter quinc quinc flute you must take thisb you flute what is thisb that they would shriek that were enough hang us all all that would hang us everi mother s son bottom i grant you friend if you should fright ladi their wit they would have no more discret but hang us see summer s day most love gentleman like man therefor you must need play pyramu bottom well i will undertak it what beard were i best play it quinc whi what you will bottom i will discharg it either your straw colour beard your orang tawni beard your purpl grain beard or your french crown colour beard your perfect yellow quinc some your french crown have no hair all then you will play bare face but master here are your part i am entreat you request you desir you con them tomorrow night meet me palac wood mile town moonlight there will we rehears if we meet citi we shall be dogg d compani our devic known meantim i will draw bill properti such as our play want i pray you fail me not bottom we will meet there we may rehears most obscen courag take pain be perfect adieu quinc duke s oak we meet bottom enough hold or cut bow string _exeunt _ act ii scene i wood near athen enter fairi one door puck anoth puck how now spirit whither wander you fairi hill dale thorough bush thorough brier park pale thorough flood thorough fire i do wander everywher swifter than moon s sphere i serv fairi queen dew her orb green cowslip tall her pension be their gold coat spot you see those be rubi fairi favour those freckl live their savour i must go seek some dew drop here hang pearl everi cowslip s ear farewel thou lob spirit i ll be gone our queen all her elv come here anon puck king doth keep hi revel here tonight take heed queen come not hi sight oberon is pass fell wrath becaus that she as her attend hath love boy stol n indian king she never had so sweet changel jealou oberon would have child knight hi train trace forest wild but she perforc withhold lovd boy crown him flower make him all her joy now they never meet grove or green fountain clear or spangl starlight sheen but they do squar that all their elv fear creep acorn cup hide them there fairi either i mistak your shape make quit or els you are that shrewd knavish sprite call d robin goodfellow are not you he that fright maiden villageri skim milk sometim labour quern bootless make breathless housewif churn sometim make drink bear no barm mislead night wander laugh their harm those that hobgoblin call you sweet puck you do their work they shall have good luck are not you he puck thou speak st aright i am that merri wander night i jest oberon make him smile when i fat bean fed hors beguil neigh like filli foal sometim lurk i gossip s bowl veri like roast crab when she drink against her lip i bob her wither dewlap pour ale wisest aunt tell saddest tale sometim three foot stool mistaketh me then slip i her bum down toppl she tailor cri fall cough then whole quir hold their hip loff waxen their mirth neez swear merrier hour wa never wast there but room fairi here come oberon fairi here my mistress would that he were gone enter oberon one door hi train titania anoth her oberon ill met moonlight proud titania titania what jealou oberon fairi skip henc i have forsworn hi bed compani oberon tarri rash wanton am not i thi lord titania then i must be thi ladi but i know when thou hast stol n away fairyland shape corin sat all day play pipe corn vers love amor phillida whi art thou here come farthest steep india but that forsooth bounc amazon your buskin d mistress your warrior love theseu must be wed you come give their bed joy prosper oberon how canst thou thu shame titania glanc my credit hippolyta know i know thi love theseu didst not thou lead him glimmer night perigenia whom he ravish make him fair aegl break hi faith ariadn antiopa titania these are forgeri jealousi never middl summer s spring met we hill dale forest or mead pavd fountain or rushi brook or beachd margent sea danc our ringlet whistl wind but thi brawl thou hast disturb d our sport therefor wind pipe us vain as reveng have suck d sea contagi fog which fall land hath everi pelt river made so proud that they have overborn their contin ox hath therefor stretch d hi yoke vain ploughman lost hi sweat green corn hath rot ere hi youth attain d beard fold stand empti drownd field crow are fat murrion flock nine men s morri is fill d mud quaint maze wanton green lack tread are undistinguish human mortal want their winter here no night is now hymn or carol blest therefor moon gover flood pale her anger wash all air that rheumat diseas do abound thorough thi distemperatur we see season alter hoari head frost fall fresh lap crimson rose old hiem thin ici crown odor chaplet sweet summer bud is as mockeri set spring summer child autumn angri winter chang their wont liveri maze world their increas now know not which is which thi same progeni evil come our debat our dissens we are their parent origin oberon do you amend it then it lie you whi should titania cross her oberon i do but beg littl changel boy be my henchman titania set your heart rest fairyland buy not child me hi mother wa vot ress my order spicd indian air night full often hath she gossip d my side sat me neptun s yellow sand mark th embarkd trader flood when we have laugh d see sail conceiv grow big belli wanton wind which she pretti swim gait follow her womb then rich my young squir would imit sail land fetch me trifl return again as voyag rich merchandis but she be mortal that boy did die her sake do i rear her boy her sake i will not part him oberon how long thi wood intend you stay titania perchanc till theseu wed day if you will patient danc our round see our moonlight revel go us if not shun me i will spare your haunt oberon give me that boy i will go thee titania not thi fairi kingdom fairi away we shall chide downright if i longer stay _exit titania her train _ oberon well go thi way thou shalt not thi grove till i torment thee thi injuri my gentl puck come hither thou rememb rest onc i sat time i saw but thou couldst not fli cold moon earth cupid all arm d certain aim he took fair vestal thrond west loo d hi love shaft smartli hi bow as it should pierc hundr thousand heart but i might see young cupid s fieri shaft quench d chast beam wateri moon imperi votress pass maiden medit fanci free yet mark d i where bolt cupid fell it fell littl western flower milk white now purpl love s wound maiden call it love idl fetch me that flower herb i show thee onc juic it sleep eyelid laid will make or man or woman madli dote next live creatur that it see fetch me thi herb be thou here again ere leviathan can swim leagu puck i ll put girdl round earth forti minut _exit puck _ oberon have onc thi juic i ll watch titania when she is asleep drop liquor it her eye next thing then she come here i am invis i will overhear their confer enter demetriu helena follow him demetriu i love thee not therefor pursu me not where is lysand fair hermia one i ll slay other slayeth me thou told st me they were stol n thi wood here am i wode thi wood becaus i cannot meet hermia henc get thee gone follow me no more helena you draw me you hard heart adam but yet you draw not iron my heart is true as steel leav you your power draw i shall have no power follow you demetriu do i entic you do i speak you fair or rather do i not plainest truth tell you i do not nor i cannot love you helena even that do i love you more i am your spaniel demetriu more you beat me i will fawn you use me but as your spaniel spurn me strike me neglect me lose me onli give me leav unworthi as i am follow you what worser place can i beg your love yet place high respect me than be usd as you use your dog demetriu tempt not too much hatr my spirit i am sick when i do look thee helena i am sick when i look not you demetriu you do impeach your modesti too much leav citi commit yourself hand one that love you not trust opportun night ill counsel desert place rich worth your virgin helena your virtu is my privileg that it is not night when i do see your face therefor i think i am not night nor doth thi wood lack world compani you my respect are all world then how can it be said i am alon when all world is here look me demetriu i ll run thee hide me brake leav thee merci wild beast helena wildest hath not such heart as you run when you will stori shall be chang d apollo fli daphn hold chase dove pursu griffin mild hind make speed catch tiger bootless speed when cowardic pursu valour fli demetriu i will not stay thi question let me go or if thou follow me do not believ but i shall do thee mischief wood helena ay templ town field you do me mischief fie demetriu your wrong do set scandal my sex we cannot fight love as men may do we should be woo d were not made woo _exit demetriu _ i ll follow thee make heaven hell die hand i love so well _exit helena _ oberon fare thee well nymph ere he do leav thi grove thou shalt fli him he shall seek thi love enter puck hast thou flower there welcom wander puck ay there it is oberon i pray thee give it me i know bank where wild thyme blow where oxlip nod violet grow quit canopi lusciou woodbin sweet musk rose eglantin there sleep titania sometim night lull d these flower danc delight there snake throw her enamel d skin weed wide enough wrap fairi juic thi i ll streak her eye make her full hate fantasi take thou some it seek thi grove sweet athenian ladi is love disdain youth anoint hi eye but do it when next thing he espi may be ladi thou shalt know man athenian garment he hath effect it some care that he may prove more fond her than she her love look thou meet me ere first cock crow puck fear not my lord your servant shall do so _exeunt _ scene ii anoth part wood enter titania her train titania come now roundel fairi song sleep _ enter puck puck forest have i gone but athenian found i none whose eye i might approv thi flower s forc stir love night silenc who is here weed athen he doth wear thi is he my master said you live good sir awak lysand _wake _ run fire i will thi sweet sake transpar helena natur show art that thi bosom make me see thi heart where is demetriu o how fit word is that vile name perish my sweet sight her dotag now i do begin piti meet her late behind wood seek sweet favour thi hate fool i did upbraid her fall her she hi hairi templ then had round coronet fresh fragrant flower that same dew which sometim bud wa wont swell like round orient pearl stood now pretti flouriet eye like tear that did their own disgrac bewail when i had my pleasur taunt her she mild term begg d my patienc i then did ask her her changel child which straight she gave me her fairi sent bear him my bower fairyland now i have boy i will undo thi hate imperfect her eye gentl puck take thi transformd scalp off head thi athenian swain that he awak when other do may all athen back again repair think no more thi night s accid but as fierc vexat dream but first i will releas fairi queen _touch her eye herb _ be as thou wast wont be see as thou wa wont see dian s bud o er cupid s flower hath such forc bless power now my titania wake you my sweet queen titania my oberon what vision have i seen methought i wa advanc their pride against that power that bred it there will she hide her listen our propos thi is thi offic bear thee well it leav us alon margaret i ll make her come i warrant you present _exit _ hero now ursula when beatric doth come as we do trace thi alley down our talk must onli be benedick when i do name him let it be thi part prais him more than ever man did merit my talk thee must be how benedick is sick love beatric thi matter is littl cupid s crafti arrow made that onli wound hearsay enter beatric behind now begin look where beatric like lapw run close ground hear our confer ursula pleasant st angl is see fish cut her golden oar silver stream greedili devour treacher bait so angl we beatric who even now is couch woodbin covertur fear you not my part dialogu hero then go we near her that her ear lose noth fals sweet bait that we lay it _they advanc bower _ no truli ursula she is too disdain i know her spirit are as coy wild as haggard rock ursula but are you sure that benedick love beatric so entir hero so say princ my new troth lord ursula did they bid you tell her it madam hero they did entreat me acquaint her it but i persuad them if they lov d benedick wish him wrestl affect never let beatric know it ursula whi did you so doth not gentleman deserv as full as fortun bed as ever beatric shall couch hero o god love i know he doth deserv as much as may be yield man but natur never fram d woman s heart prouder stuff than that beatric disdain scorn ride sparkl her eye mispris what they look her wit valu itself so highli that her all matter els seem weak she cannot love nor take no shape nor project affect she is so self endear d ursula sure i think so therefor certainli it were not good she knew hi love lest she make sport it hero whi you speak truth i never yet saw man how wise how nobl young how rare featur d but she would spell him backward if fair fac d she would swear gentleman should be her sister if black whi natur draw antick made foul blot if tall lanc ill head if low agat veri vile cut if speak whi vane blown all wind if silent whi block move none so turn she everi man wrong side never give truth virtu that which simpl merit purchaseth ursula sure sure such carp is not commend hero no not be so odd all fashion as beatric is cannot be commend but who dare tell her so if i should speak she would mock me air o she would laugh me myself press me death wit therefor let benedick like cover d fire consum away sigh wast inwardli it were better death than die mock which is as bad as die tickl ursula yet tell her it hear what she will say hero no rather i will go benedick counsel him fight against hi passion truli i ll devis some honest slander stain my cousin one doth not know how much ill word may empoison like ursula o do not do your cousin such wrong she cannot be so much true judgment have so swift excel wit as she is priz d have as refus so rare gentleman as signior benedick hero he is onli man itali alway except my dear claudio ursula i pray you be not angri me madam speak my fanci signior benedick shape bear argument valour goe foremost report itali hero inde he hath excel good name ursula hi excel did earn it ere he had it when are you marri madam hero whi everi day tomorrow come go i ll show thee some attir have thi counsel which is best furnish me tomorrow ursula she s lim d i warrant you we have caught her madam hero if it prove so then love goe hap some cupid kill arrow some trap _exeunt hero ursula _ beatric _advanc _ what fire is mine ear can thi be true stand i condemn d pride scorn so much contempt farewel maiden pride adieu no glori live behind back such benedick love i will requit thee tame my wild heart thi love hand if thou dost love my kind shall incit thee bind our love holi band other say thou dost deserv i believ it better than reportingli _exit _ scene ii room leonato s hous enter don pedro claudio benedick leonato don pedro i do but stay till your marriag be consumm then go i heart think hi tongu speak benedick gallant i am not as i have been leonato so say i methink you are sadder claudio i hope he be love don pedro hang him truant there s no true drop blood him be truli humour or worm benedick well everyon can master grief but he that ha it claudio yet say i he is love don pedro there is no appear fanci him unless it be fanci that he hath strang disguis as be dutchman today frenchman tomorrow or shape two countri onc as german waist downward all slop spaniard hip upward no doublet unless he have fanci thi fooleri as it appear he hath he is no fool fanci as you would have it appear he is claudio if he be not love some woman there is no believ old sign brush hi hat morn what should that bode don pedro hath ani man seen him barber s claudio no but barber s spirit which is now crept lute string now govern stop don pedro inde that tell heavi tale him conclud conclud he is love claudio nay but i know who love him don pedro that would i know too i warrant one that know him not claudio ye hi ill condit despit all die him don pedro she shall be buri her face upward benedick yet is thi no charm tooth ach old signior walk asid me i have studi eight or nine wise word speak you which these hobbi hors must not hear _exeunt benedick leonato _ don pedro my life break him beatric claudio ti even so hero margaret have thi play their part beatric then two bear titl i will fit her it wonder not till further warrant go but me tonight you shall see her chamber window enter even night her wed day if you love her then tomorrow wed her but it would better fit your honour chang your mind claudio may thi be so don pedro i will not think it don john if you dare not trust that you see confess not that you know if you will follow me i will show you enough when you have seen more heard more proceed accordingli claudio if i see anyth tonight whi i should not marri her tomorrow congreg where i should wed there will i shame her don pedro as i woo thee obtain her i will join thee disgrac her don john i will disparag her no farther till you are my wit bear it coldli but till midnight let issu show itself don pedro o day untowardli turn claudio o mischief strang thwart don john o plagu right well prevent so will you say when you have seen sequel _exeunt _ scene iii street enter dogberri verg watch dogberri are you good men true verg yea or els it were piti but they should suffer salvat bodi soul dogberri nay that were punish too good them if they should have ani allegi them be chosen princ s watch verg well give them their charg neighbour dogberri dogberri first who think you most desartless man be constabl first watch hugh oatcak sir or georg seacoal they can write read dogberri come hither neighbour seacoal god hath bless you good name be well favour man is gift fortun but write read come natur second watch both which master constabl dogberri you have i knew it would be your answer well your favour sir whi give god thank make no boast it your write read let that appear when there is no need such vaniti you are thought here be most senseless fit man constabl watch therefor bear you lanthorn thi is your charg you shall comprehend all vagrom men you are bid ani man stand princ s name second watch how if will not stand dogberri whi then take no note him but let him go present call rest watch togeth thank god you are rid knave verg if he will not stand when he is bidden he is none princ s subject dogberri true they are meddl none but princ s subject you shall also make no nois street watch babbl talk is most toler not be endur second watch we will rather sleep than talk we know what belong watch dogberri whi you speak like ancient most quiet watchman i cannot see how sleep should offend onli have care that your bill be not stolen well you are call all alehous bid those that are drunk get them bed second watch how if they will not dogberri whi then let them alon till they are sober if they make you not then better answer you may say they are not men you took them second watch well sir dogberri if you meet thief you may suspect him virtu your offic be no true man such kind men less you meddl or make them whi more is your honesti second watch if we know him be thief shall we not lay hand him dogberri truli your offic you may but i think they that touch pitch will be defil most peaceabl way you if you do take thief is let him show himself what he is steal your compani verg you have been alway call merci man partner dogberri truli i would not hang dog my will much more man who hath ani honesti him verg if you hear child cri night you must call nurs bid her still it second watch how if nurs be asleep will not hear us dogberri whi then depart peac let child wake her cri ewe that will not hear her lamb when it bae will never answer calf when he bleat verg ti veri true dogberri thi is end charg you constabl are present princ s own person if you meet princ night you may stay him verg nay r ladi that i think cannot dogberri five shill one t ani man that know statut he may stay him marri not princ be will inde watch ought offend no man it is offenc stay man against hi will verg r ladi i think it be or cloak is noth man conrad ye it is apparel borachio i mean fashion conrad ye fashion is fashion borachio tush i may as well say fool s fool but seest thou not what deform thief thi fashion is watch _aside_ i know that deform ha been vile thief thi seven year goe down like gentleman i rememb hi name borachio didst thou not hear somebodi conrad no twa vane hous borachio seest thou not i say what skirt round underborn bluish tinsel but fine quaint grace excel fashion your is worth ten t hero god give me joy wear it my heart is exceed heavi margaret twill be heavier soon weight man hero fie that she wa accu d shall be lament piti excu d everi hearer it so fall that what we have we prize not worth while we enjoy it but be lack d lost whi then we rack valu then we find virtu that possess would not show us while it wa our so will it fare claudio when he shall hear she die hi word idea her life shall sweetli creep hi studi imagin everi love organ her life shall come apparel d more dragon here affright thee hard her face like heaven enticeth thee view her countless glori which desert must gain which desert becaus thine eye presum reach all whole heap must die yon sometim famou then give my tongu like leav love my head antiochu _aside_ heaven that i had thi head he ha found mean but i will gloze him young princ tyre though tenour our strict edict your exposit misinterpret we might proceed cancel your day yet hope succeed so fair tree as your fair self doth tune us otherwis forti day longer we do respit you if which time our secret be undon thi merci show we ll joy such son then your entertain shall be as doth befit our honour your worth _exeunt all but pericl _ pericl how courtesi would seem cover sin when what is done is like hypocrit which is good noth but sight if it be true that i interpret fals then were it certain you were not so bad as foul incest abus your soul where now you re both father son your untim clasp your child which pleasur fit husband not father she eater her mother s flesh defil her parent s bed both like serpent are who though they feed sweetest flower yet they poison breed antioch farewel wisdom see those men blush not action blacker than night will schew no cours keep them light one sin i know anoth doth provok murder s as near lust as flame smoke poison treason are hand sin ay target put off shame then lest my life be cropp d keep you clear flight i ll shun danger which i fear _exit _ re enter antiochu antiochu he hath found mean which we mean have hi head he must not live trumpet forth my infami nor tell world antiochu doth sin such loath manner therefor instantli thi princ must die hi fall my honour must keep high who attend us there enter thaliard thaliard doth your high call antiochu thaliard you are our chamber our mind partak her privat action your secreci your faith we will advanc you thaliard behold here s poison here s gold we hate princ tyre thou must kill him it fit thee not ask reason whi becaus we bid it say is it done thaliard my lord ti done antiochu enough enter messeng let your breath cool yourself tell your hast messeng my lord princ pericl is fled _exit _ antiochu as thou wilt live fli like arrow shot well experienc archer hit mark hi eye doth level so thou ne er return unless thou say princ pericl is dead thaliard my lord if i can get him my pistol s length i ll make him sure enough so farewel your high antiochu thaliard adieu _exit thaliard _ till pericl be dead my heart can lend no succour my head _exit _ scene ii tyre room palac enter pericl hi lord pericl _to lord _ let none disturb us whi should thi chang thought sad companion dull eye melancholi be my so use guest as not hour day s gloriou walk or peac night tomb where grief should sleep can breed me quiet here pleasur court mine eye mine eye shun them danger which i fear d is antioch whose arm seem far too short hit me here yet neither pleasur s art can joy my spirit nor yet other s distanc comfort me then it is thu passion mind that have their first concept misdread have nourish life care what wa first but fear what might be done grow elder now care it be not done so me great antiochu gainst whom i am too littl contend he s so great can make hi will hi act will think me speak though i swear silenc nor boot it me say i honour him if he suspect i may dishonour him what may make him blush be known he ll stop cours which it might be known hostil forc he ll o erspread land ostent war will look so huge amaz shall drive courag state our men be vanquish d ere they do resist subject punish d that ne er thought offenc which care them not piti myself who am no more but as top tree which fenc root they grow defend them make both my bodi pine soul languish punish that that he would punish enter helicanu other lord first lord joy all comfort your sacr breast second lord keep your mind till you return us peac comfort helicanu peac peac give experi tongu they do abus king that flatter him flatteri is bellow blow sin thing which is flatter d but spark which that spark give heat stronger glow wherea reproof obedi order fit king as they are men they may err when signior sooth here doe proclaim peac he flatter you make war your life princ pardon me or strike me if you pleas i cannot be much lower than my knee pericl all leav us els but let your care o erlook what ship what lade s our haven then return us _exeunt lord _ helicanu thou hast move us what seest thou our look helicanu angri brow dread lord pericl if there be such dart princ frown how durst thi tongu move anger our face helicanu how dare plant look heaven whenc they have their nourish pericl thou know st i have power take thi life thee helicanu _kneel _ i have ground axe myself do but you strike blow pericl rise prithe rise sit down thou art no flatter i thank thee it heaven forbid that king should let their ear hear their fault hid fit counsellor servant princ who thi wisdom makest princ thi servant what wouldst thou have me do helicanu bear patienc such grief as you yourself do lay yourself pericl thou speak st like physician helicanu that minist potion unto me that thou wouldst trembl receiv thyself attend me then i went antioch where as thou know st against face death i sought purchas gloriou beauti whenc issu i might propag are arm princ bring joy subject her face wa mine eye all wonder rest hark thine ear as black as incest which my knowledg found sin father seem d not strike but smooth but thou know st thi ti time fear when tyrant seem kiss which fear so grew me i hither fled cover care night who seem d my good protector be here bethought me what wa past what might succeed i knew him tyrann tyrant fear decreas not but grow faster than year should he doubt as no doubt he doth that i should open listen air how mani worthi princ blood were shed keep hi bed black unlaid ope lop that doubt he ll fill thi land arm make pretenc wrong that i have done him when all mine if i may call offenc must feel war s blow who spare not innoc which love all which thyself art one who now reprovest me it helicanu ala sir pericl drew sleep mine eye blood my cheek muse my mind thousand doubt how i might stop thi tempest ere it came find littl comfort reliev them i thought it princ chariti griev them helicanu well my lord you have given me leav speak freeli will i speak antiochu you fear justli too i think you fear tyrant who either public war or privat treason will take away your life therefor my lord go travel while till that hi rage anger be forgot or till destini do cut hi thread life your rule direct ani if me day serv not light more faith than i ll be pericl i do not doubt thi faith but should he wrong my liberti my absenc helcanu we ll mingl our blood togeth earth whenc we had our be our birth pericl tyre i now look thee then tarsu intend my travel where i ll hear thee whose letter i ll dispos myself care i had have subject good thee i lay whose wisdom s strength can bear it i ll take thi word faith not ask thine oath who shun not break one will sure crack both but our orb we ll live so round safe that time both thi truth shall ne er convinc thou show dst subject s shine i true princ _exeunt _ scene iii tyre ant chamber palac enter thaliard thaliard so thi is tyre thi court here must i kill king pericl if i do it not i am sure be hang home ti danger well i perceiv he wa wise fellow had good discret that be bid ask what he would king desir he might know none hi secret now do i see he had some reason t if king bid man be villain he s bound indentur hi oath be one husht here come lord tyre enter helicanu escan other lord tyre helicanu you shall not need my fellow peer tyre further question me your king s departur hi seal d commiss left trust me doth speak suffici he s gone travel thaliard _asid _ how king gone helicanu if further yet you will be satisfi whi as it were unlicens your love he would depart i ll give some light unto you be antioch thaliard _asid _ what antioch helicanu royal antiochu what caus i know not took some displeasur him least he judg so doubt lest that he had err d or sinn d show hi sorrow he d correct himself so put himself unto shipman s toil whom each minut threaten life or death thaliard _asid _ well i perceiv i shall not be hang d now although i would but he s gone king s sea must pleas he scape land perish sea i ll present myself peac lord tyre helicanu lord thaliard antiochu is welcom thaliard him i come messag unto princ pericl but my land i have understood your lord ha betook himself unknown travel my messag must return whenc it came helicanu we have no reason desir it commend our master not us yet ere you shall depart thi we desir as friend antioch we may feast tyre _exeunt _ scene iv tarsu room governor s hous enter cleon governor tarsu dionyza other cleon my dionyza shall we rest us here relat tale other grief see if twill teach us forget our own dionyza that were blow fire hope quench it who dig hill becaus they do aspir throw down one mountain cast higher o my distress lord even such our grief are here they re but felt seen mischief s eye but like grove be topp d they higher rise cleon o dionyza who wanteth food will not say he want it or can conceal hi hunger till he famish our tongu sorrow do sound deep our woe air our eye do weep till tongu fetch breath that may proclaim them louder that if heaven slumber while their creatur want they may awak their help comfort them i ll then discours our woe felt sever year want breath speak help me tear dionyza i ll do my best sir cleon thi tarsu o er which i have govern citi whom plenti held full hand rich strew d herself even street whose tower bore head so high they kiss d cloud stranger ne er beheld but wonder d whose men dame so jet adorn d like one anoth s glass trim them their tabl were store full glad sight not so much feed as delight all poverti wa scorn d pride so great name help grew odiou repeat dionyza o ti too true cleon but see what heaven can do thi our chang these mouth who but late earth sea air were all too littl content pleas although they gave their creatur abund as hous are defil want use they are now starv want exercis those palat who not yet two summer younger must have invent delight tast would now be glad bread beg it those mother who nousl their babe thought nought too curiou are readi now eat those littl darl whom they love so sharp are hunger s teeth that man wife draw lot who first shall die lengthen life here stand lord there ladi weep here mani sink yet those which see them fall have scarc strength left give them burial is not thi true dionyza our cheek hollow eye do wit it cleon o let those citi that plenti s cup her prosper so larg tast their superfl riot hear these tear miseri tarsu may be their enter lord lord where s lord governor cleon here speak thi sorrow which thou bring st hast comfort is too far us expect lord we have descri our neighbour shore portli sail ship make hitherward cleon i thought as much one sorrow never come but bring heir that may succeed as hi inheritor so our some neighbour nation take advantag our miseri that stuff d hollow vessel their power beat us down which are down alreadi make conquest unhappi me wherea no glori s got overcom lord that s least fear semblanc their white flag display d they bring us peac come us as favour not as foe cleon thou speak st like him s untutor d repeat who make fairest show mean most deceit but bring they what they will what they can what need we fear ground s lowest we are half way there go tell their gener we attend him here know what he come whenc he come what he crave lord i go my lord _exit _ cleon welcom is peac if he peac consist if war we are unabl resist enter pericl attend pericl lord governor so we hear you are let not our ship number our men be like beacon fire amaz your eye we have heard your miseri as far as tyre seen desol your street nor come we add sorrow your tear but reliev them their heavi load these our ship you happili may think are like trojan hors wa stuff d bloodi vein expect overthrow are store corn make your needi bread give them life whom hunger starv half dead all god greec protect you we ll pray you pericl aris i pray you rise we do not look rever but love harbourag ourself our ship men cleon which when ani shall not gratifi or pay you unthank thought be it our wive our children or ourselv curs heaven men succeed their evil till when which i hope shall ne er be seen your grace is welcom our town us pericl which welcom we ll accept feast here awhil our star that frown lend us smile _exeunt _ act ii enter gower gower here have you seen mighti king hi child iwi incest bring better princ benign lord that will prove aw both deed word be quiet then as men should be till he hath pass d necess i ll show you those troubl reign lose mite mountain gain good convers whom i give my benison is still tarsu where each man think all is forth sea where when men been there s seldom eas now wind begin blow thunder deep make such unquiet that ship should hous him safe is wreck d split he good princ have all lost wave coast coast is tost all perishen man pelf ne aught escapen but himself till fortun tire do bad threw him ashor give him glad here he come what shall be next pardon old gower thi long text _exit _ scene i pentapoli open
