their drouth hymen hath brought bride bed where loss maidenhead babe is mould be attent time that is so briefli spent your fine fanci quaintli ech what s dumb show i ll plain speech dumb show enter pericl simonid one door attend messeng meet them kneel give pericl letter pericl show it simonid lord kneel him then enter thaisa child lychorida nurs king show her letter she rejoic she pericl take leav her father depart lychorida their attend then exeunt simonid rest mani dern pain perch pericl care search four oppos coign which world togeth join is made all due dilig that hors sail high expens can stead quest last tyre fame answer most strang enquir th court king simonid are letter brought tenour these antiochu hi daughter dead men tyru head helicanu would set crown tyre but he will none mutini he there hast t oppress say em if king pericl come not home twice six moon he obedi their doom will take crown sum thi brought hither pentapoli y ravish region round everyon clap can sound our heir appar is king who dreamt who thought such thing brief he must henc depart tyre hi queen child make her desir which who shall cross go omit we all their dole woe lychorida her nurs she take so sea their vessel shake neptun s billow half flood hath their keel cut but fortun s mood vari again grisl north disgorg such tempest forth that as duck life that dive so down poor ship drive ladi shriek well near doe fall travail her fear what ensu thi fell storm shall itself itself perform i nill relat action may conveni rest convey which might not what me is told your imagin hold thi stage ship whose deck sea tost pericl appear speak _exit _ scene i enter pericl shipboard pericl thou god thi great vast rebuk these surg which wash both heaven hell thou that hast wind command bind them brass have call d them deep o still thi deafen dread thunder gentli quench thi nimbl sulphur flash o how lychorida how doe my queen thou stormest venom wilt thou spit all thyself seaman s whistl is as whisper ear death unheard lychorida lucina o divinest patro midwif gentl those that cri night convey thi deiti aboard our danc boat make swift pang my queen s travail now lychorida enter lychorida infant lychorida here is thing too young such place who if it had conceit would die as i am like do take your arm thi piec your dead queen pericl how how lychorida lychorida patienc good sir do not assist storm here s all that is left live your queen littl daughter sake it be manli take comfort pericl o you god whi do you make us love your goodli gift snatch them straight away we here recal not what we give therein may vie honour you lychorida patienc good sir even thi charg pericl now mild may be thi life more blustrou birth had never babe quiet gentl thi condit thou art rudeliest welcom thi world that ever wa princ s child happi what follow thou hast as chide nativ as fire air water earth heaven can make herald thee womb even first thi loss is more than can thi portag quit all thou canst find here now good god throw their best eye t enter two sailor first sailor what courag sir god save you pericl courag enough i do not fear flaw it hath done me worst yet love thi poor infant thi fresh new sea farer i would it would be quiet first sailor slack bolin there thou wilt not wilt thou blow split thyself second sailor but sea room brine cloudi billow kiss moon i care not first sailor sir your queen must overboard sea work high wind is loud will not lie till ship be clear dead pericl that s your superstit first sailor pardon us sir us sea it ha been still observ we are strong custom therefor briefli yield her she must overboard straight pericl as you think meet most wretch queen lychorida here she lie sir pericl terribl childb hast thou had my dear no light no fire th unfriendli element forgot thee utterli nor have i time give thee hallow d thi grave but straight must cast thee scarc coffin d ooz where monument thi bone e er remain lamp belch whale hum water must o erwhelm thi corps lie simpl shell o lychorida bid nestor bring me spice ink paper my casket my jewel bid nicand bring me satin coffer lay babe pillow hie thee while i say priestli farewel her suddenli woman _exit lychorida _ second sailor sir we have chest beneath hatch caulk bitum readi pericl i thank thee marin say what coast is thi second sailor we are near tarsu pericl thither gentl marin alter thi cours tyre when canst thou reach it second sailor break day if wind ceas pericl o make tarsu there will i visit cleon babe cannot hold tyru there i ll leav it care nurs go thi way good marin i ll bring bodi present _exeunt _ scene ii ephesu room cerimon s hous enter cerimon servant some person who have been shipwreck cerimon philemon ho enter philemon philemon doth my lord call cerimon get fire meat these poor men t ha been turbul stormi night servant i have been mani but such night as thi till now i ne er endur cerimon your master will be dead ere you return there s noth can be minist d natur that can recov him _to philemon _ give thi pothecari tell me how it work _exeunt all but cerimon _ enter two gentlemen first gentleman good morrow second gentleman good morrow your lordship cerimon gentlemen whi do you stir so earli first gentleman sir our lodg stand bleak sea shook as earth did quak veri princip did seem rend all toppl pure surpris fear made me quit hous second gentleman that is caus we troubl you so earli ti not our husbandri cerimon o you say well first gentleman but i much marvel that your lordship have rich tire you should these earli hour shake off golden slumber repos ti most strang natur should be so convers pain be thereto not compel d cerimon i hold it ever virtu cun were endow greater than nobl rich careless heir may two latter darken expend but immort attend former make man god ti known i ever have studi physic which secret art turn o er author i have togeth my practic made familiar me my aid blest infus that dwell veget metal stone i can speak disturb that natur work her cure which doth give me more content cours true delight than be thirsti totter honour or tie my pleasur silken bag pleas fool death second gentleman your honour ha ephesu pour d forth your chariti hundr call themselv your creatur who you have been restor not your knowledg your person pain but even your purs still open hath built lord cerimon such strong renown as time shall never enter two or three servant chest first servant so lift there cerimon what s that first servant sir even now did sea toss our shore thi chest ti some wreck cerimon set t down let s look t second gentleman ti like coffin sir cerimon whate er it be ti wondrou heavi wrench it open straight if sea s stomach be o ercharg gold ti good constraint fortun it belch us second gentleman ti so my lord cerimon how close ti caulk d bitum did sea cast it first servant i never saw so huge billow sir as toss d it shore cerimon wrench it open soft it smell most sweetli my sens second gentleman delic odour cerimon as ever hit my nostril so it o you most potent god what s here corps first gentleman most strang cerimon shroud cloth state balm d entreasur full bag spice passport too apollo perfect me charact _read scroll _ _here i give understand if e er thi coffin drive land i king pericl have lost thi queen worth all our mundan cost who find her give her buri she wa daughter king besid thi treasur fee god requit hi chariti _ if thou livest pericl thou hast heart that even crack woe thi chanc tonight second gentleman most like sir cerimon nay certainli tonight look how fresh she look they were too rough that threw her sea make fire fetch hither all my box my closet _exit servant _ death may usurp natur mani hour yet fire life kindl again o erpress d spirit i heard egyptian that had nine hour lain dead who wa good applianc recov re enter servant napkin fire well said well said fire cloth rough woeful music that we have caus it sound beseech you viol onc more how thou stirr st thou block music there i pray you give her air gentlemen thi queen will live natur awak warmth breath her she hath not been entranc five hour see how she gin blow life s flower again first gentleman heaven you increas our wonder set your fame ever cerimon she is aliv behold her eyelid case those heavenli jewel which pericl hath lost begin part their fring bright gold diamond most prais water doth appear make world twice rich live make us weep hear your fate fair creatur rare as you seem be _she move _ thaisa o dear diana where am i where s my lord what world is thi second gentleman is not thi strang first gentleman most rare cerimon hush my gentl neighbour lend me your hand next chamber bear her get linen now thi matter must be look d her relaps is mortal come come aesculapiu guid us _exeunt carri her away _ scene iii tarsu room cleon s hous enter pericl cleon dionyza lychorida marina her arm pericl most honour d cleon i must need be gone my twelv month are expir tyru stand litigi peac you your ladi take my heart all thank god make rest you cleon your shaft fortun though they hurt you mortal yet glanc full wanderingli us dionyza o your sweet queen that strict fate had pleas you had brought her hither have bless d mine eye her pericl we cannot but obey power us could i rage roar as doth sea she lie yet end must be as ti my gentl babe marina whom she wa born sea i have name so here i charg your chariti withal leav her infant your care beseech you give her princ train that she may be manner d as she is born cleon fear not my lord but think your grace that fed my countri your corn which peopl s prayer still fall you must your child be thought if neglect should therein make me vile common bodi you reliev would forc me my duti but if that my natur need spur god reveng it me mine end gener pericl i believ you your honour your good teach me t your vow till she be marri madam bright diana whom we honour all unscissor shall thi hair mine remain though i show ill t so i take my leav good madam make me bless your care bring my child dionyza i have one myself who shall not be more dear my respect than your my lord pericl madam my thank prayer cleon we ll bring your grace e en edg o shore then give you mask d neptun gentlest wind heaven pericl i will embrac your offer come dearest madam o no tear lychorida no tear look your littl mistress whose grace you may depend hereaft come my lord _exeunt _ scene iv ephesu room cerimon s hous enter cerimon thaisa cerimon madam thi letter some certain jewel lay you your coffer which are your command know you charact thaisa it is my lord s that i wa shipp d sea i well rememb even my groan time but there deliv d holi god i cannot rightli say but king pericl my wed lord i ne er shall see again vestal liveri will i take me never more have joy cerimon madam if thi you purpos as ye speak diana s templ is not distant far where you may abid till your date expir moreov if you pleas niec mine shall there attend you thaisa my recompens is thank that s all yet my good will is great though gift small _exeunt _ act iv enter gower gower imagin pericl arriv tyre welcom settl hi own desir hi woeful queen we leav ephesu unto diana there votaress now marina bend your mind whom our fast grow scene must find tarsu cleon train d music s letter who hath gain d educ all grace which make her both heart place gener wonder but alack that monster envi oft wrack earn prais marina s life seek take off treason s knife thi kind our cleon hath one daughter full grown wench even ripe marriag rite thi maid hight philoten it is said certain our stori she would ever marina be be t when she weav sleid silk finger long small white as milk or when she would sharp needl wound cambric which she made more sound hurt it or when th lute she sung made night bird mute that still record moan or when she would rich constant pen vail her mistress dian still thi philoten contend skill absolut marina so dove papho might crow vie feather white marina get all prais which are paid as debt not as given thi so dark philoten all grace mark that cleon s wife envi rare present murder doe prepar good marina that her daughter might stand peerless thi slaughter sooner her vile thought stead lychorida our nurs is dead curs dionyza hath pregnant instrument wrath prest thi blow unborn event i do commend your content onli i carri wing time post lame feet my rhyme which never could i so convey unless your thought went my way dionyza doe appear leonin murder _exit _ scene i tarsu open place near seashor enter dionyza leonin dionyza thi oath rememb thou hast sworn do t ti but blow which never shall be known thou canst not do thing world so soon yield thee so much profit let not conscienc which is but cold inflam love i thi bosom inflam too nice nor let piti which even women have cast off melt thee but be soldier thi purpos leonin i will do t but yet she is goodli creatur dionyza fitter then god should have her here she come weep her onli mistress death thou art resolv leonin i am resolv enter marina basket flower marina no i will rob tellu her weed strew thi green flower yellow blue purpl violet marigold shall as carpet hang thi grave while summer day do last ay me poor maid born tempest when my mother die thi world me is like last storm whir me my friend dionyza how now marina whi do you keep alon how chanc my daughter is not you do not consum your blood sorrow have you nurs me lord how your favour s chang thi unprofit woe come give me your flower ere sea mar it walk leonin air is quick there it pierc sharpen stomach come leonin take her arm walk her marina no i pray you i ll not bereav you your servant dionyza come come i love king your father yourself more than foreign heart we everi day expect him here when he shall come find our paragon all report thu blast he will repent breadth hi great voyag blame both my lord me that we have taken no care your best cours go i pray you walk be cheer onc again reserv that excel complexion which did steal eye young old care not me i can go home alon marina well i will go but yet i have no desir it dionyza come come i know ti good you walk half hour leonin least rememb what i have said leonin i warrant you madam dionyza i ll leav you my sweet ladi while pray walk softli do not heat your blood what i must have care you marina my thank sweet madam _exit dionyza _ is thi wind westerli that blow leonin south west marina when i wa born wind wa north leonin wa t so marina my father as nurs said did never fear but cri good seamen sailor gall hi kingli hand hale rope clasp mast endur sea that almost burst deck leonin when wa thi marina when i wa born never wa wave nor wind more violent ladder tackl wash off canva climber ha say one wolt drop industri they skip stem stern boatswain whistl master call trebl their confus leonin come say your prayer marina what mean you leonin if you requir littl space prayer i grant it pray but be not tediou god are quick ear i am sworn do my work hast marina whi will you kill me leonin satisfi my ladi marina whi would she have me kill d now as i can rememb my troth i never did her hurt all my life i never spake bad word nor did ill turn ani live creatur believ me la i never kill d mous nor hurt fli i trod worm against my will but i wept it how have i offend wherein my death might yield her ani profit or my life impli her ani danger leonin my commiss is not reason deed but do it marina you will not do t all world i hope you are well favour d your look foreshow you have gentl heart i saw you late when you caught hurt part two that fought good sooth it show d well you do so now your ladi seek my life come you save poor me weaker leonin i am sworn will dispatch _he seiz her _ enter pirat first pirat hold villain _leonin run away _ second pirat prize prize third pirat half part mate half part come let s have her aboard suddenli _exeunt pirat marina _ re enter leonin leonin these rogu thiev serv great pirat vald they have seiz marina let her go there s no hope she will return i ll swear she s dead thrown sea but i ll see further perhap they will but pleas themselv her not carri her aboard if she remain whom they have ravish d must me be slain _exit _ scene ii mytilen room brothel enter pandar bawd boult pandar boult boult sir pandar search market narrowli mytilen is full gallant we lost too much money thi mart be too wenchless bawd we were never so much creatur we have but poor three they can do no more than they can do they continu action are even as good as rotten pandar therefor let s have fresh one whate er we pay them if there be not conscienc be use everi trade we shall never prosper bawd thou sayest true ti not our bring poor bastard as i think i have brought some eleven boult ay eleven brought them down again but shall i search market bawd what els man stuff we have strong wind will blow it piec they are so piti sodden pandar thou sayest true they re too unwholesom o conscienc poor transylvanian is dead that lay littl baggag boult ay she quickli poop him she made him roast meat worm but i ll go search market _exit _ pandar three or four thousand chequin were as pretti proport live quietli so give bawd whi give i pray you is it shame get when we are old pandar o our credit come not like commod nor commod wage not danger therefor if our youth we could pick some pretti estat twere not amiss keep our door hatch besid sore term we stand god will be strong us give bawd come other sort offend as well as we pandar as well as we ay better too we offend wors neither is our profess ani trade it s no call but here come boult re enter boult pirat marina boult _to pirat _ come your way my master you say she s virgin first pirat o sir we doubt it not boult master i have gone thi piec you see if you like her so if not i have lost my earnest bawd boult ha she ani qualiti boult she ha good face speak well ha excel good cloth there s no farther necess qualiti can make her be refus bawd what is her price boult boult i cannot be bait one doit thousand piec pandar well follow me my master you shall have your money present wife take her instruct her what she ha do that she may not be raw her entertain _exeunt pandar pirat _ bawd boult take you mark her colour her hair complexion height her age warrant her virgin cri he that will give most shall have her first such maidenhead were no cheap thing if men were as they have been get thi done as i command you boult perform shall follow _exit _ marina alack that leonin wa so slack so slow he should have struck not spoke or that these pirat not enough barbar had not o erboard thrown me seek my mother bawd whi lament you pretti one marina that i am pretti bawd come god have done their part you marina i accus them not bawd you are light my hand where you are like live marina more my fault scape hi hand where i wa like die bawd ay you shall live pleasur marina no bawd ye inde shall you tast gentlemen all fashion you shall fare well you shall have differ all complexion what do you stop your ear marina are you woman bawd what would you have me be i be not woman marina honest woman or not woman bawd marri whip gosl i think i shall have someth do you come you re young foolish sapl must be bow as i would have you marina god defend me bawd if it pleas god defend you men then men must comfort you men must feed you men stir you boult s return re enter boult now sir hast thou cri her market boult i have cri her almost number her hair i have drawn her pictur my voic bawd i prithe tell me how dost thou find inclin peopl especi younger sort boult faith they listen me as they would have hearken their father s testament there wa spaniard s mouth so water that he went bed her veri descript bawd we shall have him here tomorrow hi best ruff boult tonight tonight but mistress do you know french knight that cower i ham bawd who monsieur verol boult ay he he offer cut caper proclam but he made groan it swore he would see her tomorrow bawd well well as him he brought hi diseas hither here he doe but repair it i know he will come our shadow scatter hi crown sun boult well if we had everi nation travel we should lodg them thi sign _to marina _ pray you come hither awhil you have fortun come you mark me you must seem do that fear which you commit willingli despis profit mistress take her home these blush her must be quench some present practic bawd thou sayest true i faith so they must your bride goe that shame which is her way go warrant boult faith some do some do not but mistress if i have bargain joint bawd thou mayst cut morsel off spit boult i may so bawd who should deni it come young one i like manner your garment well boult ay my faith they shall not be undo deed ladi much less blood than virtu yet princess equal ani singl crown o earth i justic compar o villain leonin whom thou hast poison d too if thou hadst drunk him t had been kind becom well thi face what canst thou say when nobl pericl shall demand hi child dionyza that she is dead nurs are not fate foster it nor ever preserv she die night i ll say so who can cross it unless you play piou innoc honest attribut cri she die foul play cleon o go well well all fault beneath heaven god do like thi worst dionyza be one those that think petti wren tarsu will fli henc open thi pericl i do shame think what nobl strain you are how coward spirit cleon such proceed whoever but hi approb ad though not hi prime consent he did not flow honour sourc dionyza be it so then yet none doe know but you how she came dead nor none can know leonin be gone she did distain my child stood her her fortun none would look her but cast their gaze marina s face whilst our wa blurt held malkin not worth time day it pierc me though you call my cours unnatur you not your child well love yet i find it greet me as enterpris kind perform d your sole daughter cleon heaven forgiv it dionyza as pericl what should he say we wept her hears yet we mourn her monument is almost finish d her epitaph glitter golden charact express gener prais her care us whose expens ti done cleon thou art like harpi which betray dost thine angel s face seiz thine eagl s talon dionyza you are like one that superstiti doth swear god that winter kill fli but yet i know you ll do as i advis _exeunt _ scene iv enter gower monument marina tarsu gower thu time we wast long leagu make short sail sea cockl have wish but t make take your imagin bourn bourn region region you be pardon d we commit no crime use one languag pretti one my author shall not see thee or els look friendli thee come bring me some privat place come come marina if you were born honour show it now if put you make judgement good that thought you worthi it lysimachu how s thi how s thi some more be sage marina me that am maid though most ungentl fortun have place me thi sti where i came diseas have been sold dearer than physic o that god would set me free thi unhallow d place though they did chang me meanest bird that fli i purer air lysimachu i did not think thou couldst have spoke so well ne er dream d thou couldst had i brought hither corrupt mind thi speech had alter d it hold here s gold thee persev that clear way thou goest god strengthen thee marina good god preserv you lysimachu me be you thoughten that i came no ill intent me veri door window savour vile fare thee well thou art piec virtu i doubt not but thi train hath been nobl hold here s more gold thee curs him die he like thief that rob thee thi good if thou dost hear me it shall be thi good re enter boult boult i beseech your honour one piec me lysimachu avaunt thou damn door keeper your hous but thi virgin that doth prop it would sink overwhelm you away _exit _ boult how s thi we must take anoth cours you if your peevish chastiti which is not worth breakfast cheapest countri cope shall undo whole household let me be geld like spaniel come your way marina whither would you have me boult i must have your maidenhead taken off or common hangman shall execut it come your way we ll have no more gentlemen driven away come your way i say re enter bawd bawd how now what s matter boult wors wors mistress she ha here spoken holi word lord lysimachu bawd o abomin boult she make our profess as it were stink afor face god bawd marri hang her ever boult nobleman would have dealt her like nobleman she sent him away as cold as snowbal say hi prayer too bawd boult take her away use her thi pleasur crack glass her virgin make rest malleabl boult if she were thornier piec ground than she is she shall be plough marina hark hark you god bawd she conjur away her would she had never come my door marri hang you she s born undo us will you not go way womankind marri come my dish chastiti rosemari bay _exit _ boult come mistress come your way me marina whither wilt thou have me boult take you jewel you hold so dear marina prithe tell me one thing first boult come now your one thing marina what canst thou wish thine enemi be boult whi i could wish him be my master or rather my mistress marina neither these are so bad as thou art they do better thee their command thou hold st place which pain st fiend hell would not reput chang thou art damn doorkeep everi coistrel that come inquir hi tib choler fist everi rogu thi ear is liabl thi food is such as hath been belch d infect lung boult what would you have me do go war would you where man may serv seven year loss leg have not money enough end buy him wooden one marina do anyth but thi thou doest empti old receptacl or common shore filth serv indentur common hangman ani these way are yet better than thi what thou professest baboon could he speak would own name too dear o that god would safe deliv me thi place here here s gold thee if that thi master would gain me proclaim that i can sing weav sew danc other virtu which i ll keep boast i will undertak all these teach i doubt not but thi popul citi will yield mani scholar boult but can you teach all thi you speak marina prove that i cannot take me home again prostitut me basest groom that doth frequent your hous boult well i will see what i can do thee if i can place thee i will marina but honest women boult faith my acquaint lie littl them but my master mistress have bought you there s no go but their consent therefor i will make them acquaint your purpos i doubt not but i shall find them tractabl enough come i ll do thee what i can come your way _exeunt _ act v enter gower gower marina thu brothel scape chanc honest hous our stori say she sing like one immort she danc as goddess like her admir lay deep clerk she dumb her nee le compos natur s own shape bud bird branch or berri that even her art sister natur rose her inkl silk twin rubi cherri that pupil lack she none nobl race who pour their bounti her her gain she give curs bawd here we her place her father turn our thought again where we left him sea we there him lost whenc driven wind he is arriv here where hi daughter dwell thi coast suppos him now anchor citi strive god neptun s annual feast keep whenc lysimachu our tyrian ship espi hi banner sabl trimm d rich expens him hi barg fervour hie your suppos onc more put your sight heavi pericl think thi hi bark where what is done action more if might shall be discov d pleas you sit hark _exit _ scene i board pericl ship off mytilen close pavilion deck curtain it pericl it reclin couch barg lie besid tyrian vessel enter two sailor one belong tyrian vessel other barg them helicanu tyrian sailor _to sailor mytilen _ where is lord helicanu he can resolv you o here he is sir there s barg put off mytilen it is lysimachu governor who crave come aboard what is your will helicanu that he have hi call some gentlemen tyrian sailor ho gentlemen my lord call enter two or three gentlemen first gentleman doth your lordship call helicanu gentlemen there is some worth would come aboard i pray ye greet them fairli _the gentlemen two sailor descend go board barg _ enter thenc lysimachu lord gentlemen two sailor tyrian sailor sir thi is man that can aught you would resolv you lysimachu hail reverend sir god preserv you helicanu you sir outliv age i am die as i would do lysimachu you wish me well be shore honour neptun s triumph see thi goodli vessel ride us i made it know whenc you are helicanu first what is your place lysimachu i am governor thi place you lie helicanu sir our vessel is tyre it king man who thi three month hath not spoken anyon nor taken susten but prorogu hi grief lysimachu what ground is hi distemperatur helicanu twould be too tediou repeat but main grief spring loss belov daughter wife lysimachu may we not see him helicanu you may but bootless is your sight he will not speak ani lysimachu yet let me obtain my wish helicanu behold him _pericl discov _ thi wa goodli person till disast that one mortal night drove him thi lysimachu sir king all hail god preserv you hail royal sir helicanu it is vain he will not speak you first lord sir we have maid mytilen i durst wager would win some word him lysimachu ti well bethought she questionless her sweet harmoni other chosen attract would allur make batteri hi deafen d part which now are midway stopp d she is all happi as fairest all her fellow maid is now leafi shelter that abut against island s side _whisper lord who goe off barg lysimachu _ helicanu sure all s effectless yet noth we ll omit that bear recoveri s name but your kind we have stretch d thu far let us beseech you that our gold we may provis have wherein we are not destitut want but weari stale lysimachu o sir courtesi which if we should deni most just god everi graff would send caterpillar so inflict our provinc yet onc more let me entreat know larg caus your king s sorrow helicanu sit sir i will recount it you but see i am prevent re enter barg lord marina young ladi lysimachu o here is ladi that i sent welcom fair one is t not goodli presenc helicanu she s gallant ladi lysimachu she s such one that were i well assur came gentl kind nobl stock i d wish no better choic think me rare wed fair one all good that consist bounti expect even here where is kingli patient if that thi prosper artifici feat can draw him but answer thee aught thi sacr physic shall receiv such pay as thi desir can wish marina sir i will use my utmost skill hi recoveri provid that none but i my companion maid be suffer d come near him lysimachu come let us leav her god make her prosper _marina sing _ lysimachu mark d he your music marina no nor look d us lysimachu see she will speak him marina hail sir my lord lend ear pericl hum ha marina i am maid my lord that ne er invit eye but have been gaze like comet she speak my lord that may be hath endur grief might equal your if both were justli weigh d though wayward fortun did malign my state my deriv wa ancestor who stood equival mighti king but time hath root my parentag world awkward casualti bound me servitud _asid _ i will desist but there is someth glow my cheek whisper mine ear go not till he speak pericl my fortun parentag good parentag equal mine wa it not thu what say you marina i said my lord if you did know my parentag you would not do me violenc pericl i do think so pray you turn your eye me you are like someth that what countri woman here these shore marina no nor ani shore yet i wa mortal brought forth am no other than i appear pericl i am great woe shall deliv weep my dearest wife wa like thi maid such one my daughter might have been my queen s squar brow her statur inch as wand like straight as silver voic her eye as jewel like case as richli pace anoth juno who starv ear she feed make them hungri more she give them speech where do you live marina where i am but stranger deck you may discern place pericl where were you bred how achiev you these endow which you make more rich owe marina if i should tell my histori it would seem like lie disdain d report pericl prithe speak fals cannot come thee thou look st modest as justic thou seem st palac crown d truth dwell i will believ thee make my sens credit thi relat point that seem imposs thou look st like one i love inde what were thi friend didst thou not say when i did push thee back which wa when i perceiv thee that thou cam st good descend marina so inde i did pericl report thi parentag i think thou said st thou hadst been toss d wrong injuri that thou thought st thi grief might equal mine if both were open d marina some such thing i said said no more but what my thought did warrant me wa like pericl tell thi stori if thine consid d prove thousand part my endur thou art man i have suffer d like girl yet thou dost look like patienc gaze king grave smile extrem act what were thi friend how lost thou them thi name my most kind virgin recount i do beseech thee come sit me marina my name is marina pericl o i am mock d thou some incens god sent hither make world laugh me marina patienc good sir or here i ll ceas pericl nay i ll be patient thou littl know st how thou dost startl me call thyself marina marina name wa given me one that had some power my father king pericl how king s daughter call d marina marina you said you would believ me but not be troubler your peac i will end here pericl but are you flesh blood have you work puls are no fairi motion well speak where were you born wherefor call d marina marina call d marina i wa born sea pericl sea what mother marina my mother wa daughter king who die minut i wa born as my good nurs lychorida hath oft deliv d weep pericl o stop there littl _asid _ thi is rarest dream that e er dull sleep did mock sad fool withal thi cannot be my daughter buri well where were you bred i ll hear you more bottom your stori never interrupt you marina you scorn believ me twere best i did give o er pericl i will believ you syllabl what you shall deliv yet give me leav how came you these part where were you bred marina king my father did tarsu leav me till cruel cleon hi wick wife did seek murder me have woo d villain attempt it who have drawn do t crew pirat came rescu me brought me mytilen but good sir whither will you have me whi do you weep it may be you think me impostor no good faith i am daughter king pericl if good king pericl be pericl ho helicanu enter helicanu lysimachu helicanu call my lord pericl thou art grave nobl counsellor most wise gener tell me if thou canst what thi maid is or what is like be that thu hath made me weep helicanu i know not but here is regent sir mytilen speak nobli her lysimachu she would never tell her parentag be demand that she would sit still weep pericl o helicanu strike me honour d sir give me gash put me present pain lest thi great sea joy rush me o erbear shore my mortal drown me their sweet _to marina_ o come hither thou that beget st him that did thee beget thou that wast born sea buri tarsu found sea again o helicanu down thi knee thank holi god as loud as thunder threaten us thi is marina what wa thi mother s name tell me but that truth can never be confirm d enough though doubt did ever sleep marina first sir i pray what is your titl pericl i am pericl tyre but tell me now my drown d queen s name as rest you said thou hast been godlik perfect heir kingdom anoth life pericl thi father marina is it no more be your daughter than say my mother s name wa thaisa thaisa wa my mother who did end minut i began pericl now bless thee rise thou art my child give me fresh garment mine own helicanu she is not dead tarsu as she should have been savag cleon she shall tell thee all when thou shalt kneel justifi knowledg she is thi veri princess who is thi helicanu sir ti governor mytilen who hear your melancholi state did come see you pericl i embrac you give me my robe i am wild my behold o heaven bless my girl but hark what music tell helicanu my marina tell him o er point point yet he seem doubt how sure you are my daughter but what music helicanu my lord i hear none pericl none music sphere list my marina lysimachu it is not good cross him give him way pericl rarest sound do ye not hear lysimachu music my lord i hear _music _ pericl most heavenli music it nip me unto listen thick slumber hang mine eye let me rest _sleep _ lysimachu pillow hi head so leav him all well my companion friend if thi but answer my just belief i ll well rememb you _exeunt all but pericl _ diana appear pericl as vision diana my templ stand ephesu hie thee thither do mine altar sacrific there when my maiden priest are met togeth peopl all reveal how thou sea didst lose thi wife it woo my daughter it seem you have been nobl her lysimachu sir lend me your arm pericl come my marina _exeunt _ scene ii enter gower templ diana ephesu gower now our sand are almost run more littl cerimon other inhabit ephesu attend enter pericl hi train lysimachu helicanu marina ladi pericl hail dian perform thi just command i here confess myself king tyre who fright my countri did wed star brought her mytilen gainst whose shore ride her fortun brought maid aboard us where her own most clear remembr she made known herself my daughter thaisa voic favour you are you are o royal pericl _faint _ pericl what mean nun she die help gentlemen cerimon nobl sir if you have told diana s altar true thi is your wife pericl reverend appear no i threw her overboard these veri arm cerimon thi coast i warrant you pericl ti most certain cerimon look ladi o she s but o er joy d earli bluster morn thi ladi wa thrown thi shore i ope coffin found there rich jewel recov d her place her here diana thing omit pericl pure dian bless thee thi vision i will offer night oblat thee thaisa thi princ fair betroth your daughter shall marri her pentapoli now thi ornament make me look dismal will i clip celebr their nuptial ourselv will that kingdom spend our follow day our son daughter shall tyru reign lord cerimon we do our long stay hear rest untold sir lead s way _exeunt _ enter gower gower malic or worthili as good subject should some known ground treacheri him gaunt as near as i could sift him that argument some appar danger seen him aim your high no inveter malic king richard then call them our presenc face face frown brow brow ourselv will hear accus accus freeli speak high stomach are they both full ire rage deaf as sea hasti as fire enter bolingbrok mowbray bolingbrok mani year happi day befal my graciou sovereign my most love lieg mowbray each day still better other s happi heaven envi earth s good hap add immort titl your crown king richard we thank you both yet one but flatter us as well appeareth caus you come name appeal each other high treason cousin hereford what dost thou object against duke norfolk thoma mowbray bolingbrok first heaven be record my speech devot subject s love tend ring preciou safeti my princ free other misbegotten hate come i appel thi princ presenc now thoma mowbray do i turn thee mark my greet well what i speak my bodi shall make good thi earth or my divin soul answer it heaven thou art traitor miscreant too good be so too bad live more fair crystal is sky uglier seem cloud that it fli onc more more aggrav note foul traitor s name stuff i thi throat wish so pleas my sovereign ere i move what my tongu speak my right drawn sword may prove mowbray let not my cold word here accus my zeal ti not trial woman s war bitter clamour two eager tongu can arbitr thi caus betwixt us twain blood is hot that must be cool thi yet can i not such tame patienc boast as be hush naught all say first fair rever your high curb me give rein spur my free speech which els would post it had return these term treason doubl down hi throat set asid hi high blood s royalti let him be no kinsman my lieg i do defi him i spit him call him slander coward villain which maintain i would allow him odd meet him were i tie run afoot even frozen ridg alp or ani other ground inhabit wherev englishman durst set hi foot meantim let thi defend my loyalti all my hope most fals doth he lie bolingbrok pale trembl coward there i throw my gage disclaim here kindr king lay asid my high blood s royalti which fear not rever make thee if guilti dread have left thee so much strength as take mine honour s pawn then stoop that all rite knighthood els will i make good against thee arm arm what i have spoke or thou canst worst devis mowbray i take it that sword i swear which gentli laid my knighthood my shoulder i ll answer thee ani fair degre or chivalr design knightli trial when i mount aliv may i not light if i be traitor or unjustli fight king richard what doth our cousin lay mowbray s charg it must be great that can inherit us so much as thought ill him bolingbrok look what i speak my life shall prove it true that mowbray hath receiv eight thousand nobl name lend your high soldier which he hath detain lewd employ like fals traitor injuri villain besid i say will battl prove or here or elsewher furthest verg that ever wa survey english eye that all treason these eighteen year complot contriv thi land fetch fals mowbray their first head spring further i say further will maintain hi bad life make all thi good that he did plot duke gloucest s death suggest hi soon believ adversari consequ like traitor coward sluic hi innoc soul stream blood which blood like sacrif abel s cri even tongueless cavern earth me justic rough chastis gloriou worth my descent thi arm shall do it or thi life be spent king richard how high pitch hi resolut soar thoma norfolk what sayst thou thi mowbray o let my sovereign turn away hi face bid hi ear littl while be deaf till i have told thi slander hi blood how god good men hate so foul liar king richard mowbray imparti are our eye ear were he my brother nay my kingdom s heir as he is but my father s brother s son now my sceptr s awe i make vow such neighbour near our sacr blood should noth privileg him nor partial unstoop firm my upright soul he is our subject mowbray so art thou free speech fearless i thee allow mowbray then bolingbrok as low as thi heart fals passag thi throat thou liest three part that receipt i had calai disburs i duli hi high soldier other part reserv i consent that my sovereign lieg wa my debt remaind dear account last i went franc fetch hi queen now swallow down that lie gloucest s death i slew him not but my own disgrac neglect my sworn duti that case you my nobl lord lancast honour father my foe onc did i lay ambush your life trespass that doth vex my griev soul but ere i last receiv sacrament i did confess it exactli beg your grace s pardon i hope i had it thi is my fault as rest appeal it issu rancour villain recreant most degener traitor which myself i boldli will defend interchang hurl down my gage thi overween traitor s foot prove myself loyal gentleman even best blood chamber hi bosom hast whereof most heartili i pray your high assign our trial day king richard wrath kindl gentlemen be rule me let s purg thi choler let blood thi we prescrib though no physician deep malic make too deep incis forget forgiv conclud be agre our doctor say thi is no month bleed good uncl let thi end where it begun we ll calm duke norfolk you your son gaunt be make peac shall becom my age throw down my son duke norfolk s gage king richard norfolk throw down hi gaunt when harri when obedi bid i should not bid again king richard norfolk throw down we bid there is no boot mowbray myself i throw dread sovereign thi foot my life thou shalt command but not my shame one my duti owe but my fair name despit death that live my grave dark dishonour s use thou shalt not have i am disgrac impeach baffl here pierc soul slander s venom spear which no balm can cure but hi heart blood which breath thi poison king richard rage must be withstood give me hi gage lion make leopard tame mowbray yea but not chang hi spot take but my shame i resign my gage my dear dear lord purest treasur mortal time afford is spotless reput that away men are but gild loam or paint clay jewel ten time bar chest is bold spirit loyal breast mine honour is my life both grow one take honour me my life is done then dear my lieg mine honour let me tri that i live that will i die king richard cousin throw your gage do you begin bolingbrok o god defend my soul such deep sin shall i seem crest fallen my father s sight or pale beggar fear impeach my height thi outdar dastard ere my tongu shall wound my honour such feebl wrong or sound so base parl my teeth shall tear slavish motiv recant fear spit it bleed hi high disgrac where shame doth harbour even mowbray s face _exit gaunt _ king richard we were not born sue but command which we cannot do make you friend be readi as your live shall answer it coventri saint lambert s day there shall your sword lanc arbitr swell differ your settl hate we cannot aton you we shall see justic design victor s chivalri lord marshal command our offic arm be readi direct these home alarm _exeunt _ scene ii same room duke lancast s palac enter john gaunt duchess gloucest gaunt ala part i had woodstock s blood doth more solicit me than your exclaim stir against butcher hi life but correct lieth those hand which made fault that we cannot correct put we our quarrel will heaven who when they see hour ripe earth will rain hot vengeanc offend head duchess find brotherhood thee no sharper spur hath love thi old blood no live fire edward s seven son whereof thyself art one were as seven vial hi sacr blood or seven fair branch spring one root some those seven are dri natur s cours some those branch destini cut but thoma my dear lord my life my gloucest one vial full edward s sacr blood one flourish branch hi most royal root is crack all preciou liquor spilt is hack down hi summer leav all fade envi s hand murder s bloodi axe ah gaunt hi blood wa thine that bed that womb that metal that self mould that fashion thee made him man though thou livest breathest yet art thou slain him thou dost consent some larg measur thi father s death that thou seest thi wretch brother die who wa model thi father s life call it not patienc gaunt it is despair suff ring thu thi brother be slaughter thou showest nake pathway thi life teach stern murder how butcher thee that which mean men we entitl patienc is pale cold cowardic nobl breast what shall i say safeguard thine own life best way is veng my gloucest s death gaunt god s is quarrel god s substitut hi deputi anoint hi sight hath caus hi death which if wrong let heaven reveng i may never lift angri arm against hi minist duchess where then ala may i complain myself gaunt god widow s champion defenc duchess whi then i will farewel old gaunt thou goest coventri there behold our cousin hereford fell mowbray fight o sit my husband s wrong hereford s spear that it may enter butcher mowbray s breast or if misfortun miss first career be mowbray s sin so heavi hi bosom that they may break hi foam courser s back throw rider headlong list caitiff recreant my cousin hereford farewel old gaunt thi sometim brother s wife her companion grief must end her life gaunt sister farewel i must coventri as much good stay thee as go me duchess yet one word more grief boundeth where it fall not empti hollow but weight i take my leav i have begun sorrow end not when it seemeth done commend me thi brother edmund york lo thi is all nay yet depart not so though thi be all do not so quickli go i shall rememb more bid him ah what all good speed plashi visit me alack what shall good old york there see but empti lodg unfurnish wall unpeopl offic untrodden stone what hear there welcom but my groan therefor commend me let him not come there seek sorrow that dwell everywher desol desol will i henc die last leav thee take my weep eye _exeunt _ scene iii open space near coventri list set throne herald c attend enter lord marshal duke aumerl marshal my lord aumerl is harri hereford arm aumerl yea all point long enter marshal duke norfolk spright bold vow long weari pilgrimag then let us take ceremoni leav love farewel our sever friend marshal appel all duti greet your high crave kiss your hand take hi leav king richard _descend hi throne_ we will descend fold him our arm cousin hereford as thi caus is right so be thi fortun thi royal fight farewel my blood which if today thou shed lament we may but not reveng thee dead bolingbrok o let no nobl eye profan tear me if i be gore mowbray s spear as confid as is falcon s flight against bird do i mowbray fight my love lord i take my leav you you my nobl cousin lord aumerl not sick although i have do death but lusti young cheerli draw breath lo as english feast so i regreet daintiest last make end most sweet o thou earthli author my blood whose youth spirit me regener doth twofold vigour lift me reach victori my head add proof unto mine armour thi prayer thi bless steel my lanc s point that it may enter mowbray s waxen coat furbish new name john o gaunt even lusti haviour hi son gaunt god thi good caus make thee prosper be swift like lightn execut let thi blow doubli redoubl fall like amaz thunder casqu thi advers pernici enemi rous thi youth blood be valiant live bolingbrok mine innoc saint georg thrive _he take hi seat _ mowbray _rising_ howev god or fortun cast my lot there live or die true king richard s throne loyal just upright gentleman never did captiv freer heart cast off hi chain bondag embrac hi golden uncontrol enfranchis more than my danc soul doth celebr thi feast battl mine adversari most mighti lieg my companion peer take my mouth wish happi year as gentl as jocund as jest go i fight truth hath quiet breast king richard farewel my lord secur i espi virtu valour couch thine eye order trial marshal begin _the king lord return their seat _ marshal harri hereford lancast derbi receiv thi lanc god defend right bolingbrok _rising_ strong as tower hope i cri amen marshal _to officer_ go bear thi lanc thoma duke norfolk first herald harri hereford lancast derbi stand here god hi sovereign himself pain be found fals recreant prove duke norfolk thoma mowbray traitor hi god hi king him dare him set forward fight second herald here standeth thoma mowbray duke norfolk pain be found fals recreant both defend himself approv henri hereford lancast derbi god hi sovereign him disloy courag free desir attend but signal begin marshal sound trumpet set forward combat _a charg sound _ stay king hath thrown hi warder down king richard let them lay their helmet their spear both return back their chair again withdraw us let trumpet sound while we return these duke what we decre _a long flourish _ _to combatants_ draw near list what our council we have done that our kingdom s earth should not be soil that dear blood which it hath foster our eye do hate dire aspect civil wound plough neighbour sword we think eagl wing pride sky aspir ambiti thought rival hate envi set you wake our peac which our countri s cradl draw sweet infant breath gentl sleep which so rous boist rou untun drum harsh resound trumpet dread bray grate shock wrath iron arm might our quiet confin fright fair peac make us wade even our kindr s blood therefor we banish you our territori you cousin hereford pain life till twice five summer have enrich our field shall not regreet our fair dominion but tread stranger path banish bolingbrok your will be done thi must my comfort be that sun that warm you here shall shine me those hi golden beam you here lent shall point me gild my banish king richard norfolk thee remain heavier doom which i some unwilling pronounc sli slow hour shall not determin dateless limit thi dear exil hopeless word never return breath i against thee pain life mowbray heavi sentenc my most sovereign lieg all unlook your high mouth dearer merit not so deep maim as be cast forth common air have i deserv your high hand languag i have learnt these forti year my nativ english now i must forgo now my tongu s use is me no more than unstring viol or harp or like cun instrument case or be open put hi hand that know no touch tune harmoni my mouth you have engaol my tongu doubli portcullis my teeth lip dull unfeel barren ignor is made my gaoler attend me i am too old fawn nurs too far year be pupil now what is thi sentenc then but speechless death which rob my tongu breath nativ breath king richard it boot thee not be compassion our sentenc plain come too late mowbray then thu i turn me my countri s light dwell solemn shade endless night _retir _ king richard return again take oath thee lay our royal sword your banish hand swear duti that you owe god our part therein we banish yourselv keep oath that we administ you never shall so help you truth god embrac each other s love banish nor never look each other s face nor never write regreet nor reconcil thi lour tempest your home bred hate nor never advis purpos meet plot contriv or complot ani ill gainst us our state our subject or our land bolingbrok i swear mowbray i keep all thi bolingbrok norfolk so far as mine enemi thi time had king permit us one our soul had wander air banish thi frail sepulchr our flesh as now our flesh is banish thi land confess thi treason ere thou fli realm thou hast far go bear not clog burden guilti soul mowbray no bolingbrok if ever i were traitor my name be blot book life i heaven banish as henc but what thou art god thou i do know all too soon i fear king shall rue farewel my lieg now no way can i stray save back england all world s my way _exit _ king richard uncl even glass thine eye i see thi griev heart thi sad aspect hath number hi banish year pluck four away _to bolingbroke_ six frozen winter spent return welcom home banish bolingbrok how long time lie one littl word four lag winter four wanton spring end word such is breath king gaunt i thank my lieg that regard me he shorten four year my son s exil but littl vantag shall i reap therebi ere six year that he hath spend can chang their moon bring their time my oil dri lamp time bewast light shall be extinct age endless night my inch taper will be burnt done blindfold death not let me see my son king richard whi uncl thou hast mani year live gaunt but not minut king that thou canst give shorten my day thou canst sullen sorrow pluck night me but not lend morrow thou canst help time furrow me age but stop no wrinkl hi pilgrimag thi word is current him my death but dead thi kingdom cannot buy my breath king richard thi son is banish good advic whereto thi tongu parti verdict gave whi our justic seem st thou then lour gaunt thing sweet tast prove digest sour you urg me as judg but i had rather you would have bid me argu like father o had it been stranger not my child smooth hi fault i should have been more mild partial slander sought i avoid sentenc my own life destroy ala i look when some you should say i wa too strict make mine own away but you gave leav my unwil tongu against my will do myself thi wrong king richard cousin farewel uncl bid him so six year we banish him he shall go _flourish exit king richard train _ aumerl cousin farewel what presenc must not know where you do remain let paper show marshal my lord no leav take i i will ride as far as land will let me your side gaunt o what purpos dost thou hoard thi word that thou return st no greet thi friend bolingbrok i have too few take my leav you when tongu s offic should be prodig breath abund dolour heart gaunt thi grief is but thi absenc time bolingbrok joy absent grief is present that time gaunt what is six winter they are quickli gone bolingbrok men joy but grief make one hour ten gaunt call it travel that thou tak st pleasur bolingbrok my heart will sigh when i miscal it so which find it enforc pilgrimag gaunt sullen passag thi weari step esteem as foil wherein thou art set preciou jewel thi home return bolingbrok nay rather everi tediou stride i make will but rememb me what deal world i wander jewel that i love must i not serv long apprenticehood foreign passag end have my freedom boast noth els but that i wa journeyman grief gaunt all place that eye heaven visit are wise man port happi haven teach thi necess reason thu there is no virtu like necess think not king did banish thee but thou king woe doth heavier sit where it perceiv it is but faintli born go say i sent thee forth purchas honour not king exil thee or suppos devour pestil hang our air thou art fli fresher clime look what thi soul hold dear imagin it lie that way thou goest not whenc thou com st suppos sing bird musician grass whereon thou tread st presenc strew flower fair ladi thi step no more than delight measur or danc gnarl sorrow hath less power bite man that mock it set it light bolingbrok o who can hold fire hi hand think frosti caucasu or cloy hungri edg appetit bare imagin feast or wallow nake decemb snow think fantast summer s heat o no apprehens good give but greater feel wors fell sorrow s tooth doth never rankl more than when it bite but lanceth not sore gaunt come come my son i ll bring thee thi way had i thi youth caus i would not stay bolingbrok then england s ground farewel sweet soil adieu my mother my nurs that bear me yet where er i wander boast thi i can though banish yet true born englishman _exeunt _ scene iv london room king s castl enter king richard green bagot one door aumerl anoth king richard we did observ cousin aumerl how far brought you high hereford hi way aumerl i brought high hereford if you call him so but next highway there i left him king richard say what store part tear were shed aumerl faith none me northeast wind which then blew bitterli against our face awak sleep rheum so chanc did grace our hollow part tear king richard what said our cousin when you part him aumerl farewel my heart disdain that my tongu should so profan word that taught me craft counterfeit oppress such grief that word seem buri my sorrow s grave marri would word farewel have lengthen hour ad year hi short banish he should have had volum farewel but it would not he had none me king richard he is our cousin cousin but ti doubt when time shall call him home banish our kinsman come see hi friend ourself bushi bagot here green observ hi courtship common peopl how he did seem dive their heart humbl familiar courtesi what rever he did throw away slave woo poor craftsmen craft smile patient underbear hi fortun as twere banish their affect him off goe hi bonnet oyster wench brace draymen bid god speed him well had tribut hi suppl knee thank my countrymen my love friend as were our england revers hi he our subject next degre hope green well he is gone him go these thought now rebel which stand ireland expedi manag must be made my lieg ere further leisur yield them further mean their advantag your high loss king richard we will ourself person thi war our coffer too great court liber largess are grown somewhat light we are enforc farm our royal realm revenu whereof shall furnish us our affair hand if that come short our substitut home shall have blank charter whereto when they shall know what men are rich they shall subscrib them larg sum gold send them suppli our want we will make ireland present enter bushi bushi what news bushi old john gaunt is grievou sick my lord suddenli taken hath sent post hast entreat your majesti visit him king richard where lie he bushi eli hous king richard now put it god hi physician s mind help him hi grave immedi line hi coffer shall make coat deck our soldier these irish war come gentlemen let s all go visit him pray god we may make hast come too late all amen _exeunt _ act ii scene i london apart eli hous gaunt couch duke york other stand him gaunt will king come that i may breath my last wholesom counsel hi unstaid youth york vex not yourself nor strive not your breath all vain come counsel hi ear gaunt o but they say tongu die men enforc attent like deep harmoni where word are scarc they are seldom spent vain they breath truth that breath their word pain he that no more must say is listen more than they whom youth eas have taught glose more are men s end mark than their live set sun music close as last tast sweet is sweetest last writ remembr more than thing long past though richard my life s counsel would not hear my death s sad tale may yet undeaf hi ear york no it is stop other flatter sound as prais whose state wise are fond lascivi metr whose venom sound open ear youth doth alway listen report fashion proud itali whose manner still our tardi apish nation limp base imit where doth world thrust forth vaniti so it be new there s no respect how vile that is not quickli buzz hi ear then all too late come counsel be heard where will doth mutini wit s regard direct not him whose way himself will choos ti breath thou lack st that breath wilt thou lose gaunt methink i am prophet new inspir thu expir do foretel him hi rash fierc blaze riot cannot last violent fire soon burn themselv small shower last long but sudden storm are short he tire betim that spur too fast betim eager feed food doth choke feeder light vaniti insati cormor consum mean soon prey itself thi royal throne king thi scepter isl thi earth majesti thi seat mar thi other eden demi paradis thi fortress built natur herself against infect hand war thi happi breed men thi littl world thi preciou stone set silver sea which serv it offic wall or as moat defens hous against envi less happier land thi bless plot thi earth thi realm thi england thi nurs thi teem womb royal king fear their breed famou their birth renown their deed as far home christian servic true chivalri as is sepulchr stubborn jewri world s ransom bless mari s son thi land such dear soul thi dear dear land dear her reput world is now leas i die pronounc it like tenement or pelt farm england bound triumphant sea whose rocki shore beat back enviou sieg wat ry neptun is now bound shame inki blot rotten parchment bond that england that wa wont conquer other hath made shame conquest itself ah would scandal vanish my life how happi then were my ensu death enter king richard queen aumerl bushi green bagot ross willoughbi york king is come deal mildli hi youth young hot colt be rage do rage more queen how fare our nobl uncl lancast king richard what comfort man how is t age gaunt gaunt o how that name befit my composit old gaunt inde gaunt be old me grief hath kept tediou fast who abstain meat that is not gaunt sleep england long time have i watch watch breed lean lean is all gaunt pleasur that some father feed is my strict fast i mean my children s look therein fast hast thou made me gaunt gaunt am i grave gaunt as grave whose hollow womb inherit nought but bone king richard can sick men play so nice their name gaunt no miseri make sport mock itself thou dost seek kill my name me i mock my name great king flatter thee king richard should die men flatter those that live gaunt no no men live flatter those that die king richard thou now die sayest thou flatterest me gaunt o no thou diest though i sicker be king richard i am health i breath see thee ill gaunt now he that made me know i see thee ill ill myself see thee see ill thi death bed is no lesser than thi land wherein thou liest reput sick thou too careless patient as thou art committ st thi anoint bodi cure those physician that first wound thee thousand flatter sit thi crown whose compass is no bigger than thi head yet encag so small verg wast is no whit lesser than thi land o had thi grandsir prophet s eye seen how hi son s son should destroy hi son forth thi reach he would have laid thi shame depos thee thou wert possess which art possess now depos thyself whi cousin wert thou regent world it were shame let thi land leas but thi world enjoy but thi land is it not more than shame shame it so landlord england art thou now not king thi state law is bondslav law thou king richard lunat lean wit fool presum agu s privileg darest thi frozen admonit make pale our cheek chase royal blood furi hi nativ resid now my seat s right royal majesti wert thou not brother great edward s son thi tongu that run so roundli thi head should run thi head thi unrever shoulder gaunt o spare me not my brother edward s son that i wa hi father edward s son that blood alreadi like pelican hast thou tap drunkenli carous my brother gloucest plain well mean soul whom fair befal heaven mongst happi soul may be preced wit good that thou respect st not spill edward s blood join present sick that i have thi unkind be like crook age crop onc too long wither flower live thi shame but die not shame thee these word hereaft thi tormentor be convey me my bed then my grave love they live that love honour have _exit born off hi attend _ king richard let them die that age sullen have both hast thou both becom grave york i do beseech your majesti imput hi word wayward sickli age him he love you my life hold you dear as harri duke hereford were he here king richard right you say true as hereford s love so hi as their so mine all be as it is enter northumberland northumberland my lieg old gaunt commend him your majesti king richard what say he northumberland nay noth all is said hi tongu is now stringless instrument word life all old lancast hath spent york be york next that must be bankrupt so though death be poor it end mortal woe king richard ripest fruit first fall so doth he hi time is spent our pilgrimag must be so much that now our irish war we must supplant those rough rug head kern which live like venom where no venom els but onli they have privileg live these great affair do ask some charg our assist we do seiz us plate coin revenu moveabl whereof our uncl gaunt did stand possess york how long shall i be patient ah how long shall tender duti make me suffer wrong not gloucest s death nor hereford s banish nor gaunt s rebuk nor england s privat wrong nor prevent poor bolingbrok hi marriag nor my own disgrac have ever made me sour my patient cheek or bend one wrinkl my sovereign s face i am last nobl edward s son whom thi father princ wale wa first war wa never lion rage more fierc peac wa never gentl lamb more mild than wa that young princ gentleman hi face thou hast even so look he accomplish number thi hour but when he frown it wa against french not against hi friend hi nobl hand did win what he did spend spent not that which hi triumphant father s hand had won hi hand were guilti no kindr s blood but bloodi enemi hi kin o richard york is too far gone grief or els he never would compar king richard whi uncl what s matter york o my lieg pardon me if you pleas if not i pleas not be pardon am content withal seek you seiz gripe your hand royalti right banish hereford is not gaunt dead doth not hereford live wa not gaunt just is not harri true did not one deserv have heir is not hi heir well deserv son take hereford s right away take time hi charter hi customari right let not tomorrow then ensu today be not thyself how art thou king but fair sequenc success now afor god god forbid i say true if you do wrong seiz hereford s right call letter patent that he hath hi attorney gener sue hi liveri deni hi offer homag you pluck thousand danger your head you lose thousand well dispos heart prick my tender patienc those thought which honour allegi cannot think king richard think what you will we seiz our hand hi plate hi good hi money hi land york i ll not be while my lieg farewel what will ensu hereof there s none can tell but bad cours may be understood that their event can never fall good _exit _ king richard go bushi earl wiltshir straight bid him repair us eli hous see thi busi tomorrow next we will ireland ti time i trow we creat absenc ourself our uncl york lord governor england he is just alway love us well come our queen tomorrow must we part be merri our time stay is short _exeunt king queen bushi aumerl green bagot _ northumberland well lord duke lancast is dead ross live too now hi son is duke willoughbi bare titl not revenu northumberland richli both if justic had her right ross my heart is great but it must break silenc ere t be disburden liber tongu northumberland nay speak thi mind let him ne er speak more that speak thi word again do thee harm willoughbi tend that thou wouldst speak duke hereford if it be so it boldli man quick is mine ear hear good him ross no good all that i can do him unless you call it good piti him bereft geld hi patrimoni northumberland now afor god ti shame such wrong are born him royal princ mani moe nobl blood thi declin land king is not himself but base led flatter what they will inform mere hate gainst ani us all that will king sever prosecut gainst us our live our children our heir ross common hath he pill grievou tax quit lost their heart nobl hath he fine ancient quarrel quit lost their heart willoughbi daili new exact are devis as blank benevol i wot not what but what i god s name doth becom thi northumberland war hath not wast it war he hath not but base yield compromis that which hi ancestor achiev blow more hath he spent peac than they war ross earl wiltshir hath realm farm willoughbi king s grown bankrupt like broken man northumberland reproach dissolut hangeth him ross he hath not money these irish war hi burden taxat notwithstand but rob banish duke northumberland hi nobl kinsman most degener king but lord we hear thi fear tempest sing yet seek no shelter avoid storm we see wind sit sore our sail yet we strike not but secur perish ross we see veri wrack that we must suffer unavoid is danger now suffer so caus our wrack northumberland not so even hollow eye death i spi life peer but i dare not say how near tide our comfort is willoughbi nay let us share thi thought as thou dost our ross be confid speak northumberland we three are but thyself speak so thi word are but as thought therefor be bold northumberland then thu i have le port blanc bay brittani receiv intellig that harri duke hereford rainold lord cobham that late broke duke exet hi brother archbishop late canterburi sir thoma erpingham sir john ramston sir john norberi sir robert waterton franci coint all these well furnish duke brittani eight tall ship three thousand men war are make hither all due expedi shortli mean touch our northern shore perhap they had ere thi but that they stay first depart king ireland if then we shall shake off our slavish yoke imp our droop countri s broken wing redeem broke pawn blemish crown wipe off dust that hide our sceptr s gilt make high majesti look like itself away me post ravenspurgh but if you faint as fear do so stay be secret myself will go ross hors hors urg doubt them that fear willoughbi hold my hors i will first be there _exeunt _ scene ii same room castl enter queen bushi bagot bushi madam your majesti is too much sad you promis when you part king lay asid life harm heavi entertain cheer disposit queen pleas king i did pleas myself i cannot do it yet i know no caus whi i should welcom such guest as grief save bid farewel so sweet guest as my sweet richard yet again methink some unborn sorrow ripe fortun s womb is come me my inward soul noth trembl someth it griev more than part my lord king bushi each substanc grief hath twenti shadow which show like grief itself but is not so sorrow s eye glaze blind tear divid one thing entir mani object like perspect which rightli gaze show noth but confus eye awri distinguish form so your sweet majesti look awri your lord s departur find shape grief more than himself wail which look as it is is naught but shadow what it is not then thrice graciou queen more than your lord s departur weep not more is not seen or if it be ti fals sorrow s eye which thing true weep thing imaginari queen it may be so but yet my inward soul persuad me it is otherwis howe er it be i cannot but be sad so heavi sad as thought think no thought i think make me heavi noth faint shrink bushi ti noth but conceit my graciou ladi queen ti noth less conceit is still deriv some forefath grief mine is not so noth hath begot my someth grief or someth hath noth that i griev ti revers that i do possess but what it is that is not yet known what i cannot name ti nameless woe i wot enter green green god save your majesti well met gentlemen i hope king is not yet ship ireland queen whi hop st thou so ti better hope he is hi design crave hast hi hast good hope then wherefor dost thou hope he is not ship green that he our hope might have retir hi power driven despair enemi s hope who strongli hath set foot thi land banish bolingbrok repeal himself uplift arm is safe arriv ravenspurgh queen now god heaven forbid green ah madam ti too true that is wors lord northumberland hi son young harri perci lord ross beaumond willoughbi all their power friend are fled him bushi whi have you not proclaim northumberland all rest revolt faction traitor green we have whereupon earl worcest hath broken hi staff resign hi stewardship all household servant fled him bolingbrok queen so green thou art midwif my woe bolingbrok my sorrow s dismal heir now hath my soul brought forth her prodigi i gasp new deliv mother have woe woe sorrow sorrow join bushi despair not madam queen who shall hinder me i will despair be enmiti cozen hope he is flatter parasit keeper back death who gentli would dissolv band life which fals hope linger extrem enter york green here come duke york queen sign war hi age neck o full care busi are hi look uncl god s sake speak comfort word york should i do so i should beli my thought comfort s heaven we are earth where noth live but cross care grief your husband he is gone save far off whilst other come make him lose home here am i left underprop hi land who weak age cannot support myself now come sick hour that hi surfeit made now shall he tri hi friend that flatter him enter servingman servingman my lord your son wa gone i came york he wa whi so go all which way it will nobl they are fled common they are cold will i fear revolt hereford s side sirrah get thee plashi my sister gloucest bid her send me present thousand pound hold take my ring servingman my lord i had forgot tell your lordship today as i came i call there but i shall griev you report rest york what is t knave servingman hour i came duchess die york god hi merci what tide woe come rush thi woeful land onc i know not what do i would god so my untruth had not provok him it king had cut off my head my brother s what are there no post dispatch ireland how shall we do money these war come sister cousin i would say pray pardon me go fellow get thee home provid some cart bring away armour that is there _exit servingman _ gentlemen will you go muster men if i know how or which way order these affair thu disorderli thrust my hand never believ me both are my kinsmen th one is my sovereign whom both my oath duti bid defend th other again is my kinsman whom king hath wrong whom conscienc my kindr bid right well somewhat we must do come cousin i ll dispos you gentlemen go muster your men meet me present berkeley castl i should plashi too but time will not permit all is uneven everyth is left six seven _exeunt york queen _ bushi wind sit fair news go ireland but none return us levi power proportion enemi is all unposs green besid our near king love is near hate those love not king bagot that is waver common their love
