northumberland forc bolingbrok how far is it my lord berkeley now northumberland believ me nobl lord i am stranger here gloucestershir these high wild hill rough uneven way draw our mile make them wearisom yet your fair discours hath been as sugar make hard way sweet delect but i bethink me what weari way ravenspurgh cotshal will be found ross willoughbi want your compani which i protest hath veri much beguil tedious process my travel but their is sweeten hope have present benefit which i possess hope joy is littl less joy than hope enjoy thi weari lord shall make their way seem short as mine hath done sight what i have your nobl compani bolingbrok much less valu is my compani than your good word but who come here enter harri perci northumberland it is my son young harri perci sent my brother worcest whencesoev harri how fare your uncl perci i had thought my lord have learn hi health you northumberland whi is he not queen perci no my good lord he hath forsook court broken hi staff offic dispers household king northumberland what wa hi reason he wa not so resolv when last we spake togeth perci becaus your lordship wa proclaim traitor but he my lord is gone ravenspurgh offer servic duke hereford sent me berkeley discov what power duke york had levi there then direct repair ravenspurgh northumberland have you forgot duke hereford boy perci no my good lord that is not forgot which ne er i did rememb my knowledg i never my life did look him northumberland then learn know him now thi is duke perci my graciou lord i tender you my servic such as it is be tender raw young which elder day shall ripen confirm more approv servic desert bolingbrok i thank thee gentl perci be sure i count myself noth els so happi as soul rememb ring my good friend as my fortun ripen thi love it shall be still thi true love s recompens my heart thi coven make my hand thu seal it northumberland how far is it berkeley what stir keep good old york there hi men war perci there stand castl yon tuft tree man three hundr men as i have heard it are lord york berkeley seymour none els name nobl estim enter ross willoughbi northumberland here come lord ross willoughbi bloodi spur fieri red hast bolingbrok welcom my lord i wot your love pursu banish traitor all my treasuri is yet but unfelt thank which more enrich shall be your love labour s recompens ross your presenc make us rich most nobl lord willoughbi far surmount our labour attain it bolingbrok evermor thank exchequ poor which till my infant fortun come year stand my bounti but who come here enter berkeley northumberland it is my lord berkeley as i guess berkeley my lord hereford my messag is you bolingbrok my lord my answer is lancast i am come seek that name england i must find that titl your tongu i make repli aught you say berkeley mistak me not my lord ti not my mean rase one titl your honour you my lord i come what lord you will most graciou regent thi land duke york know what prick you take advantag absent time fright our nativ peac self born arm enter york attend bolingbrok i shall not need transport my word you here come hi grace person my nobl uncl _kneel _ york show me thi humbl heart not thi knee whose duti is deceiv fals bolingbrok my graciou uncl york tut tut grace me no grace nor uncl me no uncl i am no traitor s uncl that word grace ungraci mouth is but profan whi have those banish forbidden leg dare onc touch dust england s ground but then more whi whi have they dare march so mani mile her peac bosom fright her pale face villag war ostent despis arm com st thou becaus anoint king is henc whi foolish boy king is left behind my loyal bosom lie hi power were i but now lord such hot youth as when brave gaunt thi father myself rescu black princ that young mar men forth rank mani thousand french o then how quickli should thi arm mine now prison palsi chastis thee minist correct thi fault bolingbrok my graciou uncl let me know my fault what condit stand it wherein york even condit worst degre gross rebellion detest treason thou art banish man here art come expir thi time brave arm against thi sovereign bolingbrok as i wa banish i wa banish hereford but as i come i come lancast nobl uncl i beseech your grace look my wrong indiffer eye you are my father methink you i see old gaunt aliv o then my father will you permit that i shall stand condemn wander vagabond my right royalti pluck my arm perforc given away upstart unthrift wherefor wa i born if that my cousin king be king england it must be grant i am duke lancast you have son aumerl my nobl cousin had you first die he been thu trod down he should have found hi uncl gaunt father rous hi wrong chase them bay i am deni sue my liveri here yet my letter patent give me leav my father s good are all distrain sold these all are all amiss employ what would you have me do i am subject challeng law attorney are deni me therefor person i lay my claim my inherit free descent northumberland nobl duke hath been too much abus ross it stand your grace do him right willoughbi base men hi endow are made great york my lord england let me tell you thi i have had feel my cousin s wrong labour all i could do him right but thi kind come brave arm be hi own carver cut hi way find right wrong it may not be you that do abet him thi kind cherish rebellion are rebel all northumberland nobl duke hath sworn hi come is but hi own right that we all have strongli sworn give him aid let him never see joy that break that oath york well well i see issu these arm i cannot mend it i must need confess becaus my power is weak all ill left but if i could him that gave me life i would attach you all make you stoop unto sovereign merci king but i cannot be it known unto you i do remain as neuter so fare you well unless you pleas enter castl there repos you thi night bolingbrok offer uncl that we will accept but we must win your grace go us bristol castl which they say is held bushi bagot their complic caterpillar commonwealth which i have sworn weed pluck away york it may be i will go you but yet i ll paus i am loath break our countri s law nor friend nor foe me welcom you are thing past redress are now me past care _exeunt _ scene iv camp wale enter earl salisburi welsh captain captain my lord salisburi we have stay ten day hardli kept our countrymen togeth yet we hear no tide king therefor we will dispers ourselv farewel salisburi stay yet anoth day thou trusti welshman king reposeth all hi confid thee captain ti thought king is dead we will not stay bay tree our countri are all wither meteor fright fix star heaven pale face moon look bloodi earth lean look prophet whisper fear chang rich men look sad ruffian danc leap one fear lose what they enjoy other enjoy rage war these sign forerun death or fall king farewel our countrymen are gone fled as well assur richard their king is dead _exit _ salisburi ah richard eye heavi mind i see thi glori like shoot star fall base earth firmament thi sun set weep lowli west wit storm come woe unrest thi friend are fled wait thi foe crossli thi good all fortun goe _exit _ act iii scene i bristol bolingbrok s camp enter bolingbrok york northumberland harri perci willoughbi ross offic behind bushi green prison bolingbrok bring forth these men bushi green i will not vex your soul present your soul must part your bodi too much urg your pernici live twere no chariti yet wash your blood off my hand here view men i will unfold some caus your death you have misl princ royal king happi gentleman blood lineament you unhappi disfigur clean you have manner your sin hour made divorc betwixt hi queen him broke possess royal bed stain beauti fair queen s cheek tear drawn her eye your foul wrong myself princ fortun my birth near king blood near love till you did make him misinterpret me have stoop my neck your injuri sigh my english breath foreign cloud eat bitter bread banish whilst you have fed my signori dispark my park fell my forest wood my own window torn my household coat rase my impres leav me no sign save men s opinion my live blood show world i am gentleman thi much more much more than twice all thi condemn you death see them deliv execut hand death bushi more welcom is stroke death me than bolingbrok england lord farewel green my comfort is that heaven will take our soul plagu injustic pain hell bolingbrok my lord northumberland see them dispatch _exeunt northumberland other bushi green _ uncl you say queen is your hous god s sake fairli let her be entreat tell her i send her my kind commend take special care my greet be deliv york gentleman mine i have dispatch letter your love her larg bolingbrok thank gentl uncl come lord away fight glendow hi complic while work holiday _exeunt _ scene ii coast wale castl view flourish drum trumpet enter king richard bishop carlisl aumerl soldier king richard barkloughli castl call they thi hand aumerl yea my lord how brook your grace air your late toss break sea king richard need must i like it well i weep joy stand my kingdom onc again dear earth i do salut thee my hand though rebel wound thee their hors hoof as long part mother her child play fondli her tear smile meet so weep smile greet i thee my earth do thee favour my royal hand feed not thi sovereign s foe my gentl earth nor thi sweet comfort hi raven sens but let thi spider that suck thi venom heavi gait toad lie their way do annoy treacher feet which usurp step do trampl thee yield sting nettl mine enemi when they thi bosom pluck flower guard it i pray thee lurk adder whose doubl tongu may mortal touch throw death thi sovereign s enemi mock not my senseless conjur lord thi earth shall have feel these stone prove arm soldier ere her nativ king shall falter foul rebellion s arm carlisl fear not my lord that power that made you king hath power keep you king spite all mean that heaven yield must be embrac not neglect els if heaven would we will not heaven s offer we refus proffer mean succour redress aumerl he mean my lord that we are too remiss whilst bolingbrok our secur grow strong great substanc power king richard discomfort cousin know st thou not that when search eye heaven is hid behind globe that light lower world then thiev robber rang abroad unseen murder outrag boldli here but when thi terrestri ball he fire proud top eastern pine dart hi light everi guilti hole then murder treason detest sin cloak night be pluck off their back stand bare nake trembl themselv so when thi thief thi traitor bolingbrok who all thi while hath revel night whilst we were wand ring antipod shall see us rise our throne east hi treason will sit blush hi face not abl endur sight day but self affright trembl hi sin not all water rough rude sea can wash balm off anoint king breath worldli men cannot depos deputi elect lord everi man that bolingbrok hath press lift shrewd steel against our golden crown god hi richard hath heavenli pay gloriou angel then if angel fight weak men must fall heaven still guard right enter salisburi welcom my lord how far off lie your power salisburi nor near nor farther off my graciou lord than thi weak arm discomfort guid my tongu bid me speak noth but despair one day too late i fear me nobl lord hath cloud all thi happi day earth o call back yesterday bid time return thou shalt have twelv thousand fight men today today unhappi day too late o erthrow thi joy friend fortun thi state all welshmen hear thou wert dead are gone bolingbrok dispers fled aumerl comfort my lieg whi look your grace so pale king richard but now blood twenti thousand men did triumph my face they are fled till so much blood thither come again have i not reason look pale dead all soul that will be safe fli my side time hath set blot my pride aumerl comfort my lieg rememb who you are king richard i had forgot myself am i not king awak thou coward majesti thou sleepest is not king s name twenti thousand name arm arm my name puni subject strike thi great glori look not ground ye favourit king are we not high high be our thought i know my uncl york hath power enough serv our turn but who come here enter sir stephen scroop scroop more health happi betid my lieg than can my care tune tongu deliv him king richard mine ear is open my heart prepar worst is worldli loss thou canst unfold say is my kingdom lost whi twa my care what loss is it be rid care strive bolingbrok be as great as we greater he shall not be if he serv god we ll serv him too be hi fellow so revolt our subject that we cannot mend they break their faith god as well as us cri woe destruct ruin loss decay worst is death death will have hi day scroop glad am i that your high is so arm bear tide calam like unseason stormi day which make silver river drown their shore as if world were all dissolv tear so high hi limit swell rage bolingbrok cover your fear land hard bright steel heart harder than steel whitebeard have arm their thin hairless scalp against thi majesti boy women s voic strive speak big clap their femal joint stiff unwieldi arm against thi crown thi veri beadsmen learn bend their bow doubl fatal yew against thi state yea distaff women manag rusti bill against thi seat both young old rebel all goe wors than i have power tell king richard too well too well thou tell st tale so ill where is earl wiltshir where is bagot what is becom bushi where is green that they have let danger enemi measur our confin such peac step if we prevail their head shall pay it i warrant they have made peac bolingbrok scroop peac have they made him inde my lord king richard o villain viper damn redempt dog easili won fawn ani man snake my heart blood warm that sting my heart three judas each one thrice wors than juda would they make peac terribl hell where comfort no man speak let s talk grave worm epitaph make dust our paper raini eye write sorrow bosom earth let s choos executor talk will yet not so what can we bequeath save our depos bodi hi castl wall farewel king cover your head mock not flesh blood solemn rever throw away respect tradit form ceremoni duti you have but mistook me all thi while i live bread like you feel want tast grief need friend subject thu how can you say me i am king carlisl my lord wise men ne er sit wail their woe but present prevent way wail fear foe fear oppresseth strength give your weak strength unto your foe so your folli fight against yourself fear be slain no wors can come fight fight die is death destroy death where fear die pay death servil breath aumerl my father hath power enquir him learn make bodi limb king richard thou chid st me well proud bolingbrok i come chang blow thee our day doom thi agu fit fear is overblown easi task it is win our own say scroop where lie our uncl hi power didst lead me forth that sweet way i wa despair what say you now what comfort have we now heaven i ll hate him everlastingli that bid me be comfort ani more go flint castl there i ll pine away king woe s slave shall kingli woe obey that power i have discharg let them go ear land that hath some hope grow i have none let no man speak again alter thi counsel is but vain aumerl my lieg one word king harm should stain so fair show king richard _to northumberland _ we are amaz thu long have we stood watch fear bend thi knee becaus we thought ourself thi law king if we be how dare thi joint forget though you think that all as you have done have torn their soul turn them us we are barren bereft friend yet know my master god omnipot is muster hi cloud our behalf armi pestil they shall strike your children yet unborn unbegot that lift your vassal hand against my head threat glori my preciou crown tell bolingbrok yon methink he stand that everi stride he make my land is danger treason he is come open purpl testament bleed war but ere crown he look live peac ten thousand bloodi crown mother son shall ill becom flower england s face chang complexion her maid pale peac scarlet indign bedew her majesti thi swear he as he is princ just as i am gentleman i credit him king richard northumberland say thu king return hi nobl cousin is right welcom hither all number hi fair demand shall be rememb me more sorrow or if grief be altogeth had it add more sorrow my want joy what i have i need not repeat what i want it boot not complain ladi madam i ll sing queen ti well that thou hast caus but thou shouldst pleas me better wouldst thou weep ladi i could weep madam would it do you good queen i could sing would weep do me good never borrow ani tear thee but stay here come garden let s apricock which like unruli children make their sire stoop oppress their prodig weight give some support bend twig go thou like execution cut off head too fast grow spray that look too lofti our commonwealth all must be even our govern you thu employ i will go root away noisom weed which profit suck soil s fertil wholesom flower servant whi should we compass pale keep law form due proport show as model our firm estat when our sea wall garden whole land is full weed her fairest flower choke her fruit tree all unprun her hedg ruin her knot disord her wholesom herb swarm caterpillar skin our fruit tree lest be proud sap blood too much rich it confound itself had he done so great grow men they might have live bear he tast their fruit duti superflu branch we lop away that bear bough may live had he done so himself had home crown which wast idl hour hath quit thrown down servant what think you king shall be depos garden depress he is alreadi depos ti doubt he will be letter arrest procur your sureti your day answer littl are we behold your love littl look your help hand enter york king richard offic bear crown c king richard alack whi am i sent king i have shook off regal thought wherewith i reign i hardli yet have learn insinu flatter bow bend my knee give sorrow leav awhil tutor me thi submiss yet i well rememb favour these men were they not mine did they not sometim cri all hail me so juda did christ but he twelv found truth all but one i twelv thousand none god save king will no man say amen am i both priest clerk well then amen god save king although i be not he yet amen if heaven do think him me do what servic am i sent hither york do that offic thine own good will which tire majesti did make thee offer resign thi state crown henri bolingbrok king richard give me crown here cousin seiz crown here cousin thi side my hand that side thine now is thi golden crown like deep well that owe two bucket fill one anoth emptier ever danc air other down unseen full water that bucket down full tear am i drink my grief whilst you mount high bolingbrok i thought you had been will resign king richard my crown i am but still my grief are mine you may my glori my state depos but not my grief still am i king those bolingbrok part your care you give me your crown king richard your care set do not pluck my care down my care is loss care old care done your care is gain care new care won care i give i have though given away they tend crown yet still me they stay bolingbrok are you content resign crown king richard ay no no ay i must noth be therefor no no i resign thee now mark me how i will undo myself i give thi heavi weight off my head thi unwieldi sceptr my hand pride kingli sway my heart mine own tear i wash away my balm mine own hand i give away my crown mine own tongu deni my sacr state mine own breath releas all duteou oath all pomp majesti i do forswear my manor rent revenu i forgo my act decre statut i deni god pardon all oath that are broke me god keep all vow unbrok are made thee make me that noth have noth griev thou all pleas that hast all achiev long mayst thou live richard s seat sit soon lie richard earthli pit god save king henri unking richard say send him mani year sunshin day what more remain northumberland _offer paper_ no more but that you read these accus these grievou crime commit your person your follow against state profit thi land that confess them soul men may deem that you are worthili depos king richard must i do so must i ravel my weav folli gentl northumberland if thi offenc were record would it not shame thee so fair troop read lectur them if thou wouldst there shouldst thou find one heinou articl contain depos king crack strong warrant oath mark blot damn book heaven nay all you that stand look me whilst that my wretched doth bait myself though some you pilat wash your hand show outward piti yet you pilat have here deliv me my sour cross water cannot wash away your sin northumberland my lord dispatch read o er these articl king richard mine eye are full tear i cannot see yet salt water blind them not so much but they can see sort traitor here nay if i turn mine eye myself i find myself traitor rest i have given here my soul s consent t undeck pompou bodi king made glori base sovereignti slave proud majesti subject state peasant northumberland my lord king richard no lord thine thou haught insult man nor no man s lord i have no name no titl no not that name wa given me font but ti usurp alack heavi day that i have worn so mani winter know not now what name call myself o that i were mockeri king snow stand sun bolingbrok melt myself away water drop good king great king yet not greatli good if my word be sterl yet england let it command mirror hither straight that it may show me what face i have it is bankrupt hi majesti bolingbrok go some you fetch look glass _exit attend _ northumberland read o er thi paper while glass doth come king richard fiend thou torment me ere i come hell bolingbrok urg it no more my lord northumberland northumberland common will not then be satisfi king richard they shall be satisfi i ll read enough when i do see veri book inde where all my sin are writ that s myself re enter attend glass give me that glass therein will i read no deeper wrinkl yet hath sorrow struck so mani blow thi face mine made no deeper wound o flatt ring glass like my follow prosper thou dost beguil me wa thi face face that everi day hi household roof did keep ten thousand men wa thi face that like sun did make behold wink is thi face which face so mani folli that wa last outfac bolingbrok brittl glori shineth thi face as brittl as glori is face _dash glass against ground _ there it is crack hundr shiver mark silent king moral thi sport how soon my sorrow hath destroy my face bolingbrok shadow your sorrow hath destroy shadow your face king richard say that again shadow my sorrow ha let s see ti veri true my grief lie all these extern manner lament are mere shadow unseen grief that swell silenc tortur soul there lie substanc i thank thee king thi great bounti that not onli giv st me caus wail but teachest me way how lament caus i ll beg one boon then be gone troubl you no more shall i obtain it bolingbrok name it fair cousin king richard fair cousin i am greater than king when i wa king my flatter were then but subject be now subject i have king here my flatter be so great i have no need beg bolingbrok yet ask king richard shall i have bolingbrok you shall king richard then give me leav go bolingbrok whither king richard whither you will so i were your sight bolingbrok go some you convey him tower king richard o good convey convey are you all that rise thu nimbl true king s fall _exeunt king richard guard _ bolingbrok wednesday next we solemnli set down our coron lord prepar yourselv _exeunt all but bishop carlisl abbot westminst aumerl _ abbot woeful pageant have we here beheld carlisl woe s come children yet unborn shall feel thi day as sharp them as thorn aumerl you holi clergymen is there no plot rid realm thi pernici blot abbot my lord i freeli speak my mind herein you shall not onli take sacrament buri mine intent but also effect whatev i shall happen devis i see your brow are full discont your heart sorrow your eye tear come home me supper i will lay plot shall show us all merri day _exeunt _ act v scene i london street lead tower enter queen ladi queen thi way king will come thi is way juliu caesar s ill erect tower whose flint bosom my condemn lord is doom prison proud bolingbrok here let us rest if thi rebelli earth have ani rest her true king s queen enter king richard guard but soft but see or rather do not see my fair rose wither yet look behold that you piti may dissolv dew wash him fresh again true love tear ah thou model where old troy did stand thou map honour thou king richard s tomb not king richard thou most beauteou inn whi should hard favour grief be lodg thee when triumph is becom alehous guest king richard join not grief fair woman do not so make my end too sudden learn good soul think our former state happi dream which awak truth what we are show us but thi i am sworn brother sweet grim necess he i will keep leagu till death hie thee franc cloister thee some religi hous our holi live must win new world s crown which our profan hour here have thrown down queen what is my richard both shape mind transform weaken hath bolingbrok depos thine intellect hath he been thi heart lion die thrusteth forth hi paw wound earth if noth els rage be o erpow wilt thou pupil like take correct mildli kiss rod fawn rage base humil which art lion king beast king richard king beast inde if aught but beast i had been still happi king men good sometim queen prepar thee henc franc think i am dead that even here thou tak st as my death bed thi last live leav winter s tediou night sit fire good old folk let them tell thee tale woeful age long ago betid ere thou bid good night quit their grief tell thou lament tale me send hearer weep their bed whi senseless brand will sympath heavi accent thi move tongu compass weep fire some will mourn ash some coal black depos right king enter northumberland attend northumberland my lord mind bolingbrok is chang you must pomfret not unto tower madam there is order ta en you all swift speed you must away franc king richard northumberland thou ladder wherewith mount bolingbrok ascend my throne time shall not be mani hour age more than it is ere foul sin gather head shall break corrupt thou shalt think though he divid realm give thee half it is too littl help him all he shall think that thou which knowst way plant unright king wilt know again be ne er so littl urg anoth way pluck him headlong usurp throne love wick men convert fear that fear hate hate turn one or both worthi danger deserv death northumberland my guilt be my head there end take leav part you must part forthwith king richard doubli divorc bad men you violat twofold marriag twixt my crown me then betwixt me my marri wife let me unkiss oath twixt thee me yet not so kiss twa made part us northumberland i north where shiver cold sick pine clime my wife franc whenc set forth pomp she came adorn hither like sweet may sent back like hallowma or short st day queen must we be divid must we part king richard ay hand hand my love heart heart queen banish us both send king me northumberland that were some love but littl polici queen then whither he goe thither let me go king richard so two togeth weep make one woe weep thou me franc i thee here better far off than near be ne er near go count thi way sigh i mine groan queen so longest way shall have longest moan king richard twice one step i ll groan way be short piec way heavi heart come come woo sorrow let s be brief wed it there is such length grief one kiss shall stop our mouth dumbl part thu give i mine thu take i thi heart _they kiss _ queen give me mine own again twere no good part take me keep kill thi heart _they kiss again _ so now i have mine own again be gone that i may strive kill it groan king richard we make woe wanton thi fond delay onc more adieu rest let sorrow say _exeunt _ scene ii same room duke york s palac enter york hi duchess duchess my lord you told me you would tell rest when weep made you break stori off our two cousin come which hi aspir rider seem know slow but state pace kept hi cours whilst all tongu cri god save thee bolingbrok you would have thought veri window spake so mani greedi look young old casement dart their desir eye hi visag that all wall paint imageri had said onc jesu preserv thee welcom bolingbrok whilst he one side other turn barehead lower than hi proud steed s neck bespak them thu i thank face still combat tear smile badg hi grief patienc that had not god some strong purpos steel heart men they must perforc have melt barbar itself have piti him but heaven hath hand these event whose dungeon castl enter richard richard i have been studi how i may compar thi prison where i live unto world becaus world is popul here is not creatur but myself i cannot do it yet i ll hammer it my brain i ll prove femal my soul my soul father these two beget gener still breed thought these same thought peopl thi littl world humour like peopl thi world no thought is content better sort as thought thing divin are intermix scrupl do set word itself against word as thu come littl one then again it is as hard come as camel thread postern needl s eye thought tend ambit they do plot unlik wonder how these vain weak nail may tear passag flinti rib thi hard world my rag prison wall they cannot die their own pride thought tend content flatter themselv that they are not first fortun s slave nor shall not be last like silli beggar who sit stock refug their shame that mani have other must sit there thi thought they find kind eas bear their own misfortun back such as have endur like thu play i one person mani peopl none content sometim am i king then treason make me wish myself beggar so i am then crush penuri persuad me i wa better when king then am i king again think that i am unking bolingbrok straight am noth but whate er i be nor i nor ani man that but man is noth shall be pleas till he be eas be noth music do i hear _music_ ha ha keep time how sour sweet music is when time is broke no proport kept so is it music men s live here have i dainti ear check time broke disord string but concord my state time had not ear hear my true time broke i wast time now doth time wast me now hath time made me hi numb ring clock my thought are minut sigh they jar their watch unto mine eye outward watch whereto my finger like dial s point is point still cleans them tear now sir sound that tell what hour it is are clamor groan which strike my heart which is bell so sigh tear groan show minut time hour but my time run post bolingbrok s proud joy while i stand fool here hi jack o clock thi music mad me let it sound no more though it have holp madmen their wit me it seem it will make wise men mad yet bless hi heart that give it me ti sign love love richard is strang brooch thi all hate world enter groom stabl groom hail royal princ richard thank nobl peer cheapest us is ten groat too dear what art thou how comest thou hither where no man never come but that sad dog that bring me food make misfortun live groom i wa poor groom thi stabl king when thou wert king who travel york much ado length have gotten leav look my sometim royal master s face o how it ern my heart when i beheld london street that coron day when bolingbrok rode roan barbari that hors that thou so often hast bestrid that hors that i so care have dress richard rode he barbari tell me gentl friend how went he him groom so proudli as if he disdain ground richard so proud that bolingbrok wa hi back that jade hath eat bread my royal hand thi hand hath made him proud clap him would he not stumbl would he not fall down pride must have fall break neck that proud man that did usurp hi back forgiv hors whi do i rail thee thou creat be awe man wast born bear i wa not made hors yet i bear burden like ass spur gall tire jaunc bolingbrok enter keeper dish keeper _to groom_ fellow give place here is no longer stay richard if thou love me ti time thou wert away groom my tongu dare not that my heart shall say _exit _ keeper my lord will t pleas you fall richard tast it first as thou art wont do keeper my lord i dare not sir pierc exton who late came king command contrari richard devil take henri lancast thee patienc is stale i am weari it _strike keeper _ keeper help help help enter exton servant arm richard how now what mean death thi rude assault villain thi own hand yield thi death s instrument _snatch weapon kill one _ go thou fill anoth room hell _he kill anoth then exton strike him down _ that hand shall burn never quench fire that stagger thu my person exton thi fierc hand hath king s blood stain king s own land mount mount my soul thi seat is high whilst my gross flesh sink downward here die _di _ exton as full valour as royal blood both have i spill o would deed were good now devil that told me i did well say that thi deed is chronicl hell thi dead king live king i ll bear take henc rest give them burial here _exeunt _ scene vi windsor apart castl flourish enter here king henri we thank thee gentl perci thi pain thi worth will add right worthi gain enter fitzwat fitzwat my lord i have oxford sent london head broca sir bennet seeli two danger consort traitor that sought oxford thi dire overthrow king henri thi pain fitzwat shall not be forgot right nobl is thi merit well i wot enter harri perci bishop carlisl perci grand conspir abbot westminst clog than thou hast it joy thi life so as thou liv st peac die free strife though mine enemi thou hast ever been high spark honour thee have i seen enter exton attend bear coffin exton great king thi coffin i present thi buri fear herein all breathless lie mightiest thi greatest enemi richard bordeaux me hither brought king henri exton i thank thee not thou hast wrought deed slander thi fatal hand my head all thi famou land exton your own mouth my lord did i thi deed king henri they love not poison that do poison need nor do i thee though i did wish him dead i hate murder love him murder guilt conscienc take thou thi labour but neither my good word nor princ favour cain go wander thorough shade night never show thi head day nor light lord i protest my soul is full woe that blood should murder keeper scene england king richard third act i scene 1 london street enter richard duke gloucest solu gloucest now is winter our discont made gloriou summer thi sun york all cloud that lour d our hous deep bosom ocean buri now are our brow bound victori wreath our bruis arm hung monument our stern alarum chang d merri meet our dread march delight measur grim visag d war hath smooth d hi wrinkl front now instead mount barb steed fright soul fear adversari he caper nimbl ladi s chamber lascivi pleas lute but i that am not shap d sportiv trick nor made court amor look glass i that am rude stamp d want love s majesti strut wanton ambl nymph i that am curtail d thi fair proport cheat featur dissembl natur deform d unfinish d sent my time thi breath world scarc half made that so lame unfashion that dog bark me as i halt them whi i thi weak pipe time peac have no delight pass away time unless spi my shadow sun descant mine own deform therefor i cannot prove lover entertain these fair well spoken day i am determin prove villain hate idl pleasur these day plot have i laid induct danger drunken propheci libel dream set my brother clarenc king deadli hate one against other if king edward be as true just as i am subtl fals treacher thi day should clarenc close be mew d propheci which say that g edward s heir murder shall be dive thought down my soul here clarenc come enter clarenc becaus my name is georg gloucest alack my lord that fault is none your he should that commit your godfath o belik hi majesti hath some intent that you should be new christ ned tower but what s matter clarenc may i know clarenc yea richard when i know i protest as yet i do not but as i can learn he hearken propheci dream cross row pluck letter g say wizard told him that g hi issu disinherit should be my name georg begin g it follow hi thought that i am he these as i learn such like toy as these hath mov d hi high commit me now gloucest whi thi it is when men are rul d women ti not king that send you tower my ladi grey hi wife clarenc ti she that temper him thi extrem wa it not she that good man worship antoni woodvil her brother there that made him send lord hast tower whenc thi present day he is deliv we are not safe clarenc we are not safe clarenc heaven i think there is no man is secur but queen s kindr night walk herald that trudg betwixt king mistress shore heard you not what humbl suppliant lord hast wa her deliveri gloucest humbl complain her deiti got my lord chamberlain hi liberti i ll tell you what i think it is our way if we will keep favour king be her men wear her liveri jealou o er worn widow herself that our brother dubb d them gentlewomen are mighti gossip our monarchi brakenburi i beseech your grace both pardon me hi majesti hath straitli given charg that no man shall have privat confer what degre soever your brother gloucest even so t pleas your worship brakenburi you may partak ani thing we say we speak no treason man we say king is wise virtuou hi nobl queen well struck year fair not jealou we say that shore s wife hath pretti foot cherri lip bonni eye pass pleas tongu that queen s kindr are made gentlefolk how say you sir can you deni all thi brakenburi thi my lord myself have naught do gloucest naught do mistress shore i tell thee fellow he that doth naught her except one were best do it secretli alon brakenburi what one my lord prevail d as much him as you hast more piti that eagl should be mew d while kite buzzard prey liberti gloucest what news abroad hast no news so bad abroad as thi home king is sickli weak melancholi hi physician fear him mightili gloucest now saint john that news is bad inde o he hath kept evil diet long overmuch consum d hi royal person ti veri grievou be thought where is he hi bed hast he is deep intent clarenc hath not anoth day live which done god take king edward hi merci leav world me bustl then i ll marri warwick s youngest daughter what though i kill d her husband her father readiest way make wench amend is becom her husband her father which will i not all so much love as anoth secret close intent marri her which i must reach unto but yet i run my hors market clarenc still breath edward still live reign when they are gone then must i count my gain exit scene 2 london anoth street enter corps king henri sixth halberd guard it ladi ann be mourner attend tressel bloodless remnant that royal blood be it law that i invoc thi ghost hear lament poor ann wife thi edward thi slaughter son stabb d self same hand that made these wound lo these window that let forth thi life i pour helpless balm my poor eye o curs be hand that made these hole curs heart that had heart do it curs blood that let thi blood henc more dire hap betid that hate wretch that make us wretch death thee than i can wish adder spider toad or ani creep venom d thing that live if ever he have child abort be it prodigi untim brought light whose ugli unnatur aspect may fright hope mother view that be heir hi unhappi if ever he have wife let her be made more miser death him than i am made my young lord thee come now chertsey your holi load taken paul s be inter there still as you are weari thi weight rest you while i lament king henri s cors bearer take coffin enter gloucest gloucest stay you that bear cors set it down ann what black magician conjur thi fiend stop devot charit deed gloucest villain set down cors or saint paul i ll make cors him that disobey first gentleman my lord stand back let coffin pass gloucest unmannerd dog stand thou when i command advanc thi halberd higher than my breast or saint paul i ll strike thee my foot spurn thee beggar thi bold bearer set down coffin ann what do you trembl are you all afraid ala i blame you not you are mortal mortal eye cannot endur devil avaunt thou dread minist hell thou hadst but power hi mortal bodi hi soul thou canst not have therefor be gone gloucest sweet saint chariti be not so curst ann foul devil god s sake henc troubl us not thou hast made happi earth thi hell fill d it curs cri deep exclaim if thou delight view thi heinou deed behold thi pattern thi butcheri o gentlemen see see dead henri s wound open their congeal d mouth bleed afresh blush blush thou lump foul deform ti thi presenc that exhal thi blood cold empti vein where no blood dwell thi deed inhuman unnatur provok thi delug most unnatur o god which thi blood mad st reveng hi death o earth which thi blood drink st reveng hi death either heav n lightn strike murd rer dead or earth gape open wide eat him quick as thou dost swallow thi good king s blood which hi hell govern d arm hath butcher gloucest ladi you know no rule chariti which render good bad bless curs ann villain thou knowest nor law god nor man no beast so fierc but know some touch piti gloucest but i know none therefor am no beast ann o wonder when devil tell truth gloucest more wonder when angel are so angri vouchsaf divin perfect woman these suppos crime give me leav circumst but acquit myself ann vouchsaf diffu d infect man these known evil but give me leav circumst accus thi curs self gloucest fairer than tongu can name thee let me have some patient leisur excus myself ann fouler than heart can think thee thou canst make no excus current but hang thyself gloucest such despair i should accus myself ann despair shalt thou stand excus do worthi vengeanc thyself that didst unworthi slaughter other gloucest say that i slew them not ann then say they were not slain but dead they are devilish slave thee gloucest i did not kill your husband ann whi then he is aliv gloucest nay he is dead slain edward s hand ann thi foul throat thou liest queen margaret saw thi murd rou falchion smoke hi blood which thou onc didst bend against her breast but that thi brother beat asid point gloucest i wa provok her sland rou tongu that laid their guilt my guiltless shoulder ann thou wast provok thi bloodi mind that never dream st aught but butcheri didst thou not kill thi king gloucest i grant ye ann dost grant me hedgehog then god grant me thou mayst be damn that wick deed o he wa gentl mild virtuou gloucest better king heaven that hath him ann he is me name it ann some dungeon gloucest your bed chamber ann ill rest betid chamber where thou liest gloucest so will it madam till i lie you ann i hope so gloucest i know so but gentl ladi ann leav thi that effect your beauti that did haunt me my sleep undertak death all world so i might live one hour your sweet bosom ann if i thought that i tell thee homicid these nail should rend that beauti my cheek gloucest these eye could not endur that beauti s wreck you should not blemish it if i stood as all world is cheer sun so i that it is my day my life ann black night o ershad thi day death thi life gloucest curs not thyself fair creatur thou art both ann i would i were be reveng d thee gloucest it is quarrel most unnatur be reveng d him that loveth thee ann it is quarrel just reason be reveng d him that kill d my husband gloucest he that bereft thee ladi thi husband did it help thee better husband ann hi better doth not breath earth gloucest he live that love thee better than he could ann name him gloucest plantagenet ann whi that wa he gloucest self same name but one better natur ann where is he gloucest here she spit him whi dost thou spit me ann would it were mortal poison thi sake gloucest never came poison so sweet place ann never hung poison fouler toad my sight thou dost infect mine eye gloucest thine eye sweet ladi have infect mine ann would they were basilisk shed remors tear no when my father york edward wept hear piteou moan that rutland made when black fac d clifford shook hi sword him nor when thi warlik father like child told sad stori my father s death twenti time made paus sob weep that all stander had wet their cheek like tree bedash d rain that sad time my manli eye did scorn humbl tear what these sorrow could not thenc exhal thi beauti hath made them blind weep i never su friend nor enemi my tongu could never learn sweet smooth word but now thi beauti is propo d my fee my proud heart sue prompt my tongu speak she look scorn him teach not thi lip such scorn it wa made kiss ladi not such contempt if thi reveng heart cannot forgiv lo here i lend thee thi sharp point sword which if thou pleas hide thi true breast let soul forth that adoreth thee i lay it nake deadli stroke humbl beg death my knee he lay hi breast open she offer it hi sword nay do not paus i did kill king henri but twa thi beauti that provok me nay now conceit or other like him well when that he bid good morrow such spirit i think there s never man christendom can lesser hide hi love or hate than he hi face straight shall you know hi heart derbi what hi heart perceiv you hi face ani livelihood he show d day hast marri that no man here he is offend were he he had shown it hi look re enter gloucest buckingham gloucest i pray you all tell me what they deserv that do conspir my death devilish plot damn witchcraft that have prevail d my bodi their hellish charm hast tender love i bear your grace my lord make me most forward thi princ presenc doom th offend whoso er they be i say my lord they have deserv death gloucest then be your eye wit their evil look how i am bewitch d behold mine arm is like blast sapl wither d thi is edward s wife that monstrou witch consort that harlot strumpet shore that their witchcraft thu have mark me hast if they have done thi deed my nobl lord gloucest if thou protector thi damn strumpet talk st thou me if thou art traitor off hi head now saint paul i swear i will not dine i see same lovel ratcliff look that it be done rest that love me rise follow me exeunt all but hast lovel ratcliff hast woe woe england not whit me i too fond might have prevent thi stanley did dream boar did raze our helm i did scorn it disdain fli three time day my foot cloth hors did stumbl start when he look d tower as loath bear me slaughter hous o now i need priest that spake me i now repent i told pursuiv as too triumph how mine enemi day pomfret bloodili were butcher d i myself secur grace favour o margaret margaret now thi heavi curs is light poor hast wretch head ratcliff come come dispatch duke would be dinner make short shrift he long see your head hast o momentari grace mortal men which we more hunt than grace god who build hi hope air your good look live like drunken sailor mast readi everi nod tumbl down fatal bowel deep lovel come come dispatch ti bootless exclaim hast o bloodi act i scene i public place enter sampson gregori arm sword buckler sampson gregori my word we ll not carri coal gregori no then we should be collier sampson i mean if we be choler we ll draw gregori ay while you live draw your neck o collar sampson i strike quickli be move gregori but thou art not quickli move strike sampson dog hous montagu move me gregori move is stir be valiant is stand therefor if thou art move thou runn st away sampson dog that hous shall move me stand i will take wall ani man or maid montagu s gregori that show thee weak slave weakest goe wall sampson true therefor women be weaker vessel are ever thrust wall therefor i will push montagu s men wall thrust hi maid wall gregori quarrel is our master us their men sampson ti all one i will show myself tyrant when i have fought men i will be civil maid i will cut off their head gregori head maid sampson ay head maid or their maidenhead take it what sens thou wilt gregori they must take it sens that feel it sampson me they shall feel while i am abl stand ti known i am pretti piec flesh gregori ti well thou art not fish if thou hadst thou hadst been poor john draw thi tool here come hous montagu enter abram balthasar sampson my nake weapon is quarrel i will back thee gregori how turn thi back run sampson fear me not gregori no marri i fear thee sampson let us take law our side let them begin gregori i will frown as i pass let them take it as they list sampson nay as they dare i will bite my thumb them which is disgrac them if they bear it abram do you bite your thumb us sir sampson i do bite my thumb sir abram do you bite your thumb us sir sampson is law our side if i say ay gregori no sampson no sir i do not bite my thumb you sir but i bite my thumb sir gregori do you quarrel sir abram quarrel sir no sir sampson but if you do sir am you i serv as good man as you abram no better sampson well sir enter benvolio gregori say better here come one my master s kinsmen sampson ye better sir abram you lie sampson draw if you be men gregori rememb thi wash blow _they fight _ benvolio part fool put your sword you know not what you do _beat down their sword _ enter tybalt tybalt have you importun d him ani mean montagu both myself mani other friend but he hi own affect counsellor is himself i will not say how true but himself so secret so close so far sound discoveri as is bud bit enviou worm ere he can spread hi sweet leav air or dedic hi beauti sun could we but learn whenc hi sorrow grow we would as willingli give cure as know enter romeo benvolio see where he come so wilt thou not jule quoth he pretti fool it stint said ay ladi capulet enough thi i pray thee hold thi peac nurs ye madam yet i cannot choos but laugh think it should leav cri say ay yet i warrant it _exeunt _ scene iv street enter romeo mercutio benvolio five or six masker torch bearer other romeo what shall thi speech be spoke our excus or shall we apolog benvolio date is such prolix we ll have no cupid hoodwink d scarf bear tartar s paint bow lath scare ladi like crow keeper nor no book prologu faintli spoke prompter our entranc but let them measur us what they will we ll measur them measur stake me ground i cannot move mercutio you are lover borrow cupid s wing soar them common bound romeo i am too sore enpierc hi shaft soar hi light feather so bound i cannot bound pitch dull woe love s heavi burden do i sink mercutio sink it should you burden love too great oppress tender thing romeo is love tender thing it is too rough too rude too boister it prick like thorn mercutio if love be rough you be rough love prick love prick you beat love down give me case put my visag _put mask _ visor visor what care i what curiou eye doth quot deform here are beetl brow shall blush me benvolio may one ask romeo i dreamt dream tonight mercutio so did i romeo well what wa your mercutio that dreamer often lie romeo bed asleep while they do dream thing true mercutio o then i see queen mab hath been you she is fairi midwif she come shape no bigger than agat stone fore finger alderman drawn team littl atomi men s nose as they lie asleep her waggon spoke made long spinner leg cover wing grasshopp her trace smallest spider s web collar moonshin s wateri beam her whip cricket s bone lash film her waggon small grey coat gnat not half so big as round littl worm prick d lazi finger maid her chariot is empti hazelnut made joiner squirrel or old grub time o mind fairi coachmak thi state she gallop night night lover brain then they dream love o er courtier knee that dream curtsi straight o er lawyer finger who straight dream fee o er ladi lip who straight kiss dream which oft angri mab blister plagu becaus their breath sweetmeat taint are sometim she gallop o er courtier s nose then dream he smell suit sometim come she tith pig s tail tickl parson s nose as lie asleep then dream he anoth benefic sometim she driveth o er soldier s neck then dream he cut foreign throat breach ambuscado spanish blade health five fathom deep then anon drum hi ear which he start wake be thu fright swear prayer or two sleep again thi is that veri mab that plat mane hors night bake elf lock foul sluttish hair which onc untangl much misfortun bode thi is hag when maid lie their back that press them learn them first bear make them women good carriag thi is she romeo peac peac mercutio peac thou talk st noth mercutio true i talk dream which are children idl brain begot noth but vain fantasi which is as thin substanc as air more inconst than wind who wooe even now frozen bosom north be anger d puff away thenc turn hi side dew drop south benvolio thi wind you talk blow us ourselv supper is done we shall come too late romeo i fear too earli my mind misgiv some consequ yet hang star shall bitterli begin hi fear date thi night s revel expir term despis life clo d my breast some vile forfeit untim death but he that hath steerag my cours direct my suit lusti gentlemen benvolio thi night capulet young romeo is it tybalt ti he that villain romeo capulet content thee gentl coz let him alon bear him like portli gentleman say truth verona brag him be virtuou well govern d youth i would not wealth all town here my hous do him disparag therefor be patient take no note him it is my will which if thou respect show fair presenc put off these frown ill beseem semblanc feast tybalt it fit when such villain is guest i ll not endur him capulet he shall be endur d what goodman boy i say he shall go am i master here or you go you ll not endur him god shall mend my soul you ll make mutini my guest you will set cock hoop you ll be man tybalt whi uncl ti shame capulet go go you are sauci boy is t so inde thi trick may chanc scath you i know what you must contrari me marri ti time well said my heart you are princox go be quiet or more light more light shame i ll make you quiet what cheerli my heart tybalt patienc perforc wil choler meet make my flesh trembl their differ greet i will withdraw but thi intrus shall now seem sweet convert bitter gall _exit _ romeo _to juliet _ if i profan my unworthiest hand thi holi shrine gentl sin is thi my lip two blush pilgrim readi stand smooth that rough touch tender kiss juliet good pilgrim you do wrong your hand too much which mannerli devot show thi saint have hand that pilgrim hand do touch palm palm is holi palmer kiss romeo have not saint lip holi palmer too juliet ay pilgrim lip that they must use prayer romeo o then dear saint let lip do what hand do they pray grant thou lest faith turn despair juliet saint do not move though grant prayer sake romeo then move not while my prayer s effect i take thu my lip thine my sin is purg d _kiss her _ juliet then have my lip sin that they have took romeo sin my lip o trespass sweetli urg d give me my sin again juliet you kiss book nurs madam your mother crave word you romeo what is her mother nurs marri bachelor her mother is ladi hous good ladi wise virtuou i nur d her daughter that you talk d withal i tell you he that can lay hold her shall have chink romeo is she capulet o dear account my life is my foe s debt benvolio away be gone sport is best romeo ay so i fear more is my unrest capulet nay gentlemen prepar not be gone we have trifl foolish banquet is it e en so whi then i thank you all i thank you honest gentlemen good night more torch here come then let s bed ah sirrah my fay it wax late i ll my rest _exeunt all but juliet nurs _ juliet come hither nurs what is yond gentleman nurs son heir old tiberio juliet what s he that now is go door nurs marri that i think be young petruchio juliet what s he that follow here that would not danc nurs i know not juliet go ask hi name if he be marri my grave is like be my wed bed nurs hi name is romeo montagu onli son your great enemi juliet my onli love sprung my onli hate too earli seen unknown known too late prodigi birth love it is me that i must love loath enemi nurs what s thi what s thi juliet rhyme bait fear hook be held foe he may not have access breath such vow as lover use swear she as much love her mean much less meet her new belov anywher but passion lend them power time mean meet temper extrem extrem sweet _exit _ scene i open place adjoin capulet s garden enter romeo romeo can i go forward when my heart is here turn back dull earth find thi centr _he climb wall leap down it _ enter benvolio mercutio benvolio romeo my cousin romeo romeo mercutio he is wise my life hath stol n him home bed benvolio he ran thi way leap d thi orchard wall call good mercutio mercutio nay i ll conjur too romeo humour madman passion lover appear thou like sigh speak but one rhyme i am satisfi cri but ah me pronounc but love dove speak my gossip venu one fair word one nicknam her purblind son heir young abraham cupid he that shot so trim when king cophetua lov d beggar maid he heareth not he stirreth not he moveth not ape is dead i must conjur him i conjur thee rosalin s bright eye her high forehead her scarlet lip her fine foot straight leg quiver thigh demesn that there adjac lie that thi like thou appear us benvolio if he hear thee thou wilt anger him mercutio thi cannot anger him twould anger him rais spirit hi mistress circl some strang natur let it there stand till she had laid it conjur d it down that were some spite my invoc is fair honest hi mistress name i conjur onli but rais him benvolio come he hath hid himself these tree be consort humor night blind is hi love best befit dark mercutio if love be blind love cannot hit mark now will he sit medlar tree wish hi mistress were that kind fruit as maid call medlar when they laugh alon o romeo that she were o that she were open ars thou poperin pear romeo good night i ll my truckl bed thi field bed is too cold me sleep come shall we go benvolio go then ti vain seek him here that mean not be found _exeunt _ scene ii capulet s garden enter romeo romeo he jest scar that never felt wound juliet appear window but soft what light yonder window break it is east juliet is sun aris fair sun kill enviou moon who is alreadi sick pale grief that thou her maid art far more fair than she be not her maid she is enviou her vestal liveri is but sick green none but fool do wear it cast it off it is my ladi o it is my love o that she knew she were she speak yet she say noth what that her eye discours i will answer it i am too bold ti not me she speak two fairest star all heaven have some busi do entreat her eye twinkl their sphere till they return what if her eye were there they her head bright her cheek would shame those star as daylight doth lamp her eye heaven would airi region stream so bright that bird would sing think it were not night see how she lean her cheek her hand o that i were glove that hand that i friend friend part swifter than hi tongu hi agil arm beat down their fatal point twixt them rush underneath whose arm enviou thrust tybalt hit life stout mercutio then tybalt fled but come back romeo who had but newli entertain d reveng t they go like lightn ere i could draw part them wa stout tybalt slain as he fell did romeo turn fli thi is truth or let benvolio die ladi capulet he is kinsman montagu affect make him fals he speak not true some twenti them fought thi black strife all those twenti could but kill one life i beg justic which thou princ must give romeo slew tybalt romeo must not live princ romeo slew him he slew mercutio who now price hi dear blood doth owe montagu not romeo princ he wa mercutio s friend hi fault conclud but what law should end life tybalt princ that offenc immedi we do exil him henc i have interest your hate s proceed my blood your rude brawl doth lie bleed but i ll amerc you so strong fine that you shall all repent loss mine i will be deaf plead excus nor tear nor prayer shall purchas abus therefor use none let romeo henc hast els when he is found that hour is hi last bear henc thi bodi attend our will merci but murder pardon those that kill _exeunt _ scene ii room capulet s hous enter juliet juliet gallop apac you fieri foot steed phoebu lodg such waggon as phaeton would whip you west bring cloudi night immedi spread thi close curtain love perform night that runaway s eye may wink romeo leap these arm untalk d unseen lover can see do their amor rite their own beauti or if love be blind it best agre night come civil night thou sober st my head off golden axe smilest stroke that murder me friar lawrenc o deadli sin o rude unthank thi fault our law call death but kind princ take thi part hath brush d asid law turn d that black word not more valid more honour state more courtship live carrion fli than romeo they may seiz white wonder dear juliet s hand steal immort bless her lip who even pure vestal modesti still blush as think their own kiss sin but romeo may not he is banish thi may fli do when i thi must fli they are free men but i am banish say st thou yet that exil is not death hadst thou no poison mix d no sharp ground knife no sudden mean death though ne er so mean but banish kill me banish o friar damn use that word hell howl attend it how hast thou heart be divin ghostli confessor sin absolv my friend profess d cold drowsi humour no puls shall keep hi nativ progress but surceas no warmth no breath shall testifi thou livest rose thi lip cheek shall fade pali ash thi eye window fall like death when he shut day time capulet death that hath ta en her henc make me wail tie my tongu will not let me speak enter friar lawrenc pari musician friar lawrenc come is bride readi go church capulet readi go but never return o son night thi wed day hath death lain thi bride there she lie flower as she wa deflow him death is my son law death is my heir my daughter he hath wed i will die leav him all life live all is death s pari have i thought long see thi morn s face doth it give me such sight as thi ladi capulet accur d unhappi wretch hate day most miser hour that e er time saw last labour hi pilgrimag but one poor one one poor love child but one thing rejoic solac cruel death hath catch d it my sight nurs o woe o woeful woeful woeful day most lament day most woeful day that ever ever i did yet behold o day o day o day o hate day never wa seen so black day as thi o woeful day o woeful day pari beguil d divorc wrong spite slain most detest death thee beguil d cruel cruel thee quit overthrown o love o life not life but love death capulet despi d distress hate martyr d kill d uncomfort time whi cam st thou now murder murder our solemn o child o child my soul not my child dead art thou alack my child is dead my child my joy are buri friar lawrenc peac ho shame confus s cure live not these confus heaven yourself had part thi fair maid now heaven hath all all better is it maid your part her you could not keep death but heaven keep hi part etern life most you sought wa her promot twa your heaven she should be advanc d weep ye now see she is advanc d cloud as high as heaven itself o thi love you love your child so ill that you run mad see that she is well she s not well marri that live marri long but she s best marri that die marri young dri your tear stick your rosemari thi fair cors as custom is her best array bear her church though fond natur bid us all lament yet natur s tear are reason s merriment capulet all thing that we ordain festiv turn their offic black funer our instrument melancholi bell our wed cheer sad burial feast our solemn hymn sullen dirg chang our bridal flower serv buri cors all thing chang them contrari friar lawrenc sir go you madam go him go sir pari everyon prepar follow thi fair cors unto her grave heaven do lower you some ill move them no more cross their high will _exeunt capulet ladi capulet pari friar _ first musician faith we may put our him jack come we ll here tarri mourner stay dinner _exeunt _ act v scene i mantua street enter romeo romeo if i may trust flatter eye sleep my dream presag some joy news hand my bosom s lord sit lightli hi throne all thi day unaccustom d spirit lift me ground cheer thought i dreamt my ladi came found me dead strang dream that give dead man leav think breath d such life kiss my lip that i reviv d wa emperor ah me how sweet is love itself possess d when but love s shadow are so rich joy enter balthasar news verona how now balthasar dost thou not bring me letter friar how doth my ladi is my father well how fare my juliet that i ask again noth can be ill if she be well balthasar then she is well noth can be ill her bodi sleep capel s monument her immort part angel live i saw her laid low her kindr s vault present took post tell it you o pardon me bring these ill news you did leav it my offic sir romeo is it even so then i defi you star thou know st my lodg get me ink paper hire post hors i will henc tonight balthasar i do beseech you sir have patienc your look are pale wild do import some misadventur romeo tush thou art deceiv d leav me do thing i bid thee do hast thou no letter me friar balthasar no my good lord romeo no matter get thee gone hire those hors i ll be thee straight _exit balthasar _ well juliet i will lie thee tonight let s see mean o mischief thou art swift enter thought desper men i do rememb apothecari hereabout he dwell which late i note tatter d weed overwhelm brow cull simpl meagr were hi look sharp miseri had worn him bone hi needi shop tortois hung allig stuff d other skin ill shape fish hi shelv beggarli account empti box green earthen pot bladder musti seed remnant packthread old cake rose were thinli scatter d make show note thi penuri myself i said if man did need poison now whose sale is present death mantua here live caitiff wretch would sell it him o thi same thought did but forerun my need thi same needi man must sell it me as i rememb thi should be hous be holiday beggar s shop is shut what ho apothecari enter apothecari apothecari who call so loud romeo come hither man i see that thou art poor hold there is forti ducat let me have dram poison such soon speed gear as will dispers itself all vein that life weari taker may fall dead that trunk may be discharg d breath as violent as hasti powder fir d doth hurri fatal cannon s womb apothecari such mortal drug i have but mantua s law is death ani he that utter them romeo art thou so bare full wretched fear st die famin is thi cheek need oppress starveth thine eye contempt beggari hang thi back world is not thi friend nor world s law world afford no law make thee rich then be not poor but break it take thi apothecari my poverti but not my will consent romeo i pay thi poverti not thi will apothecari put thi ani liquid thing you will drink it off if you had strength twenti men it would despatch you straight romeo there is thi gold wors poison men s soul do more murder thi loathsom world than these poor compound that thou mayst not sell i sell thee poison thou hast sold me none farewel buy food get thyself flesh come cordial not poison go me juliet s grave there must i use thee _exeunt _ scene ii friar lawrenc s cell enter friar john friar john holi franciscan friar brother ho enter friar lawrenc friar lawrenc thi same should be voic friar john welcom mantua what say romeo or if hi mind be writ give me hi letter friar john go find barefoot brother one our order associ me here thi citi visit sick find him searcher town suspect that we both were hous where infecti pestil did reign seal d door would not let us forth so that my speed mantua there wa stay d friar lawrenc who bare my letter then romeo friar john i could not send it here it henc get me iron crow bring it straight unto my cell friar john brother i ll go bring it thee _exit _ friar lawrenc now must i monument alon thi three hour will fair juliet wake she will beshrew me much that romeo hath had no notic these accid but i will write again mantua keep her my cell till romeo come poor live cors clo d dead man s tomb _exit _ scene iii churchyard it monument belong capulet enter pari hi page bear flower torch pari give me thi torch boy henc stand aloof yet put it i would not be seen yond yew tree lay thee all hold thi ear close hollow ground so shall no foot churchyard tread be loos unfirm dig grave but thou shalt hear it whistl then me as signal that thou hear st someth approach give me those flower do as i bid thee go page _asid _ i am almost afraid stand alon here churchyard yet i will adventur _retir _ pari sweet flower flower thi bridal bed i strew o woe thi canopi is dust stone which sweet water nightli i will dew or want that tear distil d moan obsequi that i thee will keep nightli shall be strew thi grave weep _the page whistl _ boy give warn someth doth approach what curs foot wander thi way tonight cross my obsequi true love s rite what torch muffl me night awhil _retir _ enter romeo balthasar torch mattock c romeo give me that mattock wrench iron hold take thi letter earli morn see thou deliv it my lord father give me light thi ring ring that i must use dear employ therefor henc be gone but if thou jealou dost return pri what i further shall intend do heaven i will tear thee joint joint strew thi hungri churchyard thi limb time my intent are savag wild more fierc more inexor far than empti tiger or roar sea balthasar i will be gone sir not troubl you romeo so shalt thou show me friendship take thou that live be prosper her beauti make thi vault feast presenc full light death lie thou there dead man interr d _lay pari monument _ how oft when men are point death have they been merri which their keeper call lightn death o how may i call thi lightn o my love my wife death that hath suck d honey thi breath hath had no power yet thi beauti thou art not conquer d beauti s ensign yet is crimson thi lip thi cheek death s pale flag is not advanc there tybalt liest thou there thi bloodi sheet o what more favour can i do thee than that hand that cut thi youth twain sunder hi that wa thine enemi forgiv me cousin ah dear juliet whi art thou yet so fair shall i believ that unsubstanti death is amor that lean abhor monster keep thee here dark be hi paramour fear that i still will stay thee never thi palac dim night depart again here here will i remain worm that are thi chambermaid o here will i set my everlast rest shake yoke inauspici star thi world weari flesh eye look your last arm take your last embrac not tybalt juliet pin d you remov that sieg grief her betroth d would have marri her perforc counti pari then come she me wild look bid me devis some mean rid her thi second marriag or my cell there would she kill herself then gave i her so tutor my art sleep potion which so took effect as i intend it wrought her form death meantim i writ romeo that he should hither come as thi dire night help take her her borrow d grave be time potion s forc should ceas but he which bore my letter friar john wa stay d accid yesternight return d my letter back then all alon prefix hour her wake came i take her her kindr s vault mean keep her close my cell till i conveni could send romeo but when i came some minut ere time her awak here untim lay nobl pari true romeo dead she wake i entreat her come forth bear thi work heaven patienc but then nois did scare me tomb she too desper would not go me but as it seem did violenc herself all thi i know marriag her nurs is privi if ought thi miscarri my fault let my old life be sacrif d some hour hi time unto rigour severest law princ we still have known thee holi man where s romeo s man what can he say thi balthasar i brought my master news juliet s death then post he came mantua thi same place thi same monument thi letter he earli bid me give hi father threaten d me death go vault if i depart not left him there princ give me letter i will look it where is counti s page that rai d watch sirrah what made your master thi place page he came flower strew hi ladi s grave bid me stand aloof so i did anon come one light ope tomb my master drew him that part wa aptli fit natur perform d player i think twa soto that your honour mean lord ti veri true thou didst it excel well you are come me happi time rather i have some sport hand wherein your cun can assist me much there is lord will hear you play tonight but i am doubt your modesti lest eye hi odd behaviour yet hi honour never heard play you break some merri passion so offend him i tell you sir if you should smile he grow impati player fear not my lord we can contain ourselv were he veriest antick world lord go sirrah take them butteri give them friendli welcom everyon let them want noth that my hous afford _exit one player _ sirrah go you barthol mew my page see him dress d all suit like ladi that done conduct him drunkard s chamber call him madam do him obeis tell him me as he despit enforc wateri eye see thi dispatch d all hast thou canst anon i ll give thee more instruct _exit servant _ i know boy will well usurp grace voic gait action gentlewoman i long hear him call scene ii bedchamb lord s hous sli is discov rich nightgown attend some apparel basin ewer other appurten lord dress like servant sli god s sake pot small ale first servant will t pleas your lordship drink cup sack second servant will t pleas your honour tast these conserv third servant what raiment will your honour wear today sli i am christophero sli call not me honour nor lordship i ne er drank sack my life if you give me ani conserv give me conserv beef ne er ask me what raiment i ll wear i have no more doublet than back no more stock than leg nor no more shoe than feet nay sometim more feet than shoe or such shoe as my toe look leather lord heaven ceas thi idl humour your honour o that mighti man such descent such possess so high esteem should be infus so foul spirit sli what would you make me mad am not i christoph sli old sli s son burton heath birth pedlar educ cardmak transmut bear herd now present profess tinker ask marian hacket fat ale wife wincot if she know me not if she say i am not fourteen penc score sheer ale score me lyingest knave christendom what i am not bestraught here s third servant o thi it is that make your ladi mourn second servant o thi is it that make your servant droop lord henc come it that your kindr shun your hous as beaten henc your strang lunaci o nobl lord bethink thee thi birth call home thi ancient thought banish banish henc these abject lowli dream look how thi servant do attend thee each hi offic readi thi beck wilt thou have music hark apollo play _music _ twenti cage nightingal do sing or wilt thou sleep we ll have thee couch softer sweeter than lust bed purpos trimm d semirami say thou wilt walk we will bestrew ground or wilt thou ride thi hors shall be trapp d their har stud all gold pearl dost thou love hawk thou hast hawk will soar morn lark or wilt thou hunt thi hound shall make welkin answer them fetch shrill echo hollow earth first servant say thou wilt cours thi greyhound are as swift as breath stag ay fleeter than roe second servant dost thou love pictur we will fetch thee straight adoni paint run brook cytherea all sedg hid which seem move wanton her breath even as wave sedg play wind lord we ll show thee io as she wa maid how she wa beguil surpri d as live paint as deed wa done third servant or daphn roam thorni wood scratch her leg that one shall swear she bleed that sight shall sad apollo weep so workmanli blood tear are drawn lord thou art lord noth but lord thou hast ladi far more beauti than ani woman thi wane age first servant till tear that she hath shed thee like enviou flood o er run her love face she wa fairest creatur world yet she is inferior none sli am i lord have i such ladi or do i dream or have i dream d till now i do not sleep i see i hear i speak i smell sweet savour i feel soft thing my life i am lord inde not tinker nor christophero sli well bring our ladi hither our sight onc again pot o smallest ale second servant will t pleas your mighti wash your hand _servant present ewer basin napkin _ o how we joy see your wit restor d o that onc more you knew but what you are these fifteen year you have been dream or when you wak d so wak d as if you slept sli these fifteen year my fay goodli nap but did i never speak all that time first servant o ye my lord but veri idl word though you lay here thi goodli chamber yet would you say ye were beaten door rail hostess hous say you would present her leet becaus she brought stone jug no seal d quart sometim you would call cice hacket sli ay woman s maid hous third servant whi sir you know no hous nor no such maid nor no such men as you have reckon d as stephen sli old john nap greec peter turph henri pimpernel twenti more such name men as these which never were nor no man ever saw sli now lord be thank my good amend all amen enter page as ladi attend sli i thank thee thou shalt not lose it page how fare my nobl lord sli marri i fare well here is cheer enough where is my wife page here nobl lord what is thi will her sli are you my wife will not call me husband my men should call me lord i am your goodman page my husband my lord my lord husband i am your wife all obedi sli i know it well what must i call her lord madam sli alic madam or joan madam lord madam noth els so lord call ladi sli madam wife they say that i have dream d slept some fifteen year or more page ay time seem thirti unto me be all thi time abandon d your bed sli ti much servant leav me her alon madam undress you come now bed page thrice nobl lord let me entreat you pardon me yet night or two or if not so sun be set your physician have expressli charg d peril incur your former maladi that i should yet absent me your bed i hope thi reason stand my excus sli ay it stand so that i may hardli tarri so long but i would be loath fall my dream again i will therefor tarri despit flesh blood enter messeng messeng your honour s player hear your amend are come play pleasant comedi so your doctor hold it veri meet see too much sad hath congeal d your blood melancholi is nurs frenzi therefor they thought it good you hear play frame your mind mirth merriment which bar thousand harm lengthen life sli marri i will let them play it is not commonti christma gambold or tumbl trick page no my good lord it is more pleas stuff sli what household stuff page it is kind histori sli well we ll see t come madam wife sit my side let world slip we shall ne er be younger act i scene i padua public place flourish enter lucentio tranio lucentio tranio great desir i had see fair padua nurseri art i am arriv d fruit lombardi time let him that mov d you hither remov you henc i knew you first you were moveabl petruchio whi what s moveabl katherina joint stool petruchio thou hast hit it come sit me katherina ass are made
