light such swain as you catch yet as heavi as my weight should be petruchio should be should buz katherina well ta en like buzzard petruchio o slow wing d turtl shall buzzard take thee katherina ay turtl as he take buzzard petruchio come come you wasp i faith you are too angri katherina if i be waspish best bewar my sting petruchio my remedi is then pluck it katherina ay if fool could find it where it lie petruchio who know not where wasp doe wear hi sting hi tail katherina hi tongu petruchio whose tongu katherina your if you talk tale so farewel petruchio what my tongu your tail nay come again good kate i am gentleman katherina that i ll tri _strike him _ petruchio i swear i ll cuff you if you strike again katherina so may you lose your arm if you strike me you are no gentleman if no gentleman whi then no arm petruchio herald kate o put me thi book katherina what is your crest coxcomb petruchio combless cock so kate will be my hen katherina no cock mine you crow too like craven petruchio nay come kate come you must not look so sour katherina it is my fashion when i see crab petruchio whi here s no crab therefor look not sour katherina there is there is petruchio then show it me katherina had i glass i would petruchio what you mean my face katherina well aim d such young one petruchio now saint georg i am too young you katherina yet you are wither d petruchio ti care katherina i care not petruchio nay hear you kate sooth you scape not so katherina i chafe you if i tarri let me go petruchio no not whit i find you pass gentl twa told me you were rough coy sullen now i find report veri liar thou art pleasant gamesom pass courteou but slow speech yet sweet as spring time flower thou canst not frown thou canst not look askanc nor bite lip as angri wench will nor hast thou pleasur be cross talk but thou mild entertain st thi wooer gentl confer soft affabl whi doe world report that kate doth limp o sland rou world kate like hazel twig is straight slender as brown hue as hazel nut sweeter than kernel o let me see thee walk thou dost not halt katherina go fool whom thou keep st command petruchio did ever dian so becom grove as kate thi chamber her princ gait o be thou dian let her be kate then let kate be chast dian sport katherina where did you studi all thi goodli speech petruchio it is extempor my mother wit katherina witti mother witless els her son petruchio am i not wise katherina ye keep you warm petruchio marri so i mean sweet katherin thi bed therefor set all thi chat asid thu plain term your father hath consent that you shall be my wife your dowri greed will you nill you i will marri you now kate i am husband your turn thi light wherebi i see thi beauti thi beauti that doth make me like thee well thou must be marri no man but me i am he am born tame you kate bring you wild kate kate conform as other household kate re enter baptista gremio tranio here come your father never make denial i must will have katherin my wife baptista now commod lay fret you twill bring you gain or perish sea baptista gain i seek is quiet match gremio no doubt but he hath got quiet catch but now baptista your younger daughter now is day we long have look i am your neighbour wa suitor first tranio i am one that love bianca more than word can wit or your thought can guess gremio youngl thou canst not love so dear as i tranio greybeard thi love doth freez gremio but thine doth fri skipper stand back ti age that nourisheth tranio but youth ladi eye that flourisheth baptista content you gentlemen i ll compound thi strife ti deed must win prize he both that can assur my daughter greatest dower shall have my bianca s love say signior gremio what can you assur her gremio first as you know my hous citi is richli furnish plate gold basin ewer lave her dainti hand my hang all tyrian tapestri ivori coffer i have stuff d my crown cypress chest my arra counterpoint costli apparel tent canopi fine linen turkey cushion boss d pearl valanc venic gold needlework pewter brass all thing that belong hous or housekeep then my farm i have hundr milch kine pail six score fat oxen stand my stall all thing answer thi portion myself am struck year i must confess if i die tomorrow thi is her if whilst i live she will be onli mine tranio that onli came well sir list me i am my father s heir onli son if i may have your daughter my wife i ll leav her hous three or four as good rich pisa s wall as anyon old signior gremio ha padua besid two thousand ducat year fruit land all which shall be her jointur what have i pinch d you signior gremio gremio two thousand ducat year land my land amount not so much all that she shall have besid argosi that now is lie marseil road what have i chok d you argosi tranio gremio ti known my father hath no less than three great argosi besid two galliass twelv tight galley these i will assur her twice as much whate er thou offer st next gremio nay i have offer d all i have no more she can have no more than all i have if you like me she shall have me mine tranio whi then maid is mine all world your firm promis gremio is vie baptista i must confess your offer is best let your father make her assur she is your own els you must pardon me if you should die him where s her dower tranio that s but cavil he is old i young gremio may not young men die as well as old baptista well gentlemen i am thu resolv d sunday next you know my daughter katherin is be marri now sunday follow shall bianca be bride you if you make thi assur if not signior gremio so i take my leav thank you both gremio adieu good neighbour _exit baptista _ now i fear thee not sirrah young gamest your father were fool give thee all hi wane age set foot thi tabl tut toy old italian fox is not so kind my boy _exit _ tranio vengeanc your crafti wither d hide yet i have fac d it card ten ti my head do my master good i see no reason but suppo d lucentio must get father call d suppo d vincentio that s wonder father commonli do get their children but thi case woo child shall get sire if i fail not my cun _exit _ act iii scene i padua room baptista s hous enter lucentio hortensio bianca lucentio fiddler forbear you grow too forward sir have you so soon forgot entertain her sister katherin welcom d you withal hortensio but wrangl pedant thi is patro heavenli harmoni then give me leav have prerog when music we have spent hour your lectur shall have leisur as much lucentio preposter ass that never read so far know caus whi music wa ordain d wa it not refresh mind man hi studi or hi usual pain then give me leav read philosophi while i paus serv your harmoni hortensio sirrah i will not bear these brave thine bianca whi gentlemen you do me doubl wrong strive that which resteth my choic i am no breech scholar hortensio you ll leav hi lectur when i am tune _retir _ lucentio that will be never tune your instrument bianca where left we last lucentio here madam _hic ibat simoi hic est sigeia tellu hic steterat tire jade all mad master all foul way wa ever man so beaten wa ever man so ray d wa ever man so weari i am sent make fire they are come warm them now were not i littl pot soon hot my veri lip might freez my teeth my tongu roof my mouth my heart my belli ere i should come fire thaw me but i blow fire shall warm myself consid weather taller man than i will take cold holla ho curti enter curti curti who is that call so coldli grumio piec ice if thou doubt it thou mayst slide my shoulder my heel no greater run but my head my neck fire good curti curti is my master hi wife come grumio grumio o ay curti ay therefor fire fire cast no water curti is she so hot shrew as she s report grumio she wa good curti thi frost but thou knowest winter tame man woman beast it hath tame my old master my new mistress myself fellow curti curti away you three inch fool i am no beast grumio am i but three inch whi thi horn is foot so long am i least but wilt thou make fire or shall i complain thee our mistress whose hand she be now hand thou shalt soon feel thi cold comfort be slow thi hot offic curti i prithe good grumio tell me how goe world grumio cold world curti everi offic but thine therefor fire do thi duti have thi duti my master mistress are almost frozen death curti there s fire readi therefor good grumio news grumio whi jack boy ho boy as much news as wilt thou curti come you are so full coni catch grumio whi therefor fire i have caught extrem cold where s cook is supper readi hous trim rush strew cobweb swept servingmen their new fustian their white stock everi offic hi wed garment be jack fair jill fair carpet laid everyth order curti all readi therefor i pray thee news grumio first know my hors is tire my master mistress fallen curti how grumio their saddl dirt therebi hang tale curti let s ha t good grumio grumio lend thine ear curti here grumio _strike him _ there curti thi ti feel tale not hear tale grumio therefor ti call sensibl tale thi cuff wa but knock your ear beseech listen now i begin _imprimis_ we came down foul hill my master ride behind my mistress curti both one hors grumio what s that thee curti whi hors grumio tell thou tale but hadst thou not cross me thou shouldst have heard how her hors fell she her hors thou shouldst have heard how miri place how she wa bemoil how he left her hors her how he beat me becaus her hors stumbl how she wade dirt pluck him off me how he swore how she pray that never pray how i cri how hors ran away how her bridl wa burst how i lost my crupper mani thing worthi memori which now shall die oblivion thou return unexperienc thi grave curti thi reckon he is more shrew than she grumio ay that thou proudest you all shall find when he come home but what talk i thi call forth nathaniel joseph nichola philip walter sugarsop rest let their head be sleekli comb their blue coat brush d their garter indiffer knit let them curtsi their left leg not presum touch hair my master s hors tail till they kiss their hand are they all readi curti they are grumio call them forth curti do you hear ho you must meet my master counten my mistress grumio whi she hath face her own curti who know not that grumio thou it come hither _exeunt _ re enter petruchio petruchio thu have i politicli begun my reign ti my hope end success my falcon now is sharp pass empti till she stoop she must not be full gorg d then she never look her lure anoth way i have man my haggard make her come know her keeper s call that is watch her as we watch these kite that bate beat will not be obedi she eat no meat today nor none shall eat last night she slept not nor tonight she shall not as meat some undeserv fault i ll find make bed here i ll fling pillow there bolster thi way coverlet anoth way sheet ay amid thi hurli i intend that all is done reverend care her conclus she shall watch all night if she chanc nod i ll rail brawl clamour keep her still awak thi is way kill wife kind thu i ll curb her mad headstrong humour he that know better how tame shrew now let him speak ti chariti show _exit _ scene ii padua baptista s hous enter tranio hortensio tranio is t possibl friend licio that mistress bianca doth fanci ani other but lucentio i tell you sir she bear me fair hand hortensio sir satisfi you what i have said stand mark manner hi teach _they stand asid _ enter bianca lucentio lucentio now mistress profit you what you read bianca what master read you first resolv me that lucentio i read that i profess _the art love_ bianca may you prove sir master your art lucentio while you sweet dear prove mistress my heart _they retir _ hortensio quick proceed marri now tell me i pray you that durst swear that your mistress bianca lov d none world so well as lucentio tranio o despit love unconst womankind i tell thee licio thi is wonder hortensio mistak no more i am not licio nor musician as i seem be but one that scorn live thi disguis such one as leav gentleman make god such cullion know sir that i am call d hortensio tranio signior hortensio i have often heard your entir affect bianca mine eye are wit her light i will you if you be so content forswear bianca her love ever hortensio see how they kiss court signior lucentio here is my hand here i firmli vow never woo her more but do forswear her as one unworthi all former favour that i have fondli flatter d her withal tranio here i take like unfeign oath never marri her though she would entreat fie her see how beastli she doth court him hortensio would all world but he had quit forsworn me that i may sure keep mine oath i will be marri wealthi widow ere three day pass which hath as long lov d me as i have lov d thi proud disdain haggard so farewel signior lucentio kind women not their beauteou look shall win my love so i take my leav resolut as i swore _exit hortensio lucentio bianca advanc _ tranio mistress bianca bless you such grace as longeth lover s bless case nay i have ta en you nap gentl love have forsworn you hortensio bianca tranio you jest but have you both forsworn me tranio mistress we have lucentio then we are rid licio tranio i faith he ll have lusti widow now that shall be woo d wed day bianca god give him joy tranio ay he ll tame her bianca he say so tranio tranio faith he is gone unto tame school bianca tame school what is there such place tranio ay mistress petruchio is master that teacheth trick eleven twenti long tame shrew charm her chatter tongu enter biondello run biondello o master master i have watch d so long that i am dog weari but last i spi ancient angel come down hill will serv turn tranio what is he biondello biondello master mercatant or pedant i know not what but formal apparel gait counten sure like father lucentio what him tranio tranio if he be credul trust my tale i ll make him glad seem vincentio give assur baptista minola as if he were right vincentio take your love then let me alon _exeunt lucentio bianca _ enter pedant pedant god save you sir tranio you sir you are welcom travel you far or are you farthest pedant sir farthest week or two but then farther as far as rome so tripoli if god lend me life tranio what countryman i pray pedant mantua tranio mantua sir marri god forbid come padua careless your life pedant my life sir how i pray that goe hard tranio ti death anyon mantua come padua know you not caus your ship are stay d venic duke privat quarrel twixt your duke him hath publish d proclaim d it openli ti marvel but that you are but newli come you might have heard it els proclaim d pedant ala sir it is wors me than so i have bill money exchang florenc must here deliv them tranio well sir do you courtesi thi will i do thi i will advis you first tell me have you ever been pisa pedant ay sir pisa have i often been pisa renown grave citizen tranio them know you one vincentio pedant i know him not but i have heard him merchant incompar wealth tranio he is my father sir sooth say counten somewhat doth resembl you biondello _asid _ as much as appl doth oyster all one tranio save your life thi extrem thi favour will i do you hi sake think it not worst all your fortun that you are like sir vincentio hi name credit shall you undertak my hous you shall be friendli lodg d look that you take you as you should you understand me sir so shall you stay till you have done your busi citi if thi be courtesi sir accept it pedant o sir i do will reput you ever patron my life liberti tranio then go me make matter good thi way i let you understand my father is here look d everi day pass assur dower marriag twixt me one baptista s daughter here all these circumst i ll instruct you go me cloth you as becom you _exeunt _ scene iii room petruchio s hous enter katherina grumio grumio no no forsooth i dare not my life katherina more my wrong more hi spite appear what did he marri me famish me beggar that come unto my father s door entreati have present alm if not elsewher they meet chariti but i who never knew how entreat nor never need that i should entreat am starv d meat giddi lack sleep oath kept wake brawl fed that which spite me more than all these want he doe it name perfect love as who should say if i should sleep or eat twere deadli sick or els present death i prithe go get me some repast i care not what so it be wholesom food grumio what say you neat s foot katherina ti pass good i prithe let me have it grumio i fear it is too choler meat how say you fat tripe fine broil d katherina i like it well good grumio fetch it me grumio i cannot tell i fear ti choler what say you piec beef mustard katherina dish that i do love feed grumio ay but mustard is too hot littl katherina whi then beef let mustard rest grumio nay then i will not you shall have mustard or els you get no beef grumio katherina then both or one or anyth thou wilt grumio whi then mustard beef katherina go get thee gone thou fals delud slave _beat him _ that feed st me veri name meat sorrow thee all pack you that triumph thu my miseri go get thee gone i say enter petruchio dish meat hortensio petruchio how fare my kate what sweet all amort hortensio mistress what cheer katherina faith as cold as can be petruchio pluck thi spirit look cheer me here love thou seest how dilig i am dress thi meat myself bring it thee _set dish tabl _ i am sure sweet kate thi kind merit thank what not word nay then thou lov st it not all my pain is sort no proof here take away thi dish katherina i pray you let it stand petruchio poorest servic is repaid thank so shall mine you touch meat katherina i thank you sir hortensio signior petruchio fie you are blame come mistress kate i ll bear you compani petruchio _asid _ eat it all hortensio if thou lovest me much good do it unto thi gentl heart kate eat apac now my honey love will we return unto thi father s hous revel it as brave as best silken coat cap golden ring ruff cuff farthingal thing scarf fan doubl chang braveri amber bracelet bead all thi knaveri what hast thou din d tailor stay thi leisur deck thi bodi hi ruffl treasur enter tailor come tailor let us see these ornament lay forth gown enter haberdash what news you sir haberdash here is cap your worship did bespeak petruchio whi thi wa mould porring velvet dish fie fie ti lewd filthi whi ti cockl or walnut shell knack toy trick babi s cap away it come let me have bigger katherina i ll have no bigger thi doth fit time gentlewomen wear such cap as these petruchio when you are gentl you shall have one too not till then hortensio _aside_ that will not be hast katherina whi sir i trust i may have leav speak speak i will i am no child no babe your better have endur d me say my mind if you cannot best you stop your ear my tongu will tell anger my heart or els my heart conceal it will break rather than it shall i will be free even uttermost as i pleas word petruchio whi thou say st true it is paltri cap custard coffin baubl silken pie i love thee well that thou lik st it not katherina love me or love me not i like cap it i will have or i will have none _exit haberdash _ petruchio thi gown whi ay come tailor let us see t o merci god what masqu stuff is here what s thi sleev ti like demi cannon what down carv d like appl tart here s snip nip cut slish slash like censer barber s shop whi what i devil s name tailor call st thou thi hortensio _aside_ i see she s like have neither cap nor gown tailor you bid me make it orderli well accord fashion time petruchio marri did but if you be rememb d i did not bid you mar it time go hop me everi kennel home you shall hop my custom sir i ll none it henc make your best it katherina i never saw better fashion d gown more quaint more pleas nor more commend belik you mean make puppet me petruchio whi true he mean make puppet thee tailor she say your worship mean make puppet her petruchio o monstrou arrog thou liest thou thread thou thimbl thou yard three quarter half yard quarter nail thou flea thou nit thou winter cricket thou brav d mine own hous skein thread away thou rag thou quantiti thou remnant or i shall so be mete thee thi yard as thou shalt think prate whilst thou liv st i tell thee i that thou hast marr d her gown tailor your worship is deceiv d gown is made just as my master had direct grumio gave order how it should be done grumio i gave him no order i gave him stuff tailor but how did you desir it should be made grumio marri sir needl thread tailor but did you not request have it cut grumio thou hast face mani thing tailor i have grumio face not me thou hast brave mani men brave not me i will neither be fac d nor brav d i say unto thee i bid thi master cut gown but i did not bid him cut it piec ergo thou liest tailor whi here is note fashion testifi petruchio read it grumio note lie s throat if he say i said so tailor imprimi loos bodi gown grumio master if ever i said loos bodi gown sew me skirt it beat me death bottom brown thread i said gown petruchio proceed tailor small compass cape grumio i confess cape tailor trunk sleev grumio i confess two sleev tailor sleev curious cut petruchio ay there s villaini grumio error i bill sir error i bill i command sleev should be cut sew d again that i ll prove thee though thi littl finger be arm thimbl tailor thi is true that i say i had thee place where thou shouldst know it grumio i am thee straight take thou bill give me thi mete yard spare not me hortensio god merci grumio then he shall have no odd petruchio well sir brief gown is not me grumio you are i right sir ti my mistress petruchio go take it unto thi master s use grumio villain not thi life take my mistress gown thi master s use petruchio whi sir what s your conceit that grumio o sir conceit is deeper than you think take my mistress gown hi master s use o fie fie fie petruchio _aside_ hortensio say thou wilt see tailor paid _to tailor _ go take it henc be gone say no more hortensio _asid tailor _ tailor i ll pay thee thi gown tomorrow take no unkind hi hasti word away i say commend me thi master _exit tailor _ petruchio well come my kate we will unto your father s even these honest mean habili our purs shall be proud our garment poor ti mind that make bodi rich as sun break darkest cloud so honour peereth meanest habit what is jay more preciou than lark becaus hi feather are more beauti or is adder better than eel becaus hi paint skin content eye o no good kate neither art thou wors thi poor furnitur mean array if thou account st it shame lay it me therefor frolic we will henc forthwith feast sport us thi father s hous go call my men let us straight him bring our hors unto long lane end there will we mount thither walk foot let s see i think ti now some seven o clock well we may come there dinner time katherina i dare assur you sir ti almost two twill be supper time ere you come there petruchio it shall be seven ere i go hors look what i speak or do or think do you are still cross it sir let t alon i will not go today ere i do it shall be what o clock i say it is hortensio whi so thi gallant will command sun _exeunt _ scene iv padua baptista s hous enter tranio pedant dress like vincentio tranio sir thi is hous pleas it you that i call pedant ay what els but i be deceiv signior baptista may rememb me near twenti year ago genoa where we were lodger pegasu tranio ti well hold your own ani case such auster as longeth father pedant i warrant you but sir here come your boy twere good he were school d enter biondello tranio fear you not him sirrah biondello now do your duti throughli i advis you imagin twere right vincentio biondello tut fear soft son sir your leav have come padua gather some debt my son lucentio made me acquaint weighti caus love your daughter himself good report i hear you love he beareth your daughter she him stay him signior baptista whom i hear so well baptista sir pardon me what i have say your plain your short pleas me well right true it is your son lucentio here doth love my daughter she loveth him or both dissembl deepli their affect therefor if you say no more than thi that like father you will deal him pass my daughter suffici dower match is made all is done your son shall have my daughter consent old gremio is hearken still happili we might be interrupt tranio then my lodg it like you there doth my father lie there thi night we ll pass busi privat well send your daughter your servant here my lucentio gentl sir petruchio happili met happier thi son now law as well as reverend age i may entitl thee my love father sister my wife thi gentlewoman thi son thi hath marri wonder not nor be not wonder if you talk wonder hortensio so it is i wonder what it bode petruchio marri peac it bode love quiet life aw rule right supremaci be short what not that s sweet happi baptista now fair befal show more sign her obedi her new built virtu obedi see where she come bring your froward wive as prison her womanli persuas re enter katherina bianca widow katherin that cap your becom you not off that baubl throw it underfoot _katherina pull off her cap throw it down _ widow lord let me never have caus sigh till i be brought such silli pass bianca fie what foolish duti call you thi lucentio i would your duti were as foolish too wisdom your duti fair bianca hath cost me hundr crown supper time bianca more fool you lay my duti petruchio katherin i charg thee tell these headstrong women what duti they do owe their lord husband widow come come you re mock we will have no tell petruchio come i say first begin her widow she shall not petruchio i say she shall first begin her katherina fie fie unknit that threaten unkind brow dart not scorn glanc those eye wound thi lord thi king thi governor it blot thi beauti as frost do bite mead confound thi fame as whirlwind shake fair bud no sens is meet or amiabl woman mov d is like fountain troubl muddi ill seem thick bereft beauti while it is so none so dri or thirsti will deign sip or touch one drop it thi husband is thi lord thi life thi keeper thi head thi sovereign one that care thee thi mainten commit hi bodi pain labour both sea land watch night storm day cold whilst thou liest warm home secur safe crave no other tribut thi hand but love fair look true obedi too littl payment so great debt such duti as subject owe princ even such woman oweth her husband when she is froward peevish sullen sour not obedi hi honest will what is she but foul contend rebel graceless traitor her love lord i am asham d that women are so simpl offer war where they should kneel peac or seek rule supremaci sway when they are bound serv love obey whi are our bodi soft weak smooth unapt toil troubl world but that our soft condit our heart should well agre our extern part come come you froward unabl worm my mind hath been as big as one your my heart as great my reason hapli more bandi word word frown frown but now i see our lanc are but straw our strength as weak our weak past compar that seem be most which we inde least are then vail your stomach it is no boot place your hand your husband s foot token which duti if he pleas my hand is readi may it do him eas petruchio whi there s wench come kiss me kate lucentio well go thi way old lad thou shalt ha t vincentio ti good hear when children are lucentio but harsh hear when women are froward petruchio come kate we ll bed we three are marri but you two are sped twa i won wager _to lucentio _ though you hit white be winner god give you good night _exeunt petrucio katherina _ hortensio now go thi way thou hast tam d curst shrew lucentio ti wonder your leav she will be tam d so brother awak d evil natur my trust like good parent did beget him falsehood it contrari as great as my trust wa which had inde no limit confid san bound he be thu lord not onli what my revenu yield whereon treacher armi levi one midnight fate th purpos did antonio open gate milan i th dead dark minist th purpos hurri thenc me thi cri self miranda alack piti i not rememb ring how i cri then will cri it o er again it is hint that wring mine eye t prospero hear littl further then i ll bring thee present busi which now s us which thi stori were most impertin miranda wherefor did they not that hour destroy us prospero well demand wench my tale provok that question dear they durst not so dear love my peopl bore me nor set mark so bloodi busi but colour fairer paint their foul end few they more profit than other princ can that have more time vainer hour tutor not so care miranda heaven thank you t now i pray you sir still ti beat my mind your reason rais thi sea storm prospero know thu abhor slave which ani print good wilt not take be capabl all ill i piti thee took pain make thee speak taught thee each hour one thing or other when thou didst not savag know thine own mean but thought have told thee it but i fear d lest i might anger thee prospero say again where didst thou leav these varlet ariel i told you sir they were red hot drink so full valour that they smote air breath their face beat ground kiss their feet yet alway bend their project then i beat my tabor which like unback d colt they prick d their ear advanc d their eyelid lift their nose as they smelt music so i charm d their ear that calf like they my low follow d tooth d brier sharp furz prick goss thorn which enter d their frail shin last i left them i th filthi mantl pool your cell there danc th chin that foul lake o erstunk their feet prospero thi wa well done my bird thi shape invis retain thou still trumperi my hous go bring it hither stale catch these thiev ariel i go i go _exit _ prospero devil born devil whose natur nurtur can never stick whom my pain human taken all all lost quit lost as age hi bodi uglier grow so hi mind canker i will plagu them all even roar re enter ariel loaden glister apparel c come hang them thi line prospero ariel remain invis enter caliban stephano trinculo all wet caliban pray you tread softli that blind mole may not hear foot fall we now are near hi cell stephano monster your fairi which you say is harmless fairi ha done littl better than play jack us trinculo monster i do smell all hors piss which my nose is great indign stephano so is mine do you hear monster if i should take displeasur against you look you trinculo thou wert but lost monster caliban good my lord give me thi favour still be patient prize i ll bring thee shall more me than my wet yet thi is your harmless fairi monster stephano i will fetch off my bottl though i be o er ear my labour caliban prithe my king be quiet seest thou here thi is mouth o th cell no their kind that relish all as sharpli passion as they be kindlier mov d than thou art though their high wrong i am struck th quick yet my nobler reason gainst my furi do i take part rarer action is virtu than vengeanc they be penit sole drift my purpos doth extend not frown further go releas them ariel my charm i ll break their sens i ll restor they shall be themselv ariel i ll fetch them sir roar war dread rattl thunder have i given fire rift jove s stout oak hi own bolt strong ba d promontori have i made shake spur pluck d pine cedar grave my command have wak d their sleeper op d let em forth my so potent art but thi rough magic i here abjur when i have requir d some heavenli music which even now i do work mine end their sens that thi airi charm is i ll break my staff buri it certain fathom earth deeper than did ever plummet sound i ll drown my book _solem music _ re enter ariel him alonso frantic gestur attend gonzalo sebastian antonio like manner attend adrian francisco they all draught confound them some cours come me i ll give you gold enough both name them my lord let s know them timon you that way you thi but two compani each man apart all singl alon yet arch villain keep him compani painter if where thou art two villian shall not be come not near him poet if thou wouldst not resid but where one villain is then him abandon henc pack there s gold you came gold ye slave painter you have work me there s payment henc poet you are alchemist make gold that rascal dog beat drive them enter flaviu two senat flaviu it is vain that you would speak timon he is set so onli himself that noth but himself which look like man is friendli him first senat bring us hi cave it is our part promis th athenian speak timon second senat all time alik men are not still same twa time grief that fram d him thu time hi fairer hand offer fortun hi former day former man may make him bring us him chanc it as it may flaviu here is hi cave peac content be here lord timon timon look speak root o th tongu consum it speak first senat worthi timon timon none but such as you you timon first senat senat athen greet thee timon timon i thank them would send them back plagu could i but catch it them first senat o forget what we are sorri ourselv thee senat one consent love entreat thee back athen who have thought special digniti which vacant lie thi best use wear second senat they confess thee forget too gener gross which now public bodi which doth seldom play recant feel itself lack timon s aid hath sens withal it own fail restrain aid timon send forth us make their sorrow render togeth recompens more fruit than their offenc can weigh down dram ay even such heap sum love wealth as shall thee blot what wrong were their write thee figur their love ever read them thine timon you shalt be met thank allow d absolut power thi good name live author so soon we shall drive back alcibiad th approach wild who like boar too savag doth root hi countri s peac second senat shake hi threat ning sword against wall athen first senat therefor timon timon well sir i will therefor i will sir thu if alcibiad kill my countrymen let alcibiad know thi timon that timon care not but if he sack fair athen take our goodli age men th beard give our holi virgin stain contumeli beastli mad brain d war then let him know tell him timon speak it piti our age our youth i cannot choos but tell him that i care not let him take t worst their knive care not while you have throat answer myself there s not whittl th unruli camp but i do prize it my love reverend st throat athen so i leav you protect prosper god as thiev keeper flaviu stay not all s vain timon whi i wa write my epitaph it will be seen morrow my long sick health live now begin mend noth bring me all thing go live still be alcibiad your plagu you hi last so long enough first senat we speak vain timon but yet i love my countri am not one that rejoic common wreck as common bruit doth put it first senat that s well spoke timon commend me my love countrymen first senat these word becom your lip as they pass them second senat enter our ear like great triumpher their applaud gate timon commend me them tell them that eas them their grief their fear hostil stroke their ach loss their pang love other incid throe that natur s fragil vessel doth sustain life s uncertain voyag i will some kind do them i ll teach them athen sequenc degre high low that whoso pleas stop afflict let him take hi hast come hither ere my tree hath felt axe hang himself i pray you do my greet flaviu troubl him no further thu you still shall find him timon come not me again but say athen timon hath made hi everlast mansion beach verg salt flood who onc day hi emboss froth turbul surg shall cover thither come let my graveston be your are unremov coupl natur second senat our hope him is dead let us return strain what other mean is left unto us our dear peril first senat it requir swift foot exeunt scene ii wall athen enter two bring not timon messeng i met courier one mine ancient friend whom though gener part we were oppo d yet our old love had particular forc made us speak like friend thi man wa ride alcibiad timon s cave alcibiad sound thi coward lascivi town our terribl approach sound parley senat appear wall till now you have gone fill d time all licenti measur make your will scope justic till now myself such as slept shadow your power have wander d our traver d arm breath d our suffer vainli now time is flush when crouch marrow bearer strong cri itself no more now breathless wrong shall sit pant your great chair eas pursi insol shall break hi wind fear horrid flight first senat nobl young when thi first grief were but mere conceit ere thou hadst power or we had caus fear we sent thee give thi rage balm wipe our ingratitud love their quantiti second senat so did we woo transform timon our citi s love humbl messag promi d mean we were not all unkind nor all deserv common stroke war first senat these wall our were not erect their hand whom you have receiv d your grief nor are they such that these great tow rs trophi school should fall privat fault them second senat nor are they live who were motiv that you first went shame that they want cun excess hath broke their heart march nobl lord our citi thi banner spread decim tith death if thi reveng hunger that food which natur loath take thou destin d tenth hazard spot die let die spot first senat all have not offend those that were it is not squar take those that are reveng crime like land are not inherit then dear countryman bring thi rank but leav thi rage spare thi athenian cradl those kin which bluster thi wrath must fall those that have offend like shepherd approach fold cull th infect forth but kill not all togeth second senat what thou wilt thou rather shalt enforc it thi smile than hew t thi sword first senat set but thi foot against our rampir d gate they shall ope so thou wilt send thi gentl heart say thou t enter friendli second senat throw thi glove or ani token thine honour els that thou wilt use war as thi redress not as our confus all thi power shall make their harbour our town till we have seal d thi full desir quarter or offend stream regular justic your citi s bound but shall be render d your public law heaviest answer both ti most nobli spoken alcibiad descend keep your word senat descend open gate enter turn chiron ay so turn were serv demetriu aaron thou hast hit it aaron would you had hit it too then should not we be tir d thi ado whi hark ye hark ye are you such fool squar thi would it offend you then that both should speed chiron faith not me demetriu nor me so i were one aaron shame be friend join that you jar ti polici stratagem must do that you affect so must you resolv that what you cannot as you would achiev you must perforc accomplish as you may take thi me lucrec wa not more chast than thi lavinia bassianu love speedier cours than ling ring languish must we pursu i have found path my lord solemn hunt is hand there will love roman ladi troop forest walk are wide spaciou mani unfrequ plot there are fit kind rape villaini singl you thither then thi dainti doe strike her home forc if not word thi way or not all stand you hope come come our empress her sacr wit villaini vengeanc consecr will we acquaint all what we intend she shall file our engin advic that will not suffer you squar yourselv but your wish height advanc you both emperor s court is like hous fame palac full tongu eye ear wood are ruthless dread deaf dull there speak strike brave boy take your turn there serv your lust shadow heaven s eye revel lavinia s treasuri chiron thi counsel lad smell no cowardic demetriu sit fa aut nefa till i find stream cool thi heat charm calm these fit styga mane vehor exeunt scene ii forest near rome enter titu andronicu hi three son luciu quintu martiu make nois hound horn marcu titu hunt is morn is bright grey field are fragrant wood are green uncoupl here let us make bay wake emperor hi love bride rous princ ring hunter s peal that all court may echo nois son let it be your charg as it is our attend emperor s person care i have been troubl my sleep thi night but dawn day new comfort hath inspir d here cri hound wind horn peal then enter saturninu tamora bassianu lavinia chiron demetriu their attend mani good morrow your majesti madam you as mani as good i promis your grace hunter s peal saturninu you have rung it lustili my lord somewhat too earli new marri ladi bassianu lavinia how say you lavinia i say no i have been broad awak two hour more saturninu come then hors chariot let us have our sport tamora madam now shall ye see our roman hunt marcu i have dog my lord will rous proudest panther chase climb highest promontori top titu i have hors will follow where game make way run like swallow o er plain demetriu chiron we hunt not we hors nor hound but hope pluck dainti doe ground exeunt scene iii lone part forest enter aaron alon bag gold aaron he that had wit would think that i had none buri so much gold tree never inherit it let him that think me so abjectli know that thi gold must coin stratagem which cunningli effect will beget veri excel piec villaini so repos sweet gold their unrest hide gold that have their alm empress chest enter tamora alon moor tamora my love aaron wherefor look st thou sad when everyth doe make gleeful boast bird chant melodi everi bush snake lie roll cheer sun green leav quiver cool wind make chequer d shadow ground their sweet shade aaron let us sit while babbl echo mock hound repli shrilli well tun d horn as if doubl hunt were heard onc let us sit down mark their yellow nois conflict such as wa suppo d wand ring princ dido onc enjoy when happi storm they were surpri d curtain d counsel keep cave we may each wreath other s arm our pastim done possess golden slumber while hound horn sweet melodi bird be unto us as is nurs s song lullabi bring her babe asleep aaron madam though venu govern your desir saturn is domin mine what signifi my deadli stand eye my silenc my cloudi melancholi my fleec woolli hair that now uncurl even as adder when she doth unrol do some fatal execut no madam these are no vener sign vengeanc is my heart death my hand blood reveng are hammer my head hark tamora empress my soul which never hope more heaven than rest thee thi is day doom bassianu hi philomel must lose her tongu day thi son make pillag her chastiti wash their hand bassianu blood seest thou thi letter take it i pray thee give king thi fatal plot scroll now question me no more we are espi here come parcel our hope booti which dread not yet their live destruct enter bassianu lavinia tamora ah my sweet moor sweeter me than life aaron no more great empress bassianu come be cross him i ll go fetch thi son back thi quarrel whatso er they be exit bassianu who have we here rome s royal emperess unfurnish d her well beseem troop or is it dian habit like her who hath abandon her holi grove see gener hunt thi forest tamora sauci control my privat step had i pow r that some say dian had thi templ should be plant present horn as wa actaeon s hound should drive thi new transform limb unmannerli intrud as thou art lavinia your patienc gentl emperess ti thought you have goodli gift horn be doubt that your moor you are singl forth tri thi experi jove shield your husband hi hound day ti piti they should take him stag bassianu believ me queen your swarth cimmerian doth make your honour hi bodi s hue spot detest abomin whi are you sequest red all your train dismount your snow white goodli steed wand red hither obscur plot accompani but barbar moor if foul desir had not conduct you lavinia be intercept your sport great reason that my nobl lord be rate sauci i pray you let us henc let her joy her raven colour love thi valley fit purpos pass well bassianu king my brother shall have notic thi lavinia ay these slip have made him note long good king be so mightili abus tamora whi i have patienc endur all thi enter chiron demetriu demetriu how now dear sovereign our graciou mother whi doth your high look so pale wan tamora have i not reason think you look pale these two have tice me hither thi place barren detest vale you see it is tree though summer yet forlorn lean overcom moss bale mistleto here never shine sun here noth breed unless nightli owl or fatal raven when they show d me thi abhor pit they told me here dead time night thousand fiend thousand hiss snake ten thousand swell toad as mani urchin would make such fear confus cri as ani mortal bodi hear it should straight fall mad or els die suddenli no sooner had they told thi hellish tale but straight they told me they would bind me here unto bodi dismal yew leav me thi miser death then they call d me foul adulteress lascivi goth all bitterest term that ever ear did hear such effect had you not wondrou fortun come thi vengeanc me had they execut reveng it as you love your mother s life or be ye not henceforth call d my children demetriu thi is wit that i am thi son stab bassianu chiron thi me struck home show my strength also stab lavinia ay come semirami nay barbar tamora no name fit thi natur but thi own tamora give me poniard you shall know my boy your mother s hand shall right your mother s wrong demetriu stay madam here is more belong her first thrash corn then burn straw thi minion stood her chastiti her nuptial vow her loyalti that paint hope brave your mighti shall she carri thi unto her grave chiron if she do i would i were eunuch drag henc her husband some secret hole make hi dead trunk pillow our lust tamora but when ye have honey we desir let not thi wasp outliv us both sting chiron i warrant you madam we will make that sure come mistress now perforc we will enjoy that nice preserv honesti your lavinia o tamora thou bearest woman s face tamora i will not hear her speak away her lavinia sweet lord entreat her hear me but word demetriu listen fair madam let it be your glori see her tear but be your heart them as unrel flint drop rain lavinia when did tiger s young one teach dam o do not learn her wrath she taught it thee milk thou suck dst her did turn marbl even thi teat thou hadst thi tyranni yet everi mother breed not son alik chiron do thou entreat her show woman s piti chiron what wouldst thou have me prove myself bastard lavinia ti true raven doth not hatch lark yet have i heard o could i find it now lion mov d piti did endur have hi princ paw par d all away some say that raven foster forlorn children whilst their own bird famish their nest o be me though thi hard heart say no noth so kind but someth piti tamora i know not what it mean away her lavinia o let me teach thee my father s sake that gave thee life when well he might have slain thee be not obdur open thi deaf ear tamora hadst thou person ne er offend me even hi sake am i pitiless rememb boy i pour d forth tear vain save your brother sacrific but fierc andronicu would not relent therefor away her use her as you will wors her better lov d me lavinia o tamora be call d gentl queen thine own hand kill me thi place ti not life that i have begg d so long poor i wa slain when bassianu die tamora what beg st thou then fond woman let me go lavinia ti present death i beg one thing more that womanhood deni my tongu tell o keep me their wors than kill lust tumbl me some loathsom pit where never man s eye may behold my bodi do thi be charit murder tamora so should i rob my sweet son their fee no let them satisfi their lust thee demetriu away thou hast stay d us here too long lavinia no grace no womanhood ah beastli creatur blot enemi our gener name confus fall chiron nay then i ll stop your mouth bring thou her husband thi is hole where aaron bid us hide him demetriu throw bodi bassianu pit then exeunt demetriu chiron drag off lavinia tamora farewel my son see that you make her sure ne er let my heart know merri cheer inde till all andronici be made away now will i henc seek my love moor let my spleen son thi trull deflow exit re enter aaron two titu son quintu martiu aaron come my lord better foot straight will i bring you loathsom pit where i espi panther fast asleep quintu my sight is veri dull whate er it bode martiu mine i promis you were it not shame well could i leav our sport sleep awhil fall pit quintu what art thou fallen what subtl hole is thi whose mouth is cover rude grow brier whose leav are drop new shed blood as fresh as morn dew distil d flower veri fatal place it seem me speak brother hast thou hurt thee fall martiu o brother dismal st object hurt that ever eye sight made heart lament aaron asid now will i fetch king find them here that he therebi may have like guess how these were they that made away hi brother exit martiu whi dost not comfort me help me thi unhallow d blood stain hole quintu i am surpris uncouth fear chill sweat o er run my trembl joint my heart suspect more than mine eye can see martiu pyramu when he night lay bath d maiden blood o brother help me thi faint hand if fear hath made thee faint as me it hath thi fell devour receptacl as hate as cocytu misti mouth quintu reach me thi some murder let them not speak word guilt is plain my soul were there wors end than death that end them should be execut tamora andronicu i will entreat king fear not thi son they shall do well enough titu come luciu come stay not talk them exeunt scene iv anoth part forest enter empress son demetriu chiron lavinia her hand cut off her tongu cut ravish d demetriu so now go tell if thi tongu can demetriu chiron wind horn enter marcu hunt marcu who is thi my niec that fli away so fast cousin word where is your husband if i do dream would all my wealth would wake me if i do wake some planet strike me down that i may slumber etern sleep speak gentl niec what stern ungentl hand hath lopp d hew d made thi bodi bare her two branch those sweet ornament whose circl shadow king have sought sleep might not gain so great happi as half thi love whi dost not speak me ala crimson river warm blood like bubbl fountain stirr d wind doth rise fall thi rose lip come go thi honey breath but sure some tereu hath deflow thee lest thou shouldst detect him cut thi tongu ah now thou turn st away thi face shame notwithstand all thi loss blood as conduit three issu spout yet do thi cheek look red as titan s face blush be encount red cloud shall i speak thee shall i say ti so o that i knew thi heart knew beast that i might rail him eas my mind sorrow conceal like oven stopp d doth burn heart cinder where it is fair philomel whi she but lost her tongu tediou sampler sew d her mind but love niec that mean is cut thee craftier tereu cousin hast thou met he hath cut those pretti finger off that could have better sew d than philomel o had monster seen those lili hand trembl like aspen leav lute make silken string delight kiss them he would not then have touch d them hi life or had he heard heavenli harmoni which that sweet tongu hath made he would have dropp d hi knife fell asleep as cerberu thracian poet s feet come let us go make thi father blind such sight will blind father s eye one hour s storm will drown fragrant mead what will whole month tear thi father s eye do not draw back we will mourn thee o could our mourn case thi miseri exeunt act iii scene i rome street enter judg tribun senat titu two son martiu quintu bound pass stage place execut titu go plead titu hear me grave father nobl tribun stay piti mine age whose youth wa spent danger war whilst you secur slept all my blood rome s great quarrel shed all frosti night that i have watch d these bitter tear which now you see fill age wrinkl my cheek be piti my condemn son whose soul are not corrupt as ti thought two twenti son i never wept becaus they die honour s lofti bed andronicu lieth down judg pass him prison exeunt these tribun dust i write my heart s deep languor my soul s sad tear let my tear stanch earth s dri appetit my son sweet blood will make it shame blush o earth i will befriend thee more rain that shall distil these two ancient urn than youth april shall all hi show rs summer s drought i ll drop thee still winter warm tear i ll melt snow keep etern spring time thi face so thou refus drink my dear son blood enter luciu hi weapon drawn o reverend tribun o gentl age men unbind my son revers doom death let me say that never wept my tear are now prevail orat luciu o nobl father you lament vain tribun hear you not no man is you recount your sorrow stone titu ah luciu thi brother let me plead grave tribun onc more i entreat you luciu my graciou lord no tribun hear you speak titu whi ti no matter man if they did hear they would not mark me if they did mark they would not piti me yet plead i must bootless unto them therefor i tell my sorrow stone who though they cannot answer my distress yet some sort they are better than tribun that they will not intercept my tale when i do weep they humbl my feet receiv my tear seem weep me were they but attir grave weed rome could afford no tribun like these stone is soft as wax tribun more hard than stone stone is silent offendeth not tribun their tongu doom men death rise but wherefor stand st thou thi weapon drawn luciu rescu my two brother their death which attempt judg have pronounc d my everlast doom banish titu o happi man they have befriend thee whi foolish luciu dost thou not perceiv that rome is but wilder tiger tiger must prey rome afford no prey but me mine how happi art thou then these devour be banish but who come our brother marcu here enter marcu lavinia marcu titu prepar thi age eye weep or if not so thi nobl heart break i bring consum sorrow thine age titu will it consum me let me see it then marcu thi wa thi daughter titu whi marcu so she is luciu ay me thi object kill me titu faint heart boy aris look her speak lavinia what accurs hand hath made thee handless thi father s sight what fool hath ad water sea or brought fagot bright burn troy my grief wa height thou cam st now like nilu it disdaineth bound give me sword i ll chop off my hand too they have fought rome all vain they have nur d thi woe feed life bootless prayer have they been held they have serv d me effectless use now all servic i requir them is that one will help cut other ti well lavinia that thou hast no hand hand do rome servic is but vain luciu speak gentl sister who hath martyr d thee marcu o that delight engin her thought that blabb d them such pleas eloqu is torn forth that pretti hollow cage where like sweet melodi bird it sung sweet vari note enchant everi ear luciu o say thou her who hath done thi deed marcu o thu i found her stray park seek hide herself as doth deer that hath receiv d some unrecur wound titu it wa my dear he that wound her hath hurt me more than had he kill d me dead now i stand as one rock environ d wilder sea who mark wax tide grow wave wave expect ever when some enviou surg will hi brinish bowel swallow him thi way death my wretch son are gone here stand my other son banish d man here my brother weep my woe but that which give my soul greatest spurn is dear lavinia dearer than my soul had i but seen thi pictur thi plight it would have mad me what shall i do now i behold thi live bodi so thou hast no hand wipe away thi tear nor tongu tell me who hath martyr d thee thi husband he is dead hi death thi brother are condemn d dead thi look marcu ah son luciu look her when i did name her brother then fresh tear stood her cheek as doth honey dew gath red lili almost wither marcu perchanc she weep becaus they kill d her husband perchanc becaus she know them innoc titu if they did kill thi husband then be joy becaus law hath ta en reveng them no no they would not do so foul deed wit sorrow that their sister make gentl lavinia let me kiss thi lip or make some sign how i may do thee eas shall thi good uncl thi brother luciu thou i sit round some fountain look all downward behold our cheek how they are stain d like meadow yet not dri miri slime left them flood fountain shall we gaze so long till fresh tast be taken that clear made brine pit our bitter tear or shall we cut away our hand like thine or shall we bite our tongu dumb show pass remaind our hate day what shall we do let us that have our tongu plot some devic further miseri make us wonder d time come luciu sweet father ceas your tear your grief see how my wretch sister sob weep marcu patienc dear niec good titu dri thine eye titu ah marcu marcu brother well i wot thi napkin cannot drink tear mine thou poor man hast drown d it thine own luciu ah my lavinia i will wipe thi cheek titu mark marcu mark i understand her sign had she tongu speak now would she say that her as these are meet pluck therefor mine luciu sweet father if i shall be thought thi son let me redeem my brother both death marcu our father s sake mother s care now let me show brother s love thee titu agre you i will spare my hand luciu then i ll go fetch axe marcu but i will use axe exeunt luciu marcu titu come hither aaron i ll deceiv them both lend me thi hand i will give thee mine aaron asid if that be call d deceit i will be honest never whilst i live deceiv men so but i ll deceiv you anoth sort that you ll say ere half hour pass he cut off titu hand re enter luciu marcu titu now it let fool do good fair men call grace aaron will have hi soul black like hi face exit titu o here i lift thi one hand heaven bow thi feebl ruin earth if ani power piti wretch tear that i call brother speak possibl do not break these deep extrem titu is not my sorrow deep have no bottom then be my passion bottomless them marcu but yet let reason govern thi lament titu if there were reason these miseri then limit could i bind my woe when heaven doth weep doth not earth o erflow if wind rage doth not sea wax mad threat ning welkin hi big swol n face wilt thou have reason thi coil i am sea hark how her sigh do blow she is weep welkin i earth then must my sea be move her sigh then must my earth her continu tear becom delug overflow d drown d whi my bowel cannot hide her woe but like drunkard must i vomit them then give me leav loser will have leav eas their stomach their bitter tongu enter messeng two head hand messeng worthi andronicu ill art thou repaid that good hand thou sent let hot aetna cool sicili be my heart ever burn hell these miseri are more than may be born weep them that weep doth eas some deal but sorrow flout is doubl death luciu ah that thi sight should make so deep wound yet detest life not shrink thereat that ever death should let life bear hi name where life hath no more interest but breath lavinia kiss titu marcu ala poor heart that kiss is how troy wa burnt he made miser o handl not theme talk hand lest we rememb still that we have none fie fie how franticli i squar my talk as if we should forget we had no hand if marcu did not name word hand come let s fall gentl girl eat thi here is no drink hark marcu what she say i can interpret all her martyr d sign she say she drink no other drink but tear brew d her sorrow mesh d her cheek speechless complain i will learn thi thought thi dumb action will i be as perfect as beg hermit their holi prayer thou shalt not sigh nor hold thi stump heaven nor wink nor nod nor kneel nor make sign ala poor man grief ha so wrought him he take fals shadow true substanc titu come take away lavinia go me i ll thi closet go read thee sad stori chanc time old come boy go me thi sight is young thou love me as dear as e er my mother did would not but furi fright my youth which made me down throw my book fli causeless perhap but pardon me sweet aunt madam if my uncl marcu go i will most willingli jest both her sweet hand her tongu that more dear than hand or tongu her spotless chastiti inhuman traitor you constrain d forc d what would you say if i should let you speak villain shame you could not beg grace hark wretch how i mean martyr you thi one hand yet is left cut your throat while that lavinia tween her stump doth hold basin that receiv your guilti blood you know your mother mean feast me call herself reveng think me mad hark villain i will grind your bone dust your blood it i ll make past past coffin i will rear make two pasti your shame head bid that strumpet your unhallow dam like earth swallow her own increas thi is feast that i have bid her thi banquet she shall surfeit wors than philomel you us d my daughter wors than progn i will be reveng d now prepar your throat lavinia come receiv blood when that they are dead let me go grind their bone powder small thi hate liquor temper it that past let their vile head be bak d come come be everi one offici make thi banquet which i wish may prove more stern bloodi than centaur feast he cut their throat so now bring them i will play cook see them readi against their mother come exeunt bear dead bodi scene iii knife s sharp point he stab empress saturninu die frantic wretch thi accurs deed he stab titu luciu can son s eye behold hi father bleed there s meed meed death deadli deed he stab saturninu great tumult luciu marcu their friend go balconi marcu you sad fac d men peopl son rome uproar sever d as flight fowl scatter d wind high tempestu gust o let me teach you how knit again thi scatter corn one mutual sheaf these broken limb again one bodi lest rome herself be bane unto herself she whom mighti kingdom curtsi like forlorn desper castaway do shame execut herself but if my frosti sign chap age grave wit true experi cannot induc you attend my word luciu speak rome s dear friend as erst our ancestor when hi solemn tongu he did discours love sick dido s sad attend ear stori that bale burn night when subtl greek surpri d king priam s troy tell us what sinon hath bewitch d our ear or who hath brought fatal engin that give our troy our rome civil wound my heart is not compact flint nor steel nor can i utter all our bitter grief but flood tear will drown my oratori break my utt ranc even time when it should move ye attend me most forc you commiser here s rome s young captain let him tell tale while i stand weep hear him speak luciu then graciou auditori be it known you that chiron damn d demetriu were they that murd red our emperor s brother they it were that ravish our sister their fell fault our brother were behead our father s tear despi d base cozen d that true hand that fought rome s quarrel sent her enemi unto grave lastli myself unkindli banish gate shut me turn d weep beg relief rome s enemi who drown d their enmiti my true tear op d their arm embrac me as friend i am turn forth be it known you that have preserv d her welfar my blood her bosom took enemi s hath set these jaundi o er your cheek ampl proposit that hope make all design begun earth fail promi d larg check disast grow vein action highest rear d as knot conflux meet sap infect sound pine divert hi grain tortiv errant hi cours growth nor princ is it matter new us that we come short our suppos so far that seven year sieg yet troy wall stand sith everi action that hath gone whereof we have record trial did draw bia thwart not answer aim that unbodi figur thought that gave t surmis shape whi then you princ do you cheek abash d behold our work call them shame which are inde naught els but protract trial great jove find persist constanc men fine which metal is not found fortun s love then bold coward wise fool artist unread hard soft seem all affin d kin but wind tempest her frown distinct broad power fan puf all winnow light away what hath mass or matter itself lie rich virtu unmingl nestor due observ thi godlik seat great agamemnon nestor shall appli thi latest word reproof chanc lie true proof men sea be smooth how mani shallow baubl boat dare sail her patient breast make their way those nobler bulk but let ruffian borea onc enrag gentl theti anon behold strong ribb d bark liquid mountain cut bound two moist element like perseu hors where s then sauci boat whose weak untimb d side but even now co rival d great either harbour fled or made toast neptun even so doth valour s show valour s worth divid storm fortun her ray bright herd hath more annoy breez than tiger but when split wind make flexibl knee knot oak fli fled shade whi then thing courag as rou d rage rage doth sympathis accent tun d self same key retort chide fortun ulyss agamemnon thou great command nerv bone greec heart our number soul onli spirit whom temper mind all should be shut hear what ulyss speak besid th applaus approb which _to agamemnon_ most mighti thi place sway _to nestor_ thou most reverend thi stretch d life i give both your speech which were such as agamemnon hand greec should hold high brass such again as vener nestor hatch d silver should bond air strong as axl tree which heaven ride knit all greekish ear hi experienc d tongu yet let it pleas both thou great wise hear ulyss speak agamemnon speak princ ithaca be t less expect that matter needless importless burden divid thi lip than we are confid when rank thersit ope hi mastic jaw we shall hear music wit oracl ulyss troy yet hi basi had been down great hector s sword had lack d master but these instanc specialti rule hath been neglect look how mani grecian tent do stand hollow thi plain so mani hollow faction when that gener is not like hive whom forag shall all repair what honey is expect degre be vizard th unworthiest show as fairli mask heaven themselv planet thi centr observ degre prioriti place insistur cours proport season form offic custom all line order therefor is gloriou planet sol nobl emin enthron d spher d amidst other whose med cinabl eye correct influenc evil planet post like command king san check good bad but when planet evil mixtur disord wander what plagu what portent what mutini what rage sea shake earth commot wind fright chang horror divert crack rend deracin uniti marri calm state quit their fixtur o when degre is shak d which is ladder all high design enterpris is sick how could commun degre school brotherhood citi peac commerc divid shore primogen due birth prerog age crown sceptr laurel but degre stand authent place take but degre away untun that string hark what discord follow each thing melt mere oppugn bound water should lift their bosom higher than shore make sop all thi solid globe strength should be lord imbecil rude son should strike hi father dead forc should be right or rather right wrong whose endless jar justic resid should lose their name so should justic too then everyth includ itself power power will will appetit appetit univers wolf so doubli second will power must make perforc univers prey last eat himself great agamemnon thi chao when degre is suffoc follow choke thi neglect degre it is that pace goe backward purpos it hath climb gener s disdain d him one step he next that next him beneath so everi step exampl d first pace that is sick hi superior grow enviou fever pale bloodless emul ti thi fever that keep troy foot not her own sinew end tale length troy our weak stand not her strength nestor most wise hath ulyss here discov d fever whereof all our power is sick agamemnon natur sick found ulyss what is remedi ulyss great achil whom opinion crown sinew forehand our host have hi ear full hi airi fame grow dainti hi worth hi tent lie mock our design him patroclu lazi bed livelong day break scurril jest ridicul awkward action which slander he imit call he pageant us sometim great agamemnon thi topless deput he put like strut player whose conceit lie hi hamstr doth think it rich hear wooden dialogu sound twixt hi stretch d foot scaffoldag such be piti o er wrest seem he act thi great when he speak ti like chime mend term unsquar d which tongu roar typhon dropp d would seem hyperbol thi fusti stuff larg achil hi press d bed loll hi deep chest laugh loud applaus cri excel ti agamemnon right now play me fight fals vantag or base treacheri first outlaw whi ne er repent it if it were done so but were you banish d so small fault valentin i wa held me glad such doom second outlaw have you tongu valentin my youth travel therein made me happi or els i often had been miser third outlaw bare scalp robin hood s fat friar thi fellow were king our wild faction first outlaw we ll have him sir word speed master be one them it s honour kind thieveri valentin peac villain second outlaw tell us thi have you anyth take valentin noth but my fortun third outlaw know then that some us are gentlemen such as furi ungovern d youth thrust compani aw men myself wa verona banish practis steal away ladi heir near alli unto duke second outlaw i mantua gentleman who my mood i stabb d unto heart first outlaw i such like petti crime as these but purpos we cite our fault that they may hold excu d our lawless live partli see you are beautifi goodli shape your own report linguist man such perfect as we do our qualiti much want second outlaw inde becaus you are banish d man therefor rest we parley you are you content be our gener make virtu necess live as we do thi wilder third outlaw what say st thou wilt thou be our consort say ay be captain us all we ll do thee homag be rul d thee love thee as our command our king first outlaw but if thou scorn our courtesi thou diest second outlaw thou shalt not live brag what we have offer d valentin i take your offer will live you provid that you do no outrag silli women or poor passeng third outlaw no we detest such vile base practic come go us we ll bring thee our crew show thee all treasur we have got which ourselv all rest thi dispos exeunt scene ii milan outsid duke s palac silvia s window enter proteu proteu alreadi have i been fals valentin now i must be as unjust thurio colour commend him i have access my own love prefer but silvia is too fair too true too holi be corrupt my worthless gift when i protest true loyalti her she twit me my falsehood my friend when her beauti i commend my vow she bid me think how i have been forsworn break faith julia whom i lov d notwithstand all her sudden quip least whereof would quell lover s hope yet spaniel like more she spurn my love more it grow fawneth her still enter thurio musician but here come thurio now must we her window give some even music her ear thurio how now sir proteu are you wisedom doe men proyn straight yong bow that blush thousand blossom becaus they may be rotten o duke theseu goodli mother that have groand these all long maid that ever lov d if your vow stand shall curs me my beauti their funeral song these two cosen despis my cruelti cri woe worth me till i am noth but scorn women heaven sake save their live banish em theseu what condit emilia swear em never more make me their content or know me tread thi dukedom be where ever they shall travel ever stranger one anoth palamon ile be cut peec i take thi oth forget i love her o all ye god dispis me then thi banish i not mislik so we may fair carri our sword caus els never trifl but take our live duke i must love will that love must dare kill thi cosen ani peec earth ha theseu will you arcit take these condit palamon he s villain then perith these are men arcit no never duke ti wors me than beg take my life so base though i think i never shall enjoy her yet ile preserv honour affect dye her make death devil theseu what may be done now i feel compass perith let it not fall agen sir theseu say emilia if one them were dead as one must are you content take th other your husband they cannot both enjoy you they are princ as goodli as your own eye as nobl as ever fame yet spoke look em if you can love end thi differ i give consent are you content too princ both all our soul theseu he that she refus must dye then both ani death thou canst invent duke palamon if i fall that mouth i fall favour lover yet unborn shall bless my ash arcit if she refus me yet my grave will wed me souldier sing my epitaph theseu make choic then emilia i cannot sir they are both too excel me hayr shall never fall these men hippolita what will becom em theseu thu i ordain it mine honor onc again it stand or both shall dye you shall both your countrey each thi moneth accompani three fair knight appear again thi place which ile plant pyramid us that are here can forc hi cosen fayr knightli strength touch pillar that light which show one other darken which ever wa dam horrour who do s stand accurst mani mortal million may even now cast her black mantl both that neither could find other get her self some part should thi grow camillo i know not but i am sure ti safer avoid what s grown than question how ti born if therefor you dare trust my honesti that lie enclos thi trunk which you shall bear impawn d away tonight your follow i will whisper busi will two three sever postern clear them o th citi myself i ll put my fortun your servic which are here thi discoveri lost be not uncertain honour my parent i have utter d truth which if you seek prove i dare not stand nor shall you be safer than one condemn king s own mouth thereon hi execut sworn polixen i do believ thee i saw hi heart s face give me thi hand be pilot me thi place shall still neighbour mine my ship are readi my peopl did expect my henc departur two day ago thi jealousi is preciou creatur as she s rare must it be great as hi person s mighti must it be violent as he doe conceiv he is dishonour d man which ever profess d him whi hi reveng must that be made more bitter fear o ershad me good expedit be my friend comfort graciou queen part hi theme but noth hi ill ta en suspicion come camillo i will respect thee as father if thou bear st my life off henc let us avoid camillo it is mine author command key all postern pleas your high take urgent hour come sir away _exeunt _ act ii scene i sicilia room palac enter hermion mamilliu ladi hermion take boy you he so troubl me ti past endur first ladi come my graciou lord shall i be your playfellow mamilliu no i ll none you first ladi whi my sweet lord mamilliu you ll kiss me hard speak me as if i were babi still i love you better second ladi whi so my lord mamilliu not becaus your brow are blacker yet black brow they say becom some women best so that there be not too much hair there but semicircl or half moon made pen second ladi who taught thi mamilliu i learn d it women s face pray now what colour are your eyebrow first ladi blue my lord mamilliu nay that s mock i have seen ladi s nose that ha been blue but not her eyebrow first ladi hark ye queen your cricket shall not hear it hermion come then give t me mine ear enter leont antigonu lord guard leont wa he met there hi train camillo him first lord behind tuft pine i met them never saw i men scour thi hi pander there is plot against my life my crown all s true that is mistrust that fals villain whom i employ d wa pre employ d him he ha discov d my design i remain pinch d thing yea veri trick them play will how came postern so easili open first lord hi great author which often hath no less prevail d than so your command leont i know t too well give me boy i am glad you did not nurs him though he doe bear some sign me yet you have too much blood him hermion what is thi sport leont bear boy henc he shall not come her away him let her sport herself that she s big ti polixen ha made thee swell thu _exit mamilliu some guard _ hermion but i d say he had not i ll be sworn you would believ my say howe er you learn th nayward leont you my lord look her mark her well be but say she is my cabin where i lay thrice bow d me gasp begin some speech her eye becam two spout furi spent anon did thi break her good antigonu fate against thi better disposit hath made thi person thrower my
