child bundl _ which may if fortun pleas both breed thee pretti still rest thine storm begin poor wretch that thi mother s fault art thu expo d loss what may follow weep i cannot but my heart bleed most accur d am i be oath enjoin d thi farewel day frown more more thou rt like have lullabi too rough i never saw heaven so dim day savag clamour well may i get aboard thi is chase i am gone ever _exit pursu bear _ enter old shepherd shepherd i would there were no age ten three twenti or that youth would sleep rest there is noth but get wench child wrong ancientri steal fight hark you now would ani but these boil brain nineteen two twenti hunt thi weather they have scare away two my best sheep which i fear wolf will sooner find than master if anywher i have them ti sea side brows ivi good luck t be thi will what have we here _take child _ merci s bairn veri pretti bairn boy or child i wonder pretti one veri pretti one sure some scape though i am not bookish yet i can read wait gentlewoman scape thi ha been some stair work some trunk work some behind door work they were warmer that got thi than poor thing is here i ll take it piti yet i ll tarri till my son come he hallo but even now whoa ho hoa enter clown clown hilloa loa shepherd what art so near if thou lt see thing talk when thou art dead rotten come hither what ail st thou man clown i have seen two such sight sea land but i am not say it is sea it is now sky betwixt firmament it you cannot thrust bodkin s point shepherd whi boy how is it clown i would you did but see how it chafe how it rage how it take shore but that s not point o most piteou cri poor soul sometim see em not see em now ship bore moon her mainmast anon swallow yest froth as you d thrust cork hogshead then land servic see how bear tore hi shoulder bone how he cri me help said hi name wa antigonu nobleman but make end ship see how sea flap dragon d it but first how poor soul roar sea mock them how poor gentleman roar bear mock him both roar louder than sea or weather shepherd name merci when wa thi boy clown now now i have not wink i saw these sight men are not yet cold water nor bear half dine gentleman he s it now shepherd would i had been have help old man clown i would you had been ship side have help her there your chariti would have lack foot shepherd heavi matter heavi matter but look thee here boy now bless thyself thou met st thing die i thing new born here s sight thee look thee bear cloth squir s child look thee here take take boy open t so let s see it wa told me i should be rich fairi thi is some changel open t what s boy clown you re made old man if sin your youth are forgiven you you re well live gold all gold shepherd thi is fairi gold boy twill prove so it keep it close home home next way we are lucki boy be so still requir noth but secreci let my sheep go come good boy next way home clown go you next way your find i ll go see if bear be gone gentleman how much he hath eaten they are never curst but when they are hungri if there be ani him left i ll buri it shepherd that s good deed if thou mayest discern that which is left him what he is fetch me th sight him clown marri will i you shall help put him i th ground shepherd ti lucki day boy we ll do good deed t _exeunt _ act iv scene i enter time choru time i that pleas some tri all both joy terror good bad that make unfold error now take me name time use my wing imput it not crime me or my swift passag that i slide o er sixteen year leav growth untri that wide gap it is my power o erthrow law one self born hour plant o erwhelm custom let me pass same i am ere ancient st order wa or what is now receiv i wit time that brought them so shall i do th freshest thing now reign make stale glister thi present as my tale now seem it your patienc thi allow i turn my glass give my scene such grow as you had slept leont leav th effect hi fond jealousi so griev that he shut himself imagin me gentl spectat that i now may be fair bohemia rememb well i mention son o th king s which florizel i now name you speed so pace speak perdita now grown grace equal wonder what her ensu i list not prophesi but let time s news be known when ti brought forth shepherd s daughter what her adher which follow is th argument time thi allow if ever you have spent time wors ere now if never yet that time himself doth say he wish earnestli you never may _exit _ scene ii bohemia room palac polixen enter polixen camillo polixen i pray thee good camillo be no more importun ti sick deni thee anyth death grant thi camillo it is fifteen year i saw my countri though i have most part been air abroad i desir lay my bone there besid penit king my master hath sent me whose feel sorrow i might be some allay or i o erween think so which is anoth spur my departur polixen as thou lov st me camillo wipe not rest thi servic leav me now need i have thee thine own good hath made better not have had thee than thu want thee thou have made me busi which none thee can suffici manag must either stay execut them thyself or take away thee veri servic thou hast done which if i have not enough consid as too much i cannot be more thank thee shall be my studi my profit therein heap friendship that fatal countri sicilia prithe speak no more whose veri name punish me remembr that penit as thou call st him reconcil king my brother whose loss hi most preciou queen children are even now be afresh lament say me when sawest thou princ florizel my son king are no less unhappi their issu not be graciou than they are lose them when they have approv their virtu camillo sir it is three day i saw princ what hi happier affair may be are me unknown but i have missingli note he is late much retir court is less frequent hi princ exercis than formerli he hath appear polixen i have consid so much camillo some care so far that i have eye my servic which look hi removed whom i have thi intellig that he is seldom hous most home shepherd man they say that veri noth imagin hi neighbour is grown unspeak estat camillo i have heard sir such man who hath daughter most rare note report her is extend more than can be thought begin such cottag polixen that s likewis part my intellig but i fear angl that pluck our son thither thou shalt accompani us place where we will not appear what we are have some question shepherd whose simplic i think it not uneasi get caus my son s resort thither prithe be my present partner thi busi lay asid thought sicilia camillo i willingli obey your command polixen my best camillo we must disguis ourselv _exeunt _ perdita florizel these your unusu weed each part you do give life no shepherdess but flora peer april s front thi your sheep shear is as meet petti god you queen t perdita sir my graciou lord chide your extrem it not becom me o pardon that i name them your high self graciou mark o th land you have obscur d swain s wear me poor lowli maid most goddess like prank d but that our feast everi mess have folli feeder digest it custom i should blush see you so attir d swoon i think show myself glass florizel i bless time when my good falcon made her flight across thi father s ground perdita now jove afford you caus me differ forg dread your great hath not been us d fear even now i trembl think your father some accid should pass thi way as you did o fate how would he look see hi work so nobl vile bound what would he say or how should i these my borrow d flaunt behold stern hi presenc florizel apprehend noth but jolliti god themselv humbl their deiti love have taken shape beast them jupit becam bull bellow d green neptun ram bleat fire rob d god golden apollo poor humbl swain as i seem now their transform were never piec beauti rarer nor way so chast my desir run not mine honour nor my lust burn hotter than my faith perdita o but sir your resolut cannot hold when ti oppo d as it must be power king one these two must be necess which then will speak that you must chang thi purpos or i my life florizel thou dearest perdita these forc d thought i prithe darken not mirth o th feast or i ll be thine my fair or not my father s i cannot be mine own nor anyth ani if i be not thine thi i am most constant though destini say no be merri gentl strangl such thought as these anyth that you behold while your guest are come lift your counten as it were day celebr that nuptial which we two have sworn shall come perdita o ladi fortun stand you auspici florizel see your guest approach address yourself entertain them sprightli let s be red mirth enter shepherd polixen camillo disguis clown nor birth trembl winter fairest flower o th season are our carnat streak d gillyvor which some call natur s bastard that kind our rustic garden s barren i care not get slip them polixen wherefor gentl maiden do you neglect them perdita i have heard it said there is art which their pied share great creat natur polixen say there be yet natur is made better no mean but natur make that mean so that art which you say add natur is art that natur make you see sweet maid we marri gentler scion wildest stock make conceiv bark baser kind bud nobler race thi is art which doe mend natur chang it rather but art itself is natur perdita so it is polixen then make your garden rich gillyvor do not call them bastard perdita i ll not put dibbl earth set one slip them no more than were i paint i would wish thi youth should say twere well onli therefor desir breed me here s flower you hot lavend mint savori marjoram marigold that goe bed th sun him rise weep these are flower middl summer i think they are maladi most incid maid bold oxlip crown imperi lili all kind flower de luce be one o these i lack make you garland my sweet friend strew him o er o er florizel what like cors perdita no like bank love lie play not like cors or if not be buri but quick mine arm come take your flower methink i play as i have seen them do whitsun pastor sure thi robe mine doe chang my disposit florizel what you do th sea that you might ever do noth but that move still still so own no other function each your do so singular each particular crown what you are do present deed that all your act are queen perdita o as your anchor who do their best offic if they can but stay you where you ll be loath be besid you know prosper s veri bond love whose fresh complexion whose heart togeth afflict alter perdita one these is true i think afflict may subdu cheek but not take mind camillo yea say you so there shall not your father s hous these seven year be born anoth such florizel my good camillo she is as forward my fortun do all lie there it shall be so my care have you royal appoint as if scene you play were mine instanc sir that you may know you shall not want one word _they talk asid _ enter autolycu autolycu ha ha what fool honesti is trust hi sworn brother veri simpl gentleman i have sold all my trumperi not counterfeit stone not ribbon glass pomand brooch tabl book ballad knife tape glove shoe tie bracelet horn ring keep my pack fast they throng who should buy first as if my trinket had been hallow brought benedict buyer which mean i saw whose purs wa best pictur what i saw my good use i rememb my clown who want but someth be reason man grew so love wench song that he would not stir hi pettito till he had both tune word which so drew rest herd me that all their other sens stuck ear sun whereon thought might think sometim it saw carcass beauti spent done time had not scyth all that youth begun nor youth all quit but spite heaven s fell rage some beauti peep lattic sear d age oft did she heav her napkin her eyn which it had conceit charact laund ring silken figur brine that season woe had pellet tear often read what content it bear as often shriek undistinguish d woe clamour all size both high low sometim her level d eye their carriag ride as they did batt ry sphere intend sometim divert their poor ball are tie th orb earth sometim they do extend their view right anon their gaze lend everi place onc nowher fix d mind sight distractedli commix d her hair nor loos nor tie formal plat proclaim d her careless hand pride some untuck d descend her sheav d hat hang her pale pine cheek besid some her threaden fillet still did bide true bondag would not break thenc though slackli braid loos neglig thousand favour maund she drew amber crystal bead jet which one one she river threw whose weep margent she wa set like usuri appli wet wet or monarch hand that let not bounti fall where want cri some but where excess beg all fold schedul had she mani one which she peru d sigh d tore gave flood crack d mani ring posi gold bone bid them find their sepulchr mud found yet mo letter sadli penn d blood sleid silk feat affectedli enswath d seal d curiou secreci these often bath d she her fluxiv eye often kiss d often gave tear cri o fals blood thou regist lie what unapprov wit dost thou bear ink would have seem d more black damn here thi said top rage line she rent big discont so break their content reverend man that graze hi cattl nigh sometim bluster that ruffl knew court citi had let go swiftest hour observ as they flew thi afflict fanci fastli drew privileg d age desir know brief ground motiv her woe so slide he down hi grain bat come distant sit he her side when he again desir her be sat her grievanc hi hear divid if that him there may be aught appli which may her suffer ecstasi assuag ti promis chariti age father she say though me you behold injuri mani blast hour let it not tell your judgement i am old not age but sorrow me hath power i might as yet have been spread flower fresh myself if i had self appli love myself no love besid but woe is me too earli i attend youth suit it wa gain my grace o one natur s outward so commend that maiden s eye stuck all hi face love lack d dwell made him her place when hi fair part she did abid she wa new lodg d newli deifi hi browni lock did hang crook curl everi light occas wind hi lip their silken parcel hurl what s sweet do do will aptli find each eye that saw him did enchant mind hi visag wa littl drawn what larg think paradis wa sawn small show man wa yet hi chin hi phoenix down began but appear like unshorn velvet that termless skin whose bare bragg d web it seem wear yet show d hi visag that cost more dear nice affect waver stood doubt if best were as it wa or best hi qualiti were beauteou as hi form maiden tongu he wa thereof free yet if men mov d him wa he such storm as oft twixt may april is see when wind breath sweet unruli though they be hi rude so hi authoriz d youth did liveri fals pride truth well could he ride often men would say that hors hi mettl hi rider take proud subject nobl sway what round what bound what cours what stop he make controversi henc question take hors him becam hi deed or he hi manag th well do steed but quickli thi side verdict went hi real habitud gave life grace appertain ornament accomplish d himself not hi case all aid themselv made fairer their place came addit yet their purpo d trim piec d not hi grace but were all grac d him so tip hi subdu tongu all kind argument question deep all replic prompt reason strong hi advantag still did wake sleep make weeper laugh laugher weep he had dialect differ skill catch all passion hi craft will that he did gener bosom reign young old sex both enchant dwell him thought or remain person duti follow where he haunt consent s bewitch d ere he desir have grant dialogu him what he would say ask d their own will made their will obey mani there were that did hi pictur get serv their eye it put their mind like fool that th imagin set goodli object which abroad they find land mansion their thought assign d labour moe pleasur bestow them than true gouti landlord which doth owe them so mani have that never touch d hi hand sweetli suppo d them mistress hi heart my woeful self that did freedom stand wa my own fee simpl not part what hi art youth youth art threw my affect hi charm power reserv d stalk gave him all my flower yet did i not as some my equal did demand him nor be desir yield find myself honour so forbid safest distanc i mine honour shield experi me mani bulwark build proof new bleed which remain d foil thi fals jewel hi amor spoil but ah who ever shunn d preced destin d ill she must herself assay or forc d exampl gainst her own content put pass d peril her way counsel may stop while what will not stay when we rage advic is often seen blunt us make our will more keen nor give it satisfact our blood that we must curb it other proof be forbod sweet that seem so good fear harm that preach our behoof o appetit judgement stand aloof one palat hath that need will tast though reason weep cri it is thi last further i could say thi man s untru knew pattern hi foul beguil heard where hi plant other orchard grew saw how deceit were gild hi smile knew vow were ever broker defil thought charact word mere but art bastard hi foul adulter heart long these term i held my citi till thu he gan besieg me gentl maid have my suffer youth some feel piti be not my holi vow afraid that s ye sworn none wa ever said feast love i have been call d unto till now did ne er invit nor never woo all my offenc that abroad you see are error blood none mind love made them not actur they may be where neither parti is nor true nor kind they sought their shame that so their shame did find so much less shame me remain how much me their reproach contain mani that mine eye have seen not one whose flame my heart so much as warm or my affect put th smallest teen or ani my leisur ever charm harm have i done them but ne er wa harm kept heart liveri but mine own wa free reign d command hi monarchi look here what tribut wound fanci sent me pallid pearl rubi red as blood figur that they their passion likewis lent me grief blush aptli understood bloodless white encrimson d mood effect terror dear modesti encamp d heart but fight outwardli lo behold these talent their hair twist metal amor empleach d i have receiv d mani sever fair their kind accept weepingli beseech d th annexion fair gem enrich d deep brain d sonnet that did amplifi each stone s dear natur worth qualiti diamond whi twa beauti hard whereto hi invi d properti did tend deep green emerald whose fresh regard weak sight their sickli radianc do amend heaven hu sapphir opal blend object manifold each sever stone wit well blazon d smil d or made some moan lo all these trophi affect hot pensiv d subdu desir tender natur hath charg d me that i hoard them not but yield them where i myself must render that is you my origin ender these forc must your oblat be i their altar you empatron me o then advanc your that phraseless hand whose white weigh down airi scale prais take all these simil your own command hallow sigh that burn lung did rais what me your minist you obey work you your audit come their distract parcel combin sum lo thi devic wa sent me nun or sister sanctifi holiest note which late her nobl suit court did shun whose rarest have made blossom dote she wa sought spirit richest coat but kept cold distanc did thenc remov spend her live etern love but o my sweet what labour is t leav thing we have not mast ring what not strive plane place which did no form receiv play patient sport unconstrain gyve she that her fame so herself contriv scar battl scapeth flight make her absenc valiant not her might o pardon me that my boast is true accid which brought me her eye moment did her forc subdu now she would cage cloister fli religi love put religion s eye not be tempt would she be immur d now tempt all liberti procur d how mighti then you are o hear me tell broken bosom that me belong have empti all their fountain my well mine i pour your ocean all i strong o er them you o er me be strong must your victori us all congest as compound love physic your cold breast my part had pow r charm sacr nun who disciplin d diet grace believ d her eye when they t assail begun all vow consecr give place o most potenti love vow bond nor space thee hath neither sting knot nor confin thou art all all thing els are thine when thou impressest what are precept worth stale exampl when thou wilt inflam how coldli those impedi stand forth wealth filial fear law kindr fame love s arm are peac gainst rule gainst sens gainst shame sweeten suff ring pang it bear alo all forc shock fear now all these heart that do mine depend feel it break bleed groan they pine supplic their sigh your extend leav batt ry that you make gainst mine lend soft audienc my sweet design credent soul that strong bond oath that shall prefer undertak my troth thi said hi wat ry eye he did dismount whose sight till then were level d my face each cheek river run fount brinish current downward flow apac o how channel stream gave grace who glaz d crystal gate glow rose that flame water which their hue enclos o father what hell witchcraft lie small orb one particular tear but inund eye what rocki heart water will not wear what breast so cold that is not warm here o cleft effect cold modesti hot wrath both fire henc chill extinctur hath lo hi passion but art craft even there resolv d my reason tear there my white stole chastiti i daff d shook off my sober guard civil fear appear him as he me appear all melt though our drop thi diff renc bore hi poison d me mine did him restor him plenitud subtl matter appli cautel all strang form receiv burn blush or weep water or swoon pale he take leav either s apt as it best deceiv blush speech rank weep woe or turn white swoon tragic show that not heart which hi level came could scape hail hi all hurt aim show fair natur is both kind tame veil d them did win whom he would maim against thing he sought he would exclaim when he most burn heart wish d luxuri he preach d pure maid prai d cold chastiti thu mere garment grace nake conceal fiend he cover d that th unexperi gave tempter place which like cherubin them hover d who young simpl would not be so lover d ay me i fell yet do question make what i should do again such sake o that infect moistur hi eye o that fals fire which hi cheek so glow d o that forc d thunder hi heart did fli o that sad breath hi spongi lung bestow d o all that borrow motion seem owe would yet again betray fore betray new pervert reconcil maid passion pilgrim i did not heavenli rhetor thine eye gainst whom world could not hold argument persuad my heart thi fals perjuri vow thee broke deserv not punish woman i forswor but i will prove thou be goddess i forswor not thee my vow wa earthli thou heavenli love thi grace be gain d cure all disgrac me my vow wa breath breath vapour is then thou fair sun that thi earth doth shine exhal thi vapour vow thee it is if broken then it is no fault mine if me broke what fool is not so wise break oath win paradis ii sweet cytherea sit brook young adoni love fresh green did court lad mani love look such look as none could look but beauti s queen she told him stori delight hi ear she show d him favour allur hi eye win hi heart she touch d him here there touch so soft still conquer chastiti but unrip year did want conceit or he refu d take her figur d proffer tender nibbler would not touch bait but smile jest everi gentl offer then fell she her back fair queen he rose ran away ah fool too froward iii if love make me forsworn how shall i swear love o never faith could hold if not beauti vow d though myself forsworn thee i ll constant prove those thought me like oak thee like osier bow d studi hi bia leav make hi book thine eye where all those pleasur live that art can comprehend if knowledg be mark know thee shall suffic well learn is that tongu that well can thee commend all ignor that soul that see thee wonder which is me some prais that i thi part admir thi eye jove s lightn seem thi voic hi dread thunder which not anger bent is music sweet fire celesti as thou art o do not love that wrong sing heaven prais such earthli tongu iv scarc had sun dri dewi morn scarc herd gone hedg shade when cytherea all love forlorn long tarrianc adoni made osier grow brook brook where adon use cool hi spleen hot wa day she hotter that did look hi approach that often there had been anon he come throw hi mantl stood stark nake brook s green brim sun look d world gloriou eye yet not so wistli as thi queen him he spi her bounc d wherea he stood o jove quoth she whi wa not i flood v fair is my love but not so fair as fickl mild as dove but neither true nor trusti brighter than glass yet as glass is brittl softer than wax yet as iron rusti lili pale damask die grace her none fairer nor none falser defac her her lip mine how often hath she join d each kiss her oath true love swear how mani tale pleas me hath she coin d dread my love loss thereof still fear yet midst all her pure protest her faith her oath her tear all were jest she burn d love as straw fire flameth she burn d love as soon as straw outburneth she fram d love yet she foil d frame she bade love last yet she fell turn wa thi lover or lecher bad best though excel neither vi if music sweet poetri agre as they must need sister brother then must love be great twixt thee me becaus thou lovest one i other dowland thee is dear whose heavenli touch lute doth ravish human sens spenser me whose deep conceit is such as pass all conceit need no defenc thou lov st hear sweet melodi sound that phoebu lute queen music make i deep delight am chiefli drown d whena himself sing he betak one god is god both as poet feign one knight love both both thee remain vii fair wa morn when fair queen love paler sorrow than her milk white dove adon s sake youngster proud wild her stand she take steep hill anon adoni come horn hound she silli queen more than love s good will forbad boy he should not pass those ground onc quoth she did i see fair sweet youth here these brake deep wound boar deep thigh spectacl ruth see my thigh quoth she here wa sore she show her he saw more wound than one blush fled left her all alon viii sweet rose fair flower untim pluck d soon vade pluck d bud vade spring bright orient pearl alack too time shade fair creatur kill d too soon death s sharp sting like green plum that hang tree fall wind fall should be i weep thee yet no caus i have whi thou left st me noth thi will yet thou left st me more than i did crave whi i crave noth thee still o ye dear friend i pardon crave thee thi discont thou didst bequeath me ix venu young adoni sit her myrtl shade began woo him she told youngl how god mar did tri her as he fell her so fell she him even thu quoth she warlik god embrac d me then she clipp d adoni her arm even thu quoth she warlik god unlac me as if boy should use like love charm even thu quoth she he seiz my lip her lip hi did act seizur as she fetch breath away he skip would not take her mean nor her pleasur ah that i had my ladi thi bay kiss clip me till i run away x crab age youth cannot live togeth youth is full pleasanc age is full care youth like summer morn age like winter weather youth like summer brave age like winter bare youth is full sport age s breath is short youth is nimbl age is lame youth is hot bold age is weak cold youth is wild age is tame age i do abhor thee youth i do ador thee o my love my love is young age i do defi thee o sweet shepherd hie thee methink thou stay st too long xi beauti is but vain doubt good shine gloss that vadeth suddenli flower that die when first it gin bud brittl glass that s broken present doubt good gloss glass flower lost vade broken dead hour as good lost are seld or never found as vade gloss no rub will refresh as flower dead lie wither d ground as broken glass no cement can redress so beauti blemish d onc ever s lost spite physic paint pain cost xii good night good rest ah neither be my share she bade good night that kept my rest away daff d me cabin hang d care descant doubt my decay farewel quoth she come again tomorrow fare well i could not i supp d sorrow yet my part sweetli did she smile scorn or friendship nill i constru t may be she joy d jest my exil t may be again make me wander thither wander word shadow like myself as take pain but cannot pluck pelf xiii lord how mine eye throw gaze east my heart doth charg watch morn rise doth cite each move sens idl rest not dare trust offic mine eye while philomela sit sing i sit mark wish her lay were tune like lark she doth welcom daylight her ditti drive away dark dismal dream night night so pack d i post unto my pretti heart hath hi hope eye their wish sight sorrow chang d solac solac mix d sorrow whi she sigh d bade me come tomorrow were i her night would post too soon but now are minut ad hour spite me now each minut seem moon yet not me shine sun succour flower pack night peep day good day night now borrow short night night length thyself morrow phoenix turtl let bird loudest lay sole arabian tree herald sad trumpet be whose sound chast wing obey but thou shriek harbing foul precurr fiend augur fever s end thi troop come thou not near thi session interdict everi fowl tyrant wing save eagl feather d king keep obsequy so strict let priest surplic white that defunct music can be death divin swan lest requiem lack hi right thou trebl date crow that thi sabl gender mak st breath thou giv st tak st mongst our mourner shalt thou go here anthem doth commenc love constanc is dead phoenix turtl fled mutual flame henc so they lov d as love twain had essenc but one two distinct divis none number there love wa slain heart remot yet not asund distanc no space wa seen twixt thi turtl hi queen but them it were wonder so them love did shine that turtl saw hi right flame phoenix sight either wa other s mine properti wa thu appal that self wa not same singl natur s doubl name neither two nor one wa call reason itself confound saw divis grow togeth themselv yet either neither simpl were so well compound that it cri how true twain seemeth thi concord one love hath reason reason none if what part can so remain whereupon it made thi threne phoenix dove co suprem star love as choru their tragic scene threno beauti truth rariti grace all simplic here enclo d cinder lie death is now phoenix nest turtl s loyal breast etern doth rest leav no poster twa not their infirm it wa marri chastiti truth may seem but cannot be beauti brag but ti not she truth beauti buri be thi urn let those repair that are either true or fair these dead bird sigh prayer rape lucrec right honour henri wriothesli earl southampton baron titchfield love i dedic your lordship is end whereof thi pamphlet begin is but superflu moieti warrant i have your honour disposit not worth my untutor line make it assur accept what i have done is your what i have do is your be part all i have devot your were my worth greater my duti would show greater meantim as it is it is bound your lordship whom i wish long life still lengthen all happi your lordship s all duti william shakespear argument luciu tarquiniu hi excess pride surnam superbu he had caus hi own father law serviu tulliu be cruelli murder contrari roman law custom not requir or stay peopl s suffrag had possess himself kingdom went accompani hi son other noblemen rome besieg ardea which sieg princip men armi meet one even tent sextu tarquiniu king s son their discours supper everi one commend virtu hi own wife whom collatinu extol incompar chastiti hi wife lucretia that pleasant humour they all post rome intend their secret sudden arriv make trial that which everi one had avouch onli collatinu find hi wife though it were late night spin her maid other ladi were all found danc revel or sever disport whereupon noblemen yield collatinu victori hi wife fame that time sextu tarquiniu be inflam lucrec s beauti yet smother hi passion present depart rest back camp whenc he shortli privili withdrew himself wa accord hi estat royal entertain lodg lucrec collatium same night he treacher stealeth her chamber violent ravish her earli morn speedeth away lucrec thi lament plight hastili dispatch messeng one rome her father anoth camp collatin they came one accompani juniu brutu other publiu valeriu find lucrec attir mourn habit demand caus her sorrow she first take oath them her reveng reveal actor whole manner hi deal withal suddenli stab herself which done one consent they all vow root whole
