state govern chang king consul _______________________________________________________________ besieg ardea all post born trustless wing fals desir lust breath tarquin leav roman host collatium bear lightless fire which pale ember hid lurk aspir girdl embrac flame waist collatin s fair love lucrec chast hapli that name chast unhapp ly set thi bateless edg hi keen appetit when collatin unwis did not let prais clear unmatch red white which triumph d that sky hi delight where mortal star as bright as heaven s beauti pure aspect did him peculiar duti he night tarquin s tent unlock d treasur hi happi state what priceless wealth heaven had him lent possess hi beauteou mate reckon hi fortun such high proud rate that king might be espous more fame but king nor peer such peerless dame o happi enjoy d but few if possess d as soon decay d done as is morn s silver melt dew against golden splendour sun expir d date cancel d ere well begun honour beauti owner s arm are weakli fortress d world harm beauti itself doth itself persuad eye men orat what needeth then apolog be made set forth that which is so singular or whi is collatin publish that rich jewel he should keep unknown thievish ear becaus it is hi own perchanc hi boast lucrec sovereignti suggest thi proud issu king our ear our heart oft taint be perchanc that envi so rich thing brave compar disdain did sting hi high pitch d thought that meaner men should vaunt that golden hap which their superior want but some untim thought did instig hi all too timeless speed if none those hi honour hi affair hi friend hi state neglect all swift intent he goe quench coal which hi liver glow o rash fals heat wrapp d repent cold thi hasti spring still blast ne er grow old when collatium thi fals lord arriv d well wa he welcom d roman dame whose face beauti virtu striv d which them both should underprop her fame when virtu bragg d beauti would blush shame when beauti boast blush despit virtu would stain that or silver white but beauti that white intitul venu dove doth challeng that fair field then virtu claim beauti beauti s red which virtu gave golden age gild their silver cheek call d it then their shield teach them thu use it fight when shame assail d red should fenc white thi heraldri lucrec face wa seen argu beauti s red virtu s white either s colour wa other queen prove world s minor their right yet their ambit make them still fight sovereignti either be so great that oft they interchang each other s seat their silent war lili rose which tarquin view d her fair face s field their pure rank hi traitor eye enclos where lest them both it should be kill d coward captiv vanquish d doth yield those two armi that would let him go rather than triumph so fals foe now think he that her husband s shallow tongu niggard prodig that prai d her so that high task hath done her beauti wrong which far exce hi barren skill show therefor that prais which collatin doth owe enchant tarquin answer surmis silent wonder still gaze eye thi earthli saint ador thi devil littl suspecteth fals worshipp unstain d thought do seldom dream evil bird never lim d no secret bush fear so guiltless she secur give good cheer reverend welcom her princ guest whose inward ill no outward harm express d that he colour d hi high estat hide base sin plait majesti that noth him seem d inordin save sometim too much wonder hi eye which have all all could not satisfi but poorli rich so wanteth hi store that cloy d much he pineth still more but she that never cop d stranger eye could pick no mean their parl look nor read subtl shine secreci writ glassi margent such book she touch d no unknown bait nor fear d no hook nor could she moral hi wanton sight more than hi eye were open d light he stori her ear her husband s fame won field fruit itali deck prais collatin s high name made gloriou hi manli chivalri bruis arm wreath victori her joy heav d hand she doth express wordless so greet heaven hi success far purpos hi come hither he make excus hi be there no cloudi show stormi bluster weather doth yet hi fair welkin onc appear till sabl night mother dread fear world dim dark doth display her vaulti prison stow day then is tarquin brought unto hi bed intend weari heavi spright supper long he question modest lucrec wore night now leaden slumber life s strength doth fight everi one rest themselv betak save thiev care troubl mind that wake as one which doth tarquin lie revolv sundri danger hi will s obtain yet ever obtain hi will resolv though weak built hope persuad him abstain despair gain doth traffic oft gain when great treasur is meed propo d though death be adjunct there s no death suppo d those that much covet are gain so fond what they have not that which they possess they scatter unloos it their bond so hope more they have but less or gain more profit excess is but surfeit such grief sustain that they prove bankrupt thi poor rich gain aim all is but nurs life honour wealth eas wane age thi aim there is such thwart strife that one all or all one we gage as life honour fell battl rage honour wealth oft that wealth doth cost death all all togeth lost so that vent ring ill we leav be thing we are that which we expect thi ambiti foul infirm have much torment us defect that we have so then we do neglect thing we have all want wit make someth noth augment it such hazard now must dote tarquin make pawn hi honour obtain hi lust himself himself he must forsak then where is truth if there be no self trust when shall he think find stranger just when he himself himself confound betray slander tongu wretch hate day now stole time dead night when heavi sleep had close mortal eye no comfort star did lend hi light no nois but owl wolv death bode cri now serv season that they may surpris silli lamb pure thought are dead still while lust murder wake stain kill now thi lust lord leap d hi bed throw hi mantl rude o er hi arm is madli toss d desir dread th one sweetli flatter th other feareth harm but honest fear bewitch d lust s foul charm doth too too oft betak him retir beaten away brain sick rude desir hi falchion flint he softli smiteth that cold stone spark fire do fli whereat waxen torch forthwith he lighteth which must be lode star hi lust eye flame thu speak advisedli as thi cold flint i enforc thi fire so lucrec must i forc my desir here pale fear he doth premedit danger hi loathsom enterpris hi inward mind he doth debat what follow sorrow may thi aris then look scorn he doth despis hi nake armour still slaughter d lust justli thu control hi thought unjust fair torch burn thi light lend it not darken her whose light excelleth thine die unhallow d thought you blot your unclean that which is divin offer pure incens so pure shrine let fair human abhor deed that spot stain love s modest snow white weed o shame knighthood shine arm o foul dishonour my household s grave o impiou act includ all foul harm martial man be soft fanci s slave true valour still true respect should have then my digress is so vile so base that it will live engraven my face yea though i die scandal will surviv be eye sore my golden coat some loathsom dash herald will contriv cipher me how fondli i did dote that my poster sham d note shall curs my bone hold it no sin wish that i their father had not been what win i if i gain thing i seek dream breath froth fleet joy who buy minut s mirth wail week or sell etern get toy one sweet grape who will vine destroy or what fond beggar but touch crown would sceptr straight be strucken down if collatinu dream my intent will he not wake desper rage post hither thi vile purpos prevent thi sieg that hath engirt hi marriag thi blur youth thi sorrow sage thi die virtu thi surviv shame whose crime will bear ever blame o what excus can my invent make when thou shalt charg me so black deed will not my tongu be mute my frail joint shake mine eye forego their light my fals heart bleed guilt be great fear doth still exceed extrem fear can neither fight nor fli but coward like trembl terror die had collatinu kill d my son or sire or lain ambush betray my life or were he not my dear friend thi desir might have excus work hi wife as reveng or quittal such strife but as he is my kinsman my dear friend shame fault find no excus nor end shame it is ay if fact be known hate it is there is no hate love i ll beg her love but she is not her own worst is but denial reprov my will is strong past reason s weak remov who fear sentenc or old man s saw shall paint cloth be kept awe thu graceless hold he disput tween frozen conscienc hot burn will good thought make dispens urg worser sens vantag still which moment doth confound kill all pure effect doth so far proceed that what is vile show like virtuou deed quoth he she took me kindli hand gaz d tide my eager eye fear some hard news warlik band where her belov collatinu lie o how her fear did make her colour rise first red as rose that lawn we lay then white as lawn rose took away how her hand my hand be lock d forc d it trembl her loyal fear which struck her sad then it faster rock d her husband s welfar she did hear whereat she smile so sweet cheer that had narcissu seen her as she stood self love had never drown d him flood whi hunt i then colour or excus all orat are dumb when beauti pleadeth poor wretch have remors poor abus love thrive not heart that shadow dreadeth affect is my captain he leadeth when hi gaudi banner is display d coward fight will not be dismay d then childish fear avaunt debat die respect reason wait wrinkl age my heart shall never countermand mine eye sad paus deep regard beseem sage my part is youth beat these stage desir my pilot is beauti my prize then who fear sink where such treasur lie as corn o ergrown weed so heed fear is almost chok d unresist lust away he steal open listen ear full foul hope full fond mistrust both which as servitor unjust so cross him their opposit persuas that now he vow leagu now invas hi thought her heavenli imag sit self same seat sit collatin that eye which look her confound hi wit that eye which him behold as more divin unto view so fals will not inclin but pure appeal seek heart which onc corrupt take worser part therein hearten hi servil power who flatter d their leader s jocund show stuff hi lust as minut fill hour as their captain so their pride doth grow pay more slavish tribut than they owe reprob desir thu madli led roman lord marcheth lucrec bed lock her chamber hi will each one him enforc d retir hi ward but as they open they all rate hi ill which drive creep thief some regard threshold grate door have him heard night wand ring weasel shriek see him there they fright him yet he still pursu hi fear as each unwil portal yield him way littl vent cranni place wind war hi torch make him stay blow smoke it hi face extinguish hi conduct thi case but hi hot heart which fond desir doth scorch puff forth anoth wind that fire torch be light light he spi lucretia s glove wherein her needl stick he take it rush where it lie gripe it neeld hi finger prick as who should say thi glove wanton trick is not inur d return again hast thou see st our mistress ornament are chast but all these poor forbid could not stay him he worst sens constru their denial door wind glove that did delay him he take accident thing trial or as those bar which stop hourli dial who linger stay hi cours doth let till everi minut pay hour hi debt so so quoth he these let attend time like littl frost that sometim threat spring add more rejoic prime give sneap bird more caus sing pain pay incom each preciou thing huge rock high wind strong pirat shelv sand merchant fear ere rich home he land now is he come unto chamber door that shut him heaven hi thought which yield latch no more hath barr d him bless thing he sought so himself impieti hath wrought that hi prey pray he doth begin as if heaven should counten hi sin but midst hi unfruit prayer have solicit etern power that hi foul thought might compass hi fair fair they would stand auspici hour even there he start quoth he i must de flower power whom i pray abhor thi fact how can they then assist me act then love fortun be my god my guid my will is back d resolut thought are but dream till their effect be tri blackest sin is clear d absolut against love s fire fear s frost hath dissolut eye heaven is misti night cover shame that follow sweet delight thi said hi guilti hand pluck d latch hi knee door he open wide dove sleep fast that thi night owl will catch thu treason work ere traitor be espi who see lurk serpent step asid but she sound sleep fear no such thing lie merci hi mortal sting chamber wickedli he stalk gazeth her yet unstain bed curtain be close he walk roll hi greedi eyebal hi head their high treason is hi heart misl which give watch word hi hand full soon draw cloud that hide silver moon look as fair fieri point sun rush forth cloud bereav our sight even so curtain drawn hi eye begun wink be blind greater light it is that she reflect so bright that dazzleth them or els some shame suppos but blind they are keep themselv enclos o had they that darksom prison die then had they seen period their ill then collatin again lucrec side hi clear bed might have repos still but they must ope thi bless leagu kill holi thought lucrec their sight must sell her joy her life her world s delight her lili hand her rosi cheek lie cozen pillow law kiss who therefor angri seem part sunder swell either side want hi bliss whose hill her head entomb is where like virtuou monument she lie be admir d lewd unhallow d eye bed her other fair hand wa green coverlet whose perfect white show d like april daisi grass pearli sweat resembl dew night her eye like marigold had sheath d their light canopi dark sweetli lay till they might open adorn day her hair like golden thread play d her breath o modest wanton wanton modesti show life s triumph map death death s dim look life s mortal each her sleep themselv so beautifi as if them twain there were no strife but that life liv d death death life her breast like ivori globe circl blue pair maiden world unconqu save their lord no bear yoke they knew him oath they truli honour these world tarquin new ambit bred who like foul usurp went thi fair throne heav owner what could he see but mightili he note what did he note but strongli he desir d what he beheld that he firmli dote hi will hi wil eye he tir d more than admir he admir d her azur vein her alabast skin her coral lip her snow white dimpl chin as grim lion fawneth o er hi prey sharp hunger conquest satisfi so o er thi sleep soul doth tarquin stay hi rage lust graze qualifi slack d not suppress d stand her side hi eye which late thi mutini restrain unto greater uproar tempt hi vein they like straggl slave pillag fight obdur vassal fell exploit effect bloodi death ravish delight nor children s tear nor mother groan respect swell their pride onset still expect anon hi beat heart alarum strike give hot charg bid them do their like hi drum heart cheer hi burn eye hi eye commend lead hi hand hi hand as proud such digniti smoke pride march d make hi stand her bare breast heart all her land whose rank blue vein as hi hand did scale left their round turret destitut pale they muster quiet cabinet where their dear gover ladi lie do tell her she is dread beset fright her confus their cri she much amaz d break ope her lock d eye who peep forth thi tumult behold are hi flame torch dimm d control d imagin her as one dead night forth dull sleep dread fanci wake that think she hath beheld some ghastli sprite whose grim aspect set everi joint shake what terror ti but she worser take sleep disturb heed doth view sight which make suppos terror true wrapp d confound thousand fear like new kill d bird she trembl lie she dare not look yet wink there appear quick shift antic ugli her eye such shadow are weak brain s forgeri who angri that eye fli their light dark daunt them more dread sight hi hand that yet remain her breast rude ram batter such ivori wall may feel her heart poor citizen distress d wound itself death rise fall beat her bulk that hi hand shake withal thi move him more rage lesser piti make breach enter thi sweet citi first like trumpet doth hi tongu begin sound parley hi heartless foe who o er white sheet peer her whiter chin reason thi rash alarm know which he dumb demeanour seek show but she vehement prayer urgeth still what colour he commit thi ill thu he repli colour thi face that even anger make lili pale red rose blush her own disgrac shall plead me tell my love tale that colour am i come scale thi never conquer d fort fault is thine those thine eye betray thee unto mine thu i forestal thee if thou mean chide thi beauti hath ensnar thee thi night where thou patienc must my will abid my will that mark thee my earth s delight which i conquer sought all my might but as reproof reason beat it dead thi bright beauti wa it newli bred i see what cross my attempt will bring i know what thorn grow rose defend i think honey guard sting all thi beforehand counsel comprehend but will is deaf hear no heed friend onli he hath eye gaze beauti dote what he look gainst law or duti i have debat even my soul what wrong what shame what sorrow i shall breed but noth can affect s cours control or stop headlong furi hi speed i know repent tear ensu deed reproach disdain deadli enmiti yet strike i embrac mine infami thi said he shake aloft hi roman blade which like falcon tower sky coucheth fowl hi wing shade whose crook beak threat if he mount he die so hi insult falchion lie harmless lucretia mark what he tell trembl fear as fowl hear falcon s bell lucrec quoth he thi night i must enjoy thee if thou deni then forc must work my way thi bed i purpos destroy thee that done some worthless slave thine i ll slay kill thine honour thi life s decay thi dead arm do i mean place him swear i slew him see thee embrac him so thi surviv husband shall remain scorn mark everi open eye thi kinsmen hang their head thi disdain thi issu blurr d nameless bastardi thou author their obloquy shalt have thi trespass cite rhyme sung children succeed time but if thou yield i rest thi secret friend fault unknown is as thought unact littl harm done great good end law polici remain enact poison simpl sometim is compact pure compound be so appli hi venom effect is purifi then thi husband thi children s sake tender my suit bequeath not their lot shame that them no devic can take blemish that will never be forgot wors than slavish wipe or birth hour s blot mark descri men s nativ are natur s fault not their own infami here cockatric dead kill eye he rouseth himself make paus while she pictur pure pieti like white hind grype s sharp claw plead wilder where are no law rough beast that know no gentl right nor aught obey but hi foul appetit but when black fac d cloud world doth threat hi dim mist aspir mountain hide earth s dark womb some gentl gust doth get which blow these pitchi vapour their bide hinder their present fall thi divid so hi unhallow d hast her word delay moodi pluto wink while orpheu play yet foul night work cat he doth but dalli while hi hold fast foot weak mous panteth her sad behaviour feed hi vultur folli swallow gulf that even plenti wanteth hi ear her prayer admit but hi heart granteth no penetr entranc her plain tear harden lust though marbl wear rain her piti plead eye are sadli fix d remorseless wrinkl hi face her modest eloqu sigh is mix d which her oratori add more grace she put period often hi place midst sentenc so her accent break that twice she doth begin ere onc she speak she conjur him high almighti jove knighthood gentri sweet friendship s oath her untim tear her husband s love holi human law common troth heaven earth all power both that hi borrow d bed he make retir stoop honour not foul desir quoth she reward not hospit such black payment as thou hast pretend mud not fountain that gave drink thee mar not thing that cannot be amend end thi ill aim shoot be end he is no woodman that doth bend hi bow strike poor unseason doe my husband is thi friend hi sake spare me thyself art mighti thine own sake leav me myself weakl do not then ensnar me thou look st not like deceit do not deceiv me my sigh like whirlwind labour henc heav thee if ever man were mov d woman s moan be move my tear my sigh my groan all which togeth like troubl ocean beat thi rocki wreck threaten heart soften it their continu motion stone dissolv d water do convert o if no harder than stone thou art melt my tear be compassion soft piti enter iron gate tarquin s like i did entertain thee hast thou put hi shape do him shame all host heaven i complain me thou wrong st hi honour wound st hi princ name thou art not what thou seem st if same thou seem st not what thou art god king king like god should govern everi thing how will thi shame be seed thine age when thu thi vice bud thi spring if thi hope thou dar st do such outrag what dar st thou not when onc thou art king o be rememb d no outrag thing vassal actor can he wip d away then king misde cannot be hid clay thi deed will make thee onli lov d fear but happi monarch still are fear d love foul offend thou perforc must bear when they thee like offenc prove if but fear thi thi will remov princ are glass school book where subject eye do learn do read do look wilt thou be school where lust shall learn must he thee read lectur such shame wilt thou be glass wherein it shall discern author sin warrant blame privileg dishonour thi name thou back st reproach against long live laud mak st fair reput but bawd hast thou command him that gave it thee pure heart command thi rebel will draw not thi sword guard iniqu it wa lent thee all that brood kill thi princ offic how canst thou fulfil when pattern d thi fault foul sin may say he learn d sin thou didst teach way think but how vile spectacl it were view thi present trespass anoth men s fault do seldom themselv appear their own transgress partial they smother thi guilt would seem death worthi thi brother o how are they wrapp d infami that their own misde askaunc their eye thee thee my heav d hand appeal not seduc lust thi rash relier i sue exil d majesti s repeal let him return flatter thought retir hi true respect will prison fals desir wipe dim mist thi dote eyn that thou shalt see thi state piti mine have done quoth he my uncontrol tide turn not but swell higher thi let small light are soon blown huge fire abid wind greater furi fret petti stream that pay daili debt their salt sovereign their fresh fall hast add hi flow but alter not hi tast thou art quoth she sea sovereign king lo there fall thi boundless flood black lust dishonour shame misgovern who seek stain ocean thi blood if all these petti ill shall chang thi good thi sea puddl s womb is hear d not puddl thi sea disper d so shall these slave be king thou their slave thou nobli base they base dignifi thou their fair life they thi fouler grave thou loath their shame they thi pride lesser thing should not greater hide cedar stoop not base shrub s foot but low shrub whither cedar s root so let thi thought low vassal thi state no more quoth he heaven i will not hear thee yield my love if not enforc hate instead love s coy touch shall rude tear thee that done despit i mean bear thee unto base bed some rascal groom be thi partner thi shame doom thi said he set hi foot light light lust are deadli enemi shame fold blind conceal night when most unseen then most doth tyrann wolf hath seiz d hi prey poor lamb cri till her own white fleec her voic control d entomb her outcri her lip sweet fold nightli linen that she wear he pen her piteou clamour her head cool hi hot face chastest tear that ever modest eye sorrow shed o that prone lust should stain so pure bed spot whereof could weep purifi her tear should drop them perpetu but she hath lost dearer thing than life he hath won what he would lose again thi forc leagu doth forc further strife thi momentari joy breed month pain thi hot desir convert cold disdain pure chastiti is rifl her store lust thief far poorer than look as full fed hound or gorg hawk unapt tender smell or speedi flight make slow pursuit or altogeth balk prey wherein natur they delight so surfeit take tarquin fare thi night hi tast delici digest sour devour hi will that liv d foul devour o deeper sin than bottomless conceit can comprehend still imagin drunken desir must vomit hi receipt ere he can see hi own abomin while lust is hi pride no exclam can curb hi heat or rein hi rash desir till like jade self will himself doth tire then lank lean discolour d cheek heavi eye knit brow strengthless pace feebl desir all recreant poor meek like bankrupt beggar wail hi case flesh be proud desir doth fight grace there it revel when that decay guilti rebel remiss pray so fare it thi fault lord rome who thi accomplish so hotli cha d now against himself he sound thi doom that length time he stand disgrac d besid hi soul s fair templ is defac d whose weak ruin muster troop care ask spot princess how she fare she say her subject foul insurrect have batter d down her consecr wall their mortal fault brought subject her immort made her thrall live death pain perpetu which her prescienc she control still but her foresight could not forestal their will even thi thought dark night he stealeth captiv victor that hath lost gain bear away wound that noth healeth scar that will despit cure remain leav hi spoil perplex d greater pain she hear load lust he left behind he burthen guilti mind he like thievish dog creep sadli thenc she like weari lamb lie pant there he scowl hate himself hi offenc she desper her nail her flesh doth tear he faintli fli sweat guilti fear she stay exclaim dire night he run chide hi vanish d loath d delight he thenc depart heavi convertit she there remain hopeless castaway he hi speed look morn light she pray she never may behold day day quoth she night s scape doth open lay my true eye have never practi d how cloak offenc cun brow they think not but that everi eye can see same disgrac which they themselv behold therefor would they still dark be have their unseen sin remain untold they their guilt weep will unfold grave like water that doth eat steel my cheek what helpless shame i feel here she exclaim against repos rest bid her eye hereaft still be blind she wake her heart beat her breast bid it leap thenc where it may find some purer chest close so pure mind frantic grief thu breath she forth her spite against unseen secreci night o comfort kill night imag hell dim regist notari shame black stage tragedi murder fell vast sin conceal chao nurs blame blind muffl bawd dark harbour defam grim cave death whisper conspir close tongu treason ravish o hate vapor foggi night thou art guilti my cureless crime muster thi mist meet eastern light make war against proport d cours time or if thou wilt permit sun climb hi wont height yet ere he go bed knit poison cloud hi golden head rotten damp ravish morn air let their exhal d unwholesom breath make sick life puriti suprem fair ere he arriv hi weari noontid prick let thi misti vapour march so thick that their smoki rank hi smother d light may set noon make perpetu night were tarquin night as he is but night s child silver shine queen he would distain her twinkl handmaid too him defil d night s black bosom should not peep again so should i have co partner my pain fellowship woe doth woe assuag as palmer chat make short their pilgrimag where now i have no one blush me cross their arm hang their head mine mask their brow hide their infami but i alon alon must sit pine season earth shower silver brine mingl my talk tear my grief groan poor wast monument last moan o night thou furnac foul reek smoke let not jealou day behold that face which underneath thi black all hide cloak immodesti lie martyr d disgrac keep still possess thi gloomi place that all fault which thi reign are made may likewis be sepulchr thi shade make me not object tell tale day light will show charact d my brow stori sweet chastiti s decay impiou breach holi wedlock vow yea illiter that know not how cipher what is writ learn book will quot my loathsom trespass my look nurs still her child will tell my stori fright her cri babe tarquin s name orat deck hi oratori will coupl my reproach tarquin s shame feast find minstrel tune my defam will tie hearer attend each line how tarquin wrong me i collatin let my good name that senseless reput collatin s dear love be kept unspot if that be made theme disput branch anoth root are rot undeserv reproach him allot that is as clear thi attaint mine as i ere thi wa pure collatin o unseen shame invis disgrac o unfelt sore crest wound privat scar reproach is stamp d collatinu face tarquin s eye may read mot afar how he peac is wound not war ala how mani bear such shame blow which not themselv but he that give them know if collatin thine honour lay me me strong assault it is bereft my honey lost i drone like bee have no perfect my summer left but robb d ransack d injuri theft thi weak hive wander wasp hath crept suck d honey which thi chast bee kept yet am i guilti thi honour s wrack yet thi honour did i entertain him come thee i could not put him back it had been dishonour disdain him besid weari he did complain him talk d virtu o unlook d evil when virtu is profan d such devil whi should worm intrud maiden bud or hate cuckoo hatch sparrow nest or toad infect fair fount venom mud or tyrant folli lurk gentl breast or king be breaker their own behest but no perfect is so absolut that some impur doth not pollut age man that coffer hi gold is plagu cramp gout pain fit scarc hath eye hi treasur behold but like still pine tantalu he sit useless barn harvest hi wit have no other pleasur hi gain but torment that it cannot cure hi pain so then he hath it when he cannot use it leav it be master d hi young who their pride do present abus it their father wa too weak they too strong hold their curs bless fortun long sweet we wish turn loath sour even moment that we call them our unruli blast wait tender spring unwholesom weed take root preciou flower adder hiss where sweet bird sing what virtu breed iniqu devour we have no good that we can say is our but ill annex opportun or kill hi life or els hi qualiti o opportun thi guilt is great ti thou that executest traitor s treason thou set st wolf where he lamb may get whoever plot sin thou point st season ti thou that spurn st right law reason thi shadi cell where none may spi him sit sin seiz soul that wander him thou mak st vestal violat her oath thou blow st fire when temper is thaw d thou smother st honesti thou murther st troth thou foul abettor thou notori bawd thou plantest scandal displacest laud thou ravish thou traitor thou fals thief thi honey turn gall thi joy grief thi secret pleasur turn open shame thi privat feast public fast thi smooth titl rag name thi sugar d tongu bitter wormwood tast thi violent vaniti can never last how come it then vile opportun be so bad such number seek thee when wilt thou be humbl suppliant s friend bring him where hi suit may be obtain d when wilt thou sort hour great strife end or free that soul which wretched hath chain d give physic sick eas pain d poor lame blind halt creep cri thee but they ne er meet opportun patient die while physician sleep orphan pine while oppressor feed justic is feast while widow weep advic is sport while infect breed thou grant st no time charit deed wrath envi treason rape murder s rage thi heinou hour wait them as their page when truth virtu have do thee thousand cross keep them thi aid they buy thi help but sin ne er give fee he grati come thou art well appay d as well hear as grant what he hath said my collatin would els have come me when tarquin did but he wa stay d thee guilti thou art murder theft guilti perjuri suborn guilti treason forgeri shift guilti incest that abomin accessori thine inclin all sin past all that are come creation gener doom mi shapen time copesm ugli night swift subtl post carrier grisli care eater youth fals slave fals delight base watch woe sin s pack hors virtu s snare thou nursest all murtherest all that are o hear me then injuri shift time be guilti my death my crime whi hath thi servant opportun betray d hour thou gav st me repos cancel d my fortun enchain me endless date never end woe time s offic is fine hate foe eat error opinion bred not spend dowri law bed time s glori is calm contend king unmask falsehood bring truth light stamp seal time age thing wake morn sentinel night wrong wronger till he render right ruinat proud build thi hour smear dust their glitter golden tower fill worm hole state monument feed oblivion decay thing blot old book alter their content pluck quill ancient raven wing dri old oak s sap cherish spring spoil antiqu hammer d steel turn giddi round fortun s wheel show beldam daughter her daughter make child man man child slay tiger that doth live slaughter tame unicorn lion wild mock subtl themselv beguil d cheer ploughman increas crop wast huge stone littl water drop whi work st thou mischief thi pilgrimag unless thou couldst return make amend one poor retir minut age would purchas thee thousand thousand friend lend him wit that bad debtor lend o thi dread night wouldst thou one hour come back i could prevent thi storm shun thi wrack thou ceas ess lackey etern some mischanc cross tarquin hi flight devis extrem extrem make him curs thi curs crime night let ghastli shadow hi lewd eye affright dire thought hi commit evil shape everi bush hideou shapeless devil disturb hi hour rest restless tranc afflict him hi bed bedrid groan let there bechanc him piti mischanc make him moan but piti not hi moan stone him harden d heart harder than stone let mild women him lose their mild wilder him than tiger their wild let him have time tear hi curl hair let him have time against himself rave let him have time time s help despair let him have time live loath slave let him have time beggar s ort crave time see one that alm doth live disdain him disdain scrap give let him have time see hi friend hi foe merri fool mock him resort let him have time mark how slow time goe time sorrow how swift short hi time folli hi time sport ever let hi unrecal crime have time wail abus hi time o time thou tutor both good bad teach me curs him that thou taught st thi ill hi own shadow let thief run mad himself himself seek everi hour kill such wretch hand such wretch blood should spill who so base would such offic have as slander deathsman so base slave baser is he come king shame hi hope deed degener mightier man mightier is thing that make him honour d or beget him hate greatest scandal wait greatest state moon be cloud present is miss d but littl star may hide them when they list crow may bath hi coal black wing mire unperceiv fli filth away but if like snow white swan desir stain hi silver down will stay poor groom are sightless night king gloriou day gnat are unnot whereso er they fli but eagl gaze everi eye idl word servant shallow fool unprofit sound weak arbitr busi yourselv skill contend school debat where leisur serv dull debat trembl client be you mediat me i forc not argument straw that my case is past help law vain i rail opportun time tarquin uncheer night vain i cavil mine infami vain i spurn my confirm d despit thi helpless smoke word doth me no right remedi inde do me good is let forth my foul defil d blood poor hand whi quiver st thou thi decre honour thyself rid me thi shame if i die my honour live thee but if i live thou livest my defam thou couldst not defend thi loyal dame wast afear d scratch her wick foe kill both thyself her yield so thi said her be tumbl couch she starteth find some desper instrument death but thi no slaughter hous no tool imparteth make more vent passag her breath which throng her lip so vanisheth as smoke aetna that air consum or that which discharg cannon fume vain quoth she i live seek vain some happi mean end hapless life i fear d tarquin s falchion be slain yet self same purpos seek knife but when i fear d i wa loyal wife so am i now o no that cannot be that true type hath tarquin rifl me o that is gone which i sought live therefor now i need not fear die clear thi spot death least i give badg fame slander s liveri die life live infami poor helpless help treasur stolen away burn guiltless casket where it lay well well dear collatin thou shalt not know stain tast violat troth i will not wrong thi true affect so flatter thee infring oath thi bastard graff shall never come growth he shall not boast who did thi stock pollut that thou art dote father hi fruit nor shall he smile thee secret thought nor laugh hi companion thi state but thou shalt know thi interest wa not bought base gold but stolen forth thi gate me i am mistress my fate my trespass never will dispens till life death acquit my forc offenc i will not poison thee my attaint nor fold my fault cleanli coin d excus my sabl ground sin i will not paint hide truth thi fals night s abus my tongu shall utter all mine eye like sluic as mountain spring that feed dale shall gush pure stream purg my impur tale thi lament philomel had end well tun d warbl her nightli sorrow solemn night slow sad gait descend ugli hell when lo blush morrow lend light all fair eye that light will borrow but cloudi lucrec shame herself see therefor still night would cloister d be reveal day everi cranni spi seem point her where she sit weep whom she sob speak o eye eye whi pryest thou my window leav thi peep mock thi tickl beam eye that are sleep brand not my forehead thi pierc light day hath nought do what s done night thu cavil she everi thing she see true grief is fond testi as child who wayward onc hi mood nought agre old woe not infant sorrow bear them mild continu tame one other wild like unpracti d swimmer plung still too much labour drown want skill so she deep drench sea care hold disput each thing she view herself all sorrow doth compar no object but her passion s strength renew as one shift anoth straight ensu sometim her grief is dumb hath no word sometim ti mad too much talk afford littl bird that tune their morn s joy make her moan mad their sweet melodi mirth doth search bottom annoy sad soul are slain merri compani grief best is plea d grief s societi true sorrow then is feelingli suffic d when like semblanc it is sympathiz d ti doubl death drown ken shore he ten time pine that pine behold food see salv doth make wound ach more great grief griev most that would do it good deep woe roll forward like gentl flood who be stopp d bound bank o erflow grief dalli nor law nor limit know you mock bird quoth she your tune entomb your hollow swell feather d breast my hear be you mute dumb my restless discord love no stop nor rest woeful hostess brook not merri guest relish your nimbl note pleas ear distress like dump when time is kept tear come philomel that sing st ravish make thi sad grove my dishevel d hair as dank earth weep thi languish so i each sad strain will strain tear deep groan diapason bear burthen wise i ll hum tarquin still while thou tereu descant st better skill while against thorn thou bear st thi part keep thi sharp woe wake wretch i imit thee well against my heart will fix sharp knife affright mine eye who if it wink shall thereon fall die these mean as fret instrument shall tune our heart string true languish poor bird thou sing st not day as shame ani eye should thee behold some dark deep desert seat way that know not parch heat nor freez cold will we find there we will unfold creatur stern sad tune chang their kind men prove beast let beast bear gentl mind as poor fright deer that stand gaze wildli determin which way fli or one encompass d wind maze that cannot tread way readili so herself is she mutini live or die which twain were better when life is sham d death reproach s debtor kill myself quoth she alack what were it but my bodi my poor soul s pollut they that lose half greater patienc bear it than they whose whole is swallow d confus that mother tri merciless conclus who have two sweet babe when death take one will slay other be nurs none my bodi or my soul which wa dearer when one pure other made divin whose love either myself wa nearer when both were kept heaven collatin ah me bark peel d lofti pine hi leav will wither hi sap decay so must my soul her bark be peel d away her hous is sack d her quiet interrupt her mansion batter d enemi her sacr templ spot spoil d corrupt grossli engirt dare infami then let it not be call d impieti if thi blemish d fort i make some hole which i may convey thi troubl soul yet die i will not till my collatin have heard caus my untim death that he may vow that sad hour mine reveng him that made me stop my breath my stain blood tarquin i ll bequeath which him taint shall him be spent as hi due writ my testament my honour i ll bequeath unto knife that wound my bodi so dishonour ti honour depriv dishonour d life one will live other be dead so shame s ash shall my fame be bred my death i murther shame scorn my shame so dead mine honour is new born dear lord that dear jewel i have lost what legaci shall i bequeath thee my resolut love shall be thi boast whose exampl thou reveng d mayst be how tarquin must be use read it me myself thi friend will kill myself thi foe my sake serv thou fals tarquin so thi brief abridg my will i make my soul bodi sky ground my resolut husband do thou take mine honour be knife s that make my wound my shame be hi that did my fame confound all my fame that live disbur d be those that live think no shame me thou collatin shalt overse thi will how wa i overseen that thou shalt see it my blood shall wash slander mine ill my life s foul deed my life s fair end shall free it faint not faint heart but stoutli say so be it yield my hand my hand shall conquer thee thou dead both die both shall victor be thi plot death when sadli she had laid wip d brinish pearl her bright eye untun d tongu she hoars call d her maid whose swift obedi her mistress hie fleet wing d duti thought s feather fli poor lucrec cheek unto her maid seem so as winter mead when sun doth melt their snow her mistress she doth give demur good morrow soft slow tongu true mark modesti sort sad look her ladi s sorrow whi her face wore sorrow s liveri but durst not ask her audaci whi her two sun were cloud eclips so nor whi her fair cheek wash d woe but as earth doth weep sun be set each flower moisten d like melt eye even so maid swell drop gan wet her circl eyn enforc d sympathi those fair sun set her mistress sky who salt wav d ocean quench their light which make maid weep like dewi night pretti while these pretti creatur stand like ivori conduit coral cistern fill one justli weep other take hand no caus but compani her drop spill their gentl sex weep are often will griev themselv guess other smart then they drown their eye or break their heart men have marbl women waxen mind therefor are they form d as marbl will weak oppress d impress strang kind is form d them forc fraud or skill then call them not author their ill no more than wax shall be account evil wherein is stamp d semblanc devil their smooth like goodli champaign plain lay open all littl worm that creep men as rough grown grove remain cave keep evil that obscur sleep crystal wall each littl mote will peep though men can cover crime bold stern look poor women s face are their own fault book no man inveigb against wither d flower but chide rough winter that flower hath kill d not that devour d but that which doth devour is worthi blame o let it not be hild poor women s fault that they are so fulfil d men s abus those proud lord blame make weak made women tenant their shame preced whereof lucrec view assail d night circumst strong present death shame that might ensu that her death do her husband wrong such danger resist did belong die fear all her bodi spread who cannot abus bodi dead thi mild patienc bid fair lucrec speak poor counterfeit her complain my girl quoth she what occas break those tear thee that down thi cheek are rain if thou dost weep grief my sustain know gentl wench it small avail my mood if tear could help mine own would do me good but tell me girl when went there she stay d till deep groan tarquin henc madam ere i wa repli maid more blame my sluggard neglig yet fault i thu far can dispens myself wa stir ere break day ere i rose wa tarquin gone away but ladi if your maid may be so bold she would request know your heavi o peac quoth lucrec if it should be told repetit cannot make it less more it is than i can well express that deep tortur may be call d hell when more is felt than one hath power tell go get me hither paper ink pen yet save that labour i have them here what should i say one my husband s men bid thou be readi bear letter my lord my love my dear bid him speed prepar carri it caus crave hast it will soon be writ her maid is gone she prepar write first hover o er paper her quill conceit grief eager combat fight what wit set down is blot straight will thi is too curiou good thi blunt ill much like press peopl door throng her invent which shall go last she thu begin thou worthi lord that unworthi wife that greeteth thee health thi person next vouchsaf afford if ever love thi lucrec thou wilt see some present speed come visit me so i commend me our hous grief my woe are tediou though my word are brief here fold she tenor her woe her certain sorrow writ uncertainli thi short schedul collatin may know her grief but not her grief s true qualiti she dare not thereof make discoveri lest he should hold it her own gross abus ere she blood had stain d her stain d excus besid life feel her passion she hoard spend when he is hear her when sigh groan tear may grace fashion her disgrac better so clear her that suspicion which world my might bear her shun thi blot she would not blot letter word till action might becom them better see sad sight move more than hear them told then eye interpret ear heavi motion that it doth behold when everi part part woe doth bear ti but part sorrow that we hear deep sound make lesser nois than shallow ford sorrow ebb be blown wind word her letter now is seal d it writ ardea my lord more than hast post attend she deliv it charg sour fac d groom hie as fast as lag fowl northern blast speed more than speed but dull slow she deem extrem still urgeth such extrem home villain court sie her low blush her steadfast eye receiv scroll or yea or no forth bash innoc doth hie but they whose guilt their bosom lie imagin everi eye behold their blame lucrec thought he blush d see her shame when silli groom god wot it wa defect spirit life bold audac such harmless creatur have true respect talk deed while other saucili promis more speed but do it leisur even so thi pattern worn age pawn d honest look but laid no word gage hi kindl duti kindl her mistrust that two red fire both their face blaz d she thought he blush d as know tarquin s lust blush him wistli him gaz d her earnest eye did make him more amaz d more saw blood hi cheek replenish more she thought he spi her some blemish but long she think till he return again yet duteou vassal scarc is gone weari time she cannot entertain now ti stale sigh weep groan so woe hath weari woe moan tire moan that she her plaint littl while doth stay paus mean mourn some newer way last she call mind where hang piec skil paint made priam s troy which is drawn power greec helen s rape citi destroy threat ning cloud kiss ilion annoy which conceit painter drew so proud as heaven it seem d kiss turret bow d thousand lament object there scorn natur art gave lifeless life mani dri drop seem d weep tear shed slaughter d husband wife red blood reek d show painter s strife die eye gleam d forth their ashi light like die coal burnt tediou night there might you see labour pioner begrim d sweat smear all dust tower troy there would appear veri eye men loophol thrust gaze greek littl lust such sweet observ thi work wa had that one might see those far off eye look sad great command grace majesti you might behold triumph their face youth quick bear dexter here there painter interlac pale coward march trembl pace which heartless peasant did so well resembl that one would swear he saw them quak trembl ajax ulyss o what art physiognomi might one behold face either cipher d either s heart their face their manner most expressli told ajax eye blunt rage rigour roll d but mild glanc that sli ulyss lent show d deep regard smile govern there plead might you see grave nestor stand as t were encourag greek fight make such sober action hi hand that it beguil attent charm d sight speech it seem d hi beard all silver white wagg d down hi lip did fli thin wind breath which purl d sky him were press gape face which seem d swallow hi sound advic all jointli listen but sever grace as if some mermaid did their ear entic some high some low painter wa so nice scalp mani almost hid behind jump higher seem d mock mind here one man s hand lean d anoth s head hi nose be shadow d hi neighbour s ear here one be throng d bear back all boll n red anoth smother d seem pelt swear their rage such sign rage they bear as but loss nestor s golden word it seem d they would debat angri sword much imaginari work wa there conceit deceit so compact so kind that achil imag stood hi spear grip d arm hand himself behind wa left unseen save eye mind hand foot face leg head stood whole be imagin wall strong besieg troy when their brave hope bold hector march d field stood mani trojan mother share joy see their youth son bright weapon wield their hope they such odd action yield that their light joy seem appear like bright thing stain d kind heavi fear strond dardan where they fought simoi reedi bank red blood ran whose wave imit battl sought swell ridg their rank began break gall shore than retir again till meet greater rank they join shoot their foam simoi bank thi well paint piec is lucrec come find face where all distress is stell d mani she see where care have carv some but none where all distress dolour dwell d till she despair hecuba beheld stare priam s wound her old eye which bleed pyrrhu proud foot lie her painter had anatomiz d time s ruin beauti s wrack grim care s reign her cheek chop wrinkl were disgui d what she wa no semblanc did remain her blue blood chang d black everi vein want spring that those shrunk pipe had fed show d life imprison d bodi dead thi sad shadow lucrec spend her eye shape her sorrow beldam s woe who noth want answer her but cri bitter word ban her cruel foe painter wa no god lend her those therefor lucrec swear he did her wrong give her so much grief not tongu poor instrument quoth she sound i ll tune thi woe my lament tongu drop sweet balm priam s paint wound rail pyrrhu that hath done him wrong my tear quench troy that burn so long my knife scratch angri eye all greek that are thine enemi show me strumpet that began thi stir that my nail her beauti i may tear thi heat lust fond pari did incur thi load wrath that burn troy doth bear thi eye kindl fire that burneth here here troy trespass thine eye sire son dame daughter die whi should privat pleasur some one becom public plagu mani mo let sin alon commit light alon hi head that hath transgress so let guiltless soul be freed guilti woe one s offenc whi should so mani fall plagu privat sin gener lo here weep hecuba here priam die here manli hector faint here troilu swound here friend friend bloodi channel lie friend friend give unadvis wound one man s lust these mani live confound had dote priam check d hi son s desir troy had been bright fame not fire here feelingli she weep troy s paint woe sorrow like heavi hang bell onc set ring hi own weight goe then littl strength ring dole knell so lucrec set work sad tale doth tell pencil d pensiv colour d sorrow she lend them word she their look doth borrow she throw her eye paint round whom she find forlorn she doth lament last she see wretch imag bound that piteou look phrygian shepherd lent hi face though full care yet show d content onward troy blunt swain he goe so mild that patienc seem d scorn hi woe him painter labour d hi skill hide deceit give harmless show humbl gait calm look eye wail still brow unbent that seem d welcom woe cheek neither red nor pale but mingl so that blush red no guilti instanc gave nor ashi pale fear that fals heart have but like constant confirm devil he entertain d show so seem just therein so ensconc d hi secret evil that jealousi itself cold not mistrust fals creep craft perjuri should thrust so bright day such black fac d storm or blot hell born sin such saint like form well skill d workman thi mild imag drew perjur d sinon whose enchant stori credul old priam slew whose word like wildfir burnt shine glori rich built ilion that sky were sorri littl star shot their fix place when their glass fell wherein they view d their face thi pictur she advisedli peru d chid painter hi wondrou skill say some shape sinon s wa abu d so fair form lodg not mind so ill still him she gaz d gaze still such sign truth hi plain face she spi that she conclud pictur wa beli it cannot be quoth she that so much guil she would have said can lurk such look but tarquin s shape came her mind while her tongu can lurk cannot took it cannot be she that sens forsook turn d it thu it cannot be i find but such face should bear wick mind even as subtl sinon here is paint so sober sad so weari so mild as if grief or travail he had faint me came tarquin arm so beguil d outward honesti but yet defil d inward vice as priam him did cherish so did i tarquin so my troy did perish look look how listen priam wet hi eye see those borrow d tear that sinon shed priam whi art thou old yet not wise everi tear he fall trojan bleed hi eye drop fire no water thenc proce those round clear pearl hi that move thi piti are ball quenchless fire burn thi citi such devil steal effect lightless hell sinon hi fire doth quak cold that cold hot burn fire doth dwell these contrari such uniti do hold onli flatter fool make them bold so priam s trust fals sinon s tear doth flatter that he find mean burn hi troy water here all enrag d such passion her assail that patienc is quit beaten her breast she tear senseless sinon her nail compar him that unhappi guest whose deed hath made herself herself detest last she smilingli thi give o er fool fool quoth she hi wound will not be sore thu ebb flow current her sorrow time doth weari time her complain she look night then she long morrow both she think too long her remain short time seem long sorrow s sharp sustain though woe be heavi yet it seldom sleep they that watch see time how slow it creep which all thi time hath overslipp d her thought that she paint imag hath spent be feel her own grief brought deep surmis other detriment lose her woe show discont it easeth some though none it ever cur d think their dolour other have endur d but now mind messeng come back bring home hi lord other compani who find hi lucrec clad mourn black round her tear distain eye blue circl stream d like rainbow sky these water gall her dim element foretel new storm those alreadi spent which when her sad behold husband saw amazedli her sad face he stare her eye though sod tear look d red raw her live colour kill d deadli care he hath no power ask her how she fare both stood like old acquaint tranc met far home wonder each other s chanc last he take her bloodless hand thu begin what uncouth ill event hath thee befal n that thou dost trembl stand sweet love what spite hath thi fair colour spent whi art thou thu attir d discont unmask dear dear thi moodi heavi tell thi grief that we may give redress three time sigh she give her sorrow fire ere onc she can discharg one word woe length address d answer hi desir she modestli prepar let them know her honour is ta en prison foe while collatin hi consort lord sad attent long hear her word now thi pale swan her wateri nest begin sad dirg her certain end few word quoth she shall fit trespass best where no excus can give fault amend me more woe than word are now depend my lament would be drawn too long tell them all one poor tire tongu then be thi all task it hath say dear husband interest thi bed stranger came that pillow lay where thou wast wont rest thi weari head what wrong els may be imagin foul enforc might be done me that ala thi lucrec is not free dread dead dark midnight shine falchion my chamber came creep creatur flame light softli cri awak thou roman dame entertain my love els last shame thee thine thi night i will inflict if thou my love s desir do contradict some hard favour d groom thine quoth he unless thou yoke thi like my will i ll murder straight then i ll slaughter thee swear i found you where you did fulfil loathsom act lust so did kill lecher their deed thi act will be my fame thi perpetu infami thi i did begin start cri then against my heart he set hi sword swear unless i took all patient i should not live speak anoth word so should my shame still rest record never be forgot mighti rome adulter death lucrec her groom mine enemi wa strong my poor self weak far weaker so strong fear my bloodi judg forbad my tongu speak no right plea might plead justic there hi scarlet lust came evid swear that my poor beauti had purloin d hi eye when judg is robb d prison die o teach me how make mine own excus or least thi refug let me find though my gross blood be stain d thi abus immacul spotless is my mind that wa not forc d that never wa inclin d accessari yield but still pure doth her poison d closet yet endur lo here hopeless merchant thi loss head declin d voic damm d woe sad set eye wretch arm across lip new waxen pale begin blow grief away that stop hi answer so but wretch as he is he strive vain what he breath hi breath drink again as arch violent roar tide outrun eye that doth behold hi hast yet eddi boundeth hi pride back strait that forc d him so fast rage sent recal d rage be past even so hi sigh hi sorrow make saw push grief back same grief draw which speechless woe hi poor she attendeth hi untim frenzi thu awaketh dear lord thi sorrow my sorrow lendeth anoth power no flood rain slaketh my woe too sensibl thi passion maketh more feel pain let it then suffic drown one woe one pair weep eye my sake when i might charm thee so she that wa thi lucrec now attend me be suddenli reveng my foe thine mine hi own suppos thou dost defend me what is past help that thou shalt lend me come all too late yet let traitor die spare justic feed iniqu but ere i name him you fair lord quoth she speak those that came collatin shall plight your honour faith me swift pursuit veng thi wrong mine ti meritori fair design chase injustic reveng arm knight their oath should right poor ladi harm thi request nobl disposit each present lord began promis aid as bound knighthood her imposit long hear hate foe bewray d but she that yet her sad task hath not said protest stop o speak quoth she how may thi forc stain be wip d me what is qualiti mine offenc be constrain d dread circumst may my pure mind foul act dispens my low declin honour advanc may ani term acquit me thi chanc poison d fountain clear itself again whi not i thi compel stain thi they all onc began say her bodi s stain her mind untaint clear while joyless smile she turn away face that map which deep impress bear hard misfortun carv d it tear no no quoth she no dame hereaft live my excus shall claim excus s give here sigh as if her heart would break she throw forth tarquin s name he he she say but more than he her poor tongu could not speak till mani accent delay untim breath sick short assay she utter thi he he fair lord ti he that guid thi hand give thi wound me even here she sheath her harmless breast harm knife that thenc her soul unsheath d that blow did bail it deep unrest that pollut prison where it breath d her contrit sigh unto cloud bequeath d her wing sprite her wound doth fli life s last date cancel d destini stone still astonish d thi deadli deed stood collatin all hi lordli crew till lucrec father that behold her bleed himself her self slaughter d bodi threw purpl fountain brutu drew murder knife as it left place her blood poor reveng held it chase bubbl her breast it doth divid two slow river that crimson blood circl her bodi everi side who like late sack d island vastli stood bare unpeopl thi fear flood some her blood still pure red remain d some look d black that fals tarquin stain d mourn congeal face that black blood wateri rigol goe which seem weep taint place ever as piti lucrec woe corrupt blood some wateri token show blood untaint still doth red abid blush that which is so putrifi daughter dear daughter old lucretiu cri that life wa mine which thou hast here depriv d if child father s imag lie where shall i live now lucrec is unliv d thou wast not thi end me deriv d if children pre deceas progenitor we are their offspr they none our poor broken glass i often did behold thi sweet semblanc my old age new born but now that fair fresh mirror dim old show me bare bon d death time outworn o thi cheek my imag thou hast torn shiver d all beauti my glass that i no more can see what onc i wa o time ceas thou thi cours last no longer if they surceas be that should surviv shall rotten death make conquest stronger leav falter feebl soul aliv old bee die young possess their hive then live sweet lucrec live again see thi father die not thi father thee thi start collatin as dream bid lucretiu give hi sorrow place then key cold lucrec bleed stream he fall bath pale fear hi face counterfeit die her space till manli shame bid him possess hi breath live be reveng her death deep vexat hi inward soul hath serv d dumb arrest hi tongu who mad that sorrow should hi use control or keep him heart eas word so long begin talk but hi lip do throng weak word so thick come hi poor heart s aid that no man could distinguish what he said yet sometim tarquin wa pronounc plain but hi teeth as if name he tore thi windi tempest till it blow rain held back hi sorrow s tide make it more last it rain busi wind give o er then son father weep equal strife who should weep most daughter or wife one doth call her hi other hi yet neither may possess claim they lay father say she s mine o mine she is repli her husband do not take away my sorrow s interest let no mourner say he weep her she wa onli mine onli must be wail d collatin o quoth lucretiu i did give that life which she too earli too late hath spill d woe woe quoth collatin she wa my wife i owe her ti mine that she hath kill d my daughter my wife clamour fill d disper d air who hold lucrec life answer d their cri my daughter my wife brutu who pluck d knife lucrec side see such emul their woe began cloth hi wit state pride buri lucrec wound hi folli s show he roman wa esteem so as silli jeer idiot are king sportiv word utter foolish thing but now he throw that shallow habit wherein deep polici did him disguis arm d hi long hid wit advisedli check tear collatinu eye thou wrong lord rome quoth he aris let my unsound self suppo d fool now set thi long experienc d wit school whi collatin is woe cure woe do wound help wound or grief help grievou deed is it reveng give thyself blow hi foul act whom thi fair wife bleed such childish humour weak mind proce thi wretch wife mistook matter so slay herself that should have slain her foe courag roman do not steep thi heart such relent dew lament but kneel me help bear thi part rous our roman god invoc that they will suffer these abomin rome herself them doth stand disgrac d our strong arm forth her fair street cha d now capitol that we ador thi chast blood so unjustli stain d heaven s fair sun that breed fat earth s store all our countri right rome maintain d chast lucrec soul that late complain d her wrong us thi bloodi knife we will reveng death thi true wife thi said he struck hi hand hi breast kiss d fatal knife end hi vow hi protest urg d rest who wonder him did hi word allow then jointli ground their knee they bow that deep vow which brutu made he doth again repeat that they swore when they had sworn thi advis doom they did conclud bear dead mihi flavu apollo pocula castalia plena ministret aqua _ right honour henri wriothesley earl southampton baron titchfield right honour i know not how i shall offend dedic my unpolish line your lordship nor how world will censur me choos so strong prop support so weak burthen onli if your honour seem but pleas i account myself highli prais vow take advantag all idl hour till i have honour you some graver labour but if first heir my invent prove deform i shall be sorri it had so nobl godfath never ear so barren land fear it yield me still so bad harvest i leav it your honour survey your honour your heart s content which i wish may alway answer your own wish world s hope expect your honour s all duti william shakespear venu adoni even as sun purpl colour d face had ta en hi last leav so white friend engirt so white foe 364 thi beauteou combat wil unwil show d like two silver dove that sit bill onc more engin her thought began o fairest mover thi mortal round 368 would thou wert as i am i man my heart all whole as thine thi heart my wound one sweet look thi help i would assur thee though noth but my bodi s bane would cure thee give me my hand saith he whi dost thou feel it give me my heart saith she thou shalt have it o give it me lest thi hard heart do steel it be steel d soft sigh can never grave it 376 then love s deep groan i never shall regard becaus adoni heart hath made mine hard shame he cri let go let me go my day s delight is past my hors is gone 380 ti your fault i am bereft him so i pray you henc leav me here alon all my mind my thought my busi care is how get my palfrey mare 384 thu she repli thi palfrey as he should welcom warm approach sweet desir affect is coal that must be cool d els suffer d it will set heart fire 388 sea hath bound but deep desir hath none therefor no marvel though thi hors be gone how like jade he stood tie tree servil master d leathern rein 392 but when he saw hi love hi youth s fair fee he held such petti bondag disdain throw base thong hi bend crest enfranchis hi mouth hi back hi breast 396 who see hi true love her nake bed teach sheet whiter hue than white but when hi glutton eye so full hath fed hi other agent aim like delight 400 who is so faint that dare not be so bold touch fire weather be cold let me excus thi courser gentl boy learn him i heartili beseech thee 404 take advantag present joy though i were dumb yet hi proceed teach thee o learn love lesson is but plain onc made perfect never lost again 408 i know not love quoth he nor will not know it unless it be boar then i chase it ti much borrow i will not owe it my love love is love but disgrac it 412 i have heard it is life death that laugh weep all but breath who wear garment shapeless unfinish d who pluck bud one leaf put forth 416 if spring thing be ani jot diminish d they wither their prime prove noth worth colt that s back d burden d be young loseth hi pride never waxeth strong 420 you hurt my hand wring let us part leav thi idl theme thi bootless chat remov your sieg my unyield heart love s alarm it will not ope gate 424 dismiss your vow your feign tear your flatt ry where heart is hard they make no batt ry what canst thou deep sweet music heart s deep sore wound had i no eye but ear my ear would love 433 that inward beauti invis or were i deaf thi outward part would move each part me that were but sensibl 436 though
